Reviews.Title: “10 day holiday in Rome at the Raffaello Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Munduroza
Reviews.Content: Yes, I can recommend this hotel. Just go there and relax as if at home. Service with a smile guaranteed. Staff very helpful. Meticulous cleanliness. Noise free. Location near central station and bus stop. Pharmacy, grocery, iron manger, bookshop, restaurants, you name it it is there near by.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: kmbcropper
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raffaello is nicely located near restaurants and access to shopping and sight seeing. We stayed two nights during our trip to Rome. We had an easy walk from the hotel to the Colloseum. We were able to access many other sights on foot which made seeing the city much easier. The hotel offers wonderful accommodations. We had a room with a balcony and were able to enjoy a glass of wine at the end of a long day. The breakfast is spectacular and very filling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: plazb
Reviews.Content: My family of four (two kids 11 &13) stayed here for three great nights in Rome. The hotel is within an easy walk of Termini station and located in a great neighborhood with inexpensive restaurants. It was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The staff were attentive and the breakfast selection was okay. The location of this hotel is perfect to use as a jumping off point for many of the sites in Rome. We were able to walk to the Colloseum in little more than 15 minutes. In addition, the hotel is within a 2-3 block walk of the bus line that can take you to Vatican City. In the evenings we found a number of family friendly restaurants with outside seating. In addition, we had our choice of gelato shops on the walk back to the hotel. All in all, Hotel Rafaello is a great choice for families.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: suja5
Reviews.Content: fab hotel ,clean, lovely breakfast, great staff very helpful, when our daughter was ill they made sure we got a late check out so she could stay in room until our flight, would stay here again, and would recommend to all our friends, thant you for a wonderful 4 days in march sue and phil morgan Australia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, service & location”
Reviews.Author: mroveri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and we really enjoyed it! We booked a room for 4 and it was comfortable, cozy and always clean. We booked the room with breakfast included, which was an excellent budget option taking into account that it is around 12 euros at any bar or restaurant. The service was outstanding. I speak just a little Italian, so they managed very well to speak to me in English and Spanish. They were always helpful and they tried to make my stay an excellent experience. The location was wonderfull. We were really near to all the most interesting "must-see" in Rome. If coming back to this city, it is my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: syonk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights - everything was perfect. Our room was ready for an early arrival, the breakfast staff went out of their way to give us a breakfast to go one morning, and we ordered their "gold" pillows for the room. Great location, great staff. Do not hesitate to book here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanandKaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in March 2012. Apart from the great location this hotel is very clean and well maintained. The staff (particularly the female staff members) are very polished and make you fell very welcome. The breakfast is great. Its nice to get good quality food at a budget price hotel. Yes the showers are a little weird (someone paid a lot of money to have stand up spa showers installed) but that's a very small criticism. Great eateries nearby and close to hop-on hop-off bus and underground train station. Check the local scooter hire place nearby for a tandem guided tour of Rome. They are lovely people and their prices are cheap. Only problem was the Internet connection was quite slow at times. We loved this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben H
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay in Rome for the first time and we thought the staff were welcoming and helpful. The room was clean and tidy and the breakfast just right or us. We would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay...”
Reviews.Author: giobello02
Reviews.Content: This was probably my best hotel stay, ever. I took my nine-year old on a European adventure in February. This was our first stop. Upon our arrival at 10 AM, Clementina, the wonderful concierge took him to the get breakfast while I checked in. Upon learning we had just flown in from the US, our room was changed to one that was ready so that we could rest and get ourselves situated before heading out to explore Roma. I loved where the hotel was located; close to everything, with a short walk or a quick metro ride but it was the neighborhood that gave it a true Roman feel. I have been to Roma many times before and have family here so I am familiar with it. When we ventured into more touristy areas, I appreciated our location even more. Every reommendation that Clementina gave was exactly what I wanted and her suggestions during our stay were always helpful. All staff members were kind and helpful and the hotel was immaculately clean. I also loved getting a freshly made cappucino every morning and my son loved his cornetti with Nutella. Upon our departure heading to theb airport for our next stop, they packed two breakfasts to go for us which was quite thoughtful. When I think of the reasonable cost of this hotel, it just added to my satisfaction. When I return to Roma, I will certainly stay here again! Tanto grazie a tutti!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: WinkleBerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March. And could not have asked for more from this hotel. Check in was very smooth with a very warm welcome from the lady on the desk (didn't get her name) but very pleasent indeed. We arrived from Termini station and it is just a 10 minute walk. Our room was lovely (310) nice bathroom, with hairdryer which i thought was ok, some hotel hairdryer's I have used wouldn't even blow out a candle but this one was pretty good. Also there are no iron's available for safety reason's. The bed was VERY comfortable with a pillow menu!! But the pillow's that were already there were fine so we didn't use this service. We were celebrating a 40th birthday, and were gifted with a bottle of red wine and some peanuts to help celebrate, very nice! The neighbourhood was ok, we are 2 females and felt quite safe walking back to the hotel at night. There is also a good liitle Irish bar up the road too which show's English Premiership football which was quite handy one evening. Breakfast was very nice, plenty to choose from. WiFi was good too, just had to ask for a code at reception. There is also a computer with internet access in reception along with free tea and coffee. Oh and look out for the Lord Sugar lookalike on reception!! But slightly 'younger' I must say. He was great also, very nice man. Emanuela was great! So very helpful and always bubbly and happy to see us. I would without a doubt stay here again, and would recommend to all!! Rome is a great city and Hotel Raffaello was the icing on the cake...Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: SjGirlieX
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lovely hotel. Clean, and very confortable. The staff were friendly, approachable and helpful. Emmanuella the concierge waqs on hand in the mornings to assist with directions and tips for a good day. The receptionists were pleasant, and the staff at breakfast were like sunshine itself. I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know, because it absolutely added to our Rome experience. I was 40 whilst we were over there and the hotel placed a superb bottle of red in my room with a card. Please stay at this hotel, because you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Which Pillows Would You Like?”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a wonderful short break in Rome and would like to echo all the positive comments other people have left about The Raffaello. For those of you that had previously reported problems with hard pillows, you can now return in the safe knowledge that each room now has a 'Pillow Menu' with a choice of 5 different types. This just goes to show the lengths that the hotel seems prepared to go to, in ensuring that everybody has a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Nicole175
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in, friendliness and kindness was abound. The receptionist was extremely nice and helpful. I had asked him for a metro map but they didn't have any so he printed one out and took the time and wrote down which stops to take the most popular attractions. Recommended a delicious restaurant as well. Each of the receptionists and the concierge speak multiple languages which is very helpful. The concierge was exceptionally nice and willing to help. Maids were friendly and the wait staff for breakfast was also very nice. Customer service could not have been better. Great location. Nice selection for breakfast. Rooms were accommodating. Only two complaints but they do not take away from the other all experience. The showers are tiny, it's not a big deal but just beware. The wifi in the rooms is also very slow. We were able to get everything done that we needed to but it is rather slow. Other than that, absolutely perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and comfortable choice”
Reviews.Author: Viajantes-75
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raffaello is very well located in a quiet street in the Monti neighbourhood between Termini station and the Coliseum. Service is excellent with multilingual staff. The room had a very traditional look to it but was very comfortable and fairly spacious with a choice of pillows and real clothes hangers! The bathroom was impeccably clean. The general state of repair of the hotel is very good. There were no surprises with the breakfast which offered a classic array of food. There was also coffee and tea available all day in the small lounge area which also had a computer with free wifi. An excellent choice for visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite location - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DevinMatthews
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week on holiday in Rome, along with my wife, sister and brother-in-law. At short notice the Raffaello arranged a driver to pick us up at the Leonardo Da Vinci airport. My email communications with the hotel regarding this service were answered promptly and answered all of my questions efficiently and with clarity. Upon arrival the reception was warm and very proffessional. Sometimes this is indicative of only the personality of the individual behind the desk - but in the case of the Raffaello each and every one of the staff members we encountered were courteous, friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms themselves were extremely clean and tastefully decorated. The location of the hotel was very central and allowed for easy walking to many of the major Rome attractions. Also within close proximity were metro stops and several small shops which offered various sundries. The breakfast provided was standard and a bit predictable (I'm not a fan of breakfast in general let alone continental breakfasts, so I am biased) - however the coffee was strong and service was great, so no complaints from this traveller! Definitely would recommend this hotel for your next Roman holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Scottish disaster”
Reviews.Author: gmhc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions and were very impressed by the friendliness of the staff.The reason for our visits to Rome were to watch Scotland in the 6 Nations and each time Scotland have lost.Our diappointment was mediated by the great service provided by the hotel,its locatio,its ambience and the service provided.Hopefully we will be entertained again in 2014 to witness a win by Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, service!”
Reviews.Author: kbaker1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has wonderful customer service that started even before arrival, with several emails exchanged and an airport transfer arranged. Already a great start, even prior to arrival. Then we got in from an international flight and since they were booked, could not check in early, however they held our luggage, and welcomed us for breakfast. They delivered the luggage, so that while we were out site-seeing, it was already in the rooms upon our return. The staff were all very helpful and the ladies especially, were so pleasant and friendly. Downside: several rooms are very small and found the use of the shower somewhat uncomfortable due to how tiny it was.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: It was an absolute pleasure to stay at the Raffaello Hotel. The room was excellent with a very good ensuite. The breakfast (included in the room price) was very good, the staff were outstanding. The location is excellent for seeing many of Rome's sights, very handy to the main train station.

Reviews.Title: “just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsSJ
Reviews.Content: great location just a short walk from Termini station but down a side road so quieter than most Rome hotels. Some road noise if you have a front facing room (we did but not a problem for us). Room larger than others with small sitting area and a balcony. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Large selection at breakfast, everything except sausage and bacon. Free tea and coffee available in small lounge near reception. Able to walk to all central attractions although Vatican is a bit of a way (Metro is only 1 Euro to get there). All in all don't think you can get better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Jane P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Rome - a wonderful March Break. The Raffaello was a wonderful, relaxing place to stay. The room was small, but adequate for 2. The staff were so friendly and helpful, arranging cabs and answering questions. Breakfast was delicious, and there's always espresso available. There is a minibar in the room - we bought water daily at a nearby grocery store and kept it in the fridge - why not! There is a hairdryer in the bathroom, and as a lovely touch they provided new slippers in the room at the beginning of our stay. The best advantage, I think is the Raffaello's location. It's in an old residential area, close to really wonderful restaurants, nifty shops, and within sight of Santa Maria Maggiore. Virtually all of the sites you want to see are within walking distance; the Cavour subway station is just doen the street. It can be a bit noisy - after all you are in a vibrant and exciting city! Pack earplugs, just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: Shira R
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, free wi-fi, spotless rooms, nice breakfast buffet and free safe deposit are only part of the services the hotel offers. Pretty central, we could reach everywhere by foot. Would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but not without its problems”
Reviews.Author: jaskev
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel primarily based on TA recommendations and while what people said was true, there were things left out that may have made me choose another hotel. To be fair, this hotel has its good points and its bad points - some of which are within the control of the hotel and some aren't but I still would have preferred to know everything before choosing to stay here. I hope my review will help others make a more informed decision. Location: This is completely subjective. It is within walking distance of a lot of the sites but far from others. The neighbourhood is quite residential and you can find some nice restaurants nearby. Also, if you are arriving or leaving by train, Termini is very close by. The area is safe and is very quiet at night - could be good or bad depending on what you are looking for. Staff: For the most part, they are very good and very helpful. One staff member I found was rather rude. She was usually on at night and would often just shrug when she was asked something or, in one instance, she told me I was crazy - see note about the rooms. Rooms: Clean and comfortable but housekeeping could have been a little more particular. For example, on our second night my son got some chocolate on his sheets. It was quite a visible smear and the sheets were not changed - the bed was just made up. I knew it was chocolate but it could have been something else...if you know what I mean. I would have expected the sheets to be changed. Internet access: This is a huge problem and one that needs to be addressed before the hotel can advertise that they have free wifi in the rooms. They do...sometimes. We were in a corner room and the internet disconnected on a fairly regular basis...when we could even log on. When we told the night reception woman that there was a problem with the internet in our rooms she said that they know. In the corner rooms the reception is bad...what can she do? I asked if maybe she could have a technician look at it which resulted in her saying that I was crazy and that this wasn't an emergency. I could just bring my laptop down to the lobby if I wanted to use the internet. Which is what I did. While I was in the lobby I heard her talking to another gentleman (not sure who he was) but the word "internet" came up often as they both glanced in my direction. I thought this was very unprofessional. If they know that there is a problem with the internet, why don't they fix it instead of claiming to have wifi in the rooms when it doesn't reach the corner rooms. While we were in the lobby we ran into a couple from England who were also frustrated by the sketchy internet service. Elevator This was another thing that I wasn't aware of. The elevator holds three people, maximum, but it looks more like one person who doesn't exhale. Being very claustrophobic this was a problem..and we were on the 4th floor with each level being two staircases. Not the hotel's fault but had I known I would have requested a lower floor. When I inquired the "lovely" woman on reception told me it was not possible to change rooms because they were completely full. Before I could say a word she quickly added, "If you don't believe me walk around the hotel and see for yourself!" She was very rude and her comments were completely uncalled for. Breakfast Very good - both hot and cold options. Plenty to choose from and a very nice breakfast area. All in all an average hotel. I would not go back there. There are many better options. The last time we were in Rome we stayed at Hotel Sonya and I'm sorry I didn't go back there but I wanted to try a new place for a new experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: melmich
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just returned from a 3 night stay which I booked as a surprise for his 50th birthday. The hotel was an excellent choice and all the staff were very helpful & made us very welcome, with a complementary bottle of wine & a lovely room. As with all the other reviews the hotel is in a very convenient location, is extremely clean & our room was immaculate and comfortable. The only complaint I had was that the pillows were very hard but this was sorted out immediately by the reception staff. I was even asked what type of pillow I'd like!! All in all this is a wonderful hotel which deserves more than its 3 stars & I would recommend it to anyone. Many thanks to all the hotel staff for their kindness. We hope to return one day.....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greengreenie
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel clean comfortable and classy with friendly helpful staff, great Location for Coliseum and other Rome sights. When in Rome this Hotel is a must...............................

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: JonBurton999
Reviews.Content: Just back from long weekend with 4 other couples. This is an excellent hotel and everything about it was top class. Rooms are comfortable and clean as were all public areas. The staff on reception and in breakfast room couldnt have been more helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day 2012”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 4 nights at Hotel Raffello in February and had a lovely stay. We had been upgraded to a triple room at no extra cost which was very comfortable and clean and the bathroom (with bath) was spotless (I am very fussy!). Hotel was close to Termini Station and we found we could walk to all the main attractions easily. The only downside was the pillows, they were as hard as bricks but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Friendly, Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveler973
Reviews.Content: My sister and I treated my mom on a trip to Italy to celebrate her birthday. We spent two nights at Hotel Raffaello. The rooms were very clean and toiletries were provided in abundance. We had a triple room, which consisted of one room that had two twin beds and an adjoining room that had a full size bed. The bathroom was spacious and had a large shower in the bathroom with jets that provided a full body ‘spa-like’ effect. The front desk staff was courteous and professional. We had many conversations with Massimo to assist us with directions to travel to the various landmarks. Massimo was extremely professional and accommodating. He called our hotel in Florence to confirm our late check in as a courtesy and without our request to do so. His upbeat temperament made our stay even more enjoyable. Breakfast was plentiful and consisted of various toasts, jams, eggs, poached apples and fresh fruits. The waitresses were friendly and attentive. We were pleasantly surprised by the close proximity of the hotel to Termini Station (about a 12-minute walk). There were plenty of great restaurants within close proximity to the hotel (although it is a challenge to find a bad meal in Italy!). Bus 64 has a stop that is a few minutes walk away from the hotel and provides transportation near the popular landmarks (e.g., Trevi Fountain, Pantheon), but it is very crowded and after using it twice, we decided to walk. It was one of the coldest weeks on record and due to the chill, we started taking the train by using a 24-hour pass. Overall, I had a fantastic stay at Hotel Raffaello. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to stay at a boutique hotel that is conveniently located and has very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: elaBristol
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel to celerate my husband's 30th b day. we were given beautiful room and free bottle of proseco which was a lovely gesture. breakfast was fab and u could not fault the service. location is perfect-hotel is situated right in between termini station and centre of Rome. all main attractions are within max 20 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic Hotel...great staff...great location...lovely breakfast...well done raffaello”
Reviews.Author: 887Alison1972
Reviews.Content: fantastic Hotel...great staff...great location...lovely breakfast...well done raffaello. Would highly recommend and would stay again...and all around fantastic experience. Some lovely restaurants in the surrounding area...we particularly liked La Carbonara

Reviews.Title: “As good as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: riverviewtravellers
Reviews.Content: Very clean, well-maintained hotel with great location and remarkably helpful staff. There is an extra concierge to greet you in the morning and to help out when the one at the desk is busy with people signing in or out. Free coffee all day! Close to the metro, but you can walk everywhere except maybe the Vatican, and the Colosseum and Forum are downhill.

Reviews.Title: “We shall return...”
Reviews.Author: Millbrook_Cheshire
Reviews.Content: Did lots of homework searching web reviews before deciding on Raffaello, time well spent as we could not have found better. No suprises, everything was as described - nice room, friendly staff, well located. Enjoyed every minute of our 3 night stay. Excellent breakfast and free WiFi. Only downside is they made 3 nights dissappear too quickly. We shall be going back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: FSMorecambe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Raffaello during the worst snow in Rome for 28 years. The hotel is well located, ten minutes walk from both Termini Station and the Coleseum. The rooms were what you'd expect from a hotel of this class- though the single room was tiny. Reception staff were polite and pleasant and the breakfast was great, as were the breakfast room staff. Would recommend for a well priced and well located stay with lots of family run shops and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: madrasmusik
Reviews.Content: Top-notch 3-star hotel conveniently located between the Termini rail station and Forum/Colosseum, with clean, comfortable rooms and an exceptionally nice staff, Emmanuela is a treasure trove of info for assisting with trips, excursions, eats and more. Good, solid breakfast is included. Excellent value and all-around excellent property when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: Moriarty1
Reviews.Content: Have just enjoyed a wonderful break in this super hotel. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and really went out of their way to be pleasant and welcoming. Our room, breakfast, free wifi, use of computer, slippers in room, complimentary coffee and pastries and even umbrellas (essential in the snow and sleet!) all contributed to exceeding the hotels 3star rating in our opinion. Fab!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Hotel Raffaello in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence T
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short trip to Rome. We spent three nights at the Hotel Raffaello on Via Urbana. The location is fantastic - truly 10 minutes walk from the Termini train station in one direction and 10 minutes walk from the Colosseum and Roman Forum in the other. Metro stops close by too. We spent most of the trip on our feet, walking to all sorts of wonderful places from the hotel! Tired feet but well worth it. The hotel is very clean and well-run. We stayed in room 507 which was fantastic, with it's own roof terrace. Very helpful and friendly staff, and a good breakfast with lots of variety. The hot chocolate is lovely! We whole-heartedly recommend the Hotel Raffaello and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsMollydog11
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Rome after staying at this hotel. Situated close enough to walk from the Terminni station after an easy journey from Ciampino airport via Terravision coach (4 Euros). From hotel also able to walk to most of Rome's sights. Hotel was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was excellent, extensive continental breakfast with all fresh food. All the staff in the hotel were very helpful. We could find nothing to complain about with this hote and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “high standards continue”
Reviews.Author: DrNick_11
Reviews.Content: I can only endorse the consistent high quality reviews for this hotel. Very well placed for Terminii station. Arrived from Ciampino via Terravision coach. Only 20 Euros for 5 of us (booked on-line). Extremely high standard of housekeeping throughout our stay. Very extensive continental breakfast with everything you could wish for. Booked direct with the hotel last Autumn (2011), and both before and during our stay the staff gave very helpful advice and information. Recommended to a local restaurant, literally 5 mins walk away (Ristorante Tema: excellent !). More general notes: the Colloseum's own guided tour (5 euros) on top of entrance fee was just right. 45 mins of interesting information without "overload". You are fast-tracked to a ticket booth inside the Colloseum if you take up this option. This was via Colloseum staff, not the numerous "touts" outside. Also, the climb to the top of St Peter's dome was a tremendous experience. 5 Euros if you climb all 551 steps; 7 euros if you go part way in a lift (leaving only 330 steps to climb !!!). The grotto below St Peter's houses the tombs of many late popes (John Paul II; St Peter etc) but was not obviously signposted inside the Basillica and was, therefore, very crowd free when we visited. A suggested must-do. All in all, a great time at a great hotel in a great city !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Beem10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in February with my boyfriend and had a really enjoyable stay. Our room (202) was a nice size with a wardrobe, tv and free safe and we found the bed to be very comfortable. As we arrived late, about 11.30pm, we were both in desperate need for some water and so raided the minibar. For a hotel minibar in the middle of Rome it struck us as very reasonably priced! The bathroom had a lovely, if slightly cosy, shower and was large although poorly laid out. There wasn't actually sufficient room to sit on the toilet properly because of it's proximity to the shower and bidet so you had to sit sideways. Whilst we found this amusing rather than a reason to moan, I'm sure it would irritate some people. The room and bathroom were both really clean and our towels were changed daily. I also really appreciated the 'vanity kit' which aside from the usual shower gel contained things I always forget and need like a nail file! Breakfast in the hotel was good with a nice continental buffet selection but what really struck me was how polite and attentive the breakfast staff were, they do a wonderful job. My only slight criticism would be that for the size of the hotel the breakfast area is small and it was somewhat problematic on the Sunday morning when a lot of people turned up for breakfast at around 9.30 and there weren't enough tables, we had to wait around 20 minutes. However, it was nice that the staff then didn't start clearing breakfast away at 10 like they were meant to and let the people who'd had to wait for their table continue breakfast at a leisurely pace. You could also get free tea and coffee in the lobby all day should you want it. We also found most of the hotel staff friendly, and the lady, whose name I unfortunately forget, who was always around to help in the mornings in the lobby particularly so. She recommended us a nice restaurant and was helpful in telling us how to get to the Vatican by public tranport and also how to get to the rugby game at the Stadio Olimpico. All of the major sights are walkable from the hotel, we opted to take the metro to the Vatican because of the ice and snow but walked to the colosseum and forum in about 10 minutes at a leisurely pace and the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps and Panthenon is about 15-20. Overall we had a lovely stay at this hotel and found it very clean, friendly and welcoming. Should I go to Rome again I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great value great find”
Reviews.Author: duane30
Reviews.Content: what a great hotel. stayed at this hotel for 4 nights very clean and tidy and close to most of the major attractions. metro station very close but most of the major attractions are very easy to reach by foot and you will find and see alot more. we stayed in room 512 had a nice balcony a good size double with a wonderful shower. breakfast was nice with alot of choice. all staff were very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Coul not fault it”
Reviews.Author: MillysTravels
Reviews.Content: Finding a good hotel in a city you are unfamiliar with is not easy but the Raffaello came up trumps. Check in was efficient and friendly, the room was comfortable and clean, the bathroom was marvellous, particularly the jacuzzi shower; breakfast was lovely and plentiful and the staff just made it all perfect! The central location on a quiet street is perfect for all the sights and the main train station. A nearly restaurant was recommended by the hotel staff and did not disappoint. To top it all off, we also got a great deal for booking 3 nights in winter! Absolutely nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A K
Reviews.Content: Location, staff, rooms, service, breakfast, cleanliness, everything actually was absolutely great! Read other 5* recommendations - they all are right!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel...beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Yiota G
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to Termini and ALL famous sights, maybe except from the Vatican (but if you ask me doable with comfortable walking shoes). The hotel offers clean, beautifully decorated rooms in a quiet but still very safe area. Showers might be considered a little small but generally the bathroom is big and the facilities provided in it more than adequate. Breakfast was perfect with variety, good coffee and fresh products. Staff was friendly and helpful - especially the front desk man (a tall one with a beard) who provided us with great tips and who was kind enough to show us the free coffee facilities at the lounge, which was also a plus. Too bad I forgot to ask his name. Certainly one of the best hotels I've stayed and surely my first choice in my forthcoming visits to Rome. So, I would definitely recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful romantic base for your stay in the eternal city!”
Reviews.Author: Jonandvic
Reviews.Content: Just come home from the most amazing stay at the raffaello hotel. Location - 10 mins walk from colluseum, central train station, Trevi fountain. Lots of great restaurants just a stones through away. Rooms - fantastic! Beautifully decorated, really clean, great showers. Staff - all staff we spoke with were really friendly and helpful. Special mention to francesca for arranging a room with a balcony! I proposed to my girlfriend on the balcony and she said yes!! :) Summary - really can't recommend this hotel highly enough. Great value, wonderful location - the perfect base for exploring the eternal city. Many thanks, Jon and Vicky

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the price range. It is not a luxury place, but we don't need that. The room is comfortable and very clean. The bathroom clean (very important to us) and modern. The staff is friendly, especially the two women (the men seem "colder"), and it was nice that the place is small enough that they knew our room number. Breakfast is fine for those who eat everything (we don't, as we have dietary restrictions), and my spouse loved the coffee. I'm a tea drinker, and they had good quality green tea for breakfast. We made good use of the computer in the lounge, which also has coffee and tea all the time. The location is quite decent, a short walk to the main train station and to a couple of metro stops, as well as some buses. If I had to find some things to criticize: the pillows are hard (I would like the option of a down pillow). The cleaning staff forgot to replenish some of the toilet articles, like the little tissue packs and cotton swabs that were there on the first day. And, really very unimportant to us, but if there were an English news station on the cable TV (such as BBC), it would have been nice. We found on our last morning that the TV in the coffee lounge had BBC, but I doubt we would have sat there and watched, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nikkig257
Reviews.Content: This has been our favorite hotel of our 8week tour of Europe. Great service, yum breakfast, and big room. Shower was brilliant (rain shower head). People were so friendly and helpful. Great restaurant if you walk out, turn right and go down alley, and turn right at top - first restaurant there was yum and great price. Easy walk to all Rome main sights.

Reviews.Title: “We are going back in 2012!”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Raffaello in October/November of last year (2011). We have reservations for this year (November 2012). We love this hotel. Fabulous breakfast, lovely rooms, charming staff. Looking forward to our second visit in November, 2012. Richard and Susan Rader Joyce and Hunter Roberts

Reviews.Title: “Good price, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: HappyGoLuckyNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days, 3 nights. I was amazed at how quiet it was, considering we were in a busy city. I couldn't hear any street traffic, even though we had a balcony that looked out onto an alleyway. The location was great - about a 5-8 minute walk from the Colosseum. The room was very clean and the a/c worked quite well. My only gripe with our room was that the shower was sooo small! I'm a tall girl and shaving my legs in the shower was the trickiest maneuver I've ever had to pull. There's free wi-fi available in the rooms, but the bandwidth gets really bogged down during peak web-surfing times. The breakfasts were one of the best we had in Italy, though that doesn't say much. They served warm, scrambled eggs and an array of meats, cheeses, and pastries. It's not a full buffet breakfast, but at least they had warm items. I'd definitely consider staying at this hotel again, if I ever went back to Italy. Also, it's an easy 5-7 minute walk from the Termini Train station, so no need to hail a cab or use public transportation. In fact, the only time we used public transportation was when we went to the Appian Way. Rome is small enough that we easily were able to walk from our hotel to the Vatican and back with stops along the way to sight-see. Bring good walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: p3z
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as I was in Rome to visit some friends and wanted a location within walking distance to the train station. Location felt safe enough for a solo female traveller. As mentioned by other reviewers, personnel at the front desk was friendly and within walking distance to many sites. There is a supermarket on the same street which was convenient (ask front desk for directions if unsure). Train stations are very crowded, as are tourists sites, so be mindful of personal belongings as my Italian friend mentioned pickpockets are normal. My single room was quite small but enough for me. Free Internet. Complimentary breakfast was splendid. A good, standard 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: Junie13
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 couples/2 rooms) thoroughly enjoyed our stay in September 2011. From the check-in desk, who were polite, helpful with directions, and competent service to the breakfast staff who were polite and efficient, to housekeeping who were immaculate, we were very happy with our stay. The rooms are comfortable, quiet, and warmly decorated. We had access to Wi-fi, taxis at our disposal, walking proximity to our needs. We would definitely stay again should we be so fortunate to return to Rome, and we would highly recommend this hotel for those looking for a boutique-style stay that feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: iluvbluey
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and had 5 restful nights at the hotel. Great location. Good service. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and ideal location for station and attractions of Rome”
Reviews.Author: 5474C
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at Hotel Raffaello, and our enjoyment of the hotel was a big factor in making it a wonderful to this amazing and unique city. The hotel is on a quiet street just off Via Cavour, ten minutes walk from the station, and ideally placed for walking to the Forum and Colosseum (on Via Cavour), west to Campo de Fiori, Piazza Navona, Trastevere, or north to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. We also walked across to the Vatican. We felt completely safe at all times on all these streets, though we avoided the area beyond Via Cavour, based on guide book advice. All members of the hotel staff were really helpful and friendly, from the man on reception who soon remembered our room number and presented our key with a smile every time we returned, to the ladies serving breakfast who were bright and efficient. All spoke very good English. Breakfast was enjoyable, with a good range on offer including delicious cakes. The room was very acceptable in size, daily cleaning very good, and a reasonable view from the fourth floor.

Reviews.Title: “In a word: excellent”
Reviews.Author: ktsek
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, accessible to all historic attractions friendly family with very good SERVICE warm atmosphere. The staff were very helpful. Felt like home

Reviews.Title: “A good base for your visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: 189852Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated within a 10 min walk from Statione Termini, no need to take a taxi provided that you have good wheels on your suitcase. Gives also a possibiltiy to go places outside main Rom via rail like a daytrip to Tivoli. A Metro station is nearby for easy connections in Rome. Rooms are of average size fro a Rome hotel,clean and recently refurbished as I understand it. Breakfast is quite satisfactory albeit a bit limited in extent.Service in this hotel is very helpful and good English is spoken.Good value for your money I should say after staying six nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a November holiday”
Reviews.Author: Benben3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello Hotel in November 2011. We were impressed by size, decour and cleanliness of the room which seemed to be at a discounted rate due to it being off-peak, so it was good value for money. The breakfast was decent and the only improvement would be to have fresh juice rather than squash. Location was great with regard to the Colosseum and other sights. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great service, clean and nice room and good location”
Reviews.Author: petitpuce
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 4 nights and we are very satisfied. We strongly recommend you to stay there! This hotel situated at a quiet street. The room is very clean and charming. The bath room has a nice jacuzzi shower and they offer very complet toiletries set. The drinks in the mini bar are very affortable. The hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful, they speak english and french (maybe other languages too). The breakfast is very satisfied, they change the fruits and pastry everyday. From the hotel, most of the famous places are walking distance, if not the metro station is very near too. If you are taking train, the train station is just 10minutes by foot. Raffaello hotel is definitely a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “I get a flying Kiss!”
Reviews.Author: YennTeo
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Christmas Day from an early flight, and our room was not ready yet. Here's the first big YES to Raffaello's great service - the front desk lady with the lovely smile (oops, I forgot to ask for her name! I'll call her Miss Sunshine then) said to us, "Leave your luggage here and help yourself to the breakfast!". Hungry from the cold and long haul, we went to the breakfast area only to be greeted by another lovely lady who offered us the loveliest Cappuccino ever. Breakfast was lavish with generous portions of scrambled eggs, salami, toast, etc. Right after breakfast, Miss Sunshine pulled out a map (she knows the drill - what else could tourists like us need - routes to the famous sites, of course!), circled all the sites that are within walking distance and we are set to our great adventure. The Termini station is also within walking distance. We went back to the hotel around noon for check-in after a short walk from the Colosseum and were told our luggage had been brought to our room. That was a nice touch and delighted, we went into our room, (room size is big by Italian standard and very clean) and a minute after, a Christmas card and chocolates were sent to our room. And as I've read about the Espresso machines at the lobby from others' reviews, that is the place I charged to whenever I reached the hotel and we'll just stay there for a full 10 minutes to thaw. We stayed 5 nights and have only but absolute praise for this cosy place. A little too short, we left before New Year's Eve and Miss Sunshine wished us a Happy New Year with a flying kiss. Likewise, here's many good wishes to Hotel Raffaello. Many flying kisses to you all too!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yoni L
Reviews.Content: excellent location, great value for money. will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain find”
Reviews.Author: stickan84
Reviews.Content: This little hotel, tucked away on a comparably quiet street (for being Rome), is a great bargain find that truly exceeded our expectations. The rooms are large, clean, and charming. Although sparingly furnished, they offer everything you would expect (except English TV channels :-) The bathroom is especially large, with a great shower and complementary toiletry products. The breakfast buffet offered most things you could wish for (fruit, eggs, bacon, pastries, bread, etc.), and of course excellent Italian coffee. The service both in the restaurant and the front desk was also excellent. The receptionist was happy to recommend restaurants close to the hotel, and on both occasions these restaurants had great food. It is also worth mentioning that there are an abundance of both restaurants and bars close to the hotel. The only two negatives we found were the location and construction noise. Although close to the central Termini train station, we found that there is quite a walk to most other things (perhaps with the exception of Forum, but it's still a 10-15min walk), and since there's not many attractions close to the hotel be prepared for A LOT of walking or taxi rides. The other thing we found that impacted our overall impression was the construction site across the street from our room which began making noise EARLY on weekdays. Overall, however, this hotel made our visit to Rome all the more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “My pick for Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter j
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very quiet rooms, excellent location off via cavour. Breakfast good too. Have stayed on two visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Everything has already been said”
Reviews.Author: shorttriptraveller
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a flying visit with my son and daughter to Rome and The Hotel Raffaello was the icing on the cake. Even though we were very early we were given one room straight away and were treated superbly by everyone throughout. Nothing else needs to be said and would certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: tropicalkerry2002
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect...20 mins one way to Spanish Steps, 20 mins the other to Colliseum. Very clean, wonderful breakfast, very helpful staff. Room small, but that was not unexpected. Tiny elevator that doesn't quite go to your floor, but we have experienced that before in Italy. Small step up in to bathroom proved a danger at night, when hubby forgot, tripped and hit his head on the sink, but no treatment required!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ojainel
Reviews.Content: Raffaello Hotel is a great value -- we stayed there pre-cruise for 4 nights and, compared to other cruisers who stayed in hotels nearby, we received much more and paid less. The room is a good size with a large newly renovated tiled bathroom; a generous hot and cold breakfast buffet is included; and the English-speaking staff is friendly and helpful. Convenient location to public transportation, including train station, and within walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great”
Reviews.Author: Ashley S
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Raffaello made the experience in Rome very memorable. One of the hotel hosts went out of her way to make us feel welcome and ensure our trip to Rome ran smoothly. I wish I knew her name. We were in Rome to see a contest and she had checked online to ensure we had the proper directions. In her search she discovered that the concert was cancelled and she was very sweet about telling us the news. The room was comfortable. Hard for a Canadian to adjust to small beds, but that is not the hotel's fault. Very close to the Metro Termini station and 5 minutes from the Coliseum. I would definitely stay again,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: dominic_barilla
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Rome May of 2011 and we had an excellent stay at your hotel. The staff was very accommodating and the breakfasts were very good as well. The hotel is close to the train and bus stations and all the major sites are in walking distance. There are good local restaurants and small taverns nearby also, we would recommend you try a stay at the Rafffaello Hotel. We'll be back soon. Thanks for a great time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday stay at the Hotel Raffaello - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A.MACCA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after various research for my partners birthday whilst in Rome. We also took my sister in law with us for the 5 day stay. We booked two double rooms and on arrival we were upgraded for our room for a suite/roof terrace room 502 which was a nice touch. The other room for my sister in law was also excellent/large 4TH FLOOR but she wanted to stay on the same floor as ourselves. ROOM/SUITE 502 - smaller room 510 - 5TH FLOOR: We spoke to Massimo on reception who booked us in - he was able to find a room on the same floor- this room was slightly smaller but very adequate and she was happy with it. (Room 510 She wanted to stay on the same floor as us and we were all very grateful the Hotel was able to accommodate this change at short notice). I had emailed prior to our stay Salvatore Sansone, manager who stated and responded via email we would receive a bottle of proscetto for my partners birthday - but this didnt materialise. But this was no hardship at all - we had, the upgrade and we were buying wine at a near by supermarket to the left of the entrance and across the road to Saint Maria Maggiore - this didnt spoil our stay. There are signs for the Spar by the Tourist Information opposite the Saint Maria Maggiore Church ..but across the Piazza was this other supermarket where we purchased our "Vino" and bruschetta to have on our roof terrace etc Both rooms had room safes, our room coffee facilities, aircon, tv, enough wardrobe space, our room had a shower over a bath; my sister in laws room had a power shower (The room safes - which were not huge but you could fit valuables in and were a great asset/room facility in most hotels nowadays NB...on booking in ask for the room safe key, otherwise return to reception to collect it). The roof terrace was a great added bonus, we used to sit on the terrace a glass of wine and some bruschetta etc. The room did at first appear "musty" after our first day as some guests stated but i think this is due to the air con or the room being secured all day - we opened the windows/patio and the smell was gone...no problem to us. We were out all day after breakfast anyway and returned late at night - it didnt appear to be a dirty smell - but you have to remember this is an old building in the city of Rome, but a very charming one for that and very good value for money. The room was not dirty in any aspect - cleaned daily by the maids, coffee making facilities in our room ie suite but not in the other room my sister in law was in (NB but there is coffee making facilities in the room 502 if your room does not have coffee facilities - at the main reception/also tv/internet computer area - there if you want to drink coffee whilst on the main computer etc) Tea/coffee items were replenished daily, you have a small fridge and usual beers and soft drinks at a Hotel set price The bathroom washing/shower items were replenished every day when used. There is a wall mounted hairdryers in the bathrooms were adequate but some ladies may feel they would rather take there own ones with them. My partner used the Hotel one but took a while to get used to it and in her opinion lacked a bit of "power" but she used it - just took a bit longer to get ready thats all. (NB No great hardship and no criticism of the Hotel because as the manager states in previous reviews it is the "same type of hairdryer" that other hotels have and hotels we have stayed in before have - no hardship, it saved on carrying a haridryer in our hand luggage). STAFF: All the staff on reception were very professional, courteous and knowledgeable - unfortunately i do not know all their names. (NB Maybe name badges for staff to wear Reception/dining staff/maids would assist for + or - feedback? As other hotels do) BUT we didnt have any negative treatment by any staff member while we stayed there Only person name i got to know was on asking the staff member his name - who booked us in on reception - he was called Massimo on reception He was excellent, was able to rejig the room for my sister in law and was very knowledgeable and professional. He was NOT IMPERSONAL as some guests say the reception were - i found all the reception staff to be professional and courteous when you needed something or advice. Not in your face but happy to help when asked something I asked Massimo on different occassions/days the following..he was the one on duty when i needed to ask reception staff some questions and i found the other staff professional as well :- Q: where nearest supermarket was, Q: best means to get to vatican ie metro at the termini, Q: best local restaurants to use in the vicinity(see other reviews re restaurants) Q: directions to the Coliseum and Forums which are nearby Q: City sightseeing bus near to at the termini...we used the Roma Open top bus and was excellent for two day price and buses came every 15-20mins and was on a larger route to seeing the sights than their competitors. He/Massimo was very professional and imparted his knowledge to me - adding the information on to a map at reception for us to take away MAIDS/DINING STAFF: Were also very professional and polite and were always clearing away tables for other guests to arrive..breakfast is from 0700-1000hrs and usual continental breakfast with scrambled eggs as a cooked choice. There was no complaints at all re breakfasts, our 3 party was able to find various things to eat for various eating desires, from vegetarian, fruits, croissants, cakes, cheeses, cold meats, yoghurts, toast and jam. Fruit juices, coffee and tea etc Very well done -Hotel Raffaello for a varied selection for breakfast! Thankyou the 3 x female Dining staff we seen and the chef - as stated i cant name them due to not knowing there names/no name badges Maids were cleaning our room daily and the "blonde hair" italian woman who also did work on some days in the dining rooms/ as a maid the next day during our stay were all/always polite, professional and saying "morning" good day when we bumped into them etc. Thank you all as well. BUS ROMA/ROME OPEN TOUR - CITY OPEN TOP BUS TOURS: http://www.romeguide.it/romeopentour/romeopentoureng.htm Hotel Raffaello only had a leaflet for the Green Line tours in the reception but we found the Roma open tour - City bus tours to be the best value/timescales, seeing the most sights/route of the bus ie We spoke to an independent Tourist Information Bus rep by an umbrella stand opposite the Termini who explained independantly the tour companies...he was impartial and helped us get the best city sightseeing bus company which in my opinion was Roma Open Tour - open top bus tours.... not the others ie Green line ( NB U do get a lot of people trying to sell you/get the Green line bus tours/other bus companies on most corners but we were glad we chose the Roma Open Tour /Roma tours due to buses coming every 15-20mins and it covers the all main sites/routes (some bus tours didnt on set days) - if you have any mobility problems buses on Roma Open Tour come every 15-20mins ie to take the full route from Termini to all the routes/sites and back to the Termini takes 2hours- stops for 10 mins at the Vatican facing St Peters and then at Termini for 10 to 15 mins..they park all tour buses on the left of the junction of Via Cavour/Termini - opposite the Termini...then the bus heads off down Via Cavour towards Saint Maria Maggiore .. see website link/reviews for ROME OPEN TOUR bus company; http://www.romeguide.it/romeopentour/romeopentoureng.htm 26 Euros for 48 hr bus ticket (NB if staying at Hotel Raffaello- nearest Roma Open Tour bus stop and some others is on THE ROAD THAT LEADS UP TO AND OPPOSITE the Saint Maria Maggiore church on the right handside - think the road was called Via Paolina that is the one way road that leads to the Piazza Saint Maria Maggiore - before the tourist Information hut- you will see the bus sign "Roma Open Tours " by a Trinket shop We stayed November 2011 and it was very hot 20 plus degrees when we stayed..it was a bit cold till about 1000/1100hrs then it went very hot/we had 5 days of sunny days which was great ...we were amazed re the temperature at this time - We had packed for extreme cold UK weather! So this was a great bonus eating ice cream at Trajans column in the sun, sitting on the steps facing it! Lol SISTER HOTEL ROOF TERRACE -ALBERGO DEL SENATO HOTEL - FACING THE PANTHEON: Only regret was, i wanted to take my partner to the Albergo Del Senato Sister hotel of the Hotel Raffaello for a drink on the roof terrace for her birthday and then a birthday meal nearby but Salvatore Sensane/manager emailed me to confirm that the roof terrace at this sister hotel in November was closed - ie email confirmed " I regret to inform you that the bar of the Albergo del Senato (our sister hotel ) is open only in summertime but we will try to find an alternative". This was a shame BUT was not the hotels fault, it was the date of my partners birthday ie November - Cant change that date ha ha - we wanted to enjoy a drink at the roof terrace facing the Pantheon lit up at night and during the summer they do offer you tickets to use the roof terrace bar at the sister hotel - so just ask if staying during this time You must visit the Saint Maria Maggiore Church nearby- amazing interiors and church artefacts, one of the Papacy churches etc Capuchin Crypt- is very interesting worth a visit cost 1 euro but only takes 10 mins - NO PHOTOS can be taken but you can purchase for 50 cents postcards of the sights there Vatican Museum/St Peters - last sunday of each month you can gain access for free for the Vatican museum and the St Peters Basilica - but be aware get to the destination before 0900hrs, we waited in line for 1 hour, only opens at 0900hrs and the Vatican museum was a must - didnt get to St Peters by the time we got out of the Museum but our next visit to Rome we will be heading there first, reason to return (in the queues - there are persons trying to get you out of the queues saying it is 3 hrs wait to get in to the Vatican/ St Peters Basillica and offer at a cost for a private tour, but we were there on my partners birthday and the we wanted to mark it by going to the vatican..this day was coincidentally the free day and birthdate/birthday so we went then - we waited only 1 hour. Speaking to other people who left the queues with these private tours still had to queue up and still had to wait and of course pay on the free day for the private tour! Vatican museum/ Sistine chapel was amazing - but the usual idiots were trying to take pictures of the sistine chapel when security were trying to tell people not to and having to run over to stop them- this i found disrespectful. It is a working church chapel/holy place so please please please obey the signs/instructions by staff. We did see security and plain clothes staff pulling up and stopping visitors from taking photos in the sistine chapel and again unfortunately people talking loudly in the chapel instead of being quiet and respectful IRISH PUBS IN ROME WE FREQUENTED: Didnt like the Irish pub Druids Den, off via urbana Via Urbana/Via Panisperna - nearest to Hotel Raffaello (NB : EVEN THOUGH PART OF THE SISTER PUB OF THE - FIDDLERS ELBOW) FIDDLERS ELBOW IRISH PUB: http://www.thefiddlerselbow.com/fiddlers_rome/rome_eng/welcome.htm But we all but loved the Fiddlers Elbow Irish pub off from St Maria Maggiore again near to the hotel, they have an irish music on a wednesday night..from around 2200 hrs to 2230hrs - get there early for a seat "busy" - a mixture of tourists and Italian frequent this pub - on a thursday they have an open mic and more music Scottish female barmaid at the Fiddlers Elbow was great as well as the Italian bar staff at this venue (ROME RESTAURANTS WE FREQUENTED - SEE OTHER REVIEWS IN DUE COURSE): HOTEL RAFFAELLO - CONCLUSION: I could mention other aspects of our stay but want to give a honest and truthful experience of our stay in Hotel Raffaello.I feel i have given an open opinion of this hotel/facilities. (If person(s) wish further answers you can ask me via email) The Hotel is in an up and coming area surrounded by Restaurants/Bars - various building on Via Urbana are being renovated It is prime location for the Termini/City bus tours nearby, easy access to the Sites ie Coliseum/Old Rome within walking distance, nice restaurants/irish bar- Fiddlers Elbow and music. and access to the metro for the Vatican via the Termini which is on other side of Rome/river - only about 6 stops via Line A to OTTAVIANO metro stop which leads down to the Vatican/ St Peters after a ten minute walk...........from St Peters walking also accessible to Castel Saint Angelo Via Della Concilliazione - twenty minute walk from St Peters( or get the Roma BUS TOUR which stops facing St PetersBasilica) There are some "down and outs" begging for money streets off the Hotel BUT they are also throughout Rome and do not appear to be all Italian - put this aside because most European cities Dublin, Paris, Barcelona have similar begging - a polite "No Grazie" worked during our stay etc This is no fault of the Hotel Would i stay at this Hotel again- we usually do not stay at the same Hotel BUT if as and when i want to return to Rome; i would stay at this hotel or the sister hotel at the Pantheon We chose this hotel because it ticked all the boxes we wanted near to sites, access to termini and bus shuttle from the airport one way 8 euros, good facilities and varied breakfasts for all our parties meal requirements We had a memorable stay and staff at this hotel were excellent and professional Thankyou all the staff at Hotel Raffaello!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good location”
Reviews.Author: bigrock01
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here.(Family of 4) Quiet street with plenty of eating choices close by. A short walk to the Colosseum . Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Bathroom was a tad small but you expect that in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Good value, central location”
Reviews.Author: Geoff B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in June and have since recommended it to friends. It is in a fairly quiet area within walking distance of the Coliseum and other major attractions, and there are lots of bars and restaurants nearby. There is easy access to the main railway station and underground lines. We had two good sized twin rooms which were well furnished and equipped. The staff were very helpful when I needed to receive an important fax. We expect to return to Rome sometime next year and will certainly stay at the Raffello.

Reviews.Title: “Average place”
Reviews.Author: GhumakkadCookie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Had booked the airport transfer taxi through the hotel website and there was no issue. As agreed earlier, the taxi fare was paid in cash to the driver. The reception was fine. Hotel rooms are small. Even though our room was facing the road, we did not have any issue with traffic or any kind of noise. There was a heating unit in the room but that works only for 2-3 hours in the early morning and late evenings. (something like 6-9 am and 7-10 pm). Also, in our room, the radiator knob was turned off and since the first day we were not aware of the timings, we could not heat the room. We got to know how it works when we enquired after breakfast the next day. So we missed that morning heating as well. But from then on the room was cozy. Free wi-fi is available and access can be easily gained by asking the reception for the login/password. One thing that put me off was the toilet was stinky and definitely not sanitised. I did speak to the reception about this but they did not seem to take the criticism well. They gave a response saying rooms will be cleaned whenever we leave. I did request for them to specifically disinfect the toilet seat, but this didnt happen. I did not complain again. We had asked for a dental kit but the hotel does not have any additional guest kits. We had basic toiletries like shower gel, shampoo, soap and we also had a vanity kit & shower caps. Breakfast was fine, nothing remarkable but nothing to complain about either. We did ask for fried eggs (which were not on the menu) and got a rather rude response from one of the waitress. Though the other waitress was extremely polite. There are no Halal choices on the restaurant menu (this is true for most hotels across Europe). But halal eateries are close by. The hotel is located within a 5 min walk to Cavour metro station (line B). Also, Termini is about a 10 min walk from the hotel. This proved very convenient for travelling around Rome. Colosseo is the next station to Cavour. This allowed us to take late night walks around the Colosseum when its not at all crowded and beautifully lit. (We purchased a 3 day Roma pass for EUR 25 and this made it pretty convenient to hop on and off the buses and metros. Do note that the airport line (Leonardo express) is not covered by this pass)

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: mallorcaben
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our romantic honeymoon and it surpassed every expectation. Situated close to two Metro and the Termini stations, this hotel is in the best location to explore this beautiful historic city. The Colosseum is just a stones throw away at the end of the road. The staff were without exception, welcoming, friendly and polite. The room was gorgeous, decorated in a traditional way that complimented the whole ambiance of the hotel. We came down for breakfast each day and were greeted by the waitress who offered us fresh coffee and toast, along with a lovely smile. The cold buffet had many delights to tempt you and there was also scrambled egg in the hot buffet which was usually my choice. Free wi-fi in the rooms was a bonus and although pretty slow it allowed us to plan our next days excursions on our laptops. I would like to thank the manager & ask him to pass on our thanks to all the staff who made our stay in you hotel the best honeymoon we could have wished for.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: thedishBoston
Reviews.Content: I want to give this hotel a ringing endorsement, because we encountered no major problems and overall everything went fine. But compared to other hotels we stayed at in Italy, this one was by far the most impersonal. The staff pretty much just leaves you alone, which can be a good thing or a bad thing, depending on your point of view! The location was also a little "iffy" for me... It is close to the Colosseum, but generally quite a long walk to most other places (Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, etc.). This was fine in the morning, but completely exhausting after a long day on your feet! We also had a strange, unpleasant smell in the bathroom that forced us to leave the window open. That said, the rates were excellent, we had a beautiful terrace, breakfast was good, and the room was clean. Overall, I would say Raffaello Hotel offers a very good value in this expensive city, although I might spend a little more next time and stay somewhere in a slightly more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value central location to all major sights, everything you could need”
Reviews.Author: annie_is_lovely
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic break away late November and found the hotel easily accessible from the termini and central to main tourist sights, and with a metro station within easy reach. There was the added bonus of free wifi which we found very useful, and the room we had 212 was of very good size. The shower was on the small side but perfectly useable for ourselves. The only downside for us was the poor hair dryer in the bathroom and lack of ironing facilities. We would have also liked some way of making a hot drink in our room as opposed to using the reception. Breakfast was good with wide range of choices you would expect from a continental offering. The area in the immediate vicinity of the hotel is a little less desirable but you don't have to go too far to find a decent place to eat or a good gelato!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was fantastic, Breakfast good, location excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AtyourLeisure
Reviews.Content: I'd stay here again on business or with my family in a heartbeat. Typical smallish Italian rooms (by American standards), but everything was well appointed, clean, and in working order. Breakfast was typical European buffett, good enough to fill you up with a good variety. Staff here is exceptional, they showed genuine concern for my family in a time of need. Helpful with directions. Always cheerful. Courtesy umbrellas at the entrance came in handy on many rainy days about Rome. Hotel is right up the street from a metro train stop (5 min walk), 10 minute walk to Coliseum. The Coliseum bus stop is the one we always used to get around town, as it has plenty of route coverage from there. Good choices for lunch and dinner in the area... If you know what to expect in a Rome Hotel (smallish) this is a sure bet for any occasion in Rome with easy access to everything and a phenomenal staff.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faraz S
Reviews.Content: What a treat. Rooms were amazing and the whole experience was exceptional. We never thought we'd end up with such a hotel. We did book the hotel after looking at reviews here. Breakfast was very good and we craved that breakfast in other hotels we went to. Staff was very professional an guided us properly. We really felt at home at this Hotel. Metro (Cavour Station) is 5 mins walk away. Internet is free for 5 mins every 24 hours, otherwise you can buy credits at the desk. Would definitely stay here if I ever come back. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RCNLPW1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days in Rome and the Raffaello Hotel is in a perfect location. Most important sites were walkable as was the neighborhood. Being close to Termini Station made travel around Rome easy. I had a single room, which was petite but had all the necessities. The shower is small and I’m not sure how a large person would fit but it worked for me. Breakfast was great and everyone at the front desk very helpful. Someone wrote that there aren’t any English channels on TV but that is not correct, you do get the BBC and CNN, to get to them when you turn the TV on don’t scroll the channels up, scroll down and you come right to them. Channel 70 is an Italian music channel which was nice since there isn’t a radio in the room. The pillows are hard but I used the down comforter as a pillow and that worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Alex_11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well situated - very close to the Termini, Santa Maria Maggorie and the Colessium. Breakfast was great - hot and cold offerings. The cappuccino was wonderful! The room was very clean and comfortable. There were a number of very good reasonably priced restaurants in the area. It was a lot of fun exploring the neighbourhood - from the wine stores to the speciality stores. The staff were very helpful and friendly - thank you Massimo, Francesco, and Edwardo for making our trip so special and enjoyable. Our room was restful, clean and air-conditioned. Overall, the hotel was very comfortable and welcoming. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I would unequivocally recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place right in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: SNorc
Reviews.Content: Raffaello is a super nice place right in the heart of Rome. The staff are friendly and the rooms are clean. Breakfast was really good too!! Would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “City Break to Rome at Hotel Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: BMK15
Reviews.Content: My wife and recently spent 5 days in Rome to see the sights and the city. The city is fabulous in terms of what it has to offer in terms of architecture and culture. We stayed at this hotel and cannot fault it for anything. Accommodation is provided on a Bed and Breakfast basis and the buffet breakfast that they provide is excellent catering for all tastes. The staff in reception and in the dining room are always cheeful, very helpful and always put themselves out. The hotel itself is immaculate. The decor in the rooms is first class and kept spotlessly clean. In addition, for convenient access to the main attractions to Rome I don't think you could get a much better location. I would stay here again and have no hesitation in recommending it to other eople.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: GenieNYC
Reviews.Content: When arriving earlier than check-in time, our experience is that our luggage is held for us and we are told to come back later. Not so at Rome's Hotel Raffaello! Our luggage was taken from us and we were escorted to a nearby lounge area. We were offered coffee and pastries while we sat our travel weary bodies in comfortable armchairs. The best was the free computer use for the entire time we waited for our room which was less than 45 minutes. Actually I could hardly be torn away from it. The desk clerk/concierge was delightful, friendly and very warm towards us. Our hairdryer broke while we were there and it was replaced immediately. Our room was exceptionally large by Rome's standards, including a loveseat, desk, TV, and armoir. This was not our first tripto Rome and had previously stayed in rooms no larger than closets. A very nice breakfast was included. We stayed post cruise out of Civitavecchia for 2 days at the Raffaello and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “unforgetable!”
Reviews.Author: Filomena D
Reviews.Content: super-kind receptionists, we had an unforgetable stay in Hote Raffaello. It was our tenth anniversary of marriage and we found a surprise in our room at the end of our day in Rome: white wine for two! we enjoyed very much in our very nice room with terrace. thanks again! gentilissimi alla reception, con tanto di sorpresa in camera per il nostro anniversario. grazie ancora Hotel Raffaello.......da raccomandare!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: beverley40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello for 3 nights in early November, and were extremely happy with our choice. The hotel is in a perfect location for visiting all of the major sites - we walked everywhere, never needing public transport or taxis, not even to visit the Vatican, although this took about 50 minutes. We found it took about 15 minutes to the Colesseum, 20 to the Trevi Fountain. Due to a small mixup with an airport pick-up, we were upgraded to a wonderful room on the top floor of the hotel with our own terrace looking out over the rooftops of Rome, which was magical. The room was spotless and very comfortable, and the staff are incredibly helpful. We would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Alison H
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Rome. 'It won,t be our last'. Within easy access from the termini the Raffaello is a beautiful Hotel. Friendly, clean, lovely breakfasts, adequate size room. All the sights of Rome are within easy walking distance from the hotel. Even the day we encountered a "Thunderstorm" the staff helped out with a large umbrella. We are both certain of one thing...... Rome! we will see you again next year. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard room at Rafaeello Hotel for 2 nights in October 2011. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Very very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Also, the location of the hotel is perfect. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in safe and central location”
Reviews.Author: GwenToronto
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Raffaello Hotel was perfect, from the quiet, spacious, and beautifully decorated room with great decor, to the incredible breakfast we enjoyed every morning. This hotel was perfectly suited for trips to all of Rome's major sites, was close to many delightful restaurants, and was a fantastic place to return after a busy day of sightseeing and shopping. The service was excellent. We would return anytime!

Reviews.Title: “A great place from which to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: bagspacked51
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in central Rome for a 4-day stay and couldn't have been more pleased. The room walls were upholstered, with padding under the upholstery, which gave a touch of elegance and even more quiet to the room. The staff were uniformly warm and helpful. The breakfast was great, with scrambled and hard-boiled eggs offered every morning, as well as croissants, pastries, juice, yogurt and fruit. The cappuccino was good. My only negatives: the Jacuzzi showers are small and might not work for a large person, and street noise occasionally drifted up into our rooms, such as the garbage truck that mysteriously banged below us at 2:00 Saturday morning. There were good restaurants in the neighborhood and a very reasonably priced Internet cafe. My husband is snobbish about hotels, and he thought this hotel had near 5-star quality. Only the bathroom and the small, old elevator kept the Rafaello from earning additional stars.

Reviews.Title: “Steps from the Coliseum”
Reviews.Author: ski_co_usa
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 night stay at the Hotel Raffaello. The room was great, on a quiet street, we could not have expected more. The included breakfast was a great way to start the busy days of sightseeing, within walking distance of the Coliseum and Trevi Fountain, looking forward to a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay; delightful terrace”
Reviews.Author: DeeCalAustin
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to have booked this amazing little boutique hotel on a wonderful side street in Central Rome for the first leg of our honeymoon. The manager Salvatore is fantastic, the breakfast bountiful with the best coffee I've ever tasted, and the street was very quiet at night. Salvatore gave us the perfect room on the top floor for our romantic getaway-- with a fantastic terrace-- and we were welcomed with a lovely bottle of Prosecco. We arrived early, and by the time we got back from lunch, our things had been magically transported to our room.
