The Raffaelo's location, price, space, etc was a terrific value, and most of the staff is great. (Don't expect friendliness from the guys on the night shift. Hey, every place has its downside.) The best part is that you get access to the most fantastic rooftop bar in all of Rome at their sister hotel, the Albergo del Senato just steps away from the Pantheon. (It's a much pricier hotel, but worth it if you have the budget.) A sunset drink up there is an experience you will NEVER forget-- an absolute must do!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet”
Reviews.Author: rogeralan
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here in August before a cruise. Great location on a quiet side street. Walking distance to the Coliseum and metro. Rooms on the first floor facing the street have a great balcony. Top floor rooms facing the street have large terraces. Our room on the top floor toward the back of the building had a small balcony that overlooked the neighboring church. Room size was spacious. Breakfast was a welcome treat each morning and Cristina couldn't be more accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Half term October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 night stay at the Hotel Raffaello. We really loved the position of the hotel. Metro Cavour was just down Via Urbana which is very useful. Via Urbana itself is a very interesting street with a few restaurants and useful shops leading into atmospheric backstreets. Most of the major sites can be walked to from the hotel. The breakfast's were delicious - everything was so fresh. The hotel was spotless and the staff were extremely helpful. I would happily recommend it to family and friends and would stay here again the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Hotel Near Major Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Yooper1234
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello is elegant and quiet. It is tucked away on a quiet street but within walking distance to major tourist attractions. The hotel staff spoke English and were helpful with maps and suggestions. The breakfast buffet ( included in the plan) was outstanding in quantity, quality and abudant choices. The room and bath were very large (especially by European standards) and every amenity was provided. I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, quietly located close to the ancient heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: pymmjj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3-day short Autumn break. The Raffaello is located just off the Via Cavour on a pleasant, quiet side street. There are plenty of good restaurants - frequented by the locals - within 10 minutes walk. The Hotel staff were welcoming and the rooms stylishly decorated. The only negative for us was the VERY firm bed and excruciatingly solid pillows; but then, we always seem to find this in Italy! The breakfast - served on the mezzanine - was very good with a wide selection of fruits, meats, cheeses, croissants and pastries, plus juices and jugs of great coffee. The Raffaello is an excellent hotel choice; reasonably priced and all the key sites of the ancient city can be walked to within a few minutes. Cavour Metro station is also a few minutes away, which will take you to the further away places like the Vatican. We would definitely stay here again, when in Rome - but would pack our own pillows!

Reviews.Title: “all roads should lead travelers here...”
Reviews.Author: ScribblingSabeth
Reviews.Content: A short walk from Termini Station, this gem of a hotel sits in a small alcove off the Via Urbana. Upon arrival, you are met with friendly, professional, and extremely hospitable staff who aim to ensure your time in the Eternal City is spectacular, educational, and truly enriching to your vacationing spirit. The rooms are lovely, relaxing, and filled with breathtaking views from the balcony porch. Simply elegant décor with comfortable beds, fantastic showers, clean and fresh amenities, and internet access available upon request. Raffaello's essence of true hospitality lies, however, within their Roman breakfast buffet. A vast array of options for adults and children alike, scrambled eggs to-die-for, and your own little pot of coffee every morning. This feast is a great way to begin a long day of exploration of life, history, and culture, including taking in the nearby Colosseum, Roman Forum, and Mamertine prison. I highly recommend taking in a sunrise from your room’s balcony, attending a Catholic Mass at the neighboring Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore, and wandering down Cavour for some of the most delicious and affordable Italian dining rooms. In a city absolutely full of hospitality and passion, the Raffaello truly stands alone. All roads should lead travelers here…

Reviews.Title: “What a riot”
Reviews.Author: DaveDonut
Reviews.Content: We arrived during the demonstration/riot on 15th October. On arriving at the Termini we had to cross the main demonstration road to get to the hotel and were 'kettled' by the police and became trapped between the demonstrators and the police line - just as the trouble started. It was quite frightening. Eventually, we were let through and, very relieved, found the hotel. All staff are helpful and pleasant. The breakfast was very good. Great location. Great room. My only real issue was with the shower which was a 'Jacuzzi shower'. A lot of the jets were broken and the plastic cracked and the shower unit was very cramped. A standard shower with a decent shower head would be preferable. On leaving, we decided to treat ourselves to a taxi from the hotel. The recommended taxi firm provided a very comfortable plush mercedes and a very polite driver. It was 50 euro to either of the airports - mabye the firm could charge 10 euro less to the nearer Ciampino - which is where we departed from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Spacious, comfortable room, awesome breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: olitravel
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of staying elsewhere our first two nights in Rome, but fortunately we were able to switch to Raffaello and it made all the difference in making our trip truely memorable (and it was only 20-30 euros more at peak season for 2 adults, 1 12 yo child). The hotel is a 5-10 minute (max.) walk from the train station terminal. The trick to finding a hotel in this area is to stay north (north-west) of the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore (via Cavour) -south-east of it and the neighborhood really is less than desireable and not at all esthetically pleasing. The room was very comfortable and spacious and my wife who has trouble with hotel beds slept like a baby. The room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom fabulous. I found them to be very courteous and helpful; they were able to direct me to an open pharmacy on a Sunday that also sold herbal remedies. The breakfast was absolutely fabulous! It was a great way to start off a long day of tours. There are also several restaurants and a grocery store within just a few minutes walk. The city attractions are accesible by bus, taxi (less than 10 euros from Pantheon area to the hotel), metro stop from the train station, or even a 15-20 minute walk to the Forum/Colluseum area. The hotel even let us leave our luggage after having checked out early morning before taking our last tour and returning in the afternoon for our departure from the train station. We were also able to check in early (slightly before noon) on our arrival day. Need I say more? When I return to Rome, this is where I'm staying, it is EXCELLENT!!!!! Don't settle for less.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located and Good Value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: FMMSouthWales
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated on a back street and first impressions most certainly did not do it justice. This is a smaller hotel with a family run feel offering excellent value for money (on Rome standards). Breakfast was superb, except for the orange juice (even though this is the standard orange juice for Italy!), The room was very clean and felt extremely safe (which was very important as we were two ladies travelling together) with the big plus of an excellent restaurant only a very short walk away (the first you come to going uphill from the Hotel) and the rail and open top bus terminus only a little further. The Hotel is very close to Santa Maria Maggiore if you are looking to find it on a map. One tip is that the hotel has leaflets for Greenline Open Top Tours and as you walk to the termini street sellers will try to encourage you to use Greenline but Greenline are certainly not the best value as they have the longest queues at the terminus and the lowest frequency so do go to the termini before making your choice. We used the "Walk In Rome" Open Tour which threw in a walking tour and boat trip with a two day ticket for the same cost as Green Line's 2 day ticket I would certainly stay there again if I return to Rome and would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: greyz10
Reviews.Content: Returned from a 4 day trip to rome last weekend (16th October 2011) having decided to stay at the Raffaello after much research and it was essentially the reviews posted here that made my mind up. The Raffaello offered a great central location, a ten minute walk from Termini, and within easy walking distance to all the major sights excluding the Vatican unless you dont mind a fairly sizeable walk, around 45 mins. It was great value, the room was a decent size, not huge by any means but more than enough room for my girlfriend and I. The room, and hotel in general was very clean and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfasts here are great also, served from 7 to 10am, offering a selection of cereals, fruits, yoghurts, juices and pastries, as well as eggs, ham and bread, it really set you up for a long day of sightseeing. It's a great base for your Rome adventure and I cant recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in everyway”
Reviews.Author: ttaylor929
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3nights in this hotel ,my husband myself and daughter age 15yrs,Excellent fast check in room 206,over looked street at the front of the hotel,room clean and felt luxurious ,lovely clean bathroom high ceiling felt very spacious,although pillows a little flat but hey we where happy, Breakfast plenty of choice expecting just continental got more than that,got taxi to vaticantook only 10 mins, be there early like 8.30 we got there at this time and still had to queue for 1 hr,great tour guide Luigi although a little expensive at 25 euros per person extra when its still 15 euros extra to pay when you get inside but we where told far more than if we had done it alone ,make sure you do Pompeii tour and versuvius its well worth early start,Sadly colleseum was closed due to demonstrations and riots never mind we will go back and will return to this hotel,sister hotel Albergo Del Senago is worth a visit pre organise it at Rafaello first then take lift to roof terrace and chill there with wine its excellent,100 per cent recommend this hotel but shhh dont tell anyone this is our secret

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: BardofMountbatten
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in September 2011. Excellent location and staff. We were very fortunate to stay in room 506 which had a large rooftop terrace where we could sit out and enjoy a beverage or two after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and friendly, but otherwise quite modest hotel”
Reviews.Author: tpfin
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 4 nights in Hotel Raffaello, in a quadruple with two rooms (and one bathroom). The windows were facing into a shaftlike area, so there was absolutely no view and not much sunlight either (I suppose some of the quadruples are facing the street, though). The good point was that there was no noise from the street; the bad point was the noise from kitchen starting around 6.30 am. Otherwise the rooms were good; actually the beds were very good! There was a small LCD-tv in both the rooms. Also, the rooms and the bathroom were very clean. All in all, neat rooms with no frills. The breakfast room was elegant and coffee/tea/etc was served to the table. The selection was fresh, but not very generous - unless you prefer to eat sweet pastries, etc (one morning, there were nice baked apples). As the breakfast room is quite small, it may get crowded between 9 and 10. However, if you go before that, there is no problem. Service at the reception is very friendly and wellcoming (probably the best feature in this hotel). We arrived well before the check-in time, but our room was made available immediately. Taxi was always promptly arranged for us and the suggested local restaurants were good. The area is OK. Via Urbana is a narrow street, with not much traffic. There are nice restaurants and little shops. In the evening, craftsmen sit in front of their workshops and socialize with the local people. It is quite romantic, but not in a polished way - everything is a bit rough around the edges.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Mtl
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello Hotel was our introduction to Rome. All hotel staff were super friendly and helpful from our first email contact to the end of our stay. From limo arrangements for transport from the airport, to Massimo greeting us and making sure we got a room upon early arrival, as well as Francesco who gave us super directions on making our way around and advice re our train to Civitavecchia for our cruise and Eduardo (hope I got his name right) who gave wonderful wine recommendations. The hotel is well situated: within a 10-minute walk from the Termini station in one direction and a 15-minute walk from the Colosseum, walking through the trendy Monti district in the other direction. Taking a small lift to the third floor, our room was quiet, clean, air-conditioned and although a bit small, there was plenty of storage space. Good water pressure for the shower. Breakfast was substantial with offerings of hot dishes, cold cuts, cheeses, cereals, fruit, pastries, juice, coffee, tea, etc. Overall, the hotel was elegant yet cozy with a smile at every turn. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and charming”
Reviews.Author: noonclan
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello was a charming boutique hotel that was very clean and friendly. The room was comfortable and the window sashes opened up to the quiet side street. The hotel gave us a bottle of wine, which was unexpected and delightful. They also gave us a good recommendation for a small local restaurant with great pasta just a block away. We had to leave early, but they let us get a quick breakfast before we left.

Reviews.Title: “Rome doesn't have to be expensive!”
Reviews.Author: FiFi253
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Raffaello in August, so rates were much cheaper than the rest of the year. The hotel is fantastic, we had a wonderful welcome, it is centrally situated, very comfortable with air conditioning etc and a really good breakfast. We had supper a few minutes walk from the hotel, pizzas were available form only 7 euros, all the food locally was very good. It's about 10 mins from Termini and about 10 mins to Colloseum. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Should have requested a better room”
Reviews.Author: HowWeTravel
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start off with the negatives, as we experienced them, because they do not seem to be reflected in many other reviews. Cons: - Our room smelled TERRIBLY of mold/mildew. We got used to it after being in the room for a while, but it was incredibly overwhelming each time we walked in. - There was a large window, but it looked onto a brick wall...literally. No natural light at all. - The shower (no tub, which other rooms seem to have) is so tiny it seemed like a joke. My husband and I are not tiny people, but we couldn't even comfortably turn in the shower. Despite the bathroom being a decent size, it was a teeny tiny corner shower, which had jets that took up more room and we couldn't even use. When we were checking out the gentleman at the front desk made a point of saying, in a snarky tone, that we booked through expedia (we had actually booked through hotels.com). I'm not sure if this had something to do with us getting a lesser room. This said, by no means did we get any huge bargain. Pros: - Very close to Termini and reasonable cab fare from Centro Storico - Area is good - restaurants, shops, galleries, etc - Hotel/room seems to have been renovated recently - Good breakfast - meats, cheeses, sweet roles, cereal, yogurt, etc - Access to roofdeck of sister hotel across from Pantheon

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in heart of Roma!”
Reviews.Author: kaycee2117
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Raffaello Hotel in mid September. The location is great - you can walk everywhere and it is so easy to find. It is literally one straight road from the train station and you take one turn down a little alley and here it is! Only 10 min walk from Termini station, 15 min walk to the Colosseum, 20 min walk to the Trevi Fountain.The room is nice and spacious. The bathroom has a jetted/jacuzzi like shower. Breakfast is included and offers a great selection. Francesa from the front desk is super nice and helpful. She gave us some great recommendations for local cuisine. Be sure to try Tema, La Vecca and Vecchio Roma. We also took a day trip to Vatican City and it is just a 10 min ride after you get on at Termini station. We were pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to get around Rome. This city is so beautiful and every attraction took our breath away. Cons: the gentleman at the front desk who checked us in did not offer us a Safe key or tell us about a safe at all so we had to go back downstairs to retrieve this (no big deal); the air con turns off automatically when you leave the room so after a long hot day, you come back to a stuffy room (understandable as it is a waste of energy when you are not in the room), there is limited WIFI and internet although they do give you a card with some few time on it. Also there are zero English channels on TV. But all these cons do not compare to all the pros of the hotel. We enjoyed our stay here very much and will definitely return again. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “30th Wedding anniversery”
Reviews.Author: Boffdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for five nights 2-7 Oct during which we celebrated our 30th anniversery. The hotel is clean, comfortable and the breakfasts were very good. The staff are courteous and friendly. The airconditioning is a great asset as during our time here the tempreture was 29c during the days. The location is about ten minutes to the train station and the Colloseum is about fifteen minutes (walk). We are strong walkers so the Vatican city was not a problem to us at about 50 minutes but when you add to it the walking you do when there and the return journey, you know you have been for a walk ! We have no criticisms of this hotel and would use it again. Restaraunts in the area are good and there are plenty of them all who want your trade. Oh and the shower. A bit cramped but I'm 5' 9" and 12st so to me and my wife (who is smaller) it was fine !

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: salieb
Reviews.Content: Was a nice surprise. They take a lot of effort to make the rooms very elegant and comfortable. Great breakfast - unlike any other we've seen in this city. Easy to get to - we walked from the train station (15 mins). Cab to center of old city = E6. Tiny complaint - if you are "big" or tall (>6'), sitting on the toilet in our room was difficult - knees jammed against the tub. Otherwise bathroom was sizeable, not small. Good internet. Don't forget to get a voucher to visit their "sister" hotel overlooking the Pantheon. Have drinks looking down over the quarter - fun.

Reviews.Title: “Well run,comfortable hotel in convenient place.”
Reviews.Author: Longsight
Reviews.Content: Well......what can I say - after reading the recent reviews there doesn't seem much to add, but I'll try. I'm always a little apprehnsive when arriving at an hotel not visited before but as soon as we walked in I somehow knew that all would be well. The man on reception was welcoming & it was obvious that the hotel was well cared for. Our room was on the 1st floor so we didn't have to use the lift & as I didn't see any of the other rooms, I can only comment on ours. It was not large, but perfectly formed with good quality furniture, a king size bed & overlooking a quiet side street - very little noise as it had modern double glazed window. Flat screen television with many channels & a great air conditioning unit which was very controllable & quiet - absolutely necessary as it was 29'c when we were there. The bathroom was large, modern & spotlessly clean. Several people have mentioned the small showers - yes they are small but it's modern & worked very efficiently & I managed perfectly well at 6ft 4ins & 14 stone! The breakfast has been mentioned in several reviews & it really is exceptionally good with a great variety of choice to suit everyone - even lovely scrambled egg. The 2 ladies looking after the breakfast room are pleasant & efficient, clearing the tables as soon as they are vacated & replenishing the breakfast buffet as soon as something ran out. A really, really important thing for us was the coffee machine & kettle in the small lounge. It meant that my wife could have a cup of tea, which is absolutely essential to her well being (!), & I could enjoy a really good coffee. A well run hotel is always down to the man in charge & the Raffaello is run by the Director, Salvatore Sansome who was always around & always willing to help & the rest of the staff seem to follow his lead, always pleasant, nothing too much trouble & looking as if they actually enjoyed the job. Very reassuring to stay in an hotel run by efficient staff - I could name many in England where this is not the case. I've been trying to think of a negative & I've just thought of one - there was construction work going on nearby & there was some noise. Hardly the fault of the hotel though!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Johnsr55
Reviews.Content: We cmae back to Hotl Raffaello for a 4 day and 2 day stay this year after enjoying a 2 day stay in 2010. The longer stay proved to be just as nice as last year. The location is very convenient both to the major train and Metro stations as well as the tourist sites. The rooms were comfortable and very clean. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfasts are very good and were the best of all 5 hotels we visited this trip. We are going back next year with our whole family and the staff were very helpful in making the arrangements for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: cmd94583
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for just 1 day, arriving and departing by train, with the sole purpose of taking the Colosseo underground tour so the Raffaello Hotel turned out to be a perfect choice. It's a 10 minute walk down the hill from the Termini train station and then another 15 minutes downhill to the Colosseo on Via Cavour. We had a very early train departure the next morning so this was ideal. The triple room was the perfect setup for having our son along; the room was clean and comfortable with a good shower. The continental breakfast was the best we had during our entire trip. Only two negatives: the smallest wall safe I've ever seen and an elevator to match! Not high on the priority list, but just an FYI for those of you with valuables to lock up or lots of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Thom2011
Reviews.Content: We booked well in advance of our September trip to Rome and were allocated a room on the fifth floor with views out across the rooftops and a small balcony. We loved it. The room was a reasonable size - perhaps looked smaller than it was due to ornate decoration. Very good ensuite facilities, spotlessly clean. The shower was very good but might be considered quite neat in size. A very good, wide-ranging self-service breakfast is available on the ground floor from 7-10. Pleasant multi-lingual staff serving hot drinks and toast. The service in this hotel is excellent. Reception staff couldn't have been more helpful. A special service is advertised in the morning where staff are available (with a laptop) to answer any questions about the city. Maps are provided and seemingly all queries however obscure tackled. The hotel is in a great location not far from Termini station but in a quiet street with a small range of shops, bars and restaurants. Has the feel that it is becoming quite a trendy area with a number of design shops and cool bars. Very close to bus routes and metro stations only a few blocks away. But the centre of historic Rome is close - 15 minutes to walk - as is the Colosseum and ancient Rome. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel - and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne R
Reviews.Content: This place is terrific. Quiet but centrally located, the front desk staff is without question the nicest hotel staff. Ditto for the breakfast staff and housekeeping. For a special treat, take them up on their offer to visit their sister property right next to the Pantheon. The rooftop terrace is the nicest spot in Rome to see the sunset...and very affordable. Rooms are spotless and you will be treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Re: Business Trip this year”
Reviews.Author: DAF7
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome on business and I required a hotel close to the main train station; Roma Termini. It's about a ten minute walk. The staff at this older, but modern hotel is very friendly and I requested an early arrival since I was traveling from Canada. My room was ready upon arrival. The rooms are clean, quiet and inviting, with all the amenities. Breakfast is avialable in the morning and the selection and quality is excellent. For those wanting to sightsee, a bus stop for the Green Line Tour is only two blocks away. An excellent hotel and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, excellent breakfast,very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: WalkTG
Reviews.Content: Great location to explore old city on foot. Hotel arranged a car to pick us up from airport, so easy. Rooms, staff and breakfast all great quality and value. Great local restaurants to choose from. Staff friendly and helpful. Wireless Internet pretty slow.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraMD59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel, which we chose because of tripadvisor reviews, from August 29 through September 2, 2011. It was almost perfect. The staff is very helpful and friendly and that includes everyone - front desk, breakfast room personel, etc. The location is very quiet, but close to Via Cavour, so almost everything in Rome is accessible by walking. Termini is about 4 blocks away for metro, train, and bus transportation. The colloseum and forum are about 6 blocks away in the other direction. All the main sights in Rome, with the exception of the Vatican are within a walkable distance and we are senior citizens. The rooms are very clean and well decorated. The breakfast is great - the best we had in Italy. The only problems are that the shower is small as reported in other reviews, but it is a Jacuzzi shower with multiple jets and a foot spray besides the main shower spray, so it was fun to use. The room safe is very small and will not hold even a tablet (Ipad). This is the only hotel in its price range that I would stay in Rome and I highly recommend it. Another bonus is that around the corner on Via Cavour (a half block from the hotel) is a very good and reasonable restaurant. It was so good that we ate there all 5 nights we were in Rome. The waiters were friendly and fun. Another block away on Via Cavour is the best gelato that we have ever tasted. We spent $60 there in 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sandra99999
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed twice in this hotel in Rome, which was chosen after reading other Tripadvisor reviews. I thought it was terrific! The hotel staff were all very nice and the included breakfast was yummy. I wanted an included breakfast due to the difficulties we had in finding breakfast in Paris in 2009. The hotel is small-5 stories, well-kept and quiet. It is in a good location, convenient to Metro, tourist info and the on/off bus. It's not in the midst of the hustle/bustle, but that is my preference. Be aware the twin beds are kind of narrow but not terrible. I usually choose small, locally owned hotels like this one so I find the differences between this type and the big American hotels kind of charming.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in the middle of Rome. Not perfect, but excellent.”
Reviews.Author: AwakenTampa
Reviews.Content: Overview: We wanted a hotel that was centrally located and within walking distance of some of the major sites if public transportation went on strike while we were there (which it did 1 of the 3 days). The location is very good, but not as perfect as it seemed on paper. See below for more details. It is a very well kept, clean hotel that is just 1 street off a main road (Via Cavour) so street noise wasn’t much of a problem. We did hear the occasional police siren at night but that had nothing to do with the location. The bathroom was an average size for Europe, but the shower was extremely small. We got a room on the top floor which was a little more hassle to get to with either the small winding stairs or the slow little elevator, but it was away from the street and had a nice patio so overall it was a win. It is really a 4.5 star hotel. Pros: - Within walking distance of Termini train station and Ancient Rome (Colosseum). - Good breakfast included in price. - Room was ready early. - Friendly multi-lingual staff. Let us know about a strike one day that saved us some hassle. - Adequately spacious room. - Pretty quiet overall. - Large bed (decent comfort) Cons: - Shower is super tiny. We had trouble washing our hair because of the lack of arm room and we are thin people. - Elevator was very extremely small (better than walking up 6 flights of stairs at least). - The location was very central, but not super close to anything. Being closer to Termini or somewhere on the Bus 40/64 line would have been nicer. Still a very good location, just not as perfect as it seemed on paper.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocou
Reviews.Content: Selected it from advice on TripAdvisor. Location is great, it's a short walk from many attraction, subway station, train station, and right in the Monti area - full of local restaurants, bars, cafés. Staff was very courteous and helpful, breakfast is fine, the rooms are good, not noisy (at least the one we had).

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kysupt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on August 27 for a two night stay. This hotel certainly met our high expectations. All staff members were exceptionally helpful and friendly. The breakfast offered was outstanding and the servers were very accomodating. I recommend this hotel with no reservations and would enjoy staying there again. It must be noted that many of the fine restaurants in the city are closed during August. This was not a big problem with us as hotel staff directed us to some very good alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Mito44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good base for visiting and exploring Rome. Friendly helpful polite staff. Very good breakfast. Reception staff provided good advice about excellent local restaurants and visiting local attractions. Room clean, quiet and air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hideaway in great area”
Reviews.Author: Conor-Angus
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel, in a great location in Rome and close to lots of great restaurants and sights. This area of Rome is great at night and also walking distance from Termini. The breakfast is good too. highly recommended, watch the prices though they fluctuate quite a lot depending on the season.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and service.”
Reviews.Author: Mandy H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and accommodating. The service was good and the breakfast is more extensive than anywhere else we stayed in Italy. They were helpful with advice on when to visit attractions in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MilwaukeeMeghan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and I thought it was a good value for the money. Our room was large for Rome and had a cute balcony. The man that worked at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. I thought the breakfast was good - you can ask for bread and I think some other items too. I thought it was in a good, safe area in reasonable walking distances to attractions and other parts of the city. The internet wasn't free, but it had a good, strong connection and was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: tomast
Reviews.Content: Being in a classical european city and not having a huge budget I wasn't expecting much but I was surprised on how everything looked in the hotel. Rooms were very nicely appointed with modern bathrooms and classical upholstered walls. Bedroom wasn't huge but my family spent the time seeing the city and only using the room to store our luggage and sleep. The hotel was quaint and cozy, had all the amenities we needed, and served a nice breakfast in a neat little area up the stairs from the lobby. Driving our rental car was a little tricky, too many one way streets that make you drive far to get to the location (once i had to take a shortcut down a one way street, going in the opposite direction) but location was worth it. Would definitely come back and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience ... for a 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: se7s
Reviews.Content: +ve: - Clean room, average space, but little bit old. Air conditioned though! - Good breakfast, and very good service at the restaurant. - Very good location, close to the train, Metro and bus terminals (10 minutes by foot). The hotel is also close to the main attractions (20 minutes by foot to the Colloseum). - We made couple of local calls from the room (to make a reservation at Villa Burghese), and the reception staff was kind enough not to charge us at the time of check out. - Staff speak good English. -Ve: - The restaurant is very small, so you might be faced with unavailability of seats/tables during rush hour of morning breakfast. You may need to be stand outside the restaurant for sometime till you get a free table. - No free internet. You have to buy, and it’s very expensive (3 euros for 15 minutes). Just walk to Roma Termini, and you can get 1 hour for 3-4 euros. - The hotel is old and not so well maintained, but overall is ok for a 3 stars at this price. -The hotel is surrounded by restaurants, pizzerias and groceries. Look for a supermarket chain called Despar around the hotel. I feel it offers the best variety and prices. My overall experience in the hotel is positive, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel, suited us perfectly”
Reviews.Author: dhruv8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated roughly 10 minutes walking distance from the Central Termini Station (heading in the direction towards the Colloseum) and 10 minutes from the Colloseum. Nice, clean hotel and an entire building as the hotel as opposed to most hotels which we saw in Rome which had only a couple of floors dedicated to it. The breakfast has to be the selling point of this hotel, very unlike other European establishments in which we have stayed... eggs, cereal, juices, croissants, fruits, coffees... very wholesome. The service at the breakfast is very very good. The rooms... though tiny are clean and we had no problems. The shower area is.... well the smallest in the world.... but not an issue at all. Our room did not have a safe.. The staff at the front desk is helpful - though they do give you a sense of being a wee bit irritated at times. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the colloseum as also the shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a perfect location. The staff is very friendly and accomodating - especially the women who manage the breakfast room! Clean, safe and a great value! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “No nonsense hotel”
Reviews.Author: SUBHASHINI G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. Friendly front desk who helped us find nearby vegetarian restaurants. Complimentary breakfast was decent. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Anne27Dublin
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, within walking distance of major attractions. Very clean rooms, loadsa character. They kindly left a bottle of wine for my boyfriends birthday in our room. It was a lovely surprise. Breakfast is lovely. I think this hotel is really great value. I highly recommend it. Only negative thing is the shower is very small but honestly it's such good value I don't think it's an issue. We really enjoyed our stay here & the staff are lovely & very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: tulipgirl74
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 5 days of our honeymoon in this hotel. The people were all very friendly and all spoke English very well. (Which was important because our Italian was not so good.) The staff was able to get cabs for us and assist in booking tours. Everyone was so nice...especially the tall bald gentleman who worked evenings (not nights) and the woman with long dark hair during the day. The rooms were very spacious, even by American standards, and impeccably clean. The breakfast was delicious and large to the point that we didn't need to eat lunch most days. The bed was a bit hard, but that could have been as a result of a new mattress being installed in our room. While this hotel does have an elevator, it is not handicap accessible as the lift stops halfway through the floor and you need to walk up or down to get to your room. Not an issue for us, but my stepson is in a wheelchair so we notice these kinds of things. The hotel states it is 5 minutes from the Coliseum, which is not exactly accurate. It is within easy walking distance, but I think 15 minutes might be more accurate. It is an easy 15 minute downhill walk from Termini Station, so no reason to hail a cab (although they are incredibly cheap if you do.) If you stay here (which I highly recommend) you MUST go to La Vacca for dinner 2 blocks away. As you leave the hotel, turn left and go about 2 blocks. It is on the left hand side with white doors and bright green walls. It was, hands down, the best food my husband and I have ever eaten in our lives. It was recommended by another traveler and I am so glad she did. That restaurant was the highlight of our trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely upgraded and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Steve4travel_Calgary
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms over tow nights and rooms tight on size but beds comfortable and bathrooms recently upgraded. The included breakfast was very nice and the staff very friendly. Location is convenient to the train station but we felt a bit out of any real core of restaurants or shopping - a matter of choosing your priority for location. It was good value, for Rome, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel. We will recommend it to our family and friends.”
Reviews.Author: Teresa C
Reviews.Content: The Rafaello Hotel is in a great location in Rome. Close to the Roman Colosseum and walking distance to the train station. There are a choice of tour buses to take you around Rome that stop a block from the hotel. Our room was clean and quiet. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the staff was very helpful and friendly. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Quad room for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: midlifecrsis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raffaello The location of the Raffaello is in walking distance to all the Ancient sites. Rome is a city that is best seen by walking. This is the reason we chose Raffaello. The hotel staff was smiling, cheerful and eager to assist with any of our needs. We arrived from a cruise ship and were part of a large group that was checking in at the same time. The staff did a great job of being attentive to everyone and made us all feel special. We stayed in a Quad room that had two separate bed rooms. The kids had their own room and we had a master bedroom. The room was clean and looked awesome! The bathroom shower needed some maintenance due to the doors on the “Shower Capsule” would not close all the way. The shower capsule was also a tight fit for a large man.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Stevestrumpet
Reviews.Content: The room was perfect with a lovely terrace and the staff provided a bottle of wine as we were celebrating our anniversary. This hotel is very nice and was one of the best during our trip

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ace_Coco
Reviews.Content: Raffaello Hotel is in a fabulous location - walking distance to everything (10-15min walk to the Ruins, 10min to the Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese). We arrived early (mid-morning) and walked from Termini station to Raffaelo (approximately 10minutes while carrying/rolling luggage) and our triple room was ready. The room was very large, the third bed was nearly it's own room, gently separated from the primary living space by an electrical wall with the fridge and desk. Our room faced Via Urbana, which was busier than we expected, but wasn't bothersome. The bathroom was small relative to the rest of the room (very adequate, just limited space to put your things), and quite modern. The lift for the hotel is quite small (limited to 3 persons, but with luggage, that's an ambitious 3 persons). Breakfast was very nice, with tasty pastries, fruit, cereal, yogurt, coffee/tea/juices. Internet was reasonably priced (there is a computer terminal available) with passcodes for hours (so you didn't have to purchase by day, merely by a time allotment, 10E for 8 hours). The hotel staff were really helpful, providing directions and taxi service when we needed a lift to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mprabhu
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in Raffaello Hotel with my wife for a holiday. My stay for three days in this hotel was pleasent. There are some good Indian Restaurants in a walking distance. Even Victoria Park is very near where one can get good stuff like Dresses, Warm Coats, Hand Bags etc at a very good price. Lot of Chinese shops are in Victoria and can get good bargain. The hotel room was very comfortable, staff very helpful, and the breakfats was very good. They dont provide kettle, so you cant have your own coffe or Tea whenever you want. They dont allow you to stay for even 30 minutes beyond 11 AM checkout time. The other issus was that you need to reach hotel only by Taxi, if you have heavy luggage and it is not easy to reach by train or walk, with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Central Location”
Reviews.Author: luvt0travelthew0rld
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Raffaello in Rome, Italy and were very favourably impressed with the hotel. The hotel is clean, well-appointed for a three star hotel and the location is very good, only minutes from the Termini train station. The breakfast, which is included, was also very good and the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful, friendly and courteous. We especially wish to commend Eduardo, Francessca and Massimo for their kind help and assistance. The only downside of the hotel was the small shower size. Otherwise, this is an excellent choice for families and others and good value for money in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: rines26
Reviews.Content: The cleanliness and helpful staff make this hotel a 5 for us. We made a mistake of taking a cab (14 euro) from the Termini station, but it is only about a 7 minute walk. Also, since you can get to just about everything by subway or bus, the close proximity is a great perk about this hotel. The hotel itself is very nice and clean. You can tell it's an older building (everything in Rome is) but it is up to date and nicely maintained. The free breakfast was nice compared to the rest of the hotels we stayed at in Italy and the room was surprisingly large for Europe. Wi-fi was $5 for 3 hours if you book on an online booking site and not through the hotel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel made exceptional by the staff”
Reviews.Author: zuczek99
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room at the Raffaello to recover after a long-haul flight before continuing our Italian holiday. Got to the hotel around 8am, were welcomed with lovely smiles and invited to partake of the breakfast. I love a European buffet breakfast with the buns, smallgoods, assorted croissants and the like and this one was pretty good. As we were travelling with a 5 year old, we were pretty keen to check-in as soon as possible, though were were also mindful that normal check-in time was 2pm. No problem for the staff: we were told that the room would be available by 10.30am and it was! The result was one happy and well-rested child and two relieved parents. We were heading out the next day by car and needed directions on how to get out of Rome. Again, no problem. The very kind lady at reception did a Google maps search and printed out our directions. We were also able to bring the hire car in and park outside the hotel which made luggage handling a lot easier. The hotel itself is well-appointed. Rooms are not big but - so what? - but cosy. Location is fabulous. And the willingness of the staff to assist is what really makes this place a stand-out.

Reviews.Title: “Good base, friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: DriftwoodNL
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this hotel is that for a 3 star hotel it offers a very high standard of accomodation, which explanes its higher than average price. From the minute we arrived until the end, the staff were very friendly and went out of there way to look after us. We had a triple room which was clean and comfortable. If there were any minor gripes it would have been that the airco blew cold air onto the 3rd bed ( easily solved) and the shower a little on the small size but very useable. Similarly, the fact that the breakfast room could not accomodate everyone when they wanted to eat will ether irritate you or ( as with us) add to the charm. We found it was best to take breakfast before the 09:00 rush hour. We would definately recommend this and also return. The hotel is not immediately on a tourist route but is well placed for visiting places like the National Museum or Colusium / Forum. Should you wish to go further, then reception will happily call a white cab for you. These are excellent value and recommended even above the many hop on hop off tourist buses. Our average charge was €7 for 3 people, with a trip to the Vatican being the most expensive at €9,00 . WELL RECOMMENDED. By this you can also take it that we found the Tourist buses expensive and not worth the trouble. Again shop arround, we initially used GLT which cost €63 for 3 people 24 hrs, but later found that the Archeobus was only €36 for 48 hrs and also covered the Appia way. Finally 2 recommendations. 1) Restaurant Thema, 500meters away from the hotel has excellent local food , is very friendly and 100% recommended but not cheap. It is also used by locals which is a good sign. 2) Vatican museum. AVOID unless you like moving at a snales pace with the rest of the great unwashed. The number of people visiting this makes what should be a must see, almost unpleasant. If you must visit, then prebooking is a must as this will avoid the massive ques that seem to snake arround the building

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryalamb
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here recently before we boarded a cruise. The front desk personnel were very helpful in whatever we needed. The room was a bit small but that's what you get in Europe. Internet was affordable and easy to access. Breakfast was good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it...”
Reviews.Author: Anonymus00
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, conveniently located. Very close to Termini and couple of metro stations. The rooms are spacious and well doneup. The staff was extremely helpful. Overall a very good and memorable experience

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: hushaphone
Reviews.Content: Actual hotel hotel (as opposed to a few rooms in a building) a 15-minute walk or short cab ride away from Termini station. Very helpful front desk (made reservations, checked flight with Alitalia). Large breakfast spread. Small but luxurious-feeling bedroom & bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmr11458
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here prior to a cruise. Loved this hotel. They had transporation at the airport to pick us up. Very reasonable price. Held our bags until we were able to get our rooms. The room was very clean and comfortable. We slept well. It was very quiet - heard no noise at all. Bathroom seemed bigger than I expected. The shower was tiny for my larger built but it was fine. The hotel provided a lovely breakfast in the morning. I can't say enough about this place. We were able to walk to where we wanted to go and catch the hop on/hop off bus to get further. When we checked out the hotel had made arrangements with the same transportation company to get us to the port. This company had a license to get right to the cruise ship. Many do not and then you need to take a shuttle to the ship. I see below there is a question about parking. There is no parking and if you do park close to the hotel you will receive a ticket. No spa or pool but I believe they have a sister place where you are able to use the exercise room. Not sure though.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel made special by the people!”
Reviews.Author: leytonorient
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 night stay in Rome. We contacted the hotel in advance and were lucky enough to be given a room on the top floor with a terrace. The hotel is fabulously situated within walking distance of just about everything Rome has to offer, including the Vatican if you are fit and willing! We did not use any public transport during our stay, but our feet were sore by the end of each day. The hotel is comfortable rather than splendid but the price we paid was for 3 stars not 5. The rooms are well appointed without being spectacular and whilst the shower unit could have been bigger it was fantastic after a hot day exploring this wonderful city. Breakfast was excellent although some more expensive hotels may offer a wider choice. Eduardo and Francesca on the front desk are the main reason that we had such a special stay (thanks, guys!) giving us great advice and help whenever required, in fluent English and with a smile. We loved Rome, and this hotel is a great place to stay if you want great value and appreciate great service from great people. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem - Will be returning to celebrate our anniversary!!”
Reviews.Author: Guildford93
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned business traveller I wanted to find somewhere special for myself and my fiancee to celebrate her 30th birthday. This hotel was reccomended to me and certainly didn't disappoint!! Eduardo was a fantastic concierge/receptionist and couldn't do enough for us, the room was great (although fabric walls take a bit of getting used to!) and on top of all this the location was perfect, with the roman forum & Colusseum round the corner. Also, you can gain access to it's sister hotel next to the Pantheon, which boast one of the few rooftop terraces in Rome, great place to celebrate getting engaged whilst the sun goes down. A hint if considering this hotel - visit the Tema restaurant round the corner if you can, really really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: luisoluiso
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel located in a perfect area near Rome termini station, just a 10 minutes walk. We used it as a two day stay before departure to Civitavechia Port to take a cruise and it was the perfect choice. Great staff, friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was also great. The room had a lot of space and they will leave you a raffalello candy every night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Maclugash
Reviews.Content: Very well priced small hotel in great location. Comfortable rooms, excellent breakfast, efficient front desk. Only criticism is the showers which are so small you have to get out to turn round.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: Sunnilue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rafaello in April 2011, and were pleasantly suprised by the size of the room, especially for the location being so close to everything. The hotel is conveniently located between a couple of stops on the metro, and it was only about a 15 minute walk to the Colleseum, etc. It was also close to Termini which was convenient for tours, and day trips. There were a number of small groceries nearby for fruit, snacks, water or a bit of wine! Down the hill 3 minutes is a phone store where you can call globally for cheap - it was a nice option if you don't have a global phone. The room and bathroom were good sized and wonderfully clean. My only complaint about the entire hotel was the size of the shower. I'm sure it's common for Europeans, but for an oversized American the shower was woefully small. The footprint was small, and to compound the problem the shower had a huge full length console (lots of extra shower heads, and ledges for shower stuff) that took up a third of the shower. I barely had room to turn around, and the slightest shift in position had my belly turning off the water. The door opening was also small and made getting into the shower a bit of an adventure (step up and squeeze through the door). I do have to commend the front desk staff. All the gentlemen there were very friendly, gracious and helpful. My friend's luggage didn't make it to Rome with us, and the front desk staff cheerfully checked on the status for us regularly. It finaly showed up on day 3, and I'm convinced it would have been later if the hotel had not been checking on it regularly. They do charge to use the computer in the lobby, but someone had turned in a partially used code card, and the front desk gave it to us to use for free. The breakfast had a nice selection of fruit, lunch meat, cheese, bread, cereal, hot scrambled eggs, jams, pastries, etc. It was at least as good as the rest of the hotels in Italy we stayed at, and the hot eggs were a nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE RAFAELLO AND ROME!”
Reviews.Author: Da2011
Reviews.Content: We just left the Rafaello two days ago and have nothing but great things to say about them all. Our room,106, had a little balcony overlooking via Urbana! Every evening we opened the doors and sat out there. We felt so special as our room was the only one we could see with a balcony! The room was large too, with a sitting area and bed area. Yes, as some other reviewers have said, the shower is small. But very clean and updated so we did not mind. The front desk staff was amazing! They gave us great restaurant recommendations and really stepped up to assist when we lost our credit card (all is well, visa international had a replacement card fed ex'd to our hotel we were going to the next day). Breakfasts were outstanding. Three kinds of eggs, pastries, fruits, cereals, meats and cheeses, yummy coffee and even yummier cappuccino! We can't say enough about it. Just a quick walk from the train station made it so convenient. We walked the entire city from there and never took a bus, cab, subway! We will recommend this to friends and stay there when we return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travdelwd
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a very good stay at Raffaello Hotel. The staff at the front desk was so helpful and never too busy to answer all sorts of questions - from where to eat .... to how to find sights in Rome. it was a little tricky to find the hotel the first time but the location was perfect. It was about a 10 minute walk from the main train station. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, uncomfortable bed, poor air conditioning, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nicolejax
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located to the train station and Ancient Rome. We were able to walk with our luggage from the train station to the hotel (about 15 minutes) and also walk to all of the sites in Ancient Rome (the Colloseum is about 15 minutes walk). The room was quite spacious by European standards. However, the electricity only works when your key is inserted into a slot in the wall, which means you can not keep the air conditioning on to cool off the room while you are out and about exploring the city. Even in May it was quite warm in Rome. After returning to the hotel, sweaty and tired after our day's activities it was stifling to return to an un air conditioned room. There is a cap on how low you can set the temperature so it takes quite a while for the room to cool down. The bed was decent size, but fairly hard and the pillows are flat and uncomfortable. However, all of this is pretty standard in Italy unless you book a really expensive hotel. So the main reason i rate this hotel so low is the service. The staff was the most unfriendly that we encountered in all of Italy. Everytime we asked for directions or assistance in any way they acted like we were burdening them. And if we had any follow up questions they got quite impatient. When visting a city for the first time it is nice to rely on hotel staff to help you get your bearings and figure out the best way to get places. Don't count on that from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Kyle5599
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from Italy yesterday and out of the 4 places we stayed (Rome, Florence, Venice and Milan) we both enjoyed our time in Rome the most. The Raffaello Hotel was exactly what we expected and was a great place to stay. The location of the hotel is very good, it is less than a 10 minute walk to the Termini Station and Colluseum, and only 15 minutes or so to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. We weren't in the hotel all that much, since we only had 3 days in Rome we were out the door after breakfast and didn't return until late each night. But the hotel is on a very quiet street, and the neighborhood it is in is fine. Most of the negatives about this hotel you probably have read are all accurate...small shower, firm bed. But that's just how Europe is, and we had a firm bed at every hotel we stayed at. But the room was spotlessly clean, it did have a fridge and safe, and we could not hear any noise at all from the adjacent rooms or hallway. The staff for the most part was very nice. The woman that served the coffee and toast in the morning were extremely nice, but a few of the people at the front desk were a little ehhhhh, for lack of a better word. They weren't openly rude to us, but at the same time it just seemed like they just couldn't wait for their shift to be over. I will say though that I brought a shirt down to them and they had it pressed and brought up to my room while we were out and it was hanging in the closet so that was nice of them. But overall we were very happy with our stay here and would 100% recommend it to anyone. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FishStixEvents
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel.Convenient location to metro. Quick walk to colosseum. Rooms are clean, neat and efficient. Good selection at breakfast with excellant waitstaff. Honestly can't figure out why there would be any negative comments for this place, unless those people are just unhappy travelers. Will easily be our choice for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: threepossums
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Raffaello for 5 nights in late March. We had a comfortable and generous sized triple room, facing Via Urbana. It was very quiet and peaceful however due to double glazing and blockout curtains. Room and bathroom very clean. Bathroom had good supply of toiletries. Shower cabinet took a little getting used to, but good hot water pressure. Breakfast was excellent, good variety of food served by charming and smiling ladies. Staff at desk also very pleaseant and helpful with directions and advice for dinner. Location also a feature of the hotel, close to many sites. Would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: 50andbusy
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to 'Ancient' Rome but just outside the busy core. Room was clean and well appointed. Front desk staff was really helpful. Our room didn't have a great view but we weren't spending a lot of time there so it wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemmatt1984
Reviews.Content: This review is a little delayed as we travelled to Rome back in March. We stayed for 3 nights and had a brilliant time. When we were searching for hotels this one popped up in the top 30 in Rome and assumed it would be pricey! After looking on expedia we were pleasantly suprised when we found a deal for under £250 each for 3 nights b&b and flights! The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly and the location was great (if you dont mind a bit of a walk to the Piaza Navona). We liked the little touches like slippers in the room, the chocolates on the pillow on our first night and the complimentary toiletries. The breakfast was lovely too, with a good range of jams, meats, pastries, cereals and refreshments including gorgeous cappuccinos!! Staff were welcoming and willing to answer any questions. The only slightly negative thing i would say about this hotel is the lift is VERY small so if you have a large suitcase then be prepared to squash in or take the stairs. And also yes, the shower is also very small, but hey, it got us clean!!! The location was good for us, but if you want to be right in the centre then this may not be for you but we liked the walk into the town everyday and enjoyed stopping at various places on the way and also was only a 20 minute walk to the station. Overall i would DEFINATELY reccommend this hotel and be more than happy to return if we ever went back to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: BarbW_LZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, and the location was very good. it is close to the train station, and we walked everywhere. Breakfast was very nice. Small but comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClassicMX5
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Hotel Raffaello in April at Easter time. The hotel is away from the main tourist area about a 10 minute walk from the Termini and 15 minutes to the Colosseum. We had a first floor room, to only one we could see that had a balcony which came in handy when you needed to dry some washing as there isn’t a Laundromat near by and the hotel charges for washing is quite expensive. The room was large with a two seat lounge and a small table and chair. The walls lined with padded material which made it very quite. The bathroom was small and likewise the curved corner shower. Quality of the furnishings was very good. Staff were very helpful but there was a lack of tourist information in the lobby. We found that there could be a line up for breakfast if everyone decided to head out for their sight seeing at the same time. For dinner there are a number of restaurants within a short walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: RD33333
Reviews.Content: After spending a few days in Rome, then a week in Tuscany, we headed back to Rome the day before we flew back to the USA. A few walking blocks away from the Stazione Termini we found this quaint gem of a hotel. Newly renovated with jacuzzi shower, great water pressure, all of the comforts of a US central city hotel. The hotel was impeccably clean, well decorated and full of comforts we are used to. The front desk was very helpful, providing us with a reservation for a car to to pick us up the next morning to take us to the airport (at a very reasonable price), wake-up call at the right time, an excellent restaurant suggestion and a local map to get around. The hotel is not far from the Colosseum and Forum, Trevy Fountain and Spanish steps. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy, many selections and superior service. We would definitely spend more than one night there the next time we go to Rome. GREAT HOTEL, and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: imafloridacracker
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in and the two guys behind the desk barely noticed we were there, much less a welcome, should have been a dead giveaway. Very small room, though it was clean and not worn. Not quite sure you could call them pillows, just a hunk of not very comfortable foam. But perhaps the biggest surprise was still waiting in the loo. Not quite sure what the room's designers were smoking when they located the toilet where it was inaccessible by all but the most nimble of customers. May satisfy some city ordinance for having one in the room, but that's all it satisfied. This is no three-star hotel on any continent, and greatly overpriced as it is. The ONLY redeeming value is its proximity to Roma Termini if you need to catch an early train as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Susan50225
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy walking distance to the Coliseum and hop-on/hop-off tour. Breakfast was fantastic, clean rooms with good amenities. Very nice and helpful front desk staff. Free internet available with certain packages was very useful!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: theoldveteran
Reviews.Content: We have already recommended Hotel Raffaello to our friends and one couple plans to use it in September. Our room faced the street yet was completely quiet. There was no traffic noise at all and we left the windows open to enjoy a spring breeze. The room was clean, comfortable and roomy. We should add, we had a thirteen year older who is at the present time rather critical about almost everything. She was completely satisfied, particularly about the bathroom and the efficiency of the hairdryer. The breakfast ranged from light to heavy. We chose the heavy including scrambled eggs, toast, cheese and coldcuts, hard-boiled eggs, and fruit. There was much more to choose from and we always left full and ready for an active day. We used the internet regularly; it was usually available. The staff was professional , congenial, and helpful. When we needed a cab, they arranged for it immediately. They pre-arranged two tours (Colliseum and the Vatican/Sistine) that were educational and tailored to our needs. The location for our purposes was perfect. We were close to shops, grocery stores, restaurants, and banks and never for a moment did we feel unsafe. We could go forever praising the Hotel and its staff but I think we have made our opinion clear and hopefully useful for anyone who plans a trip to Rome. We will definitely return. As we were writing this note, Linda commented, "It was like a dream.”

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: dmk1954
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at the Hotel Raffaello and was very pleased with the accomodations. It is very clean and the staff is excellent. The location is very convenient to all of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 5*CLASSYLASS
Reviews.Content: Just myself and my 11 year old son went on this 3 night trip to Rome. There was a lovely welcome at the desk and all staff were extremely attentive and courteous throughout the stay. The room was smart and clean with toiletries and hairdryer in the bathroom. The breakfast was delightful and you were served with coffee and toast as well as enjoying the buffet style continental breakfast. The location was just wonderful, my boy and I walked for miles with all of the major attractions in relatively close proximity to the hotel. I would not recommend getting a taxi from Termini, we did this on the way to the hotel and we were charged 24 Euros for what was about a 90 second journey!! Learning from our mistake, however, we walked back to Termini on our departure day and it took 7 minutes on foot. This hotel is an absolute gem in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Recharge your spirit and soul”
Reviews.Author: sandjnick
Reviews.Content: We experienced excellent service at Hotel Raffaello (Rome).There is a friendly and welcoming atmosphere and they went the extra mile to accommodate our needs. The rooms were very clean with flat screen TV and SPA shower. The location of the Hotel was on a side road off the main road and very accessible to all that Rome had to offer. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and look forward to returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a quite area”
Reviews.Author: dnish46
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Rome and this hotel was wonderful. The front desk was very friendly and helpful in giving me directions to various sites. It is a 10 minute walk to Termni Station and 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseum. The room was small, but since I was traveling solo it was not a problem. I would have to agree with other reviews that the shower is very small, but that was the only issue I had with the hotel. The room did have a minibar (prices were reasonable) and a safe. The buffet breakfast had an ample selection of food to start the day off sightseeing. There is also an expresso machine by the computer if you need more coffee. My second night in Rome the hotel recommended a restaurant just down the street called Temas. The lasagna is too die for. I talked to other travelers in the restaurant and everyone seemed to love what they got. Turn left out the front door of the hotel and take the first street to the right. It is on the right side about half way up the street. The prices are very reasonable. I found that booking directly on their website was a better deal then I would get through any of the travel websites.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, safe and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: familyof45
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the trip to Rome and the Hotel Raffaello was a great base. Staff were friendly and welcoming, at the desk and in the breakfast room / chamber staff. Hotel contacted us in advance with offer of taxi from airport (48 euros) - worth it for ease of arrival. Room was comfortable and very clean, with interconnecting rooms for us and two children - no view but quiet except early morning kitchen noise. Breakfasts very nicely presented and good quality. Found excellent restaurants in neighbouring area, well away from touristy areas - again everyone very friendly and accomodating. Would recommend Scuie Scuie as a restaurant with modern, fresh cooking. Bit of a walk to get to sights west of the Colosseum / Forum area (children aged 10 and 12 OK but too far for any younger) but open top 'hop on hop off bus' good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Quality”
Reviews.Author: aldalebr
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here in two rooms in late March. Staff was friendly and helpful, and made the arrangements for limo transport to the airport (fee). Rooms were slightly on the small side, but comfortable, clean, and quiet. Hotel decor is lovely. Breakfast buffet was nice and staff was attentive. For guests, a few steps below the main lobby there is a very nice seating area that has free coffee and internet access. The hotel is in a convenient location and we were able to walk to many tourist sites, even the Vatican. Beware of the elevator, it is very small and can only handle a few people with suitcases. There are stairs near the elevator that can be used instead. If you take the elevator to your floor, because of its location, you will also need to either do a half-flight up the stairs or a half-flight down. This is a really nice hotel with great prices for Rome, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Friendly Staff, Excellent Location, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Crystalfox
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Raffaello. I booked it with Expedia and my hustand and I travelled with friends who had been to Rome before. It is ideally located near to the Termini (about 5 mins walk when you go the right way!!), it is very central for walking to the centre of Rome, for old Rome and near to the metro for getting around. I don't know how we managed it but we got the room at the front with the balcony - it was lovely and big, very clean and very comfortable, I don't think I have ever had a comfier bed abroad which is saying something. It was a little noisy from the street as we like to sleep with the windows open - but I would expect this from any city hotel. The staff at the hotel were exceptionally friendly, very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was excellent and set you up really well for a long full day ahead. I would recommend that you travel by taxi from the airport but negotiate your fee first - it should be a flat fee of 40 Euros at present - make sure you get a white licenced cab. We actually got the train from the station to the hotel and it cost us 56 Euros for 4 of us so if there are 4 of you in your party I would recommend the taxi which is the mode of transport we got on the way home. All in all I can honestly say it is a top class hotel, for not top class prices. There are plenty of little restaurants around to eat in on a night time and lots to see and do. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to explore the sites in a nice quite area”
Reviews.Author: Mikey085
Reviews.Content: Classic European Hotel that's perfect to use as a base to explore the city of Rome. Easy to get to from the Airport (Take the Leonardo Express to Termini) and then 10mins walk. Hotel is 10mins walk to the Coliseum and about 20mins walk into the Centre of Rome. Perfect walk back after a nice meal out. Rooms were adequate and Breakfast was typical continental food to fill you up before you days sightseeing. Located down a nice cobbled street and out of the way from the busy hustle and bustle streets. Excellent value for money, Staff friendly, would recommend for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anand_Tvm
Reviews.Content: Nice stay at centre of Rome: We have booked the hotel after checking the review about it from different sources. We dont want to take risk since it was our honeymoon trip to old city of Rome. The rating of the hotel was good in trip advisor and lot recommending the same. As read from the review, it is a good hotel. We got a warm welcome at the hotel. The receptionist was really helping. Got tips about the places to visit nearby and mode of transport to take. Lot of pamplets and brochures about the Rome, places to see and travels were available in front desk. The room provided was spacious. It also had a minibar and safe. The bathroom was small with shower stall. The buffet breakfast had a wide selection of food items including ham, egg, yoghurt, cakes and buns. Major positive point for this hotel is its proximity to Rome termini station and Colosseum. Both these places are walkable distance from hotel. If you are travelling to Rome by flight. You will get direct train (Leonardo Express) to Rome termini. We made a mistake by taking a taxi to reach hotel. Cavour metro station is also 5 min walking distance from the hotel. I will recommend this hotel based on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: miayercat
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel with our two small children. The staff had our son's pull out sofa bed and daughter's crib all ready made up for us when we got there. The room was large and we had plenty of space for the four of us to move around. The staff was kind and very helpful. They gave us great recommendations for places to eat. The hotel offers an affordable shuttle from the airport. It was well worth the money for us. We had the kiddos and a mountain of luggage, car seats and a large double stroller. The driver was kind, though didn't speak very much English. This wasn't a big deal though as we know enough Italian to get by, besides...he knew where we were going! :) There is a great buffet breakfast with a wide selection of foods to choose from including eggs, ham, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, etc. A huge plus is that the hotel is located near a grocery store and Avis rental car office. We would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. It is great! Hope to go back someday...

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: bertiebirdman
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello Hotel, (after looking at many reviews on Trip Advisor) was a very pleasant surprise as we were apprehensive on our first trip to Italy. Its location on Via Urbana makes it much quieter than the nearby busier Via Cavour. Easy to get to the Colosseum from here, but Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps require more careful navigation. Free apples on the reception desk a nice touch when walking out of the hotel. Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore is ver near and is a useful landmark on return journeys. Reception staff friendly and even popped out with us to point us in the direction of a pleasant local restaurant which is good to know so as not to have the added challenge of finding somewhere to eat after dark.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but must be something better”
Reviews.Author: Twoprofs
Reviews.Content: We purchased three rooms in the Raffaello as part of an Expedia package with friends based on price/reviews at their site. The hotel is OK, but nothing more. Daytime staff was friendly and helpful; evening staff was rude and incompetent (always talking on the phone while talking to us as well, not forthcoming with information, etc.). The public areas are well worn though clean; the rooms are adequate but nothing special: TV offered a couple of English news channels; bathroom lighting was poor; pillows were like rocks; the shower was tiny and designed so that water sprayed about the room when opening the door to start the water. The "business center" is a computer in a corner, no printer; wi-fi is extra charge. Breakfast doesn't begin until 7:00, and as we had early events we were unable to try it. The distance to Termini is quite walkable and felt safe, thought the return to the station is all up hill. We walked from the Raffaello to the Vatican via lunch and many sights, taking the metro back to the Termini; it was convenient but a good hike.
