Were we to return to Rome, we would first consider other hotels but would return if the price and availability made the Raffaello "special." It's OK, but we suspect there are many better options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: lauramaria36
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with attentive staff. We stayed in a triple room with my elderly grandma...it didn't have a great view but that's not what we were there for. The beds were comfortable, the breakfast was an amazing start to the day. You will not regret staying here xx

Reviews.Title: “my first choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pmcd-RO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Close to Termini main train station. Short walk to next underground. Great hotel. Had special price. Absolutely super value for money. Rooms very nice. Great Breakfast. Good service. Friendly staff. Would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Choose this without any concerns”
Reviews.Author: cymro98
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for the rugby. The previous reports sum the place up, suited our needs well, excellent breakfast. Maybe free internet access/tv that picked up the (uk) sport would have been the final piece in the perfect jigsaw.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evicat
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. 5 minutes from the Colosseum and not more than a 10-15 minute walk from the other main attractions. Staff is great, helpful and friendly. Very small showers (perhaps a bit too small), but great water pressure. My only criticism is that while the first room we had was an acceptable size (not huge but not tiny), the second room was just way too small -- as in, the bed was pushed up against the wall because there was not enough room for it. But if you don't get that room (on the top floor), this is a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSugden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three days and was very impressed with the hotel and the staff. The room was excellent and breakfast superb.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: gnurglan
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with our stay at Rafaello. Clean room good breakfast and very friendly staff. We have found our hotel in Rome for the future.

Reviews.Title: “Its a 4 Star Hotel at a 3 star price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Michal
Reviews.Content: Great location Great Breakfast Very friendly and helpfull staff Had a Great time

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LD2010
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Raffaello based on reviews on TA and we really enjoyed our stay. We were lucky that we were given a large room on the top floor with a lovely balcony (it was our honeymoon), and when we arrived there was a bottle of wine & some nibbles waiting for us. As has been previously mentioned in other reviews we found the bed a bit firm for our liking, and the pillows I thought were rock hard, but apart from that, it was fantastic. I did find that one of the front desk staff members was a little unhelpful, or more accurately didn’t go out of their way to help with some of our questions – but the rest of the staff members we encountered were very helpful. We only ate breakfast at the hotel 2 mornings, and it was nice enough with little variety. The hotel was in an excellent location, right off Via Cavour, 10 min walk to the Termini train station and 10 mins to the Colosseum. The area surrounding the hotel was packed with lots of little restaurants, including the favourite of our stay, Restaurant Tema, and delis where you could get some lovely cheeses. We had originally planned to take the Terravision / Sitibus from the airport to Termini, but upon leaving the airport (Fiumicino) we asked how much a transfer was and at only 35 euros we decided that was probably better as it was quite late at night. We used the same company to transfer us to Ciampiono Airport at a cost of 40 euros (as it is further away).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrekker4030
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable room with good wi-fi connection. Staff was very friendly and helpful. As mentioned by other reviewers, close to the train station and colosseum, a bit distant to Campo de' Fiore, Piazza Navona, etc. Other comparable hotels were more expensive, so this was a very good value. Solid 3 star type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JenniandMatt
Reviews.Content: We found the Raffaello hotel to meet all our needs. The room was very comfortable and even enjoyed the jacuzzi shower once we worked out how to use it! The location is excellent, 5 mins away from the Termini and the Colosseum and an easy walk to all other tourist locations. Especially enjoyed the breakfast which offered an assortment of pastries, cold meats, bread, scrambled eggs, fruit and cake. Yum Yum! Amazing cappuccino's!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel except for one thing...the bed.”
Reviews.Author: rlbb1973
Reviews.Content: We returned from Rome last night after a 4 night stay at the Raffaello Hotel. The hotel is situated in a convenient part of town, right off the Via Cavour. The hotel staff from the front desk, to the breakfast staff and the cleaning staff were all very hospitable. Everyone treated us very well. The room we had was perfect for 3 people. A single bed for our child and a King size bed for my husband and I. The bathroom was beautiful. The hotel is located on a quiet street, away from most traffic noise. Easy to sleep with the window open. The room we had was exceptionally clean and beautifully decorated. The only problem was the bed. It was very firm, as were the pillows. This made sleeping uncomfortable for myself and my husband. I had to use the 2 duvets kept in the room as additional padding to the mattress, and still work on average of 3 times a night. This was really unfortunate, because everything else about the hotel was lovely. But, after spending 10+ hours walking around Rome, one wants to sleep in a comfortable and welcoming bed. The breakfast was fantastic every morning and again, the staff were wonderful. They treated my family like gold. I would recommend this hotel on every other point. Some people prefer a firm mattress, and sadly for me, I do not.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Russmel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the glowing reviews on TA. It was the last hotel we were staying in during our month around Europe and based on the reviews arrived with great anticipation. We stayed in the family room which as previously described is divided into two smaller rooms. This was suitable for our family of four and the bathroom although small provided everything we needed. (we didn't find the shower too small as others have indicated.). Our room had no street view which was a little disappointing but being back from the street probably enhanced our sleep as there was very little noise. The breakfast was OK but not worth the glowing reviews it has received. It lacked fresh fruit and the variety we found at other 3 star hotels across Germany and Austria. The most disappointing aspect was the demenour of the front desk staff. We didn't ask a lot of them and They were professional, but given the rave reviews about them we had high expectations that they did not meet. They certainly answered any question but we always felt that we were putting them out by requesting information and the answer we got was straight out of the tourist guide with no additional information, service or guidance. An example of this was when we inquired if the guest computer was linked to a printer so we could print out our flight boarding passes. We were informed that it wasn't and that we would have to go to an intent cafe to access a printer with Internet access. This was despite one sitting at the front desk which we would have happily paid to use. Given the reviews this request didn't seem to big an ask. Overall I would stay there again, but would not automatically go back without looking around and comparing other hotels, as it did not live up to the TA reviews.

Reviews.Title: “we can really recommend this hotel and will come back again”
Reviews.Author: bettinaanne
Reviews.Content: Friendly personnel; very clean, comfortable,big and cosy rooms,nice interior, breakfast offers a good variation of food for the international guests. Hotel is located in the centre of rom and near main station and yet the rooms are quiet. the price for the rooms are fair. We booked this hotel because of the good rating at tripadvisor - we were very satisfied and we will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Raffaello Hotel -Great location and Rooms, internet and front desk not up to par”
Reviews.Author: finesilver
Reviews.Content: Decent location and price, 3 star, by Termini and the Cavour Metro line; superbly clean room, small shower – the other reviews which mentioned this were not kidding. The front desk staff was professional, not the least bit warm or friendly and frankly, not willing to go the slightest bit out of the way to accommodate their guests. Example I was having trouble getting museum reservations on the internet or phone, he could have cared less. Said I could call back in the morning perhaps, no offer to call for me which frankly I did not think was too much; hesitant to even give directions a couple of times. My biggest beef was the expensive internet 25 euro with a max speed of 12Mbps which is very very slow, almost Jurassic, made skyping really challenging. Business travelers any more need this amenity, especially if they are willing to pay for it. I would not stay there again unless this was upgraded which is quite easy to do. The hotel I stayed at the next night in near the airport had faster internet speed than this supposedly three star in Roma. Here is an example of warmth, packing breakfast for people leaving on early flights like some hotels did, asking how my day was, if they could help in some way. None of this occurred.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated, friendly staff, warm atmosphere- perfecto!!”
Reviews.Author: Vix-Nix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello from 9-12 Dec. After arriving in Rome via the Leonardo Express, we got out our map and began what we thought would be a good length walk - it was five minutes away. Easy! On arrival, we checked in to our room which was lovely! It was palatial when compared to most European hotel rooms! Large bed, sofa, tv, bathroom with (small but perfectly formed) shower. We nipped out as it was late and got a takeaway from a local restaurant- Nueva Stella - we were greeted warmly here and it had lots of locals in the back of the restaurant. The food was nice too! The next morning after a comfy sleep, we woke early and went to breakfast, there was a great selection of pastries, hot & cold food, cereals, yoghurts, meats, breads, four types of juice, they offered a variety of coffees and teas and also toast. What more could you ask for to set you on your way? The service was wonderful, often a great mix of my broken Italian efforts and their much more honed English, it made for a fab start to the day! On the penultimate evening we asked to buy credit and use the Internet for online flight check in, we were given the remaining credit another guest had bought but not fully used before checking out. They had an opportunity to take a few euros and didn't, which surprised me as it was just.... Kind. On check out, after hassle free days staying in this lovely hotel, we left our bags so we could make the most of our last day. It was hassle free, an absolute bargain and ideally situated fir sightseeing. We did not use public transport once other than to and from the airport- the hotel was five minutes from the colusseum, termini, roman forum, ten from piazza navona, pantheon, spanish steps, and half an hour stroll from the vatican... Mix that perfect location with the great value for money, fab breakfast, lovely staff, who I really must thank for their superb service, the large rooms and great location it was just..... Fantastico! It's so rare you come across a hotel and think it has been rated too low! It is a three star hotel that i would have easily given 4 star too- it's rating on here speaks volumes when people are more likely to review when they have a complaint - but there really is nothing to grumble about!!

Reviews.Title: “Previous reviews completely justified”
Reviews.Author: BlairHesp
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Rafaello based on its ratings on Tripadvisor and found the reviews to be completely justified. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. Great location and breakfast was also really good. The room was also much more than could be reasonably expected for a 3-star hotel. Nice decor and large bathroom. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “There are so many hotels in Rome but it was the Raffaello for us.”
Reviews.Author: kpiddy
Reviews.Content: I don't quite remember how I singled it down to the Raffaello hotel for our 5 night stay in Roma but it was a great choice, within our budget, and it is close it Termini, Colosseum, Pantheon, Trevi fountain, in fact everywhere, we did it all by foot. We were a little early for check-in but the hotel was kind enough to give us a room, the room was on the side of the hotel not facing via Urbana and was quiet at night. The bed was comfortable with great pillows, the adjoining bathroom was clean, with a small shower compartment, OK for us, but maybe not for larger people. The only odd thing about our room was that the bidet was immediately opposite the toilet with only a 6cm gap between the two, making it a little difficult to use the toilet especially with jeans on! The staff were all so helpful and polite from the reception to breakfast room, but Francesco on reception is the best. The breakfast buffet was the usual fare and plenty of it, coffee was great, we certainly never walked away hungry. There are so many restaurants in the area but our favorite was La Carbonara, seek it out, and the little baker in via Urbana has great supplies for lunch. WIFI is not free but can be purchased at a reasonable price. There is good quality coffee and tea facilities in the guests lounge on the lower floor, available at all times.

Reviews.Title: “IN THIS RAFFAELL, EVERYONE'S A WINNER!”
Reviews.Author: windbag
Reviews.Content: We returned to Rome for a special wedding anniversary, and were not disappointed by the Raffaello. The hotel lived up to its reviews, and helped to make our stay in Rome very special. The view from our room was nothing to write home about, but Via Urbana proved to be surprisingly quiet, except for the late night shunting of a badly parked car by one of Rome's bulky bin wagons. Better than watching the telly! So sleep was not a problem, and the room, and bathroom were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was the usual fare, but it was plentiful, and the waitresses were efficient and friendly. And the coffee is fine! The hotel is close to the Termini and Metro stations, and the single fare of 1 Euro for journeys by bus and/or Metro was fantastic value. Here's a tip! If you get on a tube, do NOT assume that Basilico St. P. is St Peters Square. It isn't! Get on the Red line and head for Ottaviano, and save yourself a wasted half an hour in the suburbs. My wife was not impressed! So what was wrong with the hotel? Nothing really, unless you are the Andrews Sisters trying to get into the lift all at once. A bit snug! Oh, and the young porter tends to overfill the kettle in the downstairs lounge, so be careful! Still, if that is all you have to worry about, you will enjoy your stay as much as we did. If you are looking for McDonalds, it is right next to the 2000 year old Pantheon. I suppose we should be grateful that it is not inside! And lastly, the 218 bus to the Catacombs, (you must go - but closed 12.00 to 2.00), which goes from Piazza San Giovanni, is parked up at the top of the square, through the arches and about 200 metres straight ahead of you. Enjoy Rome, and enjoy the Hotel Raffello. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, decorative and friendly”
Reviews.Author: CoggieUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem, located close to the Colusseum, many shops and restaurants, only 5 minutes walk from the Termini, and a slightly longer walk to the Vatican.. The room was nice, a good size and traditionally decorated, bath with shower in a small bathroom (but it is only a bathroom) and a really great bed, firm and comfortable, I slept like a log. The maid even left chocolates in the evening. The staff were friendly always saying good morning or hello, welcoming and helpful with advice, even giving us a map of the local area and some basic directions to get us started. Breakfast was a great selection of fresh fruit, pastries, breads, cereals and scrambled egg which I heartily recommend. This is listed as a 3 star, but the service is definitely much more 4 star. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Cincy2
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Raffaello. Our room (414) was clean and the bathroom (shower only) was modern and large. Everything was just great. What we enjoyed most about the hotel was its small size and personal attentiveness on the part of the front desk staff. They were always welcoming and eager to help us. Their English skills were excellent. The breakfast buffet each morning was delicious and varied and offered more that you could possibly eat. We stayed here 3 nights in October. The location is within walking distance of the Train station and the metros and also with easy walking distance of the Colosseum. Excellent area restaurants are also within walking distance. We enjoyed the free use of their computer and internet (because of online booking) Their website is an accurate description of the hotel. There are about 40 rooms in this hotel, so you never feel overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: reinjay
Reviews.Content: Located withing walking distance from Termini Station and the Colosseum, this hotel was perfect for the price we paid. The breakfast in the morning was excellent, and the eggs were the best we had anywhere in Europe. The staff were very friendly and a wealth of knowledge when it came to recommendations. The room was very large and I loved that the windows of the room completely opened and overlooked the brick street in front of the hotel. It has a very old-world feel to it- and isn't that what Italy is about?

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: myangel_1014
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I went to Rome on our honeymoon and stayed at the Hotel Raffaello. It is a very quiet and elegant hotel. It is conveniently located off of Via Urbana and about 7 blocks to the Metro station and Termini Rail station. The rooms are good, with the only complaint being that the bathroom was quite small- the shower especially with no bathtub. We slept wonderfully. The breakfast was great. You could smell the fresh baked croissants every morning. The coffee was amazing as well. The service for breakfast was great as well. You have to pay for wireless internet as in most European hotels (10 euro for 6 hrs total time). There is a great gelato shop (you get 2 or 3 flavors with each cup/cone; try crema or nutella) around the corner and a Snack Shop with the nicest owner 1 block away as well. The snack shop has the most amazing pizza (try the one with broccoli and mushrooms or salami and fresh mozzarella)- he is also very generous with the slices.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: balanina
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Hotel Raffaelo having read reviews on Trip Advisor, and we weren't disappointed. Having deferred a visit to Rome last year because we couldn't find anywhere convenient at a reasonable price, this was cheap (for Rome) at just over 80 euros a night, convenient and comfortable. It's not the Ritz, but our room was spacious, comfy bed, with a bath ( a welcome rarity to soak your aching limbs after a day of Vatican museum corridors or climbing the Palatine Hill). Pretty convenient for buses once we'd worked them out. Small negatives; when the hotel is full, which it seemed to be when we were there, there isn't really enough space for breakfast, and we witnessed some slight contretemps over who got to sit upstairs near the food and who had to sit downstairs. Advice from the front desk on where to get an open-top tour bus was a bit out of date and inaccurate, but we found it anyway. A bit disappointed to have to pay for internet access - why is it that bed and breakfasts offer it free and hotels charge? But, overall, a good place to stay in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: kontiki_times
Reviews.Content: The perfect choice for Rome - good, clean room with internet availability. Very close to Termini station and city highlights like the Colosseum etc. Continental breakfast with eggs, fruits, toast and non-sweet bread which can be a pleasant change after a few days in Italy (most hotels offer sweet brioches and croissants)

Reviews.Title: “Great service, small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: RunningFaster
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello is wonderfully situated, off the main streets just south of Termini train station. This means it is wonderfully quiet, but a short walk to the train and metro to the north, and the Colosseum to the south. The room was fine but the bathroom was tiny - there was no tub and the shower was so small I constantly hit my elbow turning around. The very nice breakfast (included) was served by excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great option near train station”
Reviews.Author: Bocarob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Raffaello Hotel for 3 days. The hotel is walking distance from the Termini station which is one of the reason we picked this hotel. The room was not ready when we arrived around 11am and since I had requested a room with a terrace, they said it would take a few more hours before we could check in. I was happy to see that they had accomodated my request for a room with a terrace so I didn't mind. We were hungry and asked for a recommendation for a place to eat. Since it was early, there were not many places serving lunch yet. But, the hotel staff recommended a place right across the hotel on the other side of Cavour street. We paid 50 Euros for lunch for two and the food was mediocre so do not go to this place. There are better options all around for less money. The room was nicely decorated, the bathroom clean, and the shower very small - which was expected. The terrace was small but very nice and had a good view of the surroundings. All in all, I was very happy with the room. The elevator is tiny and can be a bit noisy as it moves up or down. The breakfast was the typical breakffast we received in most of the other hotels we stayed while in Italy. The warm scrambled eggs was a plus as some other hotels only had hard boiled eggs. The staff was not necessarily friendly but provided information when needed. One of the guys there did give me a card which another guest had left with minutes leftover for internet access so I could look up the train schedule before we departed. So I was very impressed with this gesture - kudos to the staff for that! I would definitely consider this place if we ever visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Venables78
Reviews.Content: Excellent central position, welcoming, helpful staff, plenty of space in our room, very clean, breakfast excellent, would be very happy to return and I would certainly recommend the Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, bad reception!”
Reviews.Author: JohnEsc
Reviews.Content: Well, I travelled for Italy for the first time in September 2010 and stayed in Rome, Milan & Catania. I chose The Raffaello Hotel in Rome and I liked some things and disliked others there. The man at the reception (the bald man) treated me bad in my check-in period. Maybe because I'm not european, who knows? Another bad surprise arriving in my room: it was really really small. The smallest of the 3 hotels that I stayed in Italy. On the other hand, the breakfast is excellent for a 3 star hotel. Plus, the television had excellent picture quality and had lots of TV channels to choose. There is a chuch nearby the hotel. So, their bells will wake you up every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and great service”
Reviews.Author: Helpfultraveller25
Reviews.Content: This hotel served as a great base for seeing rome. We were lucky enough to get the terrace room which was a beautiful outside space. Breakfast was ok, but the coffee not so great. there are great coffee shops just down the road though. The price can only be described as fantastic value for money! I would recommend this hotel for just about anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ted_Fez
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights at the Rafaello during April 2010. We were there at the height of the air travel blackout resulting from the Icelandic volcano eruption. We were first placed in a small dimly lit room. We spent one night there and asked to be moved. We were fortunate insofar that we were then placed in the nicest room in the hotel on the top floor and with an enormous balcony. We found the front desk staff to be very helpful and friendly for the most part. There was a decent breakfast served in the morning. The hotel is surprisingly quiet even though it is in a relatively busy area of Rome. It is also in a very good location, with a nice walk to many of the famous sites of Rome, as well as the main train station. We can give a good recommendation to this hotel and would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations, Average Location, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: sftraveler94102
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this summer with my two teenage children. I chose the hotel based upon overall value. I was not disappointed by the overall value, but I was disappointed by the overall service. First of all, the location was difficult to find by automobile. It is in a kind of out of the way place. It is marginally walking distance to most sights, but it is a bit of a "hump". It is not an easy stroll to any attraction and you have to walk uphill slightly when returning to the hotel. The decor and rooms are fine, although the decor looks like it is trying to be a luxury hotel in a bargain location. The rooms are nicely appointed, especially for the family rooms. The worst part of this hotel is the service. With the exception of one very well-meaning woman at the front desk (she gave me terrible directions to the train station), the men at the front desk were terrible. When we arrived late at night there was nobody else around and two front desk people. I was walking on a cane with two children and they did not offer to help with the luggage. Getting luggage to the room is a bit difficult because the elevator is strangely appointed and stops between floors, which means you have to take stairs either up or down to your room from the elevator landing. In addition, the front desk person advised me to park on the street, because the garage down the way was quite expensive, but did not bother to tell me that you can be towed if you don't have the right sticker and that you can drive in the area during the daytime without a spefic sticker. Fortunately, I can read Italian and the signs made it clear my rental car would be towed. The front desk staff also seemed generally annoyed when asked questions and gave the impression that it was a bother to assist you. The breakfast included was better than some places in other cities in Italy, but they ran out of fresh fruit and baked goods early, which they did not seem to replenish. The ladies in the breakfast room also seemed to be annoyed by having to assist guests as well. There isn't much else around this hotel, so once you get back after a long day, you don't really want to go out again --which means that you are stuck with not such evening choices. I did visit their sister hotel located at the Pantheon. I would stay there. The location was great. The service was great. The terrace bar was lovely with an amazing view. However, the cost was quite a bit more expensive. Also, beware trying to pick up or return a rental car at Termini Train Station. It is a disaster trying to find the rental car return location. The vendors at the rental car locations are the rudest Italians on the earth. They often don't honor your reservation and change the rate and the type of car you reserved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Pruej
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Great location...we walked everywhere easily. Plenty of restaurants and bars (go to Cavour 313). Service excellent. Only complaint was the size of my room but I had a single room and would get a double next time. Ask for a balcony room! Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Quite and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0401
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April 09. The hotel was quiet and clean and beds comfortable. Bathroom is a good size ecxept the shower is very small and when sitting on the toilet, your knees hot the shower screen. Breakfast is excellent, lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Was sad to leave...”
Reviews.Author: travelling_solo87
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed here twice in September, for three nights before visiting Tuscany and then one night before flying out of Rome. We could not fault this hotel. It was absolutely perfect. The room was beautiful with shutters that opened out onto a wonderful view of the Rome buildings, the bed was comfortable, and the front office staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast is a great start to the day with fresh coffee and toast made when you arrive at the table. The coffee was the best I had in Italy. The hotel is situated in a good neighbourhood and is a short walk to the Colosseum and Termini Station. We also walked to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, The Vatican, and the Panthenon. There are lots of great little restaurants in the area and we felt very safe walking around at night. When we arrived back for a second stay, we were greeted like old friends. When we return to Rome, we will definately be staying at the Hotel Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Koshki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling with another couple for the purpose of taking a Mediterranean cruise that departed from Port Civitavecchia. We decided to extend our trip and visit Rome and the Vatican, so we needed a hotel. After considerable research and review-reading, we settled on Hotel Raffaello. Nervous about making a decision sight unseen, we relied on our email communications to book and confirm. This hotel was a wonderful surprise. Tucked into the relatively quiet Via Urbana, the hotel presents a beautiful lobby area and friendly, helpful people at the desk. Our luggage was ported to our rooms quickly and we easily settled in for the night. The rooms for both couples were actually spacious, conveniently appointed, and most of all--CLEAN. The bathroom included a tub and handheld shower, and the AC unit ran by remote control. We had plenty of room to house our many pieces of luggage needed for the upcoming cruise. The folks at the desk recommended a place for us to eat that evening, providing directions and a phone reservation. We had a great night's sleep, away from the constant noise of the streets that we had read about. You will not be disappointed with you stay in this hotel and if we return to Rome, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: LARSevenFields
Reviews.Content: We had located this Hotel on-line and were a bit nervous about its amenities and location. Our driver assured us that the neighborhood was a "good one" and we walked about the neighborhood after dark and ate at a nearby outside restaurant confidently. The Hotel was lovely and very well-kept. Our room actually had 2 rooms and was very roomy (except for the bathroom where the toilet, door, and sink were juxtaposed a bit uncomfortably.) Be sure to take a 220 adapter as our curling iron, etc. did not work and there were no adapters available at the desk. Breakfast was included and a nice buffet was served in a beautiful balcony setting.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: kostyalevin
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Raffaello on 6 October 2010, and must say, it was quite a pleasant experience. The hotel is located in via Urbana which is a quiet street parallel to the more central via Nazionale. The area has numerous restaurants and shops and is very safe. It is situated in an old building (early 20th or late 19th century), but has been thoroughly modernized. My room was spacious even by US standards, and had A/C. The bathroom was also quite large, although the shower itself was a bit tight. Not everything was flawless, though: the elevator was quite small and two people with luggage have trouble entering. This can be attributed to the building's age, though. Also, the mattress was a bit soft for my taste, probably from overuse. I still got a good night's sleep, though. Breakfast was included in the price (a pleasant surprise). The selection was not enormous, but rather adequate. It was particularly nice to see that scrambled eggs were part of the selection! You rarely find that in Italy. Coffee was made to order, and was quite good. The waitress also offered toasted bread when she saw that I had taken the eggs. The hotel is centrally located, very close to the Altare della Patria, and within 15 minutes walk from the Pantheon, Fontana di Trevi as well as the Collosseum. You will see similar features from other hotels in Rome, however what makes the Raffaello special is the excellent customer service they offer. They try to help whenever they can and are proactive to guests' wishes. This is the only hotel with this level of customer service I've seen in Rome. I will definitely try to stay at the Raffaello again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to a Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: veryhappy78
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Raffaello was a great beginning to our travels in Italy. My husband and I were very happy with the whole staff at this charming hotel. The room was beautiful and the bed comfortable. Whenever we had a question about anything, the front desk people were more than willing to help us out. It was an easy walk to the subway to get where we wanted to go. We dined at nearby restaurants that had terrific Italian cuisine. We most definately will return to Hotel Raffaello next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely end to an unfortgettable trip”
Reviews.Author: hyperlollipop
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid-August for two nights with my partner at the end of a long tiring Contiki trip. We wanted a couple of days of relaxation before we headed home. This hotel did just the job! For Europe, the size of the room was generous. It was beautifully decorated and comfortable. The bathroom was huge! Breakfast (which was included) was more than adequate. And the hotel staff were very helpful, assisting us with which buses/trams to catch and printing off our e-tickets for our flight home etc. The hotel's location was perfect...walkable from Termini (where to had to go to catch the train to the airport) and 5 mins walk to the main street (Via Nazionale) where you can catch a bus anywhere (Vatican, Piazza Navona etc). Found Rome really easy to navigate around. It was nice to just set of from the hotel with a map and discover the Forum / Colosseum nearby etc. Unforgettable trip and a lovely end to it. Almost forgot to mention, we got an amazing deal on the room rate in the middle of peak season by booking online 6 months in advance...it was a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Most Perfect Place to Stay when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tntpaq
Reviews.Content: This most charming hotel was a hdden gem. Centrally located and close to all transport, we felt this was a great choice for our recent 3 day stay in Rome. We selected this hotel based on all the great reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed (thank you to all who had provided their recommendations). Don't expect the comforts and amenities of the international chain hotels but if you're looking for a charming boutique hotel with local character and history, we would certainly recommend Hotel Raffaello. Our room while not large, was beautifully decorated - upholstered headboard and matching wall treatments, hotel branded toiletries and even branded slippers - great attention to detail for such a small establishment. We had read all the negative reports about the small shower cubicle - yes it was tight however neither my husband nor I had any problems showering (and we are not small people), so we couldn't understand what all the fuss was about. Breakfast was amazing - fresh, plentiful and wonderful variety - juices, fruit, bakery items, cake, cheese, ham, scrambled eggs, yogurt and wonderful coffee/hot chocolate - all you could possibly need - so substantial that it kept us going until an early dinner. The breakfast staff were very efficeint and friendly and the made sure everything was replenished and coffees served at breakneck speed. Another thing we noticed which showed the generousity of the hotel. We observed earlier arrival travellers were offered to help themselves to breakfast, even though they were not technically checked in. Interestingly, further down our travels, we arrived at an International chain hotel (where we were gold loyalty members had booked an executive club room) and while waiting in the club lounge while our room was being readied, not only where we not offered to help oursevelves to something from the breakfast buffet in the lounge, but when I asked if we could have something (given we had just come off a long flight), we were told no we couldn't. So top marks to Hotel Raffaello, we are recommending you to all and can't wait to return to Rome in the future, where we would not even consider looking to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and well located for the train/bus station”
Reviews.Author: archie027
Reviews.Content: Had a great long weekend in Rome staying at the Raffaello. The hotel is very clean and there was a very acceptable continental breakfast. It is very well located for the bus/train station. We were given a bottle of wine, as it was our silver wedding, which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Pay extra for the terrace”
Reviews.Author: farcanary
Reviews.Content: Room on the top floor had a great terrace with views of surrounding neighbourhood. Bathroom was clean with a tiny but functional shower. Lift only marginally larger than the shower. Walking distance to the Collosseum. Breakfast of standard European fare with good coffee made to order. Staff were helpful if a little tourist fatigued.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy”
Reviews.Author: Chula_Banana
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for a single day on a stopover on our way back from rural Tuscany, and this hotel was in an absolutely perfect location. We walked the 5 minutes from the train station, dropped off our bags and then walked on another 15 to the Colisseum, plus a cappuccino stop on the way. The hotel is classy and pretty. At check-in our service was just adequate, but after a shift change the service became impeccable. The front desk staff arranged for a "taxi" (a brand new 5-series BMW driven by a man in a sharp suit) for us to the airport at a reasonable price, and even arranged to have the breakfast room open 15 minutes early so we could have breakfast before leaving. The quality of the breakfast was quite good and was worth the rush. Not a cheap hotel, but good value in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Faye064
Reviews.Content: Beautiful twin room on top floor, actually said apartment on checkout bill, window opened onto a lovely big garden terrace with lots of plants. Very well furnished. Breakfast was superb, lots of choice. Reception staff very friendly. Location was excellent, not far from Termini about 15 min walk, you could basically walk on foot anywhere within 20 mins or half hour or so. Lovely restaurants nearby. Would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: MerlinChester
Reviews.Content: First visit to Rome for my 50th birthday. Had read the reviews on trip advisor and decided on the Hotel Rafaello. What a good choice it turned out to be. We asked the hotel to arrange a taxi to pick us up from the airport. Giacomo pointed out all the sights on the way. First impressions of the Hotel - clean, welcoming and well kept. Allocated room 420 at the rear of the hotel. Twin beds for the boys, large separate room for us with double. Wonderful shower with power jets in the bathroom. We used the air con on some days because it was really warm, but kept the windows open generally. On the first morning woke up to wonderful smells of baking croissants. Went down to substantial breakfast buffet. Christina, our attentive and welcoming waitress was great. Attractions - visited most of them on foot. We liked the idea of following the map and my goodness we did some walking. Word of advice when you visit the Colosseum - avoid the gladiators in the surrounding area! 1 "friendly" guy posed for photos then demanded 20 euros - he didn't get it , we did pay an amount but had to be quite firm about it. Buy your tickets from the Forum and you bypass any queues. Visited St Peters and the Vatican/Sistine chapel (not on Wed - Pope does his address) The queues looked long and you were continually pestered to join unofficial trips, but if you visit St Peters in the morning and the Vatican in the afternoon there isn't usually a queue. Should there be, buy a ticket for an extra 4 euros from the information point in the Square and you can avoid this. We felt very welcomed in this city. People were very helpful and kind. At the top of my review I mentioned we were visiting for my birthday, we were dining at La Mela D'Oro. How wonderful it was, Christian and Sami dimmed the lights and brought in a home made cake, sparkly candle and everyone sang "happy birthday". I felt quite overwhelmed with their kindness - a moment I will always treasure. Thank you x Only negative bit about the area - a spitting tramp woman! she frequented the area at times getting more and more drunk and proceeded to curse and spit at anyone! The locals were quite right to be angry about her, so, beware. I have no hesitation to recommend this wonderful, welcoming hotel to anyone who wants a central base to explore this brilliant city. I threw loads of coins into the Trevi fountain and hope that the tale about returning to the city will come true sooner rather than later. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids”
Reviews.Author: RebLong
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, great location, within walking distance (15 mins) to the Coliseum lots of local pizza restuarants nearby. Great rooms, all quite recently refurbished, the showers were excellent! we asked for an ajoining room, and got a 2 bedroom , room, not 2 rooms with a connecting door! This is a lovely hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “3 star?? More like 4 star, and with 5 star service!”
Reviews.Author: meliss777
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Raffaello during a 3 day trip to Rome and found it outstanding. Normally we dont choose 3 star hotels after many bad experiences (does anyone else find usually anything below 4 star is terribly below average?). However, Hotel Raffaello is a great exception. We honestly couldnt figure out how it was a 3 star place - we think it might be because there is no view, it is a small building and the bathrooms are quite tiny - but really, the "negatives" (if you can call them that!) end there. The rooms were spacious - for sleeping in, although who is hanging out in their room in Rome?! Everything with exceptionally clean, and the bathroom, while small, had a great shower and was lovely and renovated. The breakfast, while not exactly extensive buffet, featured UNREAL scrambled eggs, some fruit, pastries, cereals, juices, tea and coffee - just what you need! But what really stands Raffaello out is the service. All the staff are lovely and helpful, they provide fantastic free maps that we completely depended on, and really make you feel that, at the end of a long sightseeing day, you have come home! You couldnt say that Raffaello was 5 star, purely on the fact that, in the quaint building it is housed in (which in itself adds to the charm - the lift only takes 3 people!) it cant provide the sumptuousness in accommodations that sprawling resorts can - but when in such an interesting city as Rome, where a lot of the buildings are back to back and stuck right beside one another, why would you want the sprawling resort experience?

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, good breakfast, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 54321GoToRome
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated a short walk from the Termini station. All of the main "must-see" sights are within easy walking distance as is the Cavour metro station. Fair size rooms with high ceiling, tiled floors. Pleasant breakfast room (no restaurant) with a more than decent buffet selection of cereals, fruit, cold meats, eggs, croissants and pastries - setting you up nicely for a day's walking and sightseeing. Minibar but no room service. Room was air-conditioned and incredibly quiet. Front desk and breakfast staff polite and spoke good English. All in all a great base from which to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient location to Roma Termini, Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: Rhodesfam
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our room. We got the "family room" -- 2 rooms -- 1 Queen, 2 twin beds. Spacious enough for 2 adults, 2 (young) teens. 5 minute walk to Roma Termini, 10 minutes to Colosseum. It was hot, so we enjoyed the A/C. Only downside was that directions from Roma Termini weren't great, so it took us 30 minutes to get there, but once we saw where it was, it's quite close to the terminal. WiFi was decent, but you had to pay by the hour of half hour, and their business center consisted of one computer -- but it was rarely if ever occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean, hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: lesinlondon
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel. The location is lovely, walking distance to bars and restaurants, very very close to Colloseum & Forum. We walked everywhere, to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. The room was a good size, bed was comfortable and all was clean and tidy. Would stay here again and certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MartiniGirlSeattle
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect only an 8 minute walk from the Termini. We easily walked to all major locations and found many places nearby to dine. Our room was a good size with the most perfect bed (firm) and bathroom was small but adequate and we were lucky to have a tub with a shower. We looked forward to the plentiful and delicious breakfast every day! Staff was very friendly and helpful and we would most definately return again!

Reviews.Title: “charming small hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: JANDDBritinParis
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Rome after 4 nights stay in this very nice hotel. Small ,quiet and friendly , conveniently located for many of the tourist sights this hotel is a good choice. The bedroom was slightly on the small side but nicely decorated in the traditional style and the bathroom was modern and tasteful. Breakfast was excellent with a wide choice of food in pleasant surroundings (there is no restaurant or bar). One of the best things about this hotel was very efficient air conditioning and double glazing ensuring a cool quiet night's sleep. A rare thing in Rome I imagine!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Morpeth
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Raffaello on the strength of previous reviews and was not disappointed. As a solo traveller I am used to small single rooms in european hotels and my room was small at the Raffaello, but it was spotlessly clean and had all the necessary facilities. The small shower was not a problem for me. But for me the best feature of the hotel was the courtesy and helpfullness of the staff, especially those on the front desk. I arrived on a late flight and this caused no problem at all. When I arrived the duty receptionist could not have been more helpful and welcoming, and a problem with my transfer on departure (not booked via the hotel) was sorted out for me swiftly and easily. I am sure I will return to Rome, and will definitely stay again at the Raffaello. I booked direct with the hotel on the website and secured a better room rate than I could find with any of the usual online travel websites.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: neets80
Reviews.Content: great hotel. friendly staff. especially the man who greated us upon arrival. very informative! great room. can easily walk to the colosseum. very close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location if you want to...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if you want to consider somewhere close enough to the main train terminus to walk to/back, and near the main tube line as well as the historic sites. The room was very pleasant no noise, and breakfast was simple but substantive. The hotel is also near to the large supermarket which may be used to make lunch to help reduce costs on the long days walks ahead. Great centre overall to base your visit

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Logan25
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night at the Raffaello on our return to Rome from Tuscany before heading home. The hotel is very close to the train station and on a quiet street. The front desk staff were very friendly. The gentlemen on the desk when we arrived made reservations for us at a nice restaurant around the corner and was always very friendly and remembered our room number and had our key in hand before we made it across the lobby to the desk on our return from dinner. The room was a very nice size and the bed very comfortable. The shower, as stated in many other reviews, is very small but was fine for us. Check out was a breeze and the taxi to the airport was there right on time. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay down by the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Really stands out”
Reviews.Author: blueman373
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Raffaello for four nights on my honeymoon...one of three different hotels during our trip. I chose the hotel based on other reviews on this site and I'm glad I did. Most of the negative reviews on this site deal with the down-sides of European hotels in general (room size, keycard in the slot for electricity...)...welcome to Europe, don't be swayed by those bad reviews. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I booked through Expedia and exchanged a few emails with the staff before our stay. They were friendly before and during our stay. We had them call a cab for us at least once a day and the cab showed up in two minutes max. Considering the other two hotels I stayed in (also highly rated) the room in Rafaello was actually a good size. The bed was amazing!! We slept so well. They have blackout curtains, and the rooms are silent. One negative is the shower size. It is a stall shower, again typical, but it was rather small. A larger person would probably have trouble in the shower. The breakfast was typical European and nothing to write home about. Eggs, baked goods, cured meats, fruit, cereal, juice, but the breakfast staff was nice. Try to come down to breakfast not at the last minute, because they only have a few tables and you might have to buddy up with someone. The location is pretty good for the money. On arrival, we walked from Termini, which was doable, but not really a good decision. After an 8 hour flight, and a train ride with no AC, walking with our bags was pretty lousy. I would recommend a cab. When we left, we took one to Termini. When taking a cab from Rafaello to anywhere in the city, it never seemed to cost more than about 10 euros. Its an easy walk to three or four different metro stops, about 10 minutes. We bought the Roma Pass (highly recommend!!) which gave us free rides on the metro. We walked to the Colosseum as well. The hotel is basically a block from Santa Maria Maggiore which makes it touristy enough but not overwhelming. There's lots of good restaurants in the area. Our first night the staff recommended a place right up the street which was good but a bit pricey. I would recommend Ristorante Strega which is right around the corner. Overall, we loved Hotel Rafaello and recommend it. I was shocked by how first rate it really is. It's a laid back hotel, but is also very fancy at the same time. They were very welcoming and made me feel rich while staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Not awful, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: RichGambler
Reviews.Content: The staff wasn't all that friendly, save for one female employee. One of the male workers even gave me a little attitude at one point. Another thing I didn't like was the fact that you had to have your keycard inserted inside the room in order for the electricity to work. When you like coming back to a cool room, this is a problem. Also, the room was small and the shower was just tiny. I mean miniscule. Overall, the hotel itself wasn't that bad as far as cleanliness/food goes but we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Europewatch
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in great location with friendly staff and excellent value. Breakfast buffet was always fresh, stocked and delicious. The staff were very attentive to our needs. The rooms were beautifully finished, comfortable furniture and beds. The bathrooms, although small, were pristine and well taken care of. The staff made an effort to make us feel welcome, the hotel clerk gave us a map and marked all the major attractions and even suggested some good restaurants close by. I highly recommend this hotel... I can’t believe it is only a 3 star!!

Reviews.Title: “OK value for money”
Reviews.Author: sjchaps
Reviews.Content: Like most places in Rome the rooms are really small. Would probably go back again particularly given 5 minute walk to Termini Station. Staff were OK but had a little attitude that I couldn't quite work out!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: DrewK
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in June 2010, (and my family one extra night - see below) and it was wonderful! The location is perfect with 3 metro stops (Repubblica, Cavour and Termini) within 10 minutes walking distance. In fact, we walked the 10 minutes from Termini when we arrived by train from Civitavecchia after our cruise - the taxi quoted us EUR 25 and said that we would need 2 taxis as we were 4 people with luggage! Definitely not worth EUR 50. Many of the tourist sites are within walking distance too, but our metro tourist travel pass was also put to good use. There are many restaurants nearby (some were recommended by the hotel) and we enjoyed some really nice dinners there. We had 2 adjoining rooms, 502 and 506, and both opened up onto lovely patios where we enjoyed a sunset pizza dinner on 21 June - summer solstice! The one room (506) was very large and had a shower over the bathtub, and the other room (502) was smaller with one of the smaller showers in the bathroom - perfect for our teenage daughters. The breakfasts were very enjoyable, with both hot and cold foods available. The only small gripe was that they sometimes ran out of the fresh fruit initially on offer, but the friendly waitresses immediately offered an alternative fresh fruit from the kitchen. My husband and daughters had to return to Raffaello a few hours after we had checked out as I fell and fractured my knee whilst climbing some broken stairs in Ostiense Station on our way to the airport and Mykonos. They very kindly offered them a room for the night and advised them where they could stay in the suburban neighbourhood close to the hospital (CTO) I had been taken to by ambulance. Just a few words of advice - if you have been hospitalised in Rome and it is at all possible, try and return home as soon as you are able to. We thought that some of our South African hospitals were not that great, but our private hospitals are far superior to the Rome one I had to spend 6 days in. After repeated postponing of the surgery to repair my exposed multiple fractured kneecap we decided that I would return to RSA for the operation. The surgeon here said that the operation had been an emergency and that it should have been done in the first six hours after the accident. By the time I got home and into surgery, it was 9 days afterwards! Needless to say we did not end up going to Mykonos as planned, and I am still in a knee brace and on crutches! The doctor says it could take up to a year for my knee to heal. If we ever return to Rome one day (and we hope to do so once my healing is complete) I would definitely choose to stay in Hotel Raffaello, and I have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: HolywoodCoDown
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the family room (which was actually two communicating rooms) with two teenagers. Hotel was brilliant, clean, staff helpful and efficient. Breakfast was superb, breads, meats, cereals, fruits, toast, juices, eggs - a great choice and good quality. Waiting staff friendly and efficient. The hotel kindly kept our luggage for us after we checked out, allowing us a full extra day sightseeing before catching our transport to the airport. They even offered us toilet facilities when we picked the bags up along with a welcome cup of tea or coffee. Hotel was excellent value 3 star hotel, location was good for trains and sight seeing. Only recommendation (rather than a criticism) would be for them to improve the lighting level in the bedrooms. Based on our experience would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at Hotel Raffaello!”
Reviews.Author: toomuchsnowhere
Reviews.Content: Make sure that the name matches the hotel you think you're researching. Trip Advisor does have it listed as Raffaello Hotel, but the name is Hotel Raffaello! There is also a Raphael Hotel, so be very careful. This did confuse me, and Massimo, one of staff at the hotel pointed it out to me in an e-mail before my arrival. He wanted to make sure that I had truly planned on staying at this hotel. I actually had thought differently, but it turned out to be a wonderful mistake on my part. Service from Salvatore, Edoardo, and Massimo and the lady whose name I forget (scusi!) was very professional and helpful. They helped with locating and reserving a space at restaurants and museums, buying a bottle of prosecco, providing ice, glasses and bucket for the prosecco, as well as locating a gym for my husband. They also helped arrange for us to be picked up at the airport by a very professional taxi service (48 Euros...worth the ease for us). Breakfast was included in the rate and we were very pleased with the breads, pastries, boiled and scrambled eggs, cheese and fruit provided each morning. The hotel was close (10-15 minutes) to the Forum and Colosseum and maybe 20-25 minutes walk to the other major points of interest in Rome. It was very clean, quiet and the space was perfect for the two of us. I loved the bathroom with the multi-jet shower, but I think that it might be difficult for a non-petite or slender person to fit well in the shower space. It was difficult for my husband 6'2" to bend over to wash his lower legs. We arranged the reservations through booking.com and received an average rate of 205 Euros a night. It differed on different days of the week. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: cherman007
Reviews.Content: Raffaello is just marvellous. Clean rooms, véry friendly and helpful (English-speaking!) staff, great location (15min walking distance from Termini station, 5min to metro's, 100m from local - cheap - grocery, very quiet neighbourhood) and above all - for Italian standards - incredible breakfast with fruits, cornflakes, all sorts of bread and toast, cheese, ham, jam, eggs, etc. Plus, the hotel rates are not that high, so this is probably the best value for your money you can get. Can't say enough good things about this place. Thank you, Raffaello, for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful hotel, excellent staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: maria2471961
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on tripadvisor and everything everyone said about it was true. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms were surprisingly spacious, everything was very clean and the breakfast was excellent. There are plenty of shops and places to eat within walking distance and the location was central enough to get around quickly to the tourist sites via bus or cab. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, clean and tidy and fair minded during volcanic ash...”
Reviews.Author: Milliedad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked into the Raffaello based on Tripadvisor reviews. We flew from London (important later). Because it was for our 10th anniversary I had emailed ahead asking if they could have some Prosecco in the room for when we arrived - it was brought up shortly after we checked in and was FOC - so a good start. Over the next couple of days we did the usual Rome sites whilst keeping an eye on the news because of the impending volcanic ash travel chaos. On the Thursday, our Friday return flight was bumped to Monday, and then on the Saturday it was bumped to the following Saturday, i.e. 8 days after our original departure. The hotel staff and management were very sympathetic to our situation and although we eventually managed to get home by rail (only 6 days late!) for the extra nights that we stayed at the Raffaello we were given a very reasonable nightly rate. As for the hotel itself, we liked where it was situated; we walked most places because in general that seemed quicker than cabs anyway. A 10 minute walk down Via Cavour and you were at the Forum and, Vatican excepted, most other sights were only another 10-15 minutes walk anyway. Although this worked for us, it might not for all. There are a fair number of pretty reasonable restaurants and bars nearby The showers (we were in three rooms during our extended stay) as has been mentioned elsewhere are all quite small but did the job - even if we couldn't get any of the 'space age' nozzles etc. to work - they seemed to have been disconnected. Our bedrooms and bathrooms were all cleaned every day and the toiletries replenished. We were never disturbed by any traffic or bin lorries at any time and we had rooms on both external sides of the hotel. The breakfasts did start to get a bit 'samey' after a while; but the items were fresh as was the coffee. All of the staff in the hotel, bar none, were exceptionally friendly towards us from the very start, and if I'm honest got more so during our plight. This is a very nice little hotel, in a nice area and it is staffed by very nice people. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, quiet well-situated and elegant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BigWind29
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel extremely accessible to the train station, the subway, a short walk from the Coliseum to one side and to the Spanish Steps to the other. Hotel is on a side street so there is less city noise. Breakfast buffets were plentiful and varied and hotel staff very helpful. What I liked best was the location and the quiet ambience. The room was comfortable and more than adequate for the price -clean, good sized bed, WC in working order. One tip: Get a map and see where you are vis-a-vis the train station. Taxis are notorious for taking roundabout ways to get you from Point A to Point B. We realized too late that the station was a mere 10 minute walk after we had paid for a 40 minute drive with a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rooms, Excellent front-desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Niket_BLR
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel. The hotel location is quite good. It is convenient to get there from Cavour metro station. Cavour metro station is mid-way between Termini and Colloseo stations. So, its a good location. Note to travelers: its a fairly long walk from Termini, if you have bags with you. The directions from Cavour on their website are poor. If coming from Termini or Tiburtina, go up the stairs to end up on Via Cavour. While facing Termini (i.e., in the direction of exit from the stairs), cross the street to your left. You will find a flight of stairs going down. Take those stairs (i.e., on the other side of Via Cavour) to reach Via Urbana. Start walking towards Termini and you will reach the hotel in about 7 minutes. The rooms are decent size... not US-size, but very adequate for a vacation. The rooms are clean and the AC worked well (it was hot when we were in Rome... and coming from someone who lives in India, I really mean it :-)). The room was clean, but it had a very bad smoke odor. We did not request a room change, since we knew we will be out for the most part. But the problem was that the smell did not clear even after leaving the windows open for a day. The bathroom was large and had ample of natural light. The (free) buffet breakfast was adequate... nothing great, but quite good nonetheless. But the reason why we liked the place was the front-desk staff. Very helpful. They recommended us Restaurant Tema (about two blocks from the hotel), which happened to be the best restaurant of our 13-day Italy trip. Will we come back... I don't know. If there is anything that will bring us back, its the helpful front-desk and the proximity to Tema.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with spacious rooms, nice amenities, good location”
Reviews.Author: z311rules
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Raffaello in Rome for 2 nights in May. We arrived by train and took a cab to our hotel, although it was actually close enough to walk if we had known where we were going. It was on a quiet street and the main entrance and lobby are very elegant. The staff was very nice and helpful (except for one guy who told us the wrong bus to take somewhere), and they provided a free coffee station at any time of day for you to make something. They also offered a really big and nice buffet breakfast, with servers to bring you drinks, toast, and anything else you may need. Great way to start off our days! Our room was VERY spacious and the bed was big and very comfortable! We had a king room on the 3rd or 4th floor, and looking out the window you could see the hotel's neon light at night and the quiet street (the light didn't come in the room to bother us). We really loved all the space, and there also was a fridge with relatively inexpensive drinks! The bathroom was also pretty spacious for Europe, the shower was a little small (and I'm thin) but that's the norm in Europe. The hair dryer took FOREVER to get my hair dry, but that's the kind they use there. There are a number of gift shops right nearby the hotel on surrounding streets, as well as a couple cafes and a great gelato place on a corner. The subway station is very close also (5min walk). As for the city of Rome, it's so huge but we utilized the subway as well as walking to get around (took a bus once and got totally lost and that ended using the bus system). We walked to the Colosseum, Capitol Hill, the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, etc. (we're fit), but the subway could easily get you around too. We particularly enjoyed the Piazza Navona, about a 5min walk off the right side of the Pantheon when facing it (don't know what direction that is). It is a really large beautiful square lined with tons of cafes and restaurants along with lots of activity going on - we saw flamedancers, an opera singer practicing in front of a crowd, and one evening before a GREAT patio dinner there was an entertaining mime working the passers-by. Lots of fun and free entertainment! There's another square not far away that is more for a younger (and late-night) crowd (we are 30-something's and like that stuff, but we went there and preferred the options and ambience in Piazza Navona). We went to Vatican on our last full day and it was pretty amazing. Don't miss the City nor the actual church. We did not have time to go to the museum. Don't miss the church and definitely try making the long walk up tons of narrow steps to the top...it's worth the view! On our last day we walked with our luggage to the train station, since we knew where we were at that point. PLEASE BE CAUTIOUS - if you're heading out to the Rome airport, the walk INSIDE the trainstation to the Leonardo Express which takes you to the airport is VERY LONG. Add an additional 15-20 minutes of walking ONCE you get to the station. Overall, Rome is a HUGE, OLD city, but it has charm and can be doable in a couple days. Pick out a few major sites, walk and subway-it around, and enjoy the GREAT food and wine everywhere. Our hotel was a great find and I'd definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShellsinKuwait
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Raffaello the 2nd week in July. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. The service was awesome. Very friendly front desk. My bag did not make it to Rome with me (beware, this apparently happens quite a bit in Rome), and they were very helpful in helping me deal with that situation. The room was perfect size for me, the A/C worked great. The breakfast was wonderful. Wireless internet worked well (I paid 25 euros for use of it for my entire stay). The location is awesome, I tend to stay lost when I go a new city and this hotel was so close to everything, I didn't get lost once. Very great place to stay. When I go back to Rome, I will stay here every single time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great Location! What a find!”
Reviews.Author: UkYorkshirelass99
Reviews.Content: We chose and booked this hotel on the internet primarily for its location close to the main railway station. What a find! Friendly staff checked us in. The bedroom was spacious and spotlessly clean. The bathroom had a bath and a bidet. Plenty of toiletries in the en-suite - all with the hotel's monogram. Thick curtains ensured the bright morning sun was kept at bay. Air conditioning was excellent. The rate included continental breakfast with a good selection of fresh fruit, eggs, cheese, meat and pastries. A wide choice of restaurants for evening dinner closeby was appreciated after a long day sightseeing in Rome. Only downside was the lift access to the bedrooms was on a mezzanine level for each floor, so we had to go a floor higher and walk down - not too easy with heavy suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: giafamily
Reviews.Content: Raffaello Hotel was the first hotel we visited on our travels through Italy.Travelling with 2 young teenagers meant that our accomodation needed to be suitable so that we could all be in the same suite. This hotel offered that and was one of the key criteria for making a booking. Upon our arrival we were pleased to find out that our room was ready for an earlier than expected check-in. Whilst our room had no view, this was not of concern. Airconditioning worked well and sleeping attangments were very comfortable. Whilst close to the Colosseum, we depended on the efficient metro system to take us to all other areas we wanted to visit. For those who enjoy staying a little further away from the hustle and bustle of a very busy city, it would provide a perfect location. Breakfast was the best we experienced throughout the country. Plentiful with great variety, and most importantly the kids loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: BestJules
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English. Our room (404) was a good size, with a big bathroom, and overlooked the street to the front. The air conditioning was great as Rome was very hot when we visited. The buffet breakfast was ample and kept us going for most of the day. There was a good selection of bread/toast, pastries, cheeses, meats, fruit, cereals, yoghurt, juices and a hot option. Make sure you ask reception for a card to access the roof terrace bar at Hotel Albergo Del Senato, which overlooks the city and is next to the Pantheon. If we get the chance to re-visit Rome, we would come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel earns its stripes! Comfortable Clean and a great Buffet Breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Smeeeagain
Reviews.Content: We were in a room on the top floor, room 512, which had a balcony as requested when we booked through Booking.com. The beds were very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was very clean but the shower was very small it would NOT be ok for large people. (You would squeeze in but it would be hard to move around) The room was cleaned daily and fresh towels were also left daily...I had a lovely sleep in that double bed, very comfy. There was also airconditioning which is essential in Rome.The staff were very proffessional and very helpful. There was internet access, but for a fee. The staff gave me wake up calls when requested, the reception is manned 24 hours a day and there are free apples at Reception which were good as a snack! :) We were on a budget in Rome as our credit card did not work without a pin, so the Buffet Breakfast was our favourite! We had a good breakfast which lasted us until Dinner. There were scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, ham, cheese, toast, croissants, yougurt, canned fruit, fresh fruit orange juice, water, tea, coffee, cakes, cereals etc...more than enough to choose from. We also took a peice of fresh fruit for afternoon tea. We loved it! We had an early Sistine Chapel tour one morning and they let us have breakfast half an hour earlier than opening time which we appreciated very much. The Hotel is within walking distance to all attractions and is close to the main Train Station which was also good as we had to catch a train to Venice and did not have to catch a taxi. This hotel earns its stripes!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service offering good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: MotherDaughter100
Reviews.Content: We went for a long week end to Rome. The Hotel is within walking distance from the Train Station though the directions are a little confusing because you can unwittingly exit the Train station at the side rather than via the main entrance. An adequately sized room. Separate lounge area available with tea and coffee making facilities. Short walk to Via Nazionale with easy access to busses. Access to the Metro nearby(which we did not use). Within walking distance of many of the tourist attractions. A comprehensive buffet style breakfast. We were made to feel safe, secure, and very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay at hotel - very clean and comfortable, and the staff were first rate.”
Reviews.Author: batemansally
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated very close to the colosseum, and all other sites of interest are within easy reach. Metro is nearby and this is very cheap and efficient. You are spoilt for choice for restaurants and shops! Whilst we were at the hotel it was my partner's 60th birthday and a bottle of champagne and some nibbles were left in the room as a surprise - very thoughtful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Would love to return.”
Reviews.Author: sma2sr
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hotel Rafaello and really enjoyed our time. The hotel is very comfortable and well located - roughly between Termini station and the Colosseum. The staff we met at reception and at breakfast were helpful and polite - good advice from the reception staff to visit the old town "Trastevere" and also useful bus and walking routes. Overall a great balance of high quality and comfortably relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place with pleasant people”
Reviews.Author: Massilia13Antony
Reviews.Content: Nice and cleaned bedrooms but bathrooms (bath) too small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and friendly and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: AleksandrMoscow
Reviews.Content: Friendly and attentive staff. Convenient location of the hotel on a quiet street not far from the city center. A beautiful design rooms. Transfer from the airport and the airport. Accommodation at the hotel made our trip a romantic and unforgettable. You can use the services Wi-Fi. Total 5 international television channels, a Russian general, no.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigJoeNYC
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Raffaello. A very nice, small hotel in a great area of Rome. Room was nicely furnished and very comfortable. Very convenient to the subway system. Nice people working the front desk and breakfast room. Included breakfast was enjoyable. When I return to Rome it will be to stay at the Hotel Raffaello. Excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: hikerchick10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and it was a great choice. Only about a 10 minute walk from the Termini train station and quick walks to all the sites you want to see. If you don't want to walk everywhere, there are metro stops close by that can get you to several locations (such as Vatican City, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc.). We stayed in a Double Room and it was nicely decorated and very clean. I'm not sure about some of the issues that previous people reported in the bathroom, as that we had no problems using the facilities. Considering that we were going to be walking A LOT during our stay in Rome, we were really happy to have such an extensive buffet breakfast. All the staff...the front desk, cleaning staff and servers at the breakfast were extremely friendly and helpful. My only complaints are that we had a view of a wall from our room and that the elevator was broken for some of our stay. I would easily recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Elio76
Reviews.Content: I choose Raffaello after reading all positive feedback from other travellers and I've been very happy with the choice. Location: Perfectly located (10 minutes walk from Termini train station), 10 minutes from Colosseo and main historical sites. You'll be able to reach other main areas with bus 64 and metro station Staff: Very professional, polite and helpful at any need with a smile. Rooms: clean, air contioned, nice bathroom. Breakfast: rich with pastries, croissants, eggs, , ham and fruits, good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on all points - staff /location /food”
Reviews.Author: johnpatricia4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day break in Rome at Hotel Raffaello. The location was excellent and reception staff advised us on amenities, restaurants and travel around the City. Very comfortable accommodation. We enjoyed our stay enormously.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jackson817
