Reviews.Content: Hotel Raffaello was a pleasant surprise to us - it is elegant and plush and makes you feel as if you are walking into wonderful grandeur. The room was magnificent, the balcony terrace was amazing and the front desk staff was always attentive and helpful. Breakfast was the best that we had throughout all of our hotel stays with B&B's and it was truly the only hotel we were sorry to leave. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel within walking distance of many sites.”
Reviews.Author: Bromcie
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have reported the shower contraption takes a genius ( my wife ) to work out. I could only get water coming out at foot level which made washing my hair a bit difficult. Apart from that little gripe the hotel is very good with everyone speaking English and being very pleasant. The breakfasts are great and if you steer away from touristy streets you can eat very cheaply and well. All in all a good base to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great, second time and many more to come!!”
Reviews.Author: dlansfor
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've every stayed at around the world! They staff is very helpful and professional! Close to all the sights and great restaurants. Second ti e in this beautiful hotel and will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant return to the Raffaello.”
Reviews.Author: Travellers286
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Raffaello, our second visit after a previous stay in October 2007. As on the last occasion, we were very happy with the quality of the accommodation. Our room was not large, but it was nicely decorated, spotlessly clean, and had the added benefit of a small balcony from which we could watch what was happening outside over a glass of wine. A small irritant was that we were kept awake on our first night into the wee small hours (try 3am) by a loud television in an adjoining room. Our attempts to contact someone to deal with the problem failed as the advertised telephone number for reception had been changed! Once appraised of the situaion the next morning, the reception staff assured us that they would deal with it and we had no further problems. Breakfast is still a good quality continental buffet, available from 7 - 10am, served by two very pleasant ladies. On this occasion we explored the local area in more detail, and discovered many more shops, cafes and restaurants within a short walking distance of the hotel than on our previous visit. We utilised the hotel's airport transfer service, and enjoyed a swift and relaxing trip to Fiumicino in a owner-driven Mercedes sedan for 48 euros. Based on two happy experiences, we would certainly book again at the Raffaello when returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel, But Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Lori_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights during our honeymoon. We found the hotel to be very average. It does have a convenient location to both the Rome subway and main train station, and our room was very clean, although it was very small in size. Becasue we were on honeymoon, I emailed them ahead of time and they provided us with complimentary champagne in our room. People considering this hotel should note that it does have a few 'wrinkles'. While our room itself looked like the pictures online, my wife discovered upon opening the curtains to our window that our room overlooked a tiny cement airshaft!!! During one of the nights we could hear other people's conversations since the room got so warm that we had to keep the window open. Also, we were told by the front desk that their operator service had gone down, so we had to make all wake-up call requests and inquiries in person down in the lobby during our entire stay. Overall, because of the room's cleanliness and location of the hotel itself, I had a positive experience. However, I wouldn't recommend it to those seeking a romantic stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Raffaello - a superb choice.”
Reviews.Author: Viv50
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews and like others I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. I travelled with my husband, cousin and her spouse. We were lucky enough to get one of the rooms with a terrace, the other had a small balcony, unfortunately weather meant we didn't get to use it as much as we would have liked, it rained on & off on 2 of our days in Rome. This hotel deserves all the praise it gets, the rooms are lovely, the continental breakfast has a good choice for a hotel of this size. We found it easy to get to most places from the hotel. We found the beds a little firm for our liking but not a huge problem. The staff are this hotels greatest asset. They go the extra mile in providing helpful advice and tips, nothing was a problem and they were so pleasant, even under pressure. In particular Francesco, who promptly answered all of my frequent emails prior to arrival. The hotel provided excellent value for money and if and when we return to Rome we will look no further than the Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, little gem”
Reviews.Author: JFC64
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at Raffaello Hotel. We had a room for 4 people, which had two single beds in the first room, a queen bed in the second, and a shared bathroom. The room was spacious enough, and beautifully decorated. The room and bathroom were impeccably clean, and were kept so throughout our stay. The hotel was very quiet, so we all slept great. Our shower was a corner unit and very small, and my teenage son (close to 6 feet) was crashing around in it. So, if you are large vertically or horizontally or have a physical disability you might want to inquire about the shower available in your room. The breakfast room was lovely, and the food was great. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with directions, recommendations, etc. All of this was great, but the BEST thing about the hotel was it's location. We were ten minutes from the Colloseum/Roman Forum/Palatine; were 2 minutes from a hop-on-hop-off bus stop and several important churches. We were an easy ten minutes from the train station (termini), and within 10 minutes walk to 3 different metro stops, which allowed fast, inexpensive and traffic free access to Spanish steps/Trevi Fountain/Piazza Navone etc, as well as to Vatican City. I truly can not imagine a better location in all of Rome, for any price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: rob091
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Raffaello in a wonderful room overlooking the street. The location is excellent, a short walk to the train station, Colosseum and the Forum. The area between the hotel and the Colosseum is full of interesting narrow streets with lots of interesting small shops and restaurants. There are some wonderful churches in the area including Santa Maria Maggiore The hotel itself is very confortable, the staff are excellent and very helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Ann_Arbor
Reviews.Content: This may be the best hotel for the money on Rome. The hotel is nice and well maintained. The staff are incredibly nice and helpful. The rooms are clean, comfortable and pretty big for he price in Rome. It is a little farther away from the major sites (20-30 minute walk) than some hotels, but you wold pay A LOT more for something similar closer to the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: careyhc
Reviews.Content: Our stay ended up being 7 days due to the ash cloud and we stayed all seven nights at the Raffaello. We had a great sized room on floor 1, just up the steps. We would rate the staff to be outstanding from securing a car to the airport to recommending restaurants they are ready to serve. They even gave us a bottle of champagne as we were celebrating our 30th anniversary. The breakfast was quite filling as well with meats cheese, fruit, cereal, toast, eggs and croissants even tomatoes on some mornings. Free wireless was a plus as we booked on their website. We Will stay at the Raffaello if we ever return to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonCaroline
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks holiday in Rome staying at Hotel Raffaello. We chose this hotel after reading the positive reviews it had recieved on Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. Our room was very clean, comfortable and quiet; towels were changed daily and linen every two days. We were warmly welcomed and found all staff friendly. The breakfast room is very pleasant and there was a range of food available. The hotel is ideally situated for walking to many of Rome's attractions and is close to Termini station. There is a variety of local restaurants near by serving good Italian food! Overall a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Pauline_E_H
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay in this excellent hotel. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we felt that we could not have asked for better customer service, all the staff were very helpful and spoke impeccable English. The bedroom was opulently furnished and a good size as was the adjoining bathroom, and everything was spotlessly clean. Unfortunately a building nearby was undergoing some renovations, which they seemed to do overnight so it was at times noisy (the weather was warm so we slept with the window open) however this was obviously not the fault of the hotel! Breakfast was plentiful and of a high standard. An open topped hop on/off tour bus runs from a stop within a 5 minute walk, and a 2 day ticket is well worth getting, as there is something of interest around every corner. Queues for entry to the main sites can be horrendous - entry to the Colosseum and Forum are via a combined ticket, buy it at the Forum as the queues are shorter.

Reviews.Title: “First Roman Adventure”
Reviews.Author: KentishKev
Reviews.Content: A lovely small hotel, excellent room, spotlessly clean, great friendly & helpful staff, situated close to main attractions but still quiet. Enjoyed our stay greatly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great value but location might not be the best for some”
Reviews.Author: DrewHartford_CT
Reviews.Content: My wife (29) and I (31) stayed here for 3 nights. We enjoyed the stay and thought it had a good value compared to similar hotels that were in more popular areas of Rome. Pro's: - Staff was very friendly - gave good restaurant rec's, always courteous, etc. - Spotless - Modern room - furniture, appliances, bathroom, etc. - Excellent breakfast spread - 10-15 min walk to train station and the Colesseum Cons: - Use of space in the bathroom: very small shower, toilet was right up against the shower - zero leg room, while the bidet and sink areas were spacious (not sure if other rooms were like that) - Location: neighborhood was safe (felt fine walking around at night) but it still wasn't the best location. Limited number of restaurants nearby. Many top attractions were a 20+ min walk, however major bus routes were a short walk away (though beware of pickpockets on buses...some guy brushed my wife's butt) - No free Wi-Fi

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Hotel Raffaello, Rome”
Reviews.Author: EnglandHolidaymaker1
Reviews.Content: We planned a short break to Rome with our 2 teenagers. The hotel room layout with interconnecting door plus ensuite facilities (quad room) and central access in Rome to all attractions on foot were key features in our selection of Hotel Raffaello. The staff were very friendly and helpful - organising a taxi pick-up service from the airport for us on arrival - and most importantly for the children the breakfast was plentiful. The rooms were beautifully decorated and we enjoyed a most relaxing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Expected good value for money - still positively surprised!”
Reviews.Author: JayBro
Reviews.Content: We chose the Raffaello based partly on the (ravingly good) reviews here. We were not disappointed! All the staff - from the different concierges to the maids - were positive and helpfull. Their recommendations were always reliable. Most staff spoke English very well. The room was even better: Good bed, enough space, window into quiet street, so very little outside noise got in. Good curtains, nice bathroom, rather quick internet axcess, flat-screen TV (however, 200 channels with nothing on but Italian game shows, but then again, we were not in Rome to watch telly). I agree, however, with the reviewer complaining slightly upon the size of the shower. My worst hotel experiences have been with dirty rooms and maids unwilling to clean what should have been done before our arrival. Raffaello was the complete opposite - it might have been the cleanest hotel room I've ever stayed at! Not one single black hair in the bed or in the bathroom throughout our five days stay - that is more seldom than one likes to think. My hope for Raffaello is that they will continue to hire the best cleaning staff in town. Breakfast was ok; what they lack in sortiment they regain with very quick and polite service. Some more fresh fruit would have been nice, though. Breakfast is included, which is good. Raffaello has a brilliant location; except for Trastevere and the Vatican, virtually all of Rome is within 25 minutes of walking. The area between the Termini train station (from where you reach the airport) and the hotel is seedy, but takes only 10 minutes. The Colosseum, Forum Romanum, The Pantheon, The Spanish steps and the rest of the cosy old city centre is within 15 minutes of walking. No taxi needed at all - the Roman Metro was surprisingly effective and VERY cheap at 1 euro per ticket. (Not needing to take a taxi was a great plus - the only taxi trip we took nearly killed us, as expected.) At 120-130 euro a night the Raffaello is perhaps the best value for money I have ever experienced at a hotel. If (or when) I go back to Rome, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - Great value.”
Reviews.Author: rodenbach
Reviews.Content: We got rooms here at the last minute because we were stuck in Rome due to the BA strike. The hotel was very attractive, and much nicer than its moderate price would indicate. The room was large, clean and quiet, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. A hearty buffet breakfast (meat, eggs, cereal, juice, rolls, coffee, and more) was included. The hotel is within walking distance of the Colosseum and Forum, as well and many good restaurants and shops. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GreAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: bob18413
Reviews.Content: fANTASTIC HOTEL AND LOCATION, EMPLOYEES couldn't be more friendly and helpful. Very nice modern rooms, superb breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of the holiday!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisDubya
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome, Stayed for 4 days (it rained for 4 days!). Hotel was excellent. Have recommeded to friends. If we return to Rome, we would not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Rome! Good choice of hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AndyCall
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome, and we based our hotel recommendation on this website entirely. What a good choice it was. Hotel is a 30ish minute drive from the airport. It is located down a very quiet side street, but 5 minutes away is a taxi rank and numerous restaurants. There is of course the train station, although this is probably 10-15 minutes away. The hotel has a very small friendly feel, and they are very welcoming. The room was smaller than what we have stayed in before, but was not missing any amenities that we required (except tea/coffee making facilities). The double bed (two singles pushed together) was very hard, but made a nice change. We were on the 1st floor, and looked out onto the side street. There was no traffic noise to worry about though. In the room itself, we had a double bed, a wardrobe, table, chair, 2x bedside cabinets and various lights. In the bathroom, there was a toilet, sink, shower and bidat. New toiletries were brought every day, but the towel only seemed to be changed every other day. Beds were made when requested, and they even folded our pyjamas up. There were only two points to the hotel, and both were to do with the room: 1) The shower was small. I am a big bloke, but not huge, and I found it hard to move around in the shower. Not a problem if you're small, but not recommended for the obese! I think you can request a room with a shower over bath. 2) The aircon did not appear to work. The room was VERY hot (even in February) and we had to sleep topless, with the windows open, and lying on top of the sheets. I think this might have had something to do with it being above the kitchen, but I'm not sure. Those are the only two bad points I can think of. Breakfast was your usual affair. Meat, cheeses, cereal, scrambled egg, fruit. Don't expect a full English though! Tea, coffee and juices were also available. Overall, the hotel was EXACTLY as described in previous reviews. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, and probably even stay there again. If you're after somewhere to eat locally, come out of the hotel, turn right, turn right again. Go up to the top of the road, cross the road, and there are a number of restaurants. Go to Pizzeria la mela d'oro. Very cheap, excellent quality and the wine is great! Probably the best we had! We had a full on meal, and it was about 50 Euros. Hope this is of help to someone!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: pompeylil
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at Hotel Raffaello. Staff gave us a very warm welcome and keys to room 502 - fabulous room with lovely outdoor terrace. Our room also had a nice large bathroom. Room was kept to a very high standard each day by the staff. Hotel location was brilliant, we didn't need to use taxis or public transport at all during our stay, everything was within walking distance. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small central hotel”
Reviews.Author: DevonStarshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. The room was clean and well appointed and the bed was comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful in answering any queries. The hotel was within walking distance of Termini but being in a quiet side street did not suffer from Traffic noise. It was only a short distance to the Terminus of one of the open top bus tours which was a useful means of reaching the various sites. Breakfast was more than adequate.We would use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service. Clean, comfortable and great location.”
Reviews.Author: howberg
Reviews.Content: Really have to tip our cap to the team at Hotel Raffaello. My girlfriend and I recently stayed for 4 nights and had a terrific experience. Special kudos to the staff for the amazing service. Warm, welcoming, knowledgeable and inviting. Special call out to Edouardo. front desk manager. Could not have exceeded our expectations any more. Mille grazie, Hotel Raffaello!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room, great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: thom235
Reviews.Content: I usually don't do reviews, but the Hotel Raffaello is so exceptional I am compelled to write. None of my party had been to Rome in many years so we had no idea where to stay. We found the Hotel Raffaello on Trip Advisor and were convinced by the reviews. It also helped that we got a very good price for our stay. I will attempt to pass on information to help the reader. This is by by far the best value of any hotel I have ever stayed in. From the front desk to the breakfast staff to the housekeepers, everyone was pleasant, professional and very efficient. Most of the staff spoke English, and seemed happy to give directions and referrals for restaurants and sightseeing attractions. My wife, two friends and I stayed for 6 nights in early February, 2009. We arrived on an overnight flight around 8:00 am Rome time and the hotel allowed us to store our bags until the 2:00 pm check-in time. The neighborhood has plenty of shops and restaurants. We felt safe on the streets, even at night. We were centrally located about 10 minutes by walking from the Termini, the central train station, and also about 10 minutes from the Coliseum. The hotel is a beautiful old building that has been restored. The floors and a lot of the trim work are marble. The decorating is nicely done. Our room on the 4th floor was spacious by European standards. The bed was called a double, but was actually about 4 inches wider and 3 inches shorter than a U.S. queen size bed. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were soft. The room also had two bedside tables, a work table, and a large free-standing closet with hanging space and shelves for clothing. The bathroom was large, even by U.S. standards, and had a tile floor and tile walls about two-thirds of the way up the walls. The sink, toilet (with seat) and bidet looked nearly new. (I mention the toilet had a seat because we found that many public toilets in Rome do not have a seat.) There was a towel warmer in the bathroom, which also doubled as a clothes dryer. The towels were large and fluffy. The bath had only a shower, and it was small by U.S. standards, but it was adequate. Very large people (over 300 pounds) will probably have trouble using the shower. The room had a telephone and local calls were free. The flat screen TV was nice and had CNN and BBC in English. The cleanliness of the room and bathroom was exceptional. Towels were replaced each day and the sheets were changed after the 3rd night. Breakfast was included with the hotel stay. It was very well prepared and the variety was good. The items served each morning included scrambled and hard-boiled eggs, toast, 3 or 4 fresh fruits, yogurt, sweet rolls and pastry, cold cuts, coffee, milk, hot chocolate, orange juice, and cereal. The breakfast staff was exceptionally happy and seemed to really like their work. I mentioned to the front desk staff that we had to leave for the airport at 6:00 am on our last day, and the breakfast staff prepared a "to-go" breakfast which was waiting for us when we checked out. I nearly forgot, but an important convenience we used was the hotel elevator. I researched extensively before the trip, and it is fairly rare to find a 3 star hotel in central Rome with an elevator. I recommend the Hotel Raffaello without any qualification, and I will stay there if I ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel with three stars”
Reviews.Author: FredBirmingham1
Reviews.Content: We now know why this hotel scores so highly. We stayed here for 4 nights from the 15th Feb 2010. The hotel is only a 10min walk from the main station. We had two triple rooms and these were exceptional. We had a king size bed and a single bed in each room. The cleanliness of everything was first class. The breakfast was excellent with the usual meat, cheese, breads, yogurts, and eggs. The staff were so so friendly, right from the chambermaid to the reception manager, Massimo. He was a real character and nothing was to much trouble. If anyone deserved to be receptionist of the year, he does. Our only regret was we could not take this hotel with us on our trips.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was good in every way!”
Reviews.Author: proprieter
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well placed, very clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. This was our first time in Rome so everything was a bit of a gamble, but it paid off and we had made a good choice with Hotel Raffaelo. The purpose of the trip was 2 fold, it was valentines weekend and also the 6 nations rugby match Italy v England, there was no trouble at all and it was very easy to get from the hotel to most of the tourist sites. Their recommendation for dinner at the nearby restaurant (Teme I think it was) was helpful as well. My husband especially liked the breakfast which set us up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Everything thing was fantastic with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gavinjsain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 8 nights while on vacation in Rome. The hotel is located in a quiet & convenient area, the metro is a short walk away and the Colosseum an easy 10 minute walk. The hotel is close to many conveniences; bistros, pharmacy, coffee shops, a laundry mat, great restaurants and boutique type shops. The room was clean and traditionally decorated and also had a modern flatscreen TV, and a computer desk. The bathroom was lovely and clean, the shower was small but ample. The method of in room WiFI was great, you could buy a block of time cheaply, and you had the ability to log on and off until your time ran out. Very fair. Overall the hotel was of a high standard, the customer service was outstanding. The buffet breakfast was a great, with everything from pastries, to toast, cereals, to fruits, cold cuts, fresh coffees & cappuccinos. A special mention to the lovely happy waitresses who looked after us each morning in the dining room. Look forward to a return stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: AnetaBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Near Termini Station, which is awesome if you want to see Rome by foot on your first day (use Cavour (front of the bus/taxi station) to walk down to Via Urbana and turn right). The staff kept our luggage until the check in time @ 2pm, which by the wide array of other people's luggage I take they do regularly. Rooms were very neat and tidy. Massimo was very helpful, so was Francesco. I had a shower cabin, my friend had a bathtub, both of us were really happy. Rooms were decent size and I loved that the hotel is not near a main road, because it was quiet at night when I opened a window. Breakfast was great, my friend is a big fun of Nutella and she was very happy to eat it everyday (ha ha). I loved their caffe americano (delish!) and because they have a lot of British tourist they always offer you a toast for breakfast. Use Via delle 4 Fontane to get to Metro by the Bernini Hotel (Barberini Station). Also remember to use banks to exchange your money, don't use any private exchange places, they have bad rates, plus service fee plus like 20% exchange fee.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i have stayed in and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: robincrete
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough. The service from the staff was excellent and we were made to feel welcome by everybody. It was my wifes birthday and a complimentary bottle of champagne was waiting in our room upon our arrival. It was very clean, an excellent location(only 10 minutes walk to the colusseum and the main railway station). Overall excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - cannot fault.”
Reviews.Author: Turner50
Reviews.Content: Polite, professional service from 2 reception staff encountered. Breakfast staff very efficient and friendly - constantly topping up breakfast buffet with fresh, hot food. Breakfast, as per other reviews, absolutely fab! Room large, clean, quiet with terrace (unfortunately wrong time of year to take advantage of!). Large, clean bathroom with good, powerful shower. Less than 10 minute walk from Termini station - easy to find, quiet street, ideally located for visiting all of the sites (everything within walking distance). Loved absolutely everything about this trip to Rome - would highly recommend both hotel and city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: carlym81uk
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights in this wondeful hotel. Situated in via Urbana, it's about a 10 minute walk from the colosseum. Our room was massive, with our own private roof terrace and big bathroom. I took my boyfriend for his 40th birthday, and they gave us a bottle of champagne and snacks in our room for us to come back to which was such a lovely touch. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was nice, scrambled eggs, toast, ham eggs cheese pastries with a choice of coffee tea and hot chocolate (highly recommend the hot choc- it's amazing!). In a lovely quiet area with lots of lovely restaurants in the area. Would definitely return if going back to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: pomWales
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Rafaello. What a great choice! Spotlessly clean rooms and a great jacuzzi shower. What more could you want? Maybe the pillows could have been a little softer!! Staff were great, and very obliging in whatever we asked of them. Recommended a great little pizzeria just around the corner on the first night; even phoned ahead to let them know we were coming! Within walking distance of all the well known sights and in a seemingly safe area. Stored our luggage on the last day until we were ready to leave for the airport. Arranged taxi from the airport on arrival. Not cheap at 45 euro, but worth it if your not sure where you're headed. Had been advised that the area around te Termini isn't safe at night. This was confirmed by several people. There's a huge choice of hotels in Rome and it's difficult to decide which is best, but if you want a reasonably priced hotel in a good location, then this could be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!!”
Reviews.Author: Smila81
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel having read other peoples reviews on trip advisor. I was looking for somewhere that would be comfortable and clean, with a good location, but that wouldn't break the bank. I had heard that all the rooms and bathrooms were tiny in Rome, but this was perfect and much larger than expected!! The shower was small, but as neither of us are overweight this wasn't a problem. The room was cleaned daily and all the towels replaced with clean ones (something I haven't experienced even in fancy 5* hotels!!) The staff were charming at all times. Breakfast was always great, lots of choice including scrambled eggs, breads, pastries, fruit, cereal, yoghurt. You did have to time your trip to the restaurant though as there was sometimes a queue! The location was fantastic, we walked everywhere. The Colloseum is just down the road!! A plus was that when the rain came (and oh did it rain!!) there were umbrellas in the entrance hall for guests free of charge! Only a few niggles. You do have to pay extra for internet, but at only €5 for 2 hours of wifi it's not too bad. Also the room smelt a bit if it was left for a long time, but this cleared if the windows were open for a few minutes. Oh, and one possible request... some english channels on the TV please? I know this sounds like a ridiculous request when one is on holiday, but the weather did get so bad that to venture outdoors was rather like taking a shower fully dressed (even with an umbrella)! Overall, brilliant. We would definitely go back to this hotel if we traveled to Rome again, and 100% recommend it to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michele034
Reviews.Content: We just loved this hotel. It was such a pleasant surprise to find such a roomy room that was so well appointed. The bathroom and shower were great- so was the breakfast. We were sad to leave this spot.

Reviews.Title: “So so, but great location.”
Reviews.Author: Cleverbroad
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome to enjoy the beauty of the city for a few days before a Mediterranean cruise. We wanted a hotel that was well reviewed and within walking distance of major historical sites and the Raffaello seemed to fill the bill perfectly. Check-in staff was rather indifferent, but we chalked this up to our later (almost 9 pm) arrival. With the help of the bellman we got our significant amount of luggage (for an 11 night cruise) to our room, adequate size by European standards but much smaller than we are used to in the U.S., then quickly came back down to go to dinner. We asked the concierge to suggest a local restaurant and he couldn’t come up with a single one within walking distance of the hotel! (He did suggest a very high end restaurant at the other side of town, and we suspected he might have some financial arrangement with them.) So, we started walking. In the rain. Which then became a downpour. We ducked into the first restaurant we found, which turned out to be a good choice, though rather expensive (about $130 with wine). Back to the room and a hot shower. Yikes! We are not large people, but this shower was a challenge for even my husband (6’, 175#). There was little room to turn around, and forget about bending down. My husband actually considered stepping out to soap up, then getting back in to rinse off! The Breakfast was good and choices varied, and my husband said the coffee was excellent. We spent the day sight seeing and the hotel’s location couldn’t be better – it’s within walking distance of the Forum, Colosseum, Termini Station and innumerable historical sites one just happens upon while walking. While we frankly found the hotel, its staff (the indifference we experienced on arrival continued) and the room rather average, the bargain rates and perfect location make it a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greatimes4ever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Raffaello for 4 nights in late November. We chose this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. The location was wonderful, just 10 minutes (if that) from the Termini with the Colosseum only just down the road. The rooms were very clean with loads of room, the bathroom was larger that we expected with the staff being friendly, informative and helpful. We would definitely stay there again should we be lucky enough to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: SinFronteras54
Reviews.Content: I travel abroad often and to Rome at least once a year and I must say that Hotel Raffaello is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in Rome. Cleanliness, location, value and staff helpfulness (attitude) are things I look for and Raffello exceeds in all these areas. I stayed at this hotel for 6 days with family who had never been to Italy before and the Raffaello made a great impression on them as well. The rooms are spacious by European standards and they were clean. The staff could not have been friendlier nor more helpful. In many other places I often feel like staff feels put upon by any question or request you have, but that was not the case at the Raffaello. Breakfast was sufficient and varied (scrambled eggs were a big hit with my travel companions). The only two minor negative aspects (which may be important to some) were the shower and the church bells. The shower was on the small side. Anyone on the larger side would probably have a bit of a challenge with it. Even so, I did notice a few pretty large guys staying there. The other was the church bells. There's a church next door (and I'm not sure if that's where the bells were ringing). In any case, I only heard them the first morning. If you're a light sleeper that might be an issue, but for me it added to the atmosphere. All in all, a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: tudin
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 25th to 30th Nov and were given room 502. This room is perfect, very spacious, nice bathroom and a lovely roof top terrace complete with table, chairs and plants and flowers. We were given a bottle of Prosecco and as it was my husbands birthday he was presented with fruit and chocolates. The staff are excellent, very friendly even though they have to deal with the miserable, mannerless American guests who cannot even be bothered to say Goodmorning. The breakfast is very good. I have stayed in Rome before and even though that hotel had a higher star rating and was a lot more expensive, it could not compare to the Raffaello for location, staff friendliness, efficiency, breakfast and spaciousness of bedroom. We loved Rome and would recommend both the city and this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel300463
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay in Rome. We stayed for 7 nights in Oct/Nov and could not fault this hotel. The staff were exceptional. The room was lovely and comfortable.We could not fault our stay in anyway. We loved Rome and hopefully one day when we return, we will stay again at the Raffaello .

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Histrytraveller
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in Rome for a long weekend (20th-23rd Nov) and this hotel was very good value, very clean, good rooms, service all round. I would definitely return there. A reasonable walk from Rome Termini with small wheeled luggage but would need a short taxi ride if your luggage is large. If walking from Termini, suggest you use the Via Cavour until you reach the Piazza Esquilino and then walk right, down one of the sloping pavements, towards the Via Agost de Pretis one block and then left into the Via Urbana. You will see the hotel just over a hundred metres on your left. If you stay Sunday, the Protestant "Chiesa Cristiana" immediately opposite the front of the hotel was founded by the traveller Thomas Cook and has an easy to follow Italian service at 10.30 am. We were warmly welcomed and some of the congregation speak English. We found the Ristorante f.lli Crisciotti in the nearby Via M. D'Azeglio to be good value with good fresh food. It closes Sundays. On our Sunday we tried the Ristorante/Pizzeria L'Angolo Di Napoli, in the Via Agostino Depretis, which was similarly priced but the food was not at all as good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: Grums
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recentlly stayed two nights November 22-24th. One issue is the hotel is slightly more than the 10 minute suggested walk particurly with luggage. Our suggestion is take a taxi from the Termini. We struggled with luggage and poor directions then, as I requested a view, had to drag the luggage up a flight of stairs after getting off the elevator. Other than that it would have been great to have a coffee pot or tea kettle in the room as the very small terrace in room 512 still has a lovely view of Rome's roofs in the morning. The staff was very helpful in giving directions and offering suggestions for restaurants. The room was large by Europe standards and the shower, as noted by others, an interesting challange as the jets shoot cold water first from the lines and the only way to adjust is by standing in the shower. Ignore the jets and the shower is fine. Breakfast is very good with eggs, fruits, cereals etc. and the staff bring toast and coffee. They are a lovely group. The hotel is pleasant and the area not too bad even in the evening. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: spoons2
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved Rome and I would recommend the Raffaello to everyone who travels there. Our room was lovely with a balcony, which was a nice surprise. I booked the trip for my husband's 40th birthday and the staff were very helpful, especially in booking us a table at the Tema restaurant for his birthday meal, which was just around the corner and was an absolutely amazing meal. Well worth a visit. We also had the lovely surprise of complimentary bubbly on my hubby's birthday, which just made his day extra special. We would not stay anywhere else in Rome. It is accessible to all major sites and public transport although we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nice staff, spacious”
Reviews.Author: Sharrdon
Reviews.Content: It was possible for us to walk with our bags from Termini station to the Raffaelo (bring a good map thought if you want to chance this, especially in the dark). A cab is probably a safer option. The immediate environs of the hotel were not great but the Colosseum was only a few minutes down the road. The Santa Maria Maggiore basilica was lovely for Sunday mass and the restaurants nearby were pretty good. Go down the hill outside to the lower end of via Urbana for good pub life and lovely small neighbourhood restaurants. If you don't want to spend over €100 on a meal then avoid the restaurant (praised in a lot of guide books) called Agate & Romeo. Overpriced when there are so many other great restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price Good Room”
Reviews.Author: Presika
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the subway and there are plenty of restaurants a few minutes walk from the hotel. The Hotel is not next to any major landmark, which made the room rates lower than others I compared. The room I stayed in was very clean and spacious compared to other hotels in Rome. The bathroom was actually very nice with a shower enclosure which wasn't too small. Breakfast was actually good and had some good choices. The hotel arranged a car to pick us up from the airport at the same cost as a taxi, with the benefit of riding in a Mercedes. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming comfortable hotel with good breakfast and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: HazelSomerset
Reviews.Content: We were most impressed by the friendly and helpful attitude of all the staff - good English was spoken by most. Our room was comfortable although there was no view. The bathroom was spacious and well-equipped. Breakfast was excellent with a wide choice. We were able to walk to the Colosseum (15 minutes)and many ancient Roman sites - metro and bus transport was easily accessible and the Termini station a 15 minute walk away. Buy a 3-day Roma pass (23 euros) for easy access to transport and monuments/museums (use the middle aisle at the Colosseum with pass to sail past the queues!!) Recommend Ricci's pizzeria (Est Est Est) off Via Nazionale (right at end of Via Genova) and Luzzi's trattoria in Via San Giovanni in Laterano (near San Clemente church).

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel, very neat and clean!”
Reviews.Author: pmaTX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Raffaello for three nights in mid October. We choose this hotel for price and by reading reviews on Trip Advisor and other sites. We were very happy with the choice!! This is not a 4/5 star hotel but the staff is efficient, accomodating and helpful. The lobby and breakfast room are very nice. The rooms are on the small side but are very clean and well decorated. Unless you want the ammenities of a 4/5 star property...restaurant, bar or fitness center, this is a great property to chose! We really enjoyed the buffet breakfasts...a wide selection and everything was fresh and tasty. They have pastries, fruit, hard cooked and scrambled eggs, jams, butter , toast, yogurts, meats and cheeses and pretty good coffee! Some information we read suggested that Hotel Raffaello is walking distance from the Termini Station...which it is....but not with luggage! We took a cab! However, once we settled into our room, we walked everywhere...to the Coloseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and much more. We took a tour and bus to the Vatican. Regarding the neighborhood, we felt very safe walking in the area! We found a nice coffee shop and several good restaurants nearby. We would highly recommend this property for location, value and cleanliness for your stay in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “We recommend Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: Insearchofholidays
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, quiet, clean, safe, conveniently located hotel with excellent staff who speak English well. We booked room 508 for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. It has a small balcony and is a fair sized room for Italy. Yes the shower was tight but was clean and worked well. The price was reasonable for Italy.. We arrived at 12 noon, a little early to check in. The front desk securely held our baggage and suggested we walk across to the Golden Peach which had an outdoor cafe for a lunch and said the room would be ready when we returned. By 1pm it was ready with a bottle of champagne as well. We were so tired next day we slept in past 10am and they so kindly brought a breakfast up to our room to accomodate us. They had guide books to borrow in the front lobby and readily helped us with directions. This hotel is two streets over from jumping on the red double decker tour bus (which you must ride -48 hour ticket) that takes you everywhere and a walkable distance from Termini Station which you will need to go to the Vatican. We have no problem recommending Raffaello!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LadyDada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights of our honeymoon here. When we arrived the staff was very friendly (spoke great English, a plus!) and minutes within walking into our room a staff member showed up with complimentary champagne! The rooms are small as well as the shower but the size was not a big deal to us since we basically just slept and showered there. Rooms are clean. Breakfast was good. Great location in Rome. Walking distance to coliseum, forum, spanish steps, trevi fountain, etc. We enjoyed our nightly walks for some gelato! Tours picked us up at the hotel which was very convenient. We never took a taxi accept to the airport. We had a great time! I love you babe!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & helpful staff, hotel central, clean & comfortable & good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: tasSpalding
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay in this friendly hotel. The rooms were nicely decorated and kept very clean. The staff spoke very good English which helped. We found the hotel well situated to reach most of the sights in the city. We enjoyed the Bathsof Carracella which were in walking distance and weren't as crowded as other places. The roads were a nightmare though, do take care. Very good restaurant nearby, called Unicum with a pianist playing in the doorway next to a big model dog! Across the road is a great gelateria at good prices. Food generally is very expensive with the poor exchange rate...and also drink. 6 euros for a small beer! We couldn't fault the hotel however. Would recommend it. The breakfasts were excellent and kept us going through to the evening. Lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TrojanExplorer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights prior to our cruise. Using TripAdvisor as our guide, we decided on this hotel based upon price and location. We were not dissapointed. The room was quiet and great for sleeping. The breakfast selection in the morining was very good. You can not beat the location. It is an easy walk to Termini Station (even with luggage) or any other popular tuorist sites in Rome. Just one street over there are a number of great places to eat. Just ask the front desk, and they will direct you. We are headed back to Rome in six months, and we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely, Friendly Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TwinmaAF
Reviews.Content: I, DH and 2 children stayed 4 nights at the Raffaello. We'd a room for 4, but the great thing was it was divided by a door, so the children could be asleep in one room while we'd lights on in the other. It was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. It's true, as other reviewers have said, the shower was small, but still totally usable. I would certainly recommend the hotel, and when I return to Rome, will try for it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: Texastikigirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The front desk staff was very accommodating. Check in process was easy. The hotel lobby was always clean- everyday we saw a gentleman cleaning and taking pride in his job. We stayed in Room 214. The room was very clean, but somewhat small. Our view was of the not-so-picturesque alley. The bathroom was a good size, but the shower was tiny (as mentioned by previous posts). My husband and I actually measured it-- 27 inches! So if u are a large person u will have a hard time showering. After the first couple of showers you will learn a system for making it work! Internet is available in the lobby only, and for a fee. Breakfast was great with a large selection. The front desk recommended a pizzeria which was very good and only a couple minutes walk from the hotel. La Mela d'Oro. We actually ate there 3 times during our stay! I will also write a review on TA about our experience if u want to read more about it. Just around the corner from the hotel is a wonderful gelateria. S M Maggiore. Wow! This was the best! We learned to find real gelato made with actual fruit etc- and this was one of those places. Our experience at this hotel was good, but I'm not sure I would choose it again? I can't pinpoint any one specific reason. But I didnt leave there with that "wow" feeling...

Reviews.Title: “Darling hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: llapa00
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello Hotel is your hotel if you're looking for small hotel charm, great service, location and breakfast! Rooms are adorable, comfortable and clean. Front desk service went above and beyond what is expected (thank you Mossimo). The hotel is located in a safe, charming area right by the Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore, which has a Hop On Hop Off (Open Tour) bus stop, right by... very convenient for our tour of Rome! The breakfast was a great way to start our sightseeing (complete with eggs to make this American happy). Internet access was cheap and readily available. The reason it doesn't get the full 5 stars is only because there were stairs (yes, expedia told me they had an elevator---but didn't say there were stairs between floors... which was difficult for my less mobile father-in-law). Also, as many other posters have mentioned, the shower is quite small. Even at 5'2" and petite I felt closed-in. If you're a big person or limited by stairs, keep these things in mind. Overall, I would return and recommend to a friend! Props to Mossimo for helping our family and the front desk help that referred us to Tema for a great dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the city....a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: guava57
Reviews.Content: In spite of the traffic problems, poor street design, and humidity, this hotel was TERRIFIC. The staff was very friendly and gave us great advice. The rooms were small, yet clean and air conditioned. If you don't travel outside the USA please be advised that hotels in Rome are small (like B&Bs) and sometimes hard to find. The daily breakfast buffet, which is included in the price, was also pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located Home Base for Rome Adventures”
Reviews.Author: Stretch2m
Reviews.Content: Hotel and Room: The bi-lingual hotel staff was very helpful and gracious, answered all our questions, called taxis for us when needed, and were very efficient and responsive. The room was larger than we had ever hoped for in Rome -- particularly the bathroom, which was almost as big as the bedroom (although, ironically, the shower was so small you could hardly turn around in it -- but we're not complaining). Maid service was quick and thorough. Room has a safe and a locking wardrobe if needed. The room also had a comfortable bed, and a work desk for those who need it. Internet access on the computer in the lobby was convenient and resonably priced (3 euros for 30 minutes). Location: The location was unbeatable. You're close enough that you can get to all the points of interest, but you're not so close that you're surrounded by mobs of tourists (such as hotels next to the Trevi Fountain, for example). It feels like an apartment in a residential neighborhood, which was perfect for us. Fantini around the corner in Piazza Esquilino has good cappuccino and paninis, and the proprietors are very friendly and helpful. On Via Urbana, walking distance from the hotel, there are a couple really good restaurants: Taverna Urbana, and Non c'e Trippa pe' Gatti. Non c'e Trippa pe' Gatti, in particular, served up the best meals we had in all of Rome, in a totally non-pretentious, down-to-earth, mom-and-pop atmosphere. And just to prove how helpful and professional the hotel staff is ... after we checked out and were walking into the airport, I discovered that I had left my wallet in the taxi! I called the hotel (since they were the ones who called the taxi for us) and asked if there was any way they could get a hold of the taxi driver. (I wish I could remember the man's name, so I'll just call him Mr. Raffaello.) Mr. Raffaello said he would contact the taxi service right away and ask them to contact the driver, and that he would call me back afterwards. True to his word, he called back within 5 minutes, to let me know that the taxi was on its way back to the airport. Furthermore, he called again after 20 minutes just to make sure everything worked out ok. VERY IMPRESSIVE SERVICE, especially since we were no longer guests at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: BriGuy69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Oct 3-5 and then again on the the 10th. The location is perfect as it was only a 10 minute walk from the Roma Termini to the hotel. Be advised that there are cobblestone sidewalks along the way and the main road is a moderate hill, so if you are older or have a lot of luggage, then a taxi may be a better bet (~ 5 euro). The hotel is spotless and is very central to some great restaurants and cheap grocery marts where you can pick up inexpensive water, snacks, etc. We had room 506, which is a standard twin room, but had a large 15'x15' open verandah with a bistro table/ chairs and beautiful views (unexpected surprise!). I think room 502 (which was across the hall) had the same perk. The shower is as small as other reviewers mentioned, and the hotel elevator is only marginally larger, but that adds to the charm. Wi-fi access is available in the lobby at a cost of 5 euro for 2 hours or 10 euro for 6 hours. Breakfast was excellent and varied - we rarely had to eat lunch as we powered up in the morning. We took the metro a couple of times, but otherwise, you can walk to most points of interest (Colloseum, Roman Forum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain). We did grab the metro from the Cavor station to go to the Vatican, but that was to help save energy for our 4 hour tour. An excellent hotel offering good value and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Raffaello....is clean, comfortable and ideally situated hotel to stay in while you explore Rome Rome.”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTaWanda
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, quiet ideally located hotel in a working class neighborhood of Rome.The breakfast included in your room rate is a big plus. I suggest buying a 2 day pass for the tour buses that will take you to all the main sites...with an on/off option. That is an excellent way to become familiar with the city. The tour bus has a stop two blocks from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but watch your purse.”
Reviews.Author: GlennR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello for three nights. The hotel is in a safe area and within walking distance to the Colosseum and the Termini. The rooms were very clean but the shower was incredibly small. If you are over 6 foot you probably won't fit. Personnel at the desk were very friendly and helpful with all our questions, directions, and requests for taxi service. Breakfast was excellent, the best we had during our 12 day travels throughout Italy, and included scrambled eggs daily. One day, however, a lady had her purse stolen while at the breakfast buffet. Someone must have come in from the outside, blended in with the crowd, and made off with the purse. If I return to Italy I would try to stay nearer the Campo de Fiori area for the night life and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: vbfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Raffaello in September this year. The hotel is very well situated, close to all of the major sights on a quiet, easy to find side street. The hotel is quaint, the staff including the cleaning/maintenance people were all very friendly and always helpful and our room was extremely well maintained and clean. A major plus for me was the airconditioning which worked very well and was a necessity. I left behind some clothes (we were rushing to catch a flight to Berlin after a very late night with much wine) and the staff were kind enough to send me the items when I returned home. I cannot compliment the hotel/staff enough and I definitely will return. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “fine friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: john_whit
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we wanted a comfortable place to stay within easy walking distance of the sights (Colleseum forum etc). The staff were welcoming and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and clean, breakfast was generous and tasty. If i had one comment the Bath rooms were small. I have already recommended this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay at the same hotel?”
Reviews.Author: sammi29
Reviews.Content: We ended our 16 day Italy trip in Rome after booking all our other hotels based on Trip advisor reviews - with fantastic results. We were extremely surprised by this hotel. While it's close to the railstation it was not centrally located for anything else. The hotel lobby smelled moldy and was threadbare. Rooms were nice enough except, as previous reviewers noted, small bathroom/shower stall. We had horrible service - wake up calls forgotten, misinformation on sites, etc. The breakfast served a horrifying glop of uncooked scrambled eggs that was scary to look at, let alone eat. The rest of the breakfast was uninspiring. Upon checkout they tried to bill us for internet charges we didn't even use. For the rate being charged, this was a disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, four stars!”
Reviews.Author: Muldoon56
Reviews.Content: We are a married couple from rural Michigan in our mid 50'sand this was our first trip to Rome. After reading many reviews on Trip Advisor we were sold on the Raffello based on the reviews. It was...as everyone had said, excellent. We arrived by train from Cinque Terre at the Termini train station and the hotel was about a 10 minute walk. The staff spoke excellent English and was very helpful with any questions we had. This hotel is either fairly new or compleley redone and in either case its very nicely decorated. The room was spacious and comfortable, air conditioned and with its own bathroom. The showers in Europe are small but adeqaute unless your a very big person, anyway this shower also had Jacuzzi jets. The bed was comfortable and we slept well each night. It has a flat screen wall mounted TV with many stations, however only two are in English. There is wireless internet available and also a computer in the lobby to use for a small fee. Breakfast was included and it is excellent with many items to choose from along with lots of coffee, American style. A block away is one of the four major Basillica's where we attended Sunday mass. It's an easy walk to the Coluseum, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps to name a few. Many fine restaurants, shops etc are also close by. There is a nice grocery store down the street on Via Cavour where snacks and bottled water are much cheaper then the shops. You can catch the Hop On/ Hop Off tour bus a block away and Termini station is also the Metro stop which you need for the Vatican. The Raffello isn't cheap, we paid roughly $1200 for four nights but it's close proximity to all the attractions makes it worth it and you feel safe at night when walking back to the hotel. The front desk staff is so nice and very helpful, be sure to seek their advice for dining and other inquiries, they know the town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (close to Termini and most sites) and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rkalish12
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Raffaello Hotel for a post-cruise weekend in Rome. I choose this hotel due to their high TripAdvisor rating, price and proximity to the Termini train station. It was my second trip to Rome and am very happy that we stayed here. It was about a 10 minute walk (with suitcases) from the Termini and close to the Ancient Rome sites, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc. The Vatican is about a 30 minute walk - though you can also take the Metro (train), bus, taxi, etc. The service was extremely good (for this price range) and the breakfast was excellent (never had scrambled eggs offered as part of a European breakfast). Our room wasn't ready when we arrived (about 10am) so they held our bags so that we could began exploring the sites. When we returned to the hotel about 4pm, I was pleasantly surprised that the staff had placed our [very heavy] bags in the room! The room was a nice size, very clean, well decorated and furnished. The bathroom was large, modern and bright. The only downside was the Jacuzzi shower was relatively small (don't drop the soap).. I'd highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Start to Our Hunnymoon”
Reviews.Author: Minnesota_Traveler09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello Hotel for 4 nights. From the moment we got there we were very impressed. From the check in process to the breakfast every morning, everything was handled very professionally and with great customer service. The hotel was very well situated to everything you would want to do. It was an easy 10 min walk to the coliseum and ruins. It was about another 10 min walk to the Parthenon, Spanish steps, and the Trevi fountain. As everyone recommends room 502, the front desk laughingly said they are going to start rotating room numbers so everyone can see how nice the other rooms are. We stayed in room 508 and it was a very nice room. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel and enjoying all the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillyFogGibraltar
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a good location - well within walking distance to all main sites. Hotel is perfect for spending a couple of days in Rome - they have family rooms which are perfect for families. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast good. Echo other comments that bathroom layout could be better (shower small) - however the bathroom is the least place you will spend time in when in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! could not praise it enough!”
Reviews.Author: Lynch8
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start... 1st of all Francesco could not have done enough for us, very pleasant and helpful. the room was lovely, i would say four star standard, spacious, airconditioned and very comfortable. great location for the station and in walking distance to all main attractions. I also cannot recommend enough taking up the offer to use the roof terrace of their sister hotel, it is beautiful, with amazing views of pantheon and very reasonable priced drinks! all in all Hotel Raffaello is a gem of a hotel in Rome, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice things come in small packages!”
Reviews.Author: PebblesSky
Reviews.Content: Only got to stay in this hotel for 1 night as our visit to Rome was brief and we only arrived at midnight after having a long day travelling from the Padre Pio Shrine in Rotonda. The staff were friendly and helpful with good english. Our room was perfect and exceeded my expectations as its only rated a 3 star hotel. Great air conditioning, nice shower with jets, we had a family room which consisted of 2 single beds & a double bed in a seperate room, great rate at €145. Nice breakfast the following morning with plenty to choose from. As we were not travelling home till evening time the hotel held onto our bags for us while we got to see some of Rome. I will be back & hope to stay at this nice freindly hotel. Only minor thing I felt was that you had to pay for wifi or use of there PC which is usually free when you are a hotel guest. Wifi €5/2 hrs, PC €3/half hour. Oh and no bar!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: ShellyAus
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on Trip Advisor. Given 3 star rating and reasonable price, was surprised so highly rated. Well the experience is every bit as good as the rating. Fantastic location. Fantastic customer service. Fantastic rooms. Spotless throughout. Highly recommended. Will keep this review brief as quite honestly nothing further to add. I can't even think of anything completely minor and insignificant that needs improving. Oh, maybe the tiny elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Position was brilliant, staff very accommodating, clean, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jpbKent
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very accommodating to our every need. The reception staff were very helpful with all our requests. The staff in the breakfast room were also quick and efficient. Breakfast was good. Position of hotel in walking distance of all main attractions or near metro and bus routes. Air conditioning worked very well but room quite dark because of decorations. Everything was spotless and clean and definitely would stay at the hotel when next in Rome. Eating out easy as hotel only serves breakfast and TV only has news channel in English.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenG_9
Reviews.Content: I have just recently returned from a five day trip to Rome and had the pleasure of staying in Hotel Rafaello. This is a comfortable, clean hotel in a fairly good location. The rooms are small but the airconditioning is good ( a necessity in Aug ). The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the collesseum in one direction and termini train station in the other. A good continental breakfast is provided in the morning and there are plenty of good little resturants nearby. I had read a lot about this area of Rome being unsafe but i never felt uncomfortable or afraid at any time, even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews were right-Great place”
Reviews.Author: igsmark
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor was a wonderful tool to use to find the gem of a hotel in Hotel Raffaello.We arrived on June 22 early ,staff stored our luggage so we could venture out into Rome. Start your trip in Rome by using the Hop on /Hop off bus,great way to orient your group to the excellent views of this beautiful city.Hotel Raffaello exceeded all of our expectations-Comfortable room,excellent breakfast,clean location,and a very helpful staff. Besides being close to most of the major attractions-20 min walk to most- or use the Metro [ A line was used by our group most] If planning a trip to the Vatican,do so early on in the week,aviod the long long lines on the weekends. Take time to walk around the area surrounding Hotel Raffaello to discover some wonderful stores and tasty restaurants. Our group of eight enjoyed every restaurant, meals were inexpensive,house wine tasty,and you would tend to eat with the locals if you went after 8:00. Just up the street to the right was one of the oldest churches in Rome, you will recongize this due to the fact it is 16 ft below steet level.take time to explore it ,the gentleman there will be glad to show it. Rome's beauty is everywhere,Hotel Raffaello just made it easy to see. Start your day with a wonderful breakfast-fresh eggs,pastries,fruit,and what made our trip -american coffee. My wife and I are already looking forward to staying at Hotel Raffaello on our next trip to Rome, hopefully in spring of 2010. Learn all you can about Metro, Hop on/Hop off bus, local bus lines and most of all - Take time just to sit at streetside cafe with your loved one and watch the world go by!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, very friendly, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: roqn
Reviews.Content: We booked the room in advance online. The staff were immediately very helpful and communicative. Per other reviews, we requested a room with a terrace. They said that they couldn't promise, but would try. We assumed that was a polite "no". We were pleasantly surprised upon arrival to find that they had done what they could and had gotten us the terrace, which was wonderful. Not exactly majestic views, but very pleasant, and it's fantastic to enjoy a beverage or a gelato on a warm summer night, stargazing. Anyway, nice large room, with a very spacious and modern bathroom (especially by EU standards.) Total blackout curtains, very effective A/C. Great. Breakfast was included, and offered a nice selection of the usual EU buffet (yogurts, cereals, breads, pastries, fruit, cold cuts, juices, etc.) Tea and coffee service as well. The hotel is quite close to several good restaurants, and even more exciting for us, a very good gelato place. We sampled several of the local restaurants and all were at least decent, some quite good. The hotel is walking distance to the train station, which was great for us. It is also fairly well situated for touring Rome, although there are more centralized locations. The front desk staff was always present and always friendly and helpful. Internet was not included, but was available downstairs for some fee. I really wish hotels would simply include internet access. I know it's a small profit center, but it seems to be rather petty nickel-and-dime. Hotels in Rome are generally not super cheap unless pretty crappy. This one is nice and a good value. They are definitely at the top of the 3 star range. A very pleasant stay in a clean, well run hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: miladiva
Reviews.Content: When researching our trip around Italy we went to great lengths to book this hotel based on the reviews from trip advisor, as well as our travel company. I am so pleased that we did. The hotel was lovely, with a great location,and the rooms were nice - not 5 star, but definitely a good 4 star standard. Breakfast was lovely I would recommend Raffaello hotel to anybody,and although not the cheapest, is well worth paying for the quality that you get here. Well be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rdgeverton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location that allows you to explore the main sights of Rome on foot. Trevi Fountain 10-15mins, Spanish Steps 20-25mins, Piazza Navona 30mins, Pantheon 20mins, Colloseum/Forum 10-15mins. It is only the Vatican which really needs the Metro (Repubblica or Termini Metro 10 mins). If arriving at Termini station the hotel is 10 mins away (head for Santa Maria Maggiore Church). Walking avoids the circa 25 euro taxi fare. The nearest Metro stop is also a 10 min walk. Hotel is very clean with great rooms & very clean bathrooms. Stayed in a family room which has separate room for us plus adjoining room with 2 single beds for kids - so some privacy! Staff are very welcoming & helpful. Breakfast is good & really sets you up for the day. There is also a bus stop 50 yards from the hotel (71 or 117) which will drop you around the Trevi Fountain area. Otherwise many options from the Piazza by the Santa Maria church. If going to the Colloseum so early to avoid long queues. Also if you have kids under 18 take some ID to prove you are European Citizens & avoid entry fee of 12 euros for the kids. It visiting Vatican Museums then suggest you book on line & accept the additional booking fee costs to avoid queues that were around 200 metres long!! Entrance to St Peters is free if you do not want to do the museums albeit there is a 5 euro charge to climb the 521 steps to the top. 7 euros if you want to take the lift & only climb 320 steps! However, views from the top are stunning. Hotel also gives you access to their sister hotel which has a great roof top bar overlooking the Pantheon & Piazza below. Hotel can also arrange taxi back to the airport. 44 euros for standard taxi or 58 euros if you need a van (lotos of luugage!). Given the train far is circa 12 euros each a much more stress free option. Overall a great stay in Rome due to the excellent location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the historica centre”
Reviews.Author: vpzone
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the hotel around 11am, the staff was kind enough to make a room ready for us, although the official check-in was at 12:00. The room had some strange smell, similar to chlorine - guess it was used to clean the bathroom or the carpet. I asked if we could take another one and the receptionist made it in no time, good service! Rooms were nicely decorated, with spacy and clean bathroom. Breakfast was good, although if I had a fried egg, I would call it wonderful! We rented a scooter, so getting to main attractions was a matter of minutes and there was a parking place for scooter in front of the hotel. Well, I would definitely not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends and sure will stay there again when I get back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: gardendesigngirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I discovered Hotel Raffaello two years ago on our first trip to Italy. We enjoyed our stay so much then we decided to return again to Rome with our two teenage sons. Once again we enjoyed a very comfortable stay at Hotel Raffaello. Massimo and Francesca at the front desk were more than patient, kind and accommodating. They suggested restaurants, sites and were able to book tickets for us as well. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the breakfast service was excellent. The location is within walking distance to all major tourist sites. A little further to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain but we really enjoyed getting away from the main tourist traps at the end of the day. We hope to return someday to Rome and if we do we would stay once again at Hotel Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “A great friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Judo79
Reviews.Content: We picked Hotel Raffaello after reading lots of great reviews. We even emailed the hotel and asked if we could have room 502 after hearing it was so great. And yes we got it! It was a great hotel room, large and airy, with a large terrace! The bathroom was very big and clean. Breakfast was good and the staff were very helpful. We enjoyed it so much we went back for a night after our week in Sorrento. Different room this time (214) but still a decent size and very comfortable. Only thing they could really improve on is the lack of english channels!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Sox-Fam-of-Four
Reviews.Content: An excellent stay ! From making the reservation to checkout the Hotel Raffaello was a great experience. Many of the Trip Advisor posts were very helpful to us in making our decision to book this hotel, and we were not disappointed. We are a family of 4 (with two teens 15 & 13 ) and stayed in one of the quad rooms (3 nights in July 2009). Plenty of room for all of us – the larger bed for 2 was in a separate room with its own TV and AC. The staff is what the made the experience memorable. Massimo was very welcoming and provided good recommendations for restaurants and how to best see the sights of Rome. His other front desk colleagues and the breakfast room attendants were also helpful and friendly (all spoke English). Angela was very informative and helped with our reservation (all via e-mail). Off Via Cavor, the hotel was situated in a good spot to start the tour of ancient Rome (see Rick Steve’s Caser Shuffle) at the Coliseum & Forum. Short taxi rides were reasonable from any part of the city and the Merto & Termini station were close by. We were able to leave our bags with the hotel after check-out and were able to enjoy one last tour of the city before departing to the airport. The Hotel Raffaello was a very good choice and we would certainly stay there again and would recommend it to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of desk clerk taxi scam”
Reviews.Author: htownmv
Reviews.Content: I concur with other reviewers that this hotel is well located, has a very nice breakfast and nice rooms with good AC. All was well until we were leaving to take a prearranged van to our cruise ship. We had a picnic lunch in the breakfast area and when we finished, the desk clerk said our taxi was here early if we were ready. We said, "Sure," and hopped in. Trouble was it wasn't our prearranged cab and it wasn't nearly as nice as the one we were supposed to take. Undoubtedly the clerk got a kickback for doing this. Buyer beware. By the way, the prearranged taxi was from Romecabs and we used them 2 more times after this--they are very professional with nice new vehicles.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, centrally located at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: SummerTraveller09
Reviews.Content: My friend and I found this hotel near the historic district in Rome to be just charming! Rome was the last stop on our 16 day, personally planned, trip to Italy and we both agreed this was one of our favorite hotels. We chose to stay at medium-priced hotels in Italy and found Hotel Raffaello to be the best value for the price. The room was lovely with a spacious, modern bathroom(small, but adequate shower)and they served a great hot/cold breakfast. All staff were very helpful and spoke English. The hotel was within walking distance to the Metro, Forum, Colesseum and several piazzas, which were hubs for dining, night life, music/art and fun. Make sure to take time to stroll the streets around the piazzas.....just charming. I'd recommend this hotel for singles, families, business people ...anyone who is looking for a lovely setting in a centrally located, well-run hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: nanana
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raffaello is very well located, has a great breakfast... and a very small shower!!!! We had a hard time to get use to the shower. The room was great - we had a second floor room, the one with the cute balcony that you see on the hotel's facade. The location was great within walk distance from many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on trip”
Reviews.Author: meljord
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello is the oasis you need when you finally complete your long international plane flight and train trip from the airport. Thankyou to Trip Advisor for the recommendation! We arrived around 9.00am after the 10minute walk from the main Rome Termini which was prior to our room being ready. The friendly desk clerk stored our bags and suggested we went and had some breakfast even though we had not even checked in. The Raffaello offers the friendliest and best breakfast in Italy with freshly cooked toast and coffee served with a smile. The room for our first 2 night stay was clean and comfortable though the shower cubicle a "little tight", though we scored without any special requests the top-floor room with the large bathroom and roof-top balcony on our return before flying out. The Hotel is not the cheapest and like most Hotels each staff member is slightly different in their approach, but the Raffaello has several "gems" on staff that make the ones total stay enjoyable. All speak fluent english and assisted with all our enquiries. The Hotel location is perfect being close to major tourist sites, in a quiet though enchanting lane that leads down to a range of great outdoor eating options.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in so many ways!”
Reviews.Author: PeterHwdCA
Reviews.Content: This was one of our best hotels in Italy! It's very plush and elegant in an old world sort of way. The room was a nice size, and the bathroom seemed newly renovated. The staff was very pleasant and helpful with directions and logistics. Although the immediate block or two seems a bit dicey, the greater neighborhood has lots of character and little shops.
