The Forum and Coliseum and many other sights are very walkable from the hotel. Breakfast was bountiful, with a flawless wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheeks626
Reviews.Content: Location is good and very kind staff. Room is very clean. So, I can recommend to stay in this hotel for personal travel. It would fit family trip. If I say something improvement, it may be variaty of breakfast. But for me, it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SOKESCO
Reviews.Content: Well located, close to the Termini and etro stations. Friendly and very helpful staff. Bedroom very clean and nice. Too bad there was no free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: JohanBo
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night but it was by far the best hotel we had. Good location with a quiet street outside. We had a room towards Via Urbana and wasn't really disturbed by any traffic except that they emptied the dust bins early in the morning. We are however light-sleepers (with a child that has problems to sleep). Friendly and helpful staff. Great rooms. Only downside was the minimalistic elevator that just could fit our stroller. The elevator also only stopped between floors so you always have to carry bags and stuff half a floor. The was however a piccolo helping us and he didn't even bother to stay for a tip. Great breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: momtripToronto
Reviews.Content: Great location, 10 min walk to Termini, Forum & Coloseum. We walked to Quirinal, Trevi, Pza.Venetia, Capitolium, via del Corso, etc. Took the bus to Vatican and Borghese. Great quad room, excellent breakfast & service. Staff very nice, we booked the hotel car to go to Fiumicino and James was a great guide & driver. Loved Rome, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay, central and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SeabreezeSiena
Reviews.Content: We'd recommend the Raffaello to anyone. It's within walking distance of the station, between 5 and 10 mins. It's a very well presented hotel, beautiful rooms, extremely helpful staff, very clean, comfortable bed, impeccable bathroom, quiet and they do a fabulous breakfast. If you're flying through Rome (as we were), you can walk south to the Colosseum and the Forum, then across to the Wedding Cake, down to the river, up to St Peter's and then back towards the hotel via the Spanish Steps and the Trevi at night. This hotel offers you a nice bit of luxury in Rome - recommended+++

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaSTL
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel and the location was great. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful- recommended one of the best meals we had- Tritone! We could walk to the Colleseum- Roman Forum area but weren't in the middle of all the craziness of the city, so it was nice because you could get away from it all at night. They are located in a limited traffic area so if you decided to drive- make sure you let them know so that they can make a note of it so you don't get a ticket. Also, our shower was extremely small so if you happen to be a little big boned- make sure to make a request of a larger shower/bath tub so that you are comfortable as you shower.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: nycjones
Reviews.Content: we booked this trip on a whim and speaking no italian were nervous as to how we'd be treated. the front desk couldn't have been more lovely. we did say hello/thank you in italian and learned how to say the room number the first day. breakfast is a typical european b&b style, nothing great. i asked for one of the terraced rooms on the 5th floor (same price) when booking and was pleased to get it. it was a fantastic bonus and i highly recommend doing it. easily accessible to termini, the coliseum/forum. most other sights are walking distance or a 10/15euro cab ride. no complaints and would happily stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located.”
Reviews.Author: HildaMiami
Reviews.Content: Worth the price. Breakfast is excellent and staff is very very nice. We deffinitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Fan_120207
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here earlier this month. My husband and I had a room on the top floor with a terrace and view of the local street. No views of the city, however, we were only in our room to sleep. Our views were obtained from our sight seeing. My daughter and her husband had a smaller room on the floor below us. The hotel was clean, well staffed and had a great breakfast buffet including scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage. It was one of few places we stayed with air conditioning. The location was convenient for trains, buses and walking to many tourist sights. I can't comment on the price because it was included with our airfare through Expedia. I was pleasantly surprised with the location, cleanliness and size of our room and bath. Don't expect soft mattresses or heavy weighted towels at any Italian hotel. All beds were very firm and towels thin. The thin towels were great for drying quickly anywhere that did not have airconditioning. Via Urbana is not a main thoroughfare, however, we walked to the hotel at night and never had any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Raffaello, we will return”
Reviews.Author: BevBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to be on the top floor and had a fabulous balcony. Very, very comforatable king size bed, nice spacious room and very nice breakfast, On the whole, this was a fabulous hotel and I would return. Only thing missing was the kettle for tea/coffee and my only negative comment would be the horrible thin towels.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Carlow68
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in the Hotel Raffaello in June. It was an absolute pleasure from the time we were checked in by Angelo until our departure. We had been conned by a taxi driver out of €90 for a €10 fare and of course were upset upon arrival. But Angelo was fabulous and we stayed in the room with the balcony, which was a great size. We were there to get engaged and as I had mentioned that to Angelo, within ten minutes of getting into our room a bottle of champagne was delivered up to us. The staff are absolutely lovely and I will recommend this hotel to anyone I know travelling to Rome. We hated to leave. To all of the staff in Hotel Raffaello, thank you for your kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Very Clean. Hotel Staff Friendly and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: magsandmaths
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel late may/ early june. We booked two rooms (One Twin & One Double). Both rooms were clean and well presented. The rooms had everything we needed. The hotel was excellent and have no complaints bar the beds being a little too firm. Breakfast was excellent, with warm friendly staff. I would definately recommend a stay.

Reviews.Title: “If the hotel could be transplanted to a location with a view, it would be perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jone2008
Reviews.Content: We had a 15 minute walk from the termini to the hotel with luggage. Though early, we were given a room almost immediately by the friendly staff. The room was clean and roomy enough, but there are few extras. The hotel seems a little back alley, but safe enough, quiet, and very close to all attractions and the metro. Could not ask for more when considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as we expected”
Reviews.Author: keto99
Reviews.Content: For the high rating we we a bit disappointed. The staff were a bit unpredictable. Of the 3 clerks one was exceptional, one was helpful, and one was a bit rude and even ignored us on 2 different occasions. The hotel and rooms were very clean and comfortable. Our main problem though was the shower. It was some type of fancy Jacuzzi shower, the problem was the size. You could barely turn around in it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel with wonderful location & staff”
Reviews.Author: Maccas9
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a Hotel is Raffaello. My wife and I on our first trip to Rome wanted somewhere close to all sights and we certainly (with the help of Trip advisor) selected the right one. As suggested we requested one of the top floor rooms with a terrace and were lucky to be given Room 503. Huge, spotlessly clean and with our very own garden terrace. Very comfortable bed and lots of wardrobe space. Large clean bathroom. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the friendly staff right through from reception to breakfast staff and room cleaners. Breakfast was extremely good. Our days were spent walking Rome and returning late afternoon for drinks and nibbles on our terrace before heading out of a night. We will be returning to this hotel without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: pdise
Reviews.Content: Second Stay at Hotel Raffaello. Booked two rooms. Stayed one night prior to flying home. The Hotel is within walking distance of Termini and Coliseum. Walking to other Sights such as Trevi Fountain possible but a little long. Regardless, easy transportation to all sights. Most importantly, hotel provided excellent service. Manager was very accomodating in correcting for an error I made in booking dates. Bathroom in one room was a little tight. But it was clean and functional. Would definitely recommend hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Judith N
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have picked a better hotel. The staff were all so helpful and kind. As this was my first trip to Rome and I was alone they all made me feel a home. They would even get me a coffee before the breakfast was ready. That was so appreciated. When I had questions or needed directions they were always very courteous. I asked alot of questions!!! If I ever get back to Rome I wouldn't stay any where else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: erika1173
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and the neighbourhoud too. The cleanest hotel I have ever seen and very cosy. Breakfast very much ok.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Handyman1037
Reviews.Content: I had selected this hotel as a result of previous reviews I had seen. It lived up to all of our expections. The location was excellent. Close to the Santa Maria Maggiore, Colosium, Roman Forum, opera house, supermarket and train station. The staff was excellent with speical graditude to Massimo and Franchesca. Eveything about this hotel was excellent. Quite neighborhood, well appointed rooms. Don't look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, good value and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Clooneymore
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located close to the train station, but away from the crowds. The public area was very comfortable. The room was clean and very quiet. The staff were very helpful and recommended three excellent restaurants. The breakfast buffet was well presented and had a good choice of items. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A good place for Italian standards”
Reviews.Author: CanarioViajero
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, in an area close to Termini station, but away from the "grimmy" part of Termini, with cool bars and restaurants close by. The rooms are typically Italian, with big curtains, lots of golden decor, and new bathrooms (with Jacuzzi showers!). Ask for a room on the top floors, although note that only two rooms have a terrace (therefore, it will be very difficult to get a room with one!). Breakfast is normal, with anything you would expect (some fresh fruits--although there could be more variety, yoghourts, cereals, etc.). However, after two days, you can get tired of breakfast served at the hotel. One negative point is (i) that you have to pay to be able to use internet, which is not standard nowadays; and (ii) the service could be better, as the hotel receptionists did not know (or did not want) to give any advise on restaurants (arguing that there are so many, that there must be a good one somewhere). Therefore, service could definately be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest people in Italy”
Reviews.Author: cfrankli
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very clean by American standards. A little expensive, but we were there during the Soccer finals between Barcelona and Manchester U and everywhere was full. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The location is a bit out of the way of the sights, but close to the train station

Reviews.Title: “Close to Trains and Transit, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tyrolia-Joe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2009, my wife, her sister and I rented a room, twice, once when arriving at Rome and again the night before departure back to Canada. On both occasions the hotel and staff met or exceeded my expectations. I have been to Italy 5 times and stayed in numerous 3, 4 and 5 star hotels as well as rental homes and B&Bs. Hotel Raffaello is a 3 star that I'd say was one of the better ones I've stayed in. The staff during the day and late at night were all very considerate helping with directions to sites, suggestions about when to go, where to eat etc. When it was time to leave for home and I had issues with the on-line check-in at my airline website due to a printer problem the night clerk handled our on-line check-in and printed our boarding passes without the need for me to by an internet access card; very helpful. The breakfast was good, typical European fair which is to my liking, one can have extra cappuccini or espresso no problem. Even though we are tourist and obviously English speakers I like to practice my Italian at every opportunity; this hotel's staff was very patient and helpful and spoke Italian to me until I ran into a problem then switched to English. For me that shows that the staff, at least for me, are interested in giving me the experience I was looking for rather than just room and board. The location is OK. To walk to the Colosseum will take about 15 minutes, to walk to Trevi Fountian, Pantheon or Piazza Navona would take about 35 - 40 minutes, its a bit of a hike. It is about a 10 minute walk from the train station and bus terminal. Walking down Via Urbana away from the train station will get you to the Urbana Metro, Via Urbana is a Roman side street and not well lit or traveled at night, this may put off some people but was fine for us and we never felt there was an issue with safety. There are numerous buses that stop close to the hotel on both Via Cavour and Via Nazionalle (pardon the spelling) but you will still need to walk in a block or so. One interesting point, the hotel offered us a taxi pick-up at the airport for 65 Euro for 3 people plus baggage on arrival, we caught the train in from the airport. We had an early flight out and elected to go for a cab, the driver , a nice old Italian gentleman only charged us 48 Euro. Considering that the train tickets into the Termini from the Airport are 12 Euro each I thought the driver was more than fair. As a bonus he showed us some major , but lesser visited sites for us to see when we go back to Rome. We all threw our coins in the fountain so we should be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Who could want for more?”
Reviews.Author: joebev42
Reviews.Content: Because of a mistake on my part, I had to cancel the day of our arrival at the last minute. After explaining my problem they took car of the change without charges. We cannot rave enough about the service from the front desk staff and the wonderful treatment by the two women in the breakfast room. The rooms were roomy and beyond clean. We think this is a hidden gem in Rome. Joe & Bev Wood Macungie PA

Reviews.Title: “For a small hotel, the service was excellent and room was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jupotty
Reviews.Content: Being a first time European traveler, I didn't know what to expect of a Rome hotel. Nevertheless, the Raffaelo was better than I expected. Comfortable and elegantly appointed. The continental breakfast was excellent and the front desk staff was helpful and attentive. A little off the beaten path but close to central Rome attractions and public transportation. Short cab ride to anywhere in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ciao Roma”
Reviews.Author: Freedom49
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 wonderful days in beautiful Rome at the Raffaello, at the end of a fabulous month of travelling in Europe. The Raffaello was a little gem at the end of our journey. Location was great - around the corner from Santa Maria Maggiore, and a ten minute walk to the Colleseum - we walked everywhere, including the Vatican. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were all most accomodating and always helpful, with a smile. We were welcomed and farewelled every time we went in or out. The bottle of complimentary champagne and nibbles to celebrate our birthdays was a very special touch. We look forward to returning to Rome and staying at the Raffaello again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and close to the Coliseum”
Reviews.Author: JOB314
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel. A little pricey, but that is all of Rome. The rooms were nice, we had a balcony onto the street and that was really nice, it allowed you to people watch when you wanted to just relax a little in your room. The hotel was quite close to the Coliseum about a 10 minute walk, and we had no trouble getting to anywhere from there. It was also quite close to the metro stations that you take to the Vatican and other sights. We had a great time, the area felt safe, and there were a lot of little cafes and restaurants near by. PLUS, when we arrived, we got a bottle of Champagne delivered to our room compliments of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “claustrophobic rooms! smallest room ever seen in this price range!”
Reviews.Author: Viggiatorpediniere
Reviews.Content: Hotel position is fine, staff is ok, breakfast quite poor, but the rooms are extra-small! The bed in my room was an obstacle for the door to open, then i had 20-30 cm to the wall and even furnitures in the corner to cross for the toilet... I paid an average of 120 euros per night which i consider a real steal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value..wish we had the time to stay longer.”
Reviews.Author: chrisrob
Reviews.Content: Raffaello Hotel definitely enhanced our visit to Rome. Just a short walk from the terminal, no problems lugging our duffel bags. Clean, neat room with a great bed and a/c was just the ticket after a day taking in the sights. The water jet shower was also quite relaxing before bed. The hotel staff were very friendly and added to the experience. Raffaello really was a great starting point for our excursions. We had no problems going to all the sights on foot. After their excellent breakfast I probably needed to jog to all the sights but instead I just overindulged on the eggs, ham, salami, cheese, pastries and cereals. Good restaurants, bars and markets within a stones throw. Rome can be expensive enough, I personally feel we got lucky when we found this great value.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: naiviv1071
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really not in a nice location at all. We only stayed one night so we did not have time to explore too much. I went out to look for an atm and had to walk a long way before I found one (two or three blocks from the hotel). On the way I did not really like the area too much. There were a few drunks laying on the street and just walking about. Not a place to be walking around at night for sure. We also had lunch and dinner and two different restaurants near by. I was not impressed with the food either. I have to admit the staff at the hotel is very nice, they all spoke english and were extremely helpful. The breakfast served in the morning was plenty and I had no complaints, I just cannot recommend this hotel if you are looking to be within walking distance from the main attractions in Rome, or at least in a nice area were you can take a nice stroll. This is not the place to stay. It is very close to the train station, but you still would need a taxi because the streets are very difficult to walk with your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Champion Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vincenzo97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Raffaello, and I can certainly recommend it amongst others. We were 4 adults booked into the family room, 2 tv's, good size bathroom (with jacuzzi/2 shower heads) and safe. The overall size of the room was excellent. Centrally located e.g 15 min walk to Via del Corso. Hotel staff are so friendly, they even sent up a bottle of complimentary bottle of Prosecco. I will stay here again that's for sure, oh and the breakfast was delicious, scrambled eggs, cakes, fruit cereal etc. Forza Raffello!! C

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: jimboelrod
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel at 10 a.m., we knew this would be a good experience. The gentleman at the front desk made us feel at home right away - he gave us a room that had already been cleaned on the top floor and we even had our own little balcony. The room was supposed to be a little smaller than the regular rooms but we found it more than enough - certainly by the standards of major U.S cities. It was exceptionally clean. And the biggest bonus was the breakfast include in the room price - and if you didn't leave full and satisfied then shame on you. If you eat in Rome then you know what a savings this is and a great start to your day. I can't say enough about it and the price was excellent. There are several good yet inexpensive resturants in the small streets of thearea and the staff will gladly point them out. We were very very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for visit in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DutchFamilyHetGooi
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nicely situated near St. Maria Magiore. Just in between Statione Termini and Colloseum. A good walk from the hotel to all major sites in Rome. We stayed in the family room, with 4 beds. Nice room. Breakfast was great: all sorts of bread, meat, sweets, etc. Very polite and service dedicated staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, quiet, very good service”
Reviews.Author: tomMaryland
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, very good breakfast, very quiet. We had the top floor rooms for ourselves an another for teenagers. Slept very well. Large rooms even by US standards. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs very well.Comfortable,friendly,safe,clean and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Bear013
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to main train station.Internet access comes with a cost but was not too expensive.10 euro for 6 hours.Staff was friendly and helpful.Location to sites was great.Walking distance to all major sites except Vatcian(which could be walked to as well but a little far)but metro was very handy to go to Vatican.Hotel was very clean and breakfast was good and the area around had lots of restaurants and shops.Exellent choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, a real home from home”
Reviews.Author: Ros10
Reviews.Content: My mum and I spent 4 nights at the Hotel Rafaello, I had bought the trip as a surprise Christmas present for her so was anxious that she would enjoy the trip and the hotel. I needn't have worried everything was fabulous. From the moment we got there the reception staff were friendly and welcoming, the room was lovely, clean, smart and elegant. The only negative thing i can think to say is that the bidet was in an odd position meaning that you had to almost climb over it to use the toilet, a very small price to pay. The rooms were spotlessly clean and the maids always had a smile and a hello. The breakfasts were nice and the breakfast staff very friendly indeed and so efficient, even the man who I think was a sort of handyman, he was sweeping the front steps one afternoon, was wonderful, it was raining hard one evening and we wanted a hot drink so he went into the kitchen and brought a tray of coffee and hot milk to us in our room. I would definately stay in the hotel again, as would my mum. Rome is a beautiful city with so much to do and see, the Hotel Raffaello added very positively to our 5 day experience. Thank you very much to all at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: tacalderon
Reviews.Content: We have no complaints. Very nice rooms although the shower is a bit small. The furnishings are lovely and the lobby was very attractive. Not a bad location.

Reviews.Title: “Raffaello - What a Surprise”
Reviews.Author: greekirelander
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Raffaello from the 19th-22 April 2009. Arrived late on Sunday. If you were to guage the hotel from the street you may be a little apprenhensive about the hotel. However when you open the door all that goes away. A very inviting lobby and Angelo on the desk made check in simple and pain free. We stayed in room 104, very clean, well presented. Bathroom exceptionally clean and fresh. The room was made up everyday and fresh towels placed in the bathroom daily. Via Urbana where the hotel is situated runs parallel with the VIa Cavour, some of the surrounding building are tired, but do not let that put you off. The staff are extremely friendly and the breakfast(included in the price) was sumptuous. Only really fussy individuals would have any problem with it. Cloth table cloths, cloth napkins, very welcoming waitresses and the choice from fresh srambled eggs, cereals, fresh bread, crossiants, fruit, cake, cheeses, salamis etc etc. Very reasonably priced, not far from Termini Station, the Coliseum and the Palantine Hill. A good base for exploring Rome and its many delights. I would recommend this hotel for value, service, great staff

Reviews.Title: “So near to the Coliseum, Forum and Train Lines--great spot”
Reviews.Author: SLOCountyLocalDan
Reviews.Content: We truly had a great experience at the Raffaello Hotel in Rome near the Santa Maria Maggiore Bastilica. Although it is a 3 star hotel, the front desk staff, waiters, and other staff members treated us like royalty. They always made us feel welcome and did so with a smile....espcially Maximo and Angel. Just down the side street (Via Urbana) are many restaurants one of which was outstanding....La Carbonara. Andrea was our host, waiter, and best friend for the night....Cheers! to Andrea. This tip on restaurants was from Maximo. Great choice! We also dined at Tema ...a great choice for seafood, service, and Italian/local dinning. Excellent wine list at both....La Carbonara was established in 1906 and I know why. Our room was excellent--with a balcony....and chosen for our 14th year anniversary. Roses covered our balcony rail for the 3 nights we stayed, and we enjoyed our view sipping wine before heading out for the evening. Priceless..... :)

Reviews.Title: “Rome...what a great place to go.!”
Reviews.Author: Leedslad10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Rafaello and had a wonderful 4 night break. The rooms were clean, and kept that way everyday by the staff....everyone was friendly and spoke good English. The hotel could not have been better situated for the ancient part of the city being no more than 5 minutes walk to the Colloseum. Lots of no frills eateries around the area, with expensive ones if you want. We will definitely go to Rome again, and would have no qualms about staying at the Rafaello again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel. Exceeded expectations. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: dfo_scotland
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on Expedia reviews. I was not disappointed. We were given a 5th floor room with private terrace. This enhanced our stay. Room clean, staff friendly and efficient. Breakfast excellent. Just a 10 minute walk from either the main "Termini" railway station or the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, clean, pleasant & ideally situated - hard to improve on.”
Reviews.Author: mark11111
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Expedia and it lived up to or exceeded all our expectations. First it's an easy 5 min walk down the hill from Termini (Tube, bus & rail station) in a quiet street one block back from Via Cavour. We were greeted by name before we had reached the reception desk. We'd booked a family room (also very family friendly hotel -although we were the only family there) - this is actually 2 separate rooms with a shared shower room - all beautifully fitted out & spotlessly clean. TVs in each room. Breakfast is a superb buffet - cold meats, cheese, fruit, eggs (dressed/scrambled/boiled), breads, toast, tomatoes, and great pastries etc. - plenty to fill you up for a busy day. Loads of restaurants or pizzerias around within a few minutes walk - tried Tema (good but a bit pricey), Est,Est,Est (Pizza - good) but used the chicken/ pizza one round the corner on Via Cavour (Pollo Alto I think) - good food, good value, great atmosphere. Very family friendly. Ideally located - Coliseum 10-15 min. / Trevi 15 min. Forum 10-15 min. - we walked back from the Vatican - about 45 mins - all very easy. Basically I cannot fault this hotel & it's very reasonably priced for what you get - if we ever go back to Rome I'd not bother looking at anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - Great Staff - Great Breakfast - Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DD1215
Reviews.Content: This was a great find! he staff was amazingly helpful and courteous and spoke flawless English. The breakfast buffet was excellent and really set you off on a day of exploring on a full stomach. The hotel was very clean and charming. Do not be surprised by the size of the rooms, they are not American sized. We had a room for 3 and it was just fine. This is Rome - you are not going there to stay in the hotel room! The neighborhood is great -it's not so close to the train station that it seems slummy. We explored the streets around and found lots of great small boutiques and stores. It's a 15 -20 minute walk to the Coluseum.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: CaliKaren25
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed four nights at the Raffaello during March while visiting the sites in Rome and were very pleased. I chose the Raffaello after reading reviews on Trip Advisor as well as other sites and was not disappointed! We had a standard twin room on the 2nd floor and were quite impressed with the hotel's overall decor, service, cleanliness, and rooms. The room was a comfortable size, smartly decorated, bathroom sparkling, water pressure and temp great, and the common areas were very clean and inviting as well. The buffet breakfast was wonderful, plentiful and varied - served in a charming room with linen tablecloths, china dishes, and very attentive staff. After the first morning, they brought my coffee with hot milk and my daughter her pot of hot chocolate as soon as we sat down! The staff was wonderful in all situations - giving us directions, providing softer feather pillows, providing me with a personal tray of coffee in the morning while I checked e-mails. The location was very convenient to all sites and travel was easily accessed via metro or bus lines. As others have mentioned, the shower is small and would be difficult for a large person to use, but it worked great for us. Beds were comfortable, and we asked for (and quickly received) feather pillows because we found the pillows provided to be hard. We found the hotel to be quiet and slept well each night. Nearby, the La Carbona restaurant was wonderful (Via Panispera).

Reviews.Title: “Good Stuff...”
Reviews.Author: nineteen06
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this hotel last week w/my wife and was not disappointed. In a GREAT location, 10-12 minutes from the Coliseum/Forum - and an easy trot (or subway ride) from everything else. The staff was ABSOLUTELY top notch. Francesca was AMAZINGLY attentive and courteous (she's the best), and Mossimo was quite helpful when we had an issue (not the fault of the hotel). All we were looking for was a CLEAN place to stay with decent accommodations. This place delivered. The rooms were large compared to most European hotel rooms in non-American branded hotels. The bathrooms were sparkling, as was the bedroom when we arrived. The only concern is that even though we had the "do not disturb" sign on the door each day, they came in and cleaned anyway. But there was nothing stolen from us so it ended up not being that big a deal (besides, it was nice coming back to a made-up bed everyday). The pillows were a bit hard, the shower was very small (but great), and it was hard getting someone on the phone, but those were only minor items. No major complaints AT ALL!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Latta
Reviews.Content: We scouted this hotel on Trip Advisor and we were not dissapointed . My wife and I travel extensively and I can say this is one of the best hotel experience we have ever had. From the greeting to the room to the breakfast - the best. Our room was 502 - the biggest room with the veranda. The hotel was spotless and the staff was wonderful. If I ever return to Rome this is where we will stay. The location is perfect - even the Vatican can be reached in a 30 minute walk. There were plenty of places to eat and of course the train station is 10 minutes by foot. The only thing that was not perfect was that the bed was a little hard and the pillows were like semi-soft bricks. This could be easily remedied making this close to a five-star experience. Most importantly was the quiet - never heard anything but the bells of Santa Maria Maggiore and seagulls in the morning. We will never forget our Rome Adventure - thanks to the staff at the Raffaello - what a class act.

Reviews.Title: “value, service, and good breakfast all in one place”
Reviews.Author: SBRLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rafaello for five nights last month. The location is not far from Termini, which some don't consider to be an ideal Roman experience, but my boyfriend and I found it quite convenient for doing some day-trips outside Rome, very walkable to reach the sights of Rome, and we felt quite safe walking the surrounding area. One of my favorite parts about the location was Hotel Rafaello's closeness to Ciuri Ciuri- excellent cannoli right down the street. The hotel's staff is excellent and I appreciated that they recognized us as we came and left the hotel. We got an excellent price by booking on the internet - which they offered to match if we decided to stop in again on our way home. The included breakfast buffet was quite good and saved us much time in getting a start to our days. You must pay to access the high-speed internet but the prices are competitive with the internet cafes. I would be quite happy to stay here on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: pr1nc3ssdi
Reviews.Content: walking distance (About 10 - 15 mins with luggage) from the Central station, its easy to find this little hotel although it is located on a small road. Their staffs are overall friendly and often welcome guests with a smile. Buffet breakfast is probably one of the better ones I had in Italy.. can be better though.. Rooms are small but clean, furniture a little wear out. Overall a good experience with them, will recommend if you are looking for 3star accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Molte Grazie to all at the Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: taff37
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights at the Raffaello from 13 March and had a fantastic time. Six other couples, from Wales, also stayed at the Hotel & all will return. Staff friendly & helpful - from booking taxis to/from Airport at fixed price, providing maps/directions, taking a genuine interest in their guests & 'going the extra mile'. Facilities for fair price A1 - very good location, nice rooms, ample breakast, free safety deposit box, clean/well equipped bathrooms & daily maid service. No bar - but..for those who want it - reasonably priced mini-bar. Great base for walking - with Colloseum, Forum, St Maria Maggoria and other churches/sights all close by - along with Termini Train station & Cavour Metro. Buy a Roma Pass at 23 Euros to visit two 'sites of interest'/museums - along with 3 days travel on Metro, Tram & Bus as required. Despite £ v Euro being unfavourable - we ate well in local bars, pizzeras, trattorias at reasonable prices. Loved Rome - loved the Raffaello - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: overeazy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Raffaello Hotel and it was more then we expected. Loved the location so close to the train station and yet so easy to get to all the sites either walking or the Metro. Sure the lift (elevator) and the room is a little small by american standards but we expected worse with our first visit to Italy. The staff from the cleaining staff to the desk to the breakfast staff was always very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. If you do not expect to be visiting a 5 star resort you will enjoy the Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: muskokaguys
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay in Rome at The Raffaello Hotel. The hotel is centrally located between Via Cavour and Via Nazionale, about 5 minutes from Termini. Its also a 10 minute walk to The Colosseum and about 20 to most other sites( Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon etc). Its a 45 minute walk from The Vatican. The Hotel is very clean and the room we had had a terrace(AMAZING). The staff are very friendly and help you with anything your heart desires. The breakfast buffet is sensational with eggs, toast, ham, cheese, salami, cereals, fresh tomatoes, danishes etc. There are no complaints at all about this hotel it was PERFECT HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. One tip: We went to a couple of Michelin Star restaurants in Rome-DONT BOTHER. They are very expensive and not as good as any Michelin Star restaurants I have eaten in in London-The restaurants were Baby at The Aldrovandi Palace Hotel and Vivendo at The St. Regis. Eat locally.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Drsteph1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for 7 days in March 2009. The staff was very friendly, everyone spoke english and were available to answer any questions, call cabs, etc. The breakfast was great - plenty to eat with delicious pastries. The location was perfect - close to the train and subway but in a very nice, safe street. Never felt unsafe in the neighborhood. The hotel was also remarkably clean for a european/italian hotel compared to our past experiences. Cleaned early in the morning every day, very pleasant staff. Bathrooms are newer and kept spotless! Like many others, we found the showers a little small, but it was not a problem for us. Had a safe in the room which was nice to keep extra cash and passports so we didnt have to carry them around and worry about them. Would definitely reccomend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: speedofive
Reviews.Content: Great location. 10 mins walk to colloseum, 30 mins to piazza navona/campo di fiori. Staff were fantastic. Rooms were cleaned every day. No complaints. Only minor negative was that there was no tea and coffee facilities in room and no iron. So take your own (although was told that ironing was strictly forbidden in room). Small things in comparison. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value And Ideally Positioned - Great”
Reviews.Author: boblipscomb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Raffaello for 4 nights, 23/2 - 27/2. Our room was very clean and tidy. Room was so warm we didn't need any heating on. Shower is small and takes a little bit of manouevering in. Would have liked for tea/coffee making facilities (we took our own kettle) and we would have preferred more English TV channels. But these are two very minor criticisms. Breakfast is first-class - get up and help yourself buffet - you won't go hungry. We had no cause to pester the hotel staff for anything, other than to thank the management for their kind gesture in delivering unexpectedly to the room a bottle of champagne on ice - they'd obviously noticed my wife's 50th birthday cards - a small sign of the hotel's attention to detail and its care for its guests. Location is ideal - we explored all the main sites and never once used public transport. We would recommend a very nearby restaurant called the Gallo Matto (not sure I've spelt this correctly) - up the road that is immediately adjacent to the hotel (immediately on your right as you come out of the hotel), turn right at the top, stay on this side of the road and cross the crossing and, 2 or 3 untits down, is the restaurant. Hotel to restaurant in 2-3 minutes. Watch out for the bubbly Indian waiter - he treats you well if you return the next night (we used it for 3 nights out of the 4, regretting we didn't go in there for the last night too), e.g. free Grappa (or similar type drink) at the end of your meal or a soaked aubergine (probably sounds horrible but it was nice, having a tang about it) to start whilst awaiting the first course. Good food at a very reasonable price. Wouldn't recommend the Bella Roma which is in the other direction up the hill on that same side of the road. Would definitely return to the Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anders80
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for me and my girlfriend. Close to the Termini Station so we didn't have to find a taxi when arriving. It was easy to find the hotel and we were glad to see it was in a pretty quiet street as traffic in Rome is intense at times. The staff at the hotel was most helpful and i would recommend taking the stairs for those with a faint heart when it comes to the elevator. It was small and slow :) The room was just the right size and we were positively surprised of how nice the bathroom was. As mentioned in previous reviews the shower tho is really small, but it worked. The breakfast was excellent with friendly staff and food that tasted good. Toasted bread, eggs, + + It is a cheap way of living in Rome and is a 3 star + at worst, and better then most 4 stars hotels i have lived at.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: gazza1985
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a great little hotel, perfect for use as a base for your endless trekking around Rome. I stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights from the 20 Feb to 23rd. It is situated very close to Termini station, we walked to the hotel on arrival at Termini with no more than a map in about 15 mins. There are lots of taxis outside Termini if you have a lot of luggage, it should cost around 5 euros to get to the hotel in one. The hotel did contact me before my trip offering me a car pickup from the airport for 48 euros for two people, not a bad price in comparison to local taxi rates, but the Leaonardo Express to Termini is just 11 euros each. It is very close to the colosseum and 'ancient rome' including palatine hill etc, easily walkable in around 10 mins. Other attractions like the Trevi Fountain, and Pantheon are a little further away, but can be walked to in around 20 mins, and you'll probably find yourself stubling upon them as you explore around anyway! The vatican is on the other side of the city, and so we did get a taxi there, this cost around 7 euros, but you could probably walk it in around 30-40 mins if you have the energy! Believe me, Rome will take it out of you over a weekend if you want to see all the sights! The hotel itself is faultless, completely spotless from the entrance, all the way to the rooms. It is a small, cosy hotel, and the rooms come equipped with everything you need; minibar, haridryer, in room safe etc.... The staff are very helpful, I asked the receptionist on duty for some restaurant recommendations, he was very helpful in drawing me a map to a beautiful (although pricy) restaurant which served the most amazing tortellini Ive ever come across! The breakfast is typical as far as most european restaurants are concerned, but caters well for all, with breads, cheeses and cereals, along with toast to order just ask a waitress. I booked my room directly with the hotel on their website www.hotelraffaello.it and I requested a room with a terrace. They obliged and we were given a very big room on the 5th floor with its own lovely terrace! This hotel far outweighs its 3 star rating, and comes with a personal touch which far outclasses most 4 star hotels in the area. Hotel is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Siwe
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. We had a wonderful stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Pamalama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for 2 nights with my sister-in-law and 12 girlfriends. The hotel is spotless with friendly staff and is no more than a 15 minute walk from the Train Terminal. We loved it as the Hotel offered triple and quad rooms. The breakfast is good with scrambled eggs, meat, cheeses, cereal, fresh fruit and juices. The hotel is a short walk to Santa Maria Maggiore and you can also join the open top bus tour from there. The one thing we learned is to haggle with everything. It's also a good idea to do your research in advance and have a map as everytime we asked for directions (including policemen) we drew a blank. We flew with Ryanair and paid 18euros return for the Ryanair bus that takes you from the airport to the Train Terminal. If you can travel off season then the location and price are not to be beaten for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: ecfc2000
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Raffaello for 3 nights/4 days in July 2008. Apon our arrival we were greeted by a very friendly reception manager who helped us check-in and answered all of our questions we had. Our room on the top floor was excellent. It was decorated and presented to a high standard and had a good view onto Via Urbana. The AC was fantastic and never let us down and was probably the best i have ever experienced. We certainly needed the AC in the July heat! Didnt watch much TV but did manage to get the footy results off it so was really happy with that. My only issue is the size of the shower, which is a tad on the small side. Still, i'm a fat bloke so i'm sure it'll be fine for most people! Locaiton was excellent. 10 min walk to the Collosuem, 20 min walk down town and 10 min walk to the Termini. The Metro is 200 yards down the Cavour, but we didn't get to use it as they were on strike!!! If you're a keen walker like me, you'll not need any transport. We walked everywhere. Sure it was tiring, but well worth it as you see all of the city in it's glory....or not depending on how you see things!! I'm not convinced on the city itself but thats for a different forum. If (and its a big IF) I were to return to Rome I'd certainly be checking into the Raffaello. For the price we paid it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Elamenco
Reviews.Content: Excellent breakfast, good service, very clean rooms! Located in a very nice, quiet, charming street, between Termini and very close to Colosseum. Subwaystation 3 min walk away. Nice cafes and restaurants near by. Manuela, Feb 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerSalford
Reviews.Content: The trip was a Xmas present from our 2 daughters.It was our 4th time in Rome.The hotel was wonderful and the staff were great i.e.very friendly and helpful.I could not make any criticism against this wonderful hotel and I think some of the criticisms I have read on this site are by very picky people who usually find nothing nice to say about anything.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roy17
Reviews.Content: This is 3 star hotel is a real gem! (Its location, the accommodation and its excellent standard of service). The hotel is within easy walking distance of Rome's main railway station, to which run regular trains to/from Fiumicino Airport. (How many times have I stupidly booked a so-called budget hotel in the suburbs of cities only to spend a fortune on taxi fares!) The hotel is also within easy walking distance of bars, restaurants of all standards/prices and to the Colosseum and most of the main sites. Our bedroom was tastefully decorated and spotless, with comfortable beds and a 'well-equipped' bathroom. The breakfast was first class. However, my principal 'admiration' has to be the standard of service. You soon get the impression that the hotel is well run and that all the staff are happy to work there. They all seem to go out of their way to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. I rate this hotel very highly indeed - l'albergo e` ottimo!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: nixon4ever
Reviews.Content: The thing that made this five star instead of four star is that we got such a bargain. We paid just 78 euros a night, in Rome, which was less than our rooms in Venice and Florence. Originally, our room was 95 euros a night, but I took the advice of another poster (below) and checked back on the website a few days before we left and was able to "modify" my booking for the lower price. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It's less than a ten-minute walk from the Termini train station (even with bags) and also close to the Colosseum. Between the Colosseum and the hotel is San Pietro in Vincoli, with Michelangelo's Moses. Our room was very small, but clean, with all the necessary amenities. The bathroom is modern and functional, and the towel heater was a nice touch, As others have mentioned, the shower is *really* small. A large person may have problems, as would anyone with claustrophobia. I'm relatively petite, but if the water was coming out too hard, I felt like I was drowning. My friend, however, did not have any problems, and suggested that I was showering incorrectly when I complained. The breakfast is delicious and plentiful. The scrambled eggs look a little odd, but taste amazing. The pastries are great but if you have a nut allergy, be wary, as you never know where nutella or almond paste might be hiding. There is also cereal, breads, meats, cheeses, fruits, and a variety of juices. The hotel had the broadest breakfast buffet of all the places we stayed in Italy. The staff was fine, though my friend complained about their attitude. She was particularly annoyed that the cleaning staff knocked some of her makeup off the sink in our bathroom, which caused her eye shadows to shatter, and then they didn't even clean them up. They were, however, able to check us in 6 hours early when we stopped by to drop off our stuff after our train got in, which makes up for a lot, in my view. I would definitely stay here again for the bargain off-season price we got.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel A1”
Reviews.Author: giov58
Reviews.Content: As a company director I was orgainising our annual christmas outing now since it is a busy time for us we always hold it into the new year, we decided a three day trip to Rome, I choose the Raffaello Hotel Via Urbana 3 / 5, Rome 00184 to stay based on its reviews we could not have made a better choice I contacted the Hotel by e-mail, the help I recieved in making the booking could not have been better infact they made it so easy for me, as we were 20 people in all. We were greeted with a welcome which I have never recieved in any Hotel before friendly helpful and cheerful. The rooms were excellent more a five star standard rather than 3 star and a nice little touch in the evening with a goodnight note and chocolate in your room when you returned at night, buffet breakfast with a wide range of choice and plentiful. I definitly will staying agian when in Rome. Also its location is quiet yet within walking distance to many of the cities attractions. Book this hotel you will not be disapointed. Giovanni

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Everything”
Reviews.Author: NPro
Reviews.Content: I booked this break for my husbands birthday so i had done alot of research online before booking. Out main priorty is location and being clean! WE were never going to be in the hotel so as long as it was clean and close to most things we were happy! We arrived into Da Vinci airport and was shown where to get the express train into the city! It took about 40 mins and brought us straight into the Termini station. I had printed maps off so we had a good idea of where the hotel was. It was lashing rain when we arrived but within 5 mins we were at the hotel after a stroll down the road. We arrived and were checked in quickly and told where i room was. Ok the lift is TINY but who cares!! As long as it works! Our room was on the 6th floor so a good way up and it was very large and we were impressed on arrival! A large double bed and a beautiful room terrace over looking the streets of Rome! We did a qucik change and back out to explore the city! The collesum is literly only 10 mins stroll down the main Cavour Road. We werent put off by the crazy rain but it would have been a,lot nicer had it been dry! We asked at reception for a reccomodation for dinner adn we were told about this fantastic little Italian restaurant about 5 mins walk from the hotel. Its was excellent and there were lots of locals there so always a good sign. On the way back to the hotel i spotted an ice cream shop so that became our tradition for dessert every night on our walk home! Dont let the other reviews put you off though! Ok its not 5 Star but what do you expect for such a cheap place! Its clean and its right in the middle of everything! The longest walk was over to the spanish steps which took about 30 mins but that was going slowly and taking in the atmosphere! Well Hope you enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall unsatisfied”
Reviews.Author: Karlie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Raffaello is a few blocks from Termini station, and from their website, looks like a classy, elegant hotel. Unfortunately, this is not the case. When we arrived, I took the luggage to the room while my husband waited with the car. I had two suitcases and two carry on bags, and I was not offered any help at all. The elevator is very cramped. This hotel had something I have never seen before. The elevator lets you off in between floors, so you have to either go up or down nine stairs to get to the floor with the rooms on it. I struggled to get the luggage in and out of the elevator and up and down the stairs. When we got into our room, it smelled like very strong cologne, so we opened the window. We realized the smell was obviously trying to hide the musty odor of this obviously aging hotel. The décor was extremely outdated, but not in a nice antique way. It was just ugly. The bed was uncomfortable, even by European standards. The bathroom soaps were another very strong smelling item in this hotel, strongly resembling very cheap men’s cologne. I highly advise anyone to bring their own. The air conditioning is weak and we could barely feel it. There is wireless internet available in the lobby, but you have to pay for it. Breakfast is included. The front desk staff were not polite at all and not particularly helpful. A cab to the airport is 40 Euros. The express train to the airport is 11 Euros, but I would rather take a cab and not have to lug my stuff through the very busy neighbourhood and train station. If your party is any more than two or three people, taking the train isn’t much of a savings anyways. We paid 170 Euro a night for our room. We would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: michaelenej
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located right in the heart of Rome about a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum, Palatine and Roman Forum. It's also about a 5 minute walk from Termini Station, so it's really convenient to catch the train, bus or subway (it's a 10 minute subway ride to the Vatican/St. Peters). The rooms are very clean and spacious, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The price was very reasonable, and included internet access and a lovely breakfast buffet with local and international items. The neighborhood is nice and quiet and contains several quaint little "Ristorantes" that serve the most delicious food (try "Pasta Love"!) I had a very delightful stay and will happily be returning to this hotel on my next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmarienf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, reasonably priced, and offers a great location. The doormen were super helpful, and all hotel staff was extremely pleasant to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Raffaello is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mcbe4travel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at the Raffaello. My wife and I traveled with our two teens and took a quad ("family") room. Value for the money was outstanding, owing in part, I imagine, to the time of year. A tip: when you make your reservation on their hotel website, do check back to see if the rate has dropped -- that gave us some extra, unexpected savings. The bathrooms are exceptionally clean, and the room was overall very nicely appointed. The breakfast in the morning is really good, including eggs and toast along with lots of baked goods and cereals, etc. The hotel's location is excellent for walking to many sites, and we took the metro to the Vatican. The front desk recommended Osteria La Carbonara for dinner one night, and its off the charts good (and very, very reasonable) on via Panisperna nearby. Another huge plus is that the hotel is about a ten minute walk from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Raffaello is Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: dfpasto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week (August 15 - 22) and thoroughly enjoyed the Hotel Raffaello. Me, my wife and two sons 20 and 16 years old had booked a Quad room. However, when we checked in, the nice lady at check-in said that since we were going to stay for a long visit she arranged to give us two rooms, adjacent to each other, for the price of the Quad! Hello? That was sweet and started us off on a very nice hotel experience. Several things we found outstanding: 1) Air conditioning unit was the best of any hotel I have ever stayed at (I have 750,000 FF miles; I have enough experience to compare). It was so quiet I had to actualy check to see if it was on. From what I've read about hotels in Europe in general, A/C is not what we experience in the States 2) Loved the firm bed; slept like a rock all week 3) Location . . . a few blocks from Termini Train Station and about 1/2 mile walk to the Coliseum and the Roman Forum area 4) Price/Value 5) Immaculate (you could eat off the bathroom floor) Very simple restaurant a few blocks away called The Robin Hood where we ate a couple of times because it was so good. Also, a few blocks further was a Gelato place called La Dolce Vita that had the best gelato of all the places in Rome that we tried. Really a lovely small hotel whereby the staff was friendly and the accomodations, value ande location were truly terrific. Highly recommend Hotel Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: trulyscrumtious
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raffello is a delightful hotel, with friendly helpful and English speaking staff. Rooms are comfortable, very clean and of a fair size, with ensuite that too is of a reasonable size, ours had a power shower rather than a bath. The breakfast is buffet style, tasty and more than adequate and you can eat till full, staff at breakfast are polite and attentive, great start to anyone’s day. The only down side is that dinner is not a service offered. The hotel location means that it is within easy reach of any part of town, walking or by bus. The hotel is closely located to the Termie Station where a bus to any area of Rome can be picked up. A bus ticket for the day cost 4euros and can be bought at most tobacconist. A restaurant that is fabulous and within 5 minuets walk is Est Est Est, a fabulous Pizzeria, I have never eaten a pizza like it and wished we had found it on the first night. Shopping on the via nazionale is great and for a more up market store try those leading off Piazzo del Popolo on such roads as via del Babino. It mentions in one of the reviews that the hotel is located in area where there are ladies of the night frequent, well yes it is but at no time did this effect our holiday, in fact on passing it could be mistaken for a group of girls waiting for a taxi. Overall for what you pay for this hotel, you get good service, a clean hotel that is within walking distance of most landmarks, (the Vatican would be for the most dedicated walker), one that I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Ask for More”
Reviews.Author: Taxithi60
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune of spending a week in Rome this month and stayed at the Hotel Raffaello right in the city. First, let me say I am a" fussy customer" as my Mother would say , so I was very happy we found this wonderful hotel. The staff were amazing . They spoke English and could not do enough for us. The room was very clean, a good size and the breakfast buffet was fresh and beautiful; served by a gracious staff .The location is right down the street from the St. Maria Maggigore Basilica , near all kinds of shopping , restaurants and great neighborhoods. I would definetly stay there again. Boston, MA

Reviews.Title: “Good - but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Annbon
Reviews.Content: We booked the Raffaello for 4 nights mainly on the back of the reviews on this website and whilst our hotel experience was adequate, I certainly wasn't bowled over. Location-wise it is brilliant - really close to the Termini and if you are reasonably fit, most sites are walkable. It is also on a pleasant side street so there is little traffic noise. Breakfast in the hotel is served by friendly, helpful staff and the choice is extensive enough to set you up for a days sightseeing. Although dinner is not served at the hotel, there are plenty of restaurants and trattorias to be found in the evening with a little exploration. I do, sadly, have some negative points. Our room (302) was of a good size but due to the very small window opening out onto a small inner courtyard (approx 4m x 1m) no air could circulate and the room was unpleasantly musty. Secondly, on our second night, the bath whirlpool pipe came free from the pump and water poured out onto the bathroom floor and subsequently the bedroom carpet.The hotel's response was to use room towels to mop up the excess water and with a shrug advised us to only use the shower for the rest of the stay. With little air circulating in the room, the carpet remained damp, which added to the musty smell. To be fair, we could have made a fuss but didn't - we are British after all! If they had apologised and found us another room without a fuss, then perhaps I would be giving a different review. Who knows?! As we were in Rome to view the sites and were simply using the hotel as a base, it didn't seem worth the bother. On that note, I would still recommend the hotel - as a reasonably priced, well placed base (we paid slightly less, I think, through a website on tripadvisor). If you want to feel wowed, spend more time in the hotel than we did or are looking for something special, then from our experiences, you run the risk of being disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “So great last year we went again this year!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAreaOn_The_Go
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a little hotel. Located conveniently near the train station, the hotel offers a quiet retreat. Rooms are clean and nicely decorated. We stayed in a double room last year, a room for four this year with our daughter. The rooms are small (typical for Europe) but they offer plenty of room for luggage.. The complimentary breakfast in the morning is quite lovely and a real asset. The staff are friendly and helpful, all speak English. The underground trains as well as the buses are just up the street, making it easy to get to just about anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for a Family”
Reviews.Author: dw/chicago
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a wonderful week in Italy. I was traveling with my three kids ( in their 20's) and wanted rooms that we could share to make the trip more cost effective. I highly recommend Rafaello Hotel. We had a quad room that was actaully two rooms and one bath. The rooms were very nicely furnished and immaculate. The bath was certainly large enough and the shower was really nice! The servcie from the front desk was excellent and the breakfast was very good, including scrambled eggs. The servers were very friendly also. The location was fine for us, but othere might find it too far from some attractions but we had no problem either walking or taking the Metro, which the front desk was very helpful in explaining to us. They were also so helpful with reservations and arranging transportaion to the airport. Wireless was available in the lobby for a charge. We walked from the train terminal when we arrived and that was very easy. All, in all, this was a lovely hotel, and a great price. I would definately reccommend this and would return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel - Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelchickconcierge
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered excellent customer service, a wonderful location and a great breakfast buffet! Lobby offers a computer, wtih paid internet access (reasonable). Massimo at the hotel was wonderful, assisting us with our departure plans and transportation. The other reviews mention that you take the elevator to the floor just above where you are staying and walk down a few stairs - it seems odd at first, but it's fine. The room was larger than most 3* hotels in Italy with a space aged shower! Small TV offered CNN English channel. Others have also mentioned the need of a key to use the lights in the room. It's a clever device, but I am glad that I had read about it prior to checking in. The Colloseum is about a 6 block walk, and there are good dining options nearby. The train staion is also a 6 block easy walk. I would certainly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay At This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chukkie58
Reviews.Content: One of the hardest things to do in Italy is find a good hotel at a reasonable price. I have stayed in four and five star hotels that I wouldn't rate as two! My partner and I had to spend the night in Rome and we needed a central hotel but for one night didn't want to pay a fortune. We read the reviews on here, it looked OK, so we took the plunge - fully expecting to be disappointed when we got there. We weren't! It is central; the street seems a bit downtrodden but it hardly spoils the overall experience - good restaurants are within easy walking distance. It's not a spacious hotel, the rooms are compact, but we are both quite big and it was absolutely fine. It is spotlessly clean throughout. Everything worked including the AC; many hotels in Italy turn the AC off at the end of August to save money regardless of the temperatures! The bed was super comfortable with clean, crisp, white sheets. It was also quiet and we slept like logs - yet the hotel had many guests. Breakfast was one of the best we have had in an Italian hotel; the cappuccino wasn't great but, hey! All the staff, without exception, were friendly, efficient and helpful. One thing we noted was that when they call you a taxi you get a proper, standard, licenced cab. Many concierges in the city call you a private taxi which costs you a bomb and they get a kick- back. This is a really good sign that Raffaello is well and honestly run. We got the room for Euro 155 for the two of us including tax and breakfast. In the centre of one the world's most visited cities at what is their high season we feel well satisfied and will definitely stay there again whenever we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saxlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a trip we spent 3 nights at the start of our trip to Italy and 2 nights at the end of our stay (we asked for the same room for our return when we left and we were given a friendly welcome back and our same room). This was our first trip to Rome and we found the reception staff very helpful and informative which made our stay very pleasant. The rooms are spotless and decorated to a high standard our only small complaint was the size of the shower it was extremely small. As stated in other reviews the hotel is ideally situated for the Termini station and is a 10 minute walk. All major attractions are on the doorstep and you can walk to most of them easily. We found a good reasonably priced restaurant "est est est" which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel, good food and inexpensive. We had a great time and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding find”
Reviews.Author: cbinlondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic!! It was an absolute find - boutique in nature and in a great location for exploring the Roman Forum, Colluseum; Capitoline Hill (which is a fabulous museum); the Fora; and other ancient sites. Also within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps, and the Trevi. Equally, just a stroll to the Central Train station which has a direct connection to the Fuimicino Airport. I was really impressed with the quality of the rooms; the breakfast area and the simple things like fresh flowers in the hallways; turndown at night; and the efficiency of the staff. Tourists tend to go for hotels around Piazza Navonna - but please don't overlook this spot - it is worth every penny and the staff appear to be genuinely committed to this little boutique hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: happyhoneymooner78
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome for two nights and arrived tired after a four hour train journey! The hotel is easily walkable from the Station as another reviewer already says. We would agree with all the positive reviews - location is ideal, all of Rome is walkable in the right shoes! But the Rafaello is also close to a metro station if you fancy less traipsing around. We found an excellent bar in the square nearby too, and the staff were happy to provide recommendations. We would definitely say a four star not a three. Our room had a balcony and we had some sparkly stuff to greet us, which was lovely as we were on our honeymoon. All in all, this hotel is ideal and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “OK but some issues”
Reviews.Author: L878765
Reviews.Content: A generally nice place to stay. The location is good, a ten minute walk from the main station, and ten minutes further to get to the Coloseum, with a metro station about five minutes walk away. There are smoke detectors in public areas (but not in rooms) and rather odd automatically closing fire doors that are always open and apparently close when the smoke detectors go off. That sounds odd to me - surely you want the doors to be closed all the time at night at least, and to be able to easily open them in a fire to get out! I was on top (5th Floor) and have no knowledge of whether the Rome fire brigade has ladders that go up that far. I did wonder just how terrifying it would be to try to get onto a ladder at night, given the height, if a ladder could get up that far. There is only one fire exit, which is the main staircase of the building, and windows elsewhere that might offer exit are barred with metal grilles! There was, on the top floor, an exit marked not to open, and, opening it, I found that it led onto a balcony that is used for drying laundry etc, but I don't know if that would ultimatley offer you a way out in a fire, as it mainly seemed to overlook an internal well and it might actually not be accessible to fire ladders given it was not on the street. So I felt partially safe, because of the smoke detectors and weird automatically closing doors, but not entirely. Fire safety is vital in hotels, and I think everyone needs to get a lot more assertive about this topic. Other than that? Room was lovely and quite typical for a good Italian hotel. There was a small balcony overlooking an old church. A school or convent nearby (wasnt sure what) had budgies in an aviary, who seemed to churp night and day, and that is one of the sounds I remember hearing. Staff were efficient, spoke good English willingly, and were not unhelpful. Some issues with check-in which I refer to later (they don't seem to welcome solo travellers), and they were generally brisk to the point of chilliness, but not a problem since the encounters with reception last just seconds. Tiny, old fashioned tv with only one English language station - cnn business - which plays very weird adverts for banks about adding value and adding fresh perspectives and realising potential today etc., so I had to turn it off. Breakfast service was slightly disappointing. I was travelling alone, and the only single table was perched on a stairway - so if you sat back you could literally tumble down stairs. I was offered coffee, but noticed others were also offered toast which I was not offered. The same happened the next morning - I was offered coffee but not toast, although the couple near me had just been offered toast - so - despite not wanting any, I asked for toast, and the women seemed a bit cross that I had asked for something she wasn't going to offer me. I really hate that kind of thing, it makes me dislike a place because it makes me feel unwelcome or as though my money isn't as good as anyone elses. Solo travellers are often discriminated against, with this hotel being an offender. When I checked-in, the receptionist queried why I had booked a double room, as though this was somehow wrong of me, but I'd just booked the only room they had on their website for 1 person. Was it my fault? Seemingly. Naughty me. Ridiculous shower which I couldn't work out. A "full body" thing, just horrid, and quite difficult to get the normal hand shower to work. Hard to get really hot water from any tap. I won't stay again for that price (£135 a night) given my uncertainty about fire safety, the odd and slightly hostile behaviour at brekfast in trying to deprive me of toast, and the decidedly chilly if efficient reception staff - but would recommend it if you can get a room for £100 a night or less, which reading the review here people sometimes seem to be able to get.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Close to the best restaurant in Rome - Tema!!”
Reviews.Author: dradams93
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over the Easter break. It has an excellent location, just a short walk from Termini and a stone's throw from Cavour Metro station. Tip for any new travellers to Roma, taxi drivers tried to rip us off by saying it would be a 15min drive and cost about €20 in taxi. You can walk very easily to it, even with cases. The hotel is small and homely. The reception staff are very hospitble and helpful. If you stay in this hotel, the restaurant TEMA is a must!! It is just around the corner from the hotel and the reception staff have cards for Tema. Literally a 2minute walk and unreal if you like authentic Italian cuisine. [--] Rooms are small, really clean and well decorated. We would stay in this hotel again when we return to Rome. Travel tip - If you are travelling home through ciampino airport, get a taxi and not the bus! - €30 flat rate and half the time and a quarter of the hassle of getting the bus from Termini. Enjoy Rome. Enjoy the Raffaello. Enjoy Tema!!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love the Raffaelo”
Reviews.Author: Citygal15
Reviews.Content: As a former travel editor for a major Sunday paper, I can honestly say this is a perfect little three star (could even pass for four), fantastically located - close enough to Termini to be very handy (ten minute walk), but still within a really nice area (not scuzzy at all like some hotels in other areas near station) and handy for good places you'll want to go in Rome; it's immaculate, the staff are so helpful and sweet; the rooms feel, for the price, rather luxurious (opulent fabric-covered walls! and jacuzzi shower) and the breakfast has everything you could want. BUT the major bonus of this hotel, and a very telling reason you know it's a good hotel, is that residents of the Raffaello get free access (during good weather/in season) to the rooftop terrace of their sister hotel (also very, very nice) which is located literally right next door to the Pantheon. So, for this reason alone, it's worth staying at this hotel. It's hard to beat Bellinis on a rooftop terrace at sunset with the Pantheon's dome within spitting distance. I will tell everyone I know who's going to Rome to stay here. One point, however, I noticed the price varied from day to day on Expedia and other websites so look out for a good deal. We paid £111 a night which was a great deal, and obviously contributed to our satisfaction when all was considered, but on other days I saw it jump much, much higher. But go and don't pay over the odds and you'll be more than happy, I promise.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, friendly”
Reviews.Author: peartreelot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a cruise. As long as you can carry or roll your bags you can easily walk here from Termini train station. The hotel has been beautifully refurbished. It is spotlessly clean and the staff are friendly. We had a two-room suite for the price of a room in some hotels. The rooms was not tiny as you would expect in central Rome and had high ceilings. The bathroom was lovely. It was in the 30s so the highly efficient air conditioning was very welcome. The breakfast was delicious, plentiful, varied and exquisitely presented. It was too hot to walk everywhere and the hotel was convenient for the two hop-on-hop-off bus routes which left from Sta Maria Maggiore and Termini. In the morning we left our bags at the hotel and in the afternoon they arranged an efficient RV taxi transfer to the airport for us. There is no restaurant but come out of the hotel, turn right up the alleyway, then right onto via Cavour, straight into a lovely little family-run Italian restaurant which does home-cooked food and has a surpirsingly extensive menu, all reasonably priced. Their antipasti were delicious and fresh. Last time we were in Rome we stayed near to Termini, but this area is much nicer and seems safer than the area closer to Termini. We'll definitely stay here when we go back to Rome for a longer visit

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferpoppy
Reviews.Content: We booked directly via the hotels website, and considering the price we paid, we considered this good value for Rome. We made an excellent choice in the end. Hope to visit Rome again and I will definitely be booking this hotel. Very satisfied with Hotel Raffaello. Good location, near the large Santa Maria Maggiore church, Colosseum (10 mins) Termini train station (5/ 10 mins) and Cavour metro station which is a 2 mins walk up the pleasant back street of Via Urbana. The road is much nicer than Via Serpenti which was another possibility. Unexpectedly upgraded to a room on the top floor with a lovely large balcony (thanks for this!) This is probably why we gave it five stars, though I can appreciate from previous postings that the room or view can spoil a visit. But, who goes to Rome to sit in their room? We made use of the small supermarket round the corner on Via Cavour which had a good stock of bread, cheese and wine.
