So, for one of the 5 nights, we decided to eat on the balcony watching the sun go down over Rome. The balcony was incredibly peaceful. Air conditioning was very efficient. Electricity is powered by putting the key in the slot near the door. Just a note to those who claimed there was no air con in the room! Staff were very friendly and helpful, and appreciated our Italian conversation efforts, I’m sure! The odd buonjourno and bonasera doesn’t hurt! Breakfast staff and reception staff speak English though, if that’s a concern. Good breakfast, which was nicely presented. Not sure why the previous postings states ‘just ask for no breakfast’ – it’s not that bad!! They provided tea, cappuccino, coffee and hot chocolate. You just need to talk to the staff, they seemed very efficient and genuine to me. Just a quick ‘day out’ recommendation for Tivoli Gardens (known as Villa d’Este in Tivoli). Take the metro from Cavour to Ponte Mammolo (1 euro each!) and then get a return bus ticket to Tivoli and get off at Piazza Garibaldi (town centre). Villa d’Este is a stones throw from here. The journey takes about an hour and the amazing fountains and gardens are well worth it on a hot day. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel. We had a very enjoyable time. Grazie mille di cuore!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Super Staff, Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: crealty2000
Reviews.Content: Ten adults from the USA stayed at the Raffaello in late July, 2008. We had a lovely experience. The staff (especially Mossimo and Francesco) was so kind and helpful. Every request was met with professionalism and geniune assistance. The hotel is very clean. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. As Americans we had to adjust our expectations about the size of the bathrooms. The showers are "cruise ship" size - but just fine. There are a few stairs that cannot be avoided. The lift is adequate, but doesn't take you to each floor level (after arriving at your floor, there are still 5 or 6 steps). Our group did not have a problem with this at all. Assistance is available with your luggage. The breakfast was quite good. Served in very clean, attractive surroundings. Fresh cold water was available on request for our Rome treks each day. We all agreed that this is the hotel we would return to for our next Roman adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable, Adorable, Adorable”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelMom
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel using Trip Advisor. The pictures accurately represent the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were soooo cute! It took me a minute to figure out how to turn on the lights (by putting your key in the reader), but I am a nubie to traveling in Europe. The hotel was very convenient to both metro lines. We walked to Colosseum and from there the rest of ancient Rome. It was good to be able to take the subway back. Fantastic end to our trip. I would stay there again. We took a picture of a sign saying the Hotel Raffaello is "away from confusion". Isn't that great?

Reviews.Title: “cannot be better !!!”
Reviews.Author: whattea
Reviews.Content: there are already a lot of positive reviews, just want to add this review for those families with kids (we have 2 boys 10 & 5). we got a family room with 2 separate unites (AC in each), rooms are beautifully decorated and are very very clean ! we also stayed in Cavalieri Hilton Suite in a later day, but we liked Raeffaello more comparing to Hilton, as Raffeallo makes you feel you're staying in Rome (with good accommodation). will definitely stay here if we ever get a chance to visit Rome again !

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, well located”
Reviews.Author: Incoming11
Reviews.Content: This place is really conveniently located approximately halfway between the train station and the Colosseum. All major sites are accessible either by walking or via the metro The room was clean and a decent size, ensuite bathroom the same. Breakfast was excellent with good coffee. The staff were very helpful and courteous. No complaints here. Good hotel, good location, good value. Thanks for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: treeno2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 15th July 2008. Great little hotel in a good location - only 10 minutes from the colosseum. Also near Metro stops and Termini so great for getting around. Staff were lovely and helpful. Breakfast was usual continental fare but good nonetheless. Great overall experience. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “my stay in june 08”
Reviews.Author: nlewis10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of June, 08. The hotel was in a great location. It was only a bit over a block away to the central train station and all the buses and taxis. I walked into town and it only took 20 mins. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. The hotel was very clean, beautiful room with great air conditioning! The breakfast wasnt very nice. The juice was warm and tasted old. The food was very dry, not very fresh. So if your booking, just ask for no breakfast. There are plenty of reasonable places to eat. I felt very safe at this hotel and enjoyed my stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel ..almost, almost GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Treds62
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Raffaello for 4 nights in July 2008 as part of our anniversary/second honeymoon. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance from Termini Station, a couple of Metro stations and several popular tourist sights including the Colossium/Roman Forum and Trevi fountain. The hotel and the rooms are clean, fresh and nicely decorated. For the most part the staff are friendly and helpful. Unfortunately the hotel lacks in-room internet access which is almost a requirement these days. The little 14" TV looked cheap and seemed out of place for such a nice hotel, I'd recommend they start updating to inexpensive LCD flat screens - clock radio/alarm clock in the room would be helpful also. Overall a lovely little hotel that we fully enjoyed and would certainly return to and recommend to others planning on visiting Rome in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “OK, Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Mac'sMummy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel on the basis of reviews and the hotel's location. I know there are much worse hotels in Rome but I didn't feel welcome or comfortable in this hotel. My first warning came at check in when we were told we had been "upgraded" from the room we booked to a larger one. I have travelled extensively in Europe, I know hotel rooms are small and I am not comparing it to an American hotel- trust me when I say this room was small. The desk clerk was not particularly welcoming at check in and when we had a question about the room he became rude and condescending. Another member of staff helped register my husband so he could have internet access and was OK. The lobby was lovely and breakfast was the normal croissants, yogurt & water-downed juice fare. As mentioned the room was small, it was dark, the "upgrade" gave us 2 single beds rather than the room we had booked months earlier (we were not pleased at this development) and the air conditioning didn't work properly- it ran but no cool air. The TV didn't really work either but who goes to Rome to watch Italian TV? The bathroom was uncomfortably small. The door opened only partially because it hit the toilet. When you sat on the toilet your legs were under the sink. Everything did seem clean but because the room was small, dark, and hot I have trouble recalling positives. Luckily, we were only in this hotel a night before we went to another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Rome has to offer, but not without its merits!”
Reviews.Author: mondojoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Raffaello in September 2006, though I suspect it's changed little since then, selected based on Trip Advisor reviews. The Raffaelo is very near the train station, the rooms are of adequate size, our stay included breakfasts which was convenient, and the staff are adequately friendly and English conversant. The hotel is somewhat lacking in amenities. There is no internet access, the air conditioning is almost non existent (though the AC remote control leaves you hoping you are finally making something happen!), and the shower is small even by Italian standards. (The shower is a tube, really.) Truth to tell, the Raffaello suffered in comparison with our hotel in Florence - had we not gone there I might have been more content with the Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: trevorwendy90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Raffaello Hotel the last week of May in 2008 and thought the hotel was nice. The location is close to the termini and we took the train to Vatican and Pantheon. However, very close to Colliseum and San Maria Maggiore. Rooms were nice and clean. The front desk was very friendly and helpful in providing restaurant recommendations. The breakfast buffet was good and service was very good. Overall we had a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and ok location but everything else...”
Reviews.Author: ConorBelfast
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on basis of mostly good reviews so was disappointed when I got there. The location is ok, fairly close to the train station, and it's quite clean and in good condition but found it to be a very very basic hotel. Room size was ok just but very lacking in even basic facilities: a pretty rubbish tv, air con switched off and no controls for it, a very badly advertised safety deposit box that required a key from reception, no hotel literature, no kettle to make tea/coffee, not even a 'do not disturb' sign for the door! Also, the bathroom displayed very mixed up priorities: there was a fancy power shower in it with multiple sprays but it took up nearly half the bathroom and you couldn't even sit on the toilet as a result! Why did the hotel think this was a good idea?!! Clammy heat in the room due to no a/c forced us to open the window (which opened out onto blank wall 2 foot away (not really complaining as this is a common feature in European cities)) which allowed some air in but also cigarette smoke from nearby rooms, yuck! Breakfast was again very basic with the only hot drink offered by the (harassed-looking!) waitress being coffee. When we asked to leave our luggage there for a few hours before catching a train, we were told to put it in behind a couch in the foyer. Hmm, not exactly reassuringly secure! Overall, pretty disappointed and won't be back unless it's an emergency.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AK1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The room was very nice with my only complaint being that the bed was too hard. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was great. The location was one street back off a main street. However, it was very quite. It is a short walk to the Termini train station which gives you access to not only the subway system but the the national rail system as well. If you like to walk, you'll find that you will be in easy walking distance to most of the major sites. Restaurants, cafes, bars, and shops are all within easy reach. Nothing in Rome is cheap and that includes this hotel. However, we were very happy with it and would recommend it. The one issue for some visitors is that the hotel is not well suited for those that need wheelchair access. The elevator is very small and delivers you to landings between floors. This means that you must either climb up or down a short flight of stairs to get to or from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Bevaldi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello for four nights at the end of our 11 day vacation through-out Italy. It was nice that it was close to the Termini train station but we felt it was a little far from everything else. The street it's on is not very clean, you had to watch your step, I guess not too many people cleaning after their dog. The rooms were nice, we are a family of four and had two connecting rooms which shared a bathroom. The bathroom was clean but the shower was very tight. The elevator only holds 3 persons. Breakfast was ok, I guess we had seen one croissant too many by the end of our trip. The room we were in had only one window which had a view of an interior courtyard...more like a lightwell, but it was clean and very comfortable. The staff at the front desk were not very friendly, if anything they seemed to be a bit crancky.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: crisdp57
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel for the money. We received breakfast on our arrival which was great! Our room was ready, very clean and nice. The hotel is located near the Colosseum so we took the Metro to visit the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The best meal we had was at Valentino on Via Del Boschetto, a favorite among Italians. Try the strawberry dessert...fabulous! I would suggest a guide for the Vatican and Colosseum. Contact Silvio at www.binrome.com.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Calfie
Reviews.Content: Very good location near the station, but on a small side street. We had room 106 which had a balcony. The room was okay size, nice decorated. It's a very good, clean hotel for a decent price in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star delight”
Reviews.Author: johnmcl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have always stayed in 4 or 5 star hotels abroad so it was with a little apprehension we made a late booking with the 3 star Raffaello. We need not have worried. Room 502 was one of the biggest rooms we have had on an Italian city break. On the top floor, with acres of hanging space, drawers galore, freshly decorated, very clean, super bathroom, (except no shower screen but actually had a window) and we even had a huge private rooftop terrace! Obviously all the rooms are not this size but we were delighted. Much has been said about rude reception staff. I found them professional and helpful. Admittedly, a few more smiles would have been nice but really, who cares? Located very close to Santa Maria Maggiore to the east of the centre it is a bit of a walk to St Peter's in the west or Borghese in the north but walk it we did. We are not as young or as fit as we were but we were in no hurry and saw all the sights by foot stumbling upon many a gem by accident but there are loads of buses and the Metro station is close by if walking is not your thing. The advantage of the location is the peace and quiet after a noisy, hectic day sightseeing. There are lots of eateries round about but I would recommend "Wanted" at the very bottom of Via Urbana for a great pizza and I think it was called "Archetta" down Via Cavour on the right just at the first main intersection for really friendly service and atmosphere. Just quickly, on another subject, we used Terravision to transfer from Pisa when we visited Florence recently. Suffice to say it was an absolute shambles. This trip we booked a private transfer through "TaxisAbroad.com" - first class, professional service. A lot dearer of course but, to me, money well spent. Literally two minutes from arrivals hall in Ciampino to leather seats in Mercedes. I would certainly recommend the Raffaello and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Raffaello is a gem.”
Reviews.Author: chemkid
Reviews.Content: We picked the Raffaello Hotel in Rome from this site, and it did not disappoint. Sometimes the pictures from the promotions exceed the value, but we found that that hotel was everything we wanted, and just like the pictures. It is a small hotel near the Forum, but just as cute as can be. The service was impeccable, the desk clerk friendly and helpful. The rooms were just out of this world. You can reach just about every attraction by walking, and there were many good restruants in the area as well. The breakfast in the morning was great as well. We would come back to the Raffaello in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Raffaello, LOVED Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Adam001
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried after reading a couple of reviews about small rooms and poor staff, but didn't have any problems. The room (404) was clean, well decorated and well appointed, with enough room for two adults and a nice-sized window overlooking the street. The bathroom was big, with a really effective, clean and new-looking shower (this wasn't the largest in the world, but at 6'4" even I could manage ok as long as I was careful!). The cleaners did a good job - but only if you had left your keycard at Reception! We forgot on the first day and the room wasn't cleaned. Most of the staff were friendly, attentive and keen to help, with the exception of one older guy who tended to do the evening shift, who was a bit offhand. The hotel is convenient for everything on the Eastern side of the river, as long as you call a 20-minute walk convenient. For us, who just wanted to amble all round Rome, it was fine. The walk from Termini station is under 10 minutes, but not the easiest if you're dragging a suitcase on wheels because of cobbles and narrow pavements. The best restaurants are a fair way away, but we went to Strega nearby a couple of times which was pretty good. We'd never been to Rome before and absolutely loved it. It's an ideal city to wander around, not as expensive as I was expecting, with amazing history that just leaps out at you every corner you turn. English is widely spoken but, as usual, a few words of Italian go a long way. Best things: watching the sun go down from the Spanish Steps, sitting in a cafe in a Piazza watching the world go by and just taking in all the sights as you wander round. Take care if you're a church fan, as many of them shut at 12 or 1pm for a few hours in the afternoon. Recommended trip - if you're fit, climb the 350 steps up inside the dome of St Peter's to get to the cupola - the view from the top is incredible. Final warning - the drivers are totally insane. The only rule is that, if someone ahead of you stops for more than half a second, you have to hoot your horn. Traffic lights are there for guidance only, so be VERY careful as a pedestrian when crossing the road!

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: bubbamorton
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 8 nights at the Raffaello Hotel & just loved everything about it! It was on a quiet out of the way street ,yet very convient to all the Rome sights.In fact whether you prefer the train for travel,only a 10 minute walk to Termini or enjoy walking the location is perfect.We found the reception staff to be attentive & professional & quite polite & helpful.The room ,although a bit on the small size was clean & perfect for sleeping after our long days touring Rome.If there was any negative at all it would be the size of the shower,which for a bigger person was tight.The breakfast was great with a variety of fresh croisants & bread,fresh fruit,yogurt,cereal,ham& salami,cheese,eggs & unlimted juice, espresso & cappucino.I highly reccomend the Raffaello!!

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Bodwood
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for a weekend, after much research into where to stay. After reading the other reviews it was good to find the hotel matched our expectations. The location was good, walking distance to almost anywhere, we walked to the Trivi fountain for dinner, only 15 min walk. The room was nice and clean, and the jacuzzi bath was great after a tiring day! Breakfast was good also, with good selection and effeicent service. I would have to agree that the service on reception was not impressive, but not bad enough to put me off choosing this hotel again. I am fairly particular about hotels but I have to say that this one ticked all the right boxes, and would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for train travelers”
Reviews.Author: ArtHistoryTeacher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little worn and has a strange vibe. It was adequate as a place to stay for a couple of nights, and conveniently located within walking distance from the train station. The interesting neighborhood seemed relatively safe if you walk with confidence. My room faced the street and it was quiet at night. The typical breakfast was included. Reception desk staff were not especially helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: taconsta
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a couple of days in April 2007. We were a bit taken aback when we found out that the contents of the minibar was not exactly what was on the "inventory" and feared we'll be riped off at the end of the stay. No, this did NOT happen. Overall we had a very nice stay there. Can warmly recommend, provided you don't expect 5 stars. The hotel is a bit off the beaten track. The good: - there are not cohorts of tourists around (this might change in high season, though) - rooms are very nice - bathrooms are even nicer (larger, to be more exact) - staff is nice and curteous - The hotel has a deal with Albergo del Senato: as a guest in Rafaello, you can get on the top of Albergo del Senato and peek at the top of the Pantheon. In summer you can also stay on the roof garten. It's worh it! The not so good (I can't really call it "bad"): - it takes about 15-20 minutes on small winding streets to get from Forum Romanum to the hotel. And we're fast walkers :-) - the breakfast "room" is a bit small and it might be that if you come late you'll have to wait for a free table - the windows are not really soundproof. This means that every now and then you hear the small motorcrades running on the street. That's not so bad as you might fear for two reasons: a) the street is a very small, one-way street with little traffic and b) I never got awaken by noise, my wife however complained a bit (to me, not to the staff). - there are not so many restaurants around. But not few, either. I can recommend Da Robertino (Via Panisperna 231): reasonable prices (can't really expect "low prices" in Rome!!), good service (can have a chat with the owner) and very nice food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel - glad to have picked it for our stay”
Reviews.Author: snippet_sf
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research and finally settled on the Raffaello for its price, reviews (on Tripadvisor and other sites) and location. I'm happy to say that our stay at the Raffaello was excellent. The room was nice, the bath clean, the breakfast excellent and the location good (not exactly overlooking the Roman Forum, but a short walk--that's why you're getting a better price). The only downside, as mentioned by other reviewers, is the front desk staff. They're friendly enough, but don't necessarily make you feel welcome. The best way to describe it is that they seem only a heart beat away from being snippy (if you were to cross some line and become a problem). Still, reception is only a minor irritation that shouldn't make you cross the hotel off your list since there are so many other things to recommend it. The hotel faces a small street just off a main thoroughfare, Via Cavour (that goes from the Termini Train Station to the Roman Forum area), making the location both quiet and convenient (note: I saw a lot of hotels that we ON the main thoroughfare--avoid these at all costs since the road is extremely loud and dirty). One concern I had was that the hotel might be too close to the train station (note: the less expensive hotels are near the train station). I had heard that the area around the train station was to be avoided since it attracts unsavory people (pick pockets, bums, peddlers, etc.). I can happily report that the area around the hotel is quite pleasant. The train station is far enough away that it is not a problem--yet close enough that you can easily walk with your roller bag luggage just fine (pleasant walk on flat streets that takes about 10 minutes--but I'd take a cab at night). And lastly, the shower in our room was this strange one person thing made by Jacuzzi (water jets squirt from the sides). It was so small I could barely turn around let along reach down and soap my legs. I'm only 5'-9" and not heavy, so you can imagine how small it was. I gather they don't have this type of shower unit in all of the rooms, so ask about the size of the shower in your room if think it's going to be a problem. I will stay at the Rafaello if I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TopHat
Reviews.Content: Great hotel reasonably close to "everything". when the weather was below average it was really great to have a comfy hotel room to come home to. Could not here a thing from the other rooms, which make it a very good place in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel. Couldn't fault anything!”
Reviews.Author: aliso_conn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raffaello is an excellent base for your trip to Rome. Rooms are quite big and very clean. Breakfast was lovely & was served from 7 - 10am. Staff were always very pleasant & spoke good English. We cannot fault this hotel and would definately recommend it. There's a lovely cocktail bar approx 50m from the hotel (towards the colosseum on the back st) and Bella Roma restaurant in the direction of the termini does excellent food, with a large selection. We would recommend a visit to the cupola at St Peters Basilica, but beware the 320 steps are extremely narrow!! We landed on a free tour of the Forum which was extremely informative - cost of ticket was 11 euros (this gives access into forum AND colosseum). We paid 45 euros for a tour of the Vatican, which was expensive, but meant we only had to queue for 90 minutes instead of the 3 hours!! Great ice cream shop near by too called blue... Scholars lounge (irish bar) , over near the chiesa gesu does good food. The metro is good if you don't want to walk. 1 euro... a bargain! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmccaleb
Reviews.Content: We (me, wife, her sister) stayed at the Raffaello for 6 nights in early March 2008. We had a "quad room", actually two adjoining rooms, one with a king bed, the second with two twin beds. The rooms were good size, nicely furnished, well-lighted, and very clean. The bathroom was spotless, adequately sized, with a nice selection of toiletries. Breakfast was excellent, including the usual selection of breads, pastries, cereals, fruits, plus scrambled eggs, and the breakfast room staff was very accommodating. The hotel arranged an early morning private car to the airport, although the price quoted was 50 euros and the actual price was 55 (not a big deal). Our room was on the fourth floor overlooking an air shaft--not much of a view but very quiet. I cannot add much to the the positive comments in all the preceding reviews and the hotel's pictures are very accurate. The location is excellent--an easy, slightly downhill walk from Termini with lots of reasonably priced restaurants and gelateria, Internet cafes, and souvenir shops within a couple of blocks. All Rome's busses converge at Termini along with the two metro lines and the express train to the airport. It is about a 15 minute walk to the Forum/Coliseum area or to Piazza Venezia. Walking to the Pantheon/Piazza Navona area or to the Trevi/Spanish Steps area is a bit farther, but doable if you are a good walker. We are good walkers, but we used the metro to get to the Vatican and took a taxi back from Trastevere. We booked the room on Expedia for $1700 for the 6 nights, which we considered quite reasonable, and were I to return to room, I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - disinterested reception”
Reviews.Author: terry_j_quinn
Reviews.Content: I have recently enjoyed a short mid-week break in Rome and stayed at the Hotel Rafaello. The tripadvisor reviews were pretty close to the mark i.e. good location, pleasant and reasonably quiet surroundings and good quality breakfast served by helpful staff. If it hadn't been for the fairly disinterested manner of some of the reception staff I would probably have struggled to find fault with this hotel. However they generally seemed to avoid eye contact and conversation if at all possible and were disppointingly inadequate at dealing with even minor queries let alone a defective credit card machine. However don't let this put you off choosing the hotel. Its a small, clean, quiet hotel in the middle of Rome which offers pretty good value for money and provides an excellent base to explore the many wonders of this fascinating city. Just don't expect a hug from the receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PRVBB
Reviews.Content: Raffaello Hotel is in a great location close to the Forum, Colosseum, Termini train station (we arrived by train and walked to the hotel around 7:30pm) and a host of small restaurants. The hotel was clean and had a nice complimentary breakfast which included eggs (scrambled and hard boiled), fruit, cold meats and cheese and an ample amount of breads and pastries. Rooms looked like they had been recently renovated with fabric wall coverings, tiled bathrooms (with lots of toiletries), cable television (if you are ever in the room to watch), heat and air conditioning. The heat worked great (I understand this not the case in a lot of hotels in Rome). When I booked our room, I was only able to get a two room suite the first night and then reserve two rooms for the last two night (we were traveling with our two boys, ages 9 and 12 and we have found that booking two room suites is often cheaper than booking two rooms). Upon arrival, the front desk manager told us to check back in the morning to see what he could about keeping us in the same room. Fortunately for us, he was able to make that happen. Now, that may not always be the case, but it was nice to have a helpful, friendly person behind the desk rather than and individual unwilling to try with a nasty attitude. We would stay at the Raffeallo again - great price, great location, great accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mar51
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our four college aged daughters spent four nights at the Raffaello on our family vacation. I had spent many hours finding a hotel that would suit our needs, and I wasn't disappointed. After a very long trip from Los Angeles, we were delighted to find our rooms ready for us when we arrived. Even though our luggage was still somewhere back in England. I was a little nervous about being so close to the train station, but the area was fine. It really was very convenient to be so close to the railway station and the major bus lines. The three rooms we had booked were all spotlessly clean and quite roomy by European standards. The bathrooms were very clean and quite modern even if the shower was a bit small. My husband and I had a lovely balcony overlooking the main street which was not busy. The breakfast was by far the best we had while in Italy. Fresh juice and breads...meats and cheeses...fruits and cereals. It was a very pleasant and relaxing way to start our days' adventures. The staff was more than helpful especially when our luggage did not arrive with us in Italy. The staff was wonderful with phone calls to the airlines to help reunite us with our luggage. My husband will be eternally grateful. (Can you imagine five women all needing eighteen days worth of new clothing?) Thank you especially to Massimo who went out of his way to help us have a great vacation. I will most definitely stay here again whenever I am in Rome, and I most certainly will recommend this hotel to my friends. Enjoy your stay, Marlene Schuberg

Reviews.Title: “Good value for less than 100 Euro per night !!!”
Reviews.Author: PJ_IG
Reviews.Content: We booked on their homepage (www.hotelraffaello.it) and got a really good deal for less than 100 Euro per night (as we stayed 4 nights). Breakfast was included and was good (for Rome at least as usually you don´t get eggs and muesli etc). Within 20 minutes walk you can reach everything - don´t forget to bring good shoes as you will walk a lot in Rome. We had very good pizza right around the corner in a nice restaurant (L´Angelo Di Napoli; pizza 9 €, bottle house wine 9 €). We tried an expensive restaurant (Al Presidente) which had a menu for 50-70 € but this was not worse the money. I would stay with the simple Italian Pizzeria... Rome is great - you´ll love it. But don´t forget to look after your money, we always only had cash in our pockets, but no credit cards, passports etc... they will be gone once you use the bus...

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDelMundo
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel online and booked it through a website other than the hotel's site. We paid 110 Euro a night which was a bargain compared to the hotel's website. The hotel was warm and cozy and quiet. We had asked for a high floor and were given the top floor (5th floor) with a lovely terrace overlooking the rooftops of Rome. This hotel has great breakfast, an okay staff (front desk staff a little grumpy) and is close to many of Rome's great tourist attractions. The shower is really tiny but refreshing none the less. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: asturias2905
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the $. NIce breakfast, nice location. people in the front desk have a funny sense of humor, but the rooms are clean, not really big. The bathroom has not bath tops, just a small shower. I mean VERY SMALL, people ho are overweight may have issues taking showers without touching the panels. Overall it was good

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Hotel Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: city-tripper-40
Reviews.Content: Hotel was exactly like all good reviews on Tripadvisor. It was newly decorated, and very, very clean. Room was great - balcony over side street, warm, and comfortable. Ensuite was very small, but again, newly upgraded. Shower very small, and space inside taken up with jacuzzi shower which was a bit of a toy. Location is great - easy to walk to from main Termini as well as to all the sites. In other reports, it was noted that the staff were unfriendly - I did not find this. However, like a lot of Italians we met in restaurants etc, they were not "gushing" - anything we asked for was given with a smile, but you had to ask! Would recommend to anyone - have stayed in worse 4-star hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dtnh
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be within walking distance to several attractions in Rome and convenient to the Termini train station. This hotel was perfect for that purpose. The lift is very small, and stops between floors, so you have to get your luggage up and down a half flight. However the porter will help if you ask. The water pressure is great, the breakfast room is fine. The rooms are comfortable, but small, and they have blackout curtains. The front desk staff is not overy helpful, but if you engage them in conversation (most speak very good English), they are outgoing and pleasant. We were very satisfied with this hotel and consider it a good value. There is a central computer, with which you can use the internet for a small fee. There is also wireless, but we did not use it. The tvs are tiny and old, with only one english channel. This was not important to us however.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: richap
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from the travel agency at the Venice train station before leaving Venice to go to Rome. We were pleasantly surprised! What a wonderful hotel, staff was incredible and the breakfast one of the best that we had between Venice and London. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “raffaello.”
Reviews.Author: markBasildonEssex
Reviews.Content: 19th to 22nd january 2008. Mark.Basildon. just stayed 3 nights at the Raffaello hotel in Rome. Absolutely loved Rome. Hotel was the best 3 star that we have stayed in Italy.Rooms were of very high standard and hotel in general had a touch of 4 star class throughout. Breakfast(served from 7 to 10am|) was good but get their early to get the hot scrambled eggs. Location was perfect for all major sightseeing trips.only a 10 minute stroll to colloseum or max 15 minutes to Trevi fountains. Only thing lacking was a hotel Bar but the Druids Irish bar was on the next street corner. Highly recommended and we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “What a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: Demeter
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on lastminute and cross referenced it with Tripadvisor, had great reviews. We were really pleased with what we found. So close to all the sights, and the room was delighful, very clean and comfortable. Breakfast had a great choice to set you up for exploring during the day. The staff are not the friendliest, but that's ok, after walking around Rome all day you don't want to be hanging around in the lobby discussing it! I would highly recommend the Raffaello and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..a bit of a walk to the attractions”
Reviews.Author: andreat22
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Raffaello was by far the nicest, most comfortable hotel we stayed in in Italy--the decor was impressive, room clean/cozy, bathroom clean with nice toiletries. The staff was uniformly warm, accommodating, and helpful. Breakfast was much better than other hotels in its class. The room was a bit too warm, which was a change from the other hotels we encountered during our Dec/Jan trip. The only real downside was the distance to many of the top attractions: I was 6 months pregnant at the time of our trip and the hike to/from some of the sites was a bit too much for me. For those who don't mind a good solid walk each day, this is an unbeatable option!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel for a rommantic get away”
Reviews.Author: garyb10688
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Christmas through New Year 2008. We had a wonderful time. The room is among the best we stayed in, in Europe. The location was great! - walking distance to Termini and to the main historic locations. The room was very clean and had a full size bath. Our bed was two twins put togther to make a queen size or larger bed. The breakfast was good as well and had a large assorment of pastrys, bread, meat and even scrambled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice”
Reviews.Author: i_like_2vacation
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty nice. Nothing really stands out as spectacular, but I had a very nice experience there. If I go back to Rome I would probably try a new place. But I do think this hotel is a very safe bet. It is centrally located, not too far from the train terminal, subway, or Coliseum. Taxis are easy to get if you want to travel beyond walking distance. It is on a side street so it is pretty quiet. I'd be surprised if anyone reading this is going to drive and park at the hotel, but if you are, they do not offer parking. The hotel is located in a restricted driving zone. Breakfast was fair, it wasn’t bad, but it wasn’t great. We would actually just eat right down the street for breakfast. They have a computer with Internet access. We had a room with a balcony, that was great! We got a bottle of wine, and just relaxed outside on our own private balcony. I would recommend a balcony. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good If You Can Get A Cheap Rate”
Reviews.Author: larover
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel if you can get a good price. I would expect it to be priced considerably below other hotels rated higher either on Tripadvisor or that had a higher star rating. The rooms are quite small. I was travelling solo so the room was acceptable to me but it would have been tight for more then one person. You can hear a bit of noise from neighboring rooms. Breakfast was decent and more than adequate with a pleasant wait staff. The rooms and hotel in general are spotless and well appointed for a three star hotel. It is in a slightly less desirable part of town than say the hotels near the Spanish steps but Rome is quite small and virtually everything is walk able. The hotel is very close to the Termini train station which is also the main bus station. That made it very easy to get around cheaply. From wherever I was I could just look for a bus going to Termini…..quite easy…….same with the metro. For 16 euros you can get a pass for unlimited bus and metro transport although the metro and buses are only 1 euro. There were several reasonable restaurants in the neighborhood and also more expensive ones that tended to be quite good. This is still a tourist area with quite a few hotels around however they tend to be two and three star hotels and the restaurants were seemingly cheaper than in other areas of town. Unfortunately while I was staying at the hotel I received a phone call from the United States that my father had died and I had to return to the States for the funeral. The hotel was of no help to me in this regard. No assistance in rebooking my flights and not even a condolence from either of the two attendants I dealt with at the front desk during the 16 hour period I was making arrangements to leave Rome. The only thing they told me was to make sure I did not make any calls outside the hotel on the house phone near the lobby. When I checked out of the hotel I was advised that since I did not stay over a Sunday evening (I was checking out Sunday morning due to my father’s death) the rate I was paying for each of the four evenings I was at the hotel had increased 10%. This was not a big deal to me. However, the airlines and other hotels I was cancelling reservations with could not have been nicer. Refunding deposits in full and asking how they could help me out. The staff at The Raffaello were not nasty or unpleasant just not helpful in my emergency and not very understanding or compassionate or willing to help in any way and I had been tipping them nicely during my stay. In sum I would say if you get a very good rate stay here. The hotel does have a lot going for it. Only do not expect any assistance in an emergency situation. If you cannot get a very good rate then I would pass on this hotel. If not for the lack of assitance or understanding with my emergency I would have given this hotel a very high rating. So if you have no emergency you should be more than fine but I would still urge you to stay only if you have a competitive rate visa vi other hotels. Oh one last thing…..right around the corner is an internet store where you can access the internet for 1 euro per half hour and make long distance phone calls quite cheaply.

Reviews.Title: “Great refuge after long days of sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: atlantic_transplant
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello was a great place to make our headquarters while we visited the sites of Rome. The hotel is with convenient walking/metro distance to all the sites we wanted to see (Coliseum, Ruins, Baths, Museum, etc.) We reserved a room with two twin beds (looks just like the yellow room, with the two paintings, computer and newspapers on the bed on the hotel site, under rooms. Our room also had a small bureau and coat hooks on the wall with the window). It was just enough space for two. The room was comfortable, clean and nicely decorated with very high ceilings. The room included the two beds, a desk, a closet; a few night stands and a mini frig. We also had a curious view of the church terrace right outside our room. The bathroom included a stand-up shower (no tub) that always had good water pressure and hot water. Breakfast is absolutely great. There is a good continental assortment of breads, pastries, meats, cheese, fruits and cereal. There is also a station for scrambled eggs. The breakfast room is also very cozy, with tablecloth, settings, etc. Coffee, tea or cappuccino served to you at your table, and the friendly staff added to making this a good way to ease into the day. The front desk staff was friendly enough (per the other reviews): We mostly dealt with the night staff, chatting as we did our late night surfing and research. There is wireless internet available at the hotel. We pre-paid for 6 non-consecutive hours, and because of the non-consecutive were able to make it stretch across several nights. For the value, comfort and convenience, I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to friends. The Raffaello was a cozy and comfortable refuge to return to after long days of sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Desertgirl1960
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Raffaello during our 25th anniversary trip to Rome in Sept. 2007. The Raffaello is in a great, convenient location just down Via Cavour from Termini station. We took a cab from the airport to the hotel which was quite expensive - 60 euro. There is an express train from the airport to Termini station. Keep in mind that if you have a lot of luggage (more than one rolling suitcase each) it might be better to take a cab. Via Cavour is a main street in Rome and the sidewalks are very crowded, made of uneven cobblestone and very narrow in spots. Navigating this street with a lot of luggage would be very difficult at best even if you are in good shape like us. Also, going to the hotel from Termini is downhill - going back to Termini from the hotel is uphill. Our room was ready upon arrival, however it had a strange smell and the t.v. didn't work. We asked to be moved and were given another room immediately which was much nicer. The elevator is about the size of a coat closet so we chose to use the stairs. Our room consisted of a bed, wardrobe and a desk. Air conditioning worked well. Our room faced a side street and was very quiet so sleeping was not a problem. The room was spotlessly clean. The bathroom was immaculate and had a bidet (which I did not use). The shower was like a tube and extremely small - no exageration here - once we got in the shower it was difficult to move. My husband and I are thin people so it was not a problem for us, but I can't imagine trying to use the shower if you are a larger person. However, the shower had great water pressure and there was always plenty of hot water any time of day. If you like to use a wash cloth, bring your own - they do not provide them at the hotel. I bought some at a dollar store before we left the States so I did not care if they were left at the hotel. The breakfast was nice. Sweet breads, meats, eggs (extremely runny - but this seems to be the standard in Europe). We always got there early so there was plenty to chose from. The front desk was friendly enough but not overly so. They recommended a restaurant nearby that was very good. They were also very helpful in booking a day trip to Naples and Pompei. There are plenty a restaurants nearby and the food was very good everywhere we ate. The gelati is great no matter where you go. We always felt very safe walking the streets around the hotel after dark. The streets of Rome can be very confusing so bring a good map. We used the hop-on, hop off open air bus the first day to get a feel for the city and where things were. This was a great was to get familiar to the city and get to all the main attractions without using the metro. We used the metro once to get to the Vatican and found the system cheap (1 euro each way) and easy to use. We took a day trip to Naples and Pompei. We were picked up at the hotel around 7 p.m. and dropped off about 8:30 p.m. The trip included lunch at a hotel and was very good. Pompei was amazing and the highlight of the entire trip to Italy! I would NOT recommend doing a tour of the Vatican Museum on your own. The lines start forming before 6 a.m. very day and by the time the museum opens, the lines extend for about 10 blocks. Most people we talked to waited 5-7 hours in line. If you go with a tour group, you get immediate access with your group and a guided tour that is very informative. Our tour started at 9 a.m. and was done about 2 p.m. and worth every penny (about 40 euros each). All in all, I would highly recommend the Raffaello hotel. We only used the room to sleep in at the end of very long, exhausting days so we did not need a large, luxurious room. If you are looking for a nice, clean place to stay and not break the budget, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: wavecatcher28
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights. We have stayed in several hotels before but were very impressed with the Raffaello. The location was superb - only 10 mins walk from Termini station. From the hotel we walked everywhere and never once had to get public transport. The Colliseum was only 10 minutes walk away. Superb and reasonably priced restaurants were only around the corner from the hotel. The welcome at reception was great (Fabio, you know who you are!), there were fresh apples on the counter each day and the rooms were spotless. However do not use the lift if you have more than 1 case - it can get a bit cramped! Breakfast was fresh - we did crave toast but it had everything else you could want and we were able to take away fresh fruit for the day. By night, this hotel is located very near to the Druids Inn / pub which is a sports bar and was quite busy, a mix of locals and holidaymakers. All in all, we would definitely receommend this hotel. For a 3 * you don't expect a lot, but this hotel more than exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Off-Season_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel within walking distance of the train station, yet also close to the main attractions in Rome. We got off the Leonardo Express and it took less than 10 minutes to walk to the hotel. This made for a great place to start our day. The room was spacious by European standards and had a very high ceiling. We stayed on the 1st floor, so we didn't have a view to speak of. Fortunately the side street below was relatively quiet. The room was also clean which is vital to us. The bed was a bit too firm for our liking, but we made do. If you like a firm bed, you shouldn't be disappointed. The breakfasts were consistent and very good. We would get there around 7:00 when there were less people. Coffee, cappuccino, tea, etc... would be brought to your table. There were meats and cheese, croissants, fruit, cereal, and different pies. There were also scrambled eggs, but by getting there early, they were rather runny. We came later one morning and they were much firmer having sat in the pan longer. The staff was friendly and very helpful. They spoke English, which is pretty much expected in Rome. There is a computer for internet access that has a fee. You buy a card with times of 30 minutes, 55 minutes, or 3 hours. Prices at internet cafe's will be better, but if you have some down time late at night it's convenient. The only negatives I experienced were the tight fit to use the toilet with the bidet right there and that it didn't have an enclosure for a shower. There was plenty of room in the bathroom that it could have been laid out much better. But that's as bad as it got, if you consider that bad...

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: nobody291
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews posted here. We weren't disappointed. The hotel is centrally located with respect to the historical sites. There are plenty of restaurants in the area. The hotel was very responsive to our email inquiries and negotiated a very favorable rate for two rooms. The lift is small, three of us couldn't fit with all of our bags. Once you arrive at your floor you still must walk up or down stairs with your bags since the lift stops between floors (likely because the building was designed well before elevators had been conceived of). If carrying your bags up/down 8-10 stairs is a problem, don't stay here. Our room was quiet and had a nice balcony overlooking the streets around the hotel. The breakfast was similar to what we saw at other hotels in Italy. There was meat/cheese, pastries, cereal, yogurt, scrambled eggs, fruit, coffee, tea, etc. We had one double room, which was typically sized for Europe (i.e. it is small by American standards). There was room for our bags, a closet, a desk, and the queen bed. There wasn't much extra room though. The bathroom was clean, but the shower was small...just barely enough room to move around inside. My Mom had a single room, so it was very small, but adequate for one person. I don't think there's really an American equivalent to the European single room. Just keep in mind that there's just enough room for a fairly small bed, closet, and not much else. There's plenty of room, but don't expect what you'd get at a Marriott in the U.S. Her bathroom was pretty much the same as our room. Overall we'd be happy to stay here again, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: excelden
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! We booked this hotel based on the positive reviews. First of all this hotel is very well kept and the rooms smell fresh and are very very clean. We booked a double room on the internet for 125.00 cdn a night. My wife and myself were travelling with our 6 year old son and thought that he would be able to sleep with us in a King size bed(most double beds in Europe are actually King size beds). Upon arrival we found out that it was a Queen size bed in the room, so we asked for a cot for our son, but the front desk guy said that he would change our room to a larger triple room at no extra charge. WOW!! this kind of thing from our experience doesn't happen there is always an extra charge. The room was very large!! Breakfast was included as well and had the usual fare scrambled eggs pastry etc. but no toast ! Not a big deal. Everything was very fresh. We rented a car in Venice and needed to drop it off in Rome driving in Rome in nerve racking and not recommended. We asked the Bell guy where the rental car location was and he offered to go with us and take us there so we took him up on his offer we thought that he really went out of his way and was well worth the 10 euro tip we gave him. Close to all major attractions but St. Peters basilica is a bit of a walk. We would recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for good clean comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: DuncRedcar
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Raffaello for 3 nights on the 5th November and booked it on the reviews from this site. Hotel were very helpful organising a limo from the airport (55 euro), interesting drive if you haven't experienced Rome traffic and arrived at the hotel 11.00 am and were able to check straight in. Room very clean and adequate size for 3 of us with a well appointed bathroom with tub and shower (Rm 306). Location was good with all main areas within walking distance or good bus/underground links close by. We would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnneSmith9
Reviews.Content: 18-23 October. We stayed at the Raffaello Hotel for 5 nights in room 106 the hotel, room, reception staff, service, breakfast we could be fault. The room was spacious, light, airy and very clean, with a good supply of toiletries in the bathroom. The towels and bed linen were charged daily. If I had to find fault the shower was a little on the small size but don’t leave the all round power jets on, leave the door open and turn it on – you get very wet! At the reception there was fruit and sweets which you could take as necessary which was a nice touch. If you arrive by train, which we did, turn left out of the station over the road to the green pharmacy sign and walk down Via Cavour to you reach Basilica de Santa Maria Maggiore which is about 300 meters down on the right, make a right down Via Agostino Depretis and turn left at the bottom the hotel is about 50 yards down on the left. It took us about 10 minutes, as I walk slowly. Don't make a mistake and go down Via Massimo D'Azelio from the station as the road comes to a dead end when it joins Via Torino. The hotel is on the corner of Via Ruinaglia and Via Urbana. There are quite a few good restaurants within a few minutes walk of the hotel – if you stay off the main streets like Via Cavour you will get a better deal. The staff in the hotel are very friendly and very helpful, great with advice on which bus to catch to the various sights round the city. If you turn left out of the hotel you can find a pharmacy, deli and a cheap pizza place, it selling pizza by slices for 1 euro and it's open until late. In all a great place to set up base to get around Rome. Would use the hotel again if we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynata
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and couldn't have been happier. Being within 10 minutes walk of the Termini is very helpful since you can get anywhere from there. Our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was a nice way to start your day without having to go out and search for a place to eat. The food was varied, abundant and good! Everything was very clean and the hotel looked well maintained. You can walk just about anywhere from this hotel except the Vatican and that was an easy 20 minute bus ride from Termini. There are also many restaurants within several blocks and a great Irish Pub, Druid's Rock, about a block away. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Italian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoobarbCambride_UK
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Midnight, tired and hungry at the Hotel Rafaello after flight difficulties. It was so nice to be greeted by a smiling face and be given such a warm welcome. Our room was very comfortable with a spacious bathroom. The first morning we had a tepid shower but after mentioning this to the man on Reception from thereon we had lovely, hot showers. The breakfasts were superb and an excellent way to build up strength for sightseeing! Our stay at this hotel was everything we wished it to be: comfortable, in a nice area (never once felt unsafe), within walking distance of the sights, restaurants and public transport, great breakfasts and friendly staff. All in all a lovely Italian Hotel and we would certainly like to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Mamma-on-the-go
Reviews.Content: Very nice room! Clean, ample space. They provided a cot, free of charge. The breakfast was filling, typical European spread: boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, yogurts, breads, cold meats, cereals, juices. They had these phenomenal croissants that had chocolate or jam inside...yum! All staff were very professional and friendly. They recommended Ristorante Tema, it's a block away and the food was delightful - would definitely return to restaurant and hotel! We left our jackets in the wardrobe and they arranged *at our expense* to have them shipped to us...received in good condition!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first stay”
Reviews.Author: Jleesure
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our 2 week Italian Honeymoon. Lobby, rooms, and staff- everything was wonderful. All staff we encountered spoke perfect English. Room was a bit smaller than American standards, but it had plenty of space. It had high ceilings and a large window, which made it seem bigger. Room was clean and furnishings were in very good condition. Bathroom was large and spotless. The included continental breakfast was much more than the continental I am used to. They had a huge spread with everything from cereal to bread and croissants, hard-boiled eggs, screamed eggs and meat. Along with variety of juice to choose from and staff brought out your choice of hot beverage (American Coffee, Cappuccino, Tea). The hotel is an excellent location. Only about a 7-minute walk to the Termini Train Station, 15 minutes to the coliseum and just a few minutes from the nearest Metro station. While the hotel is conveniently located close to lots of restaurants and major attractions it is set on a side street that is less noisy My only advise would be bring your own map. The tourist map the hotel hands outs will send you in circles trying to find your way back to the hotel the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Vivi28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and nice and we got a bigger than expected room. It's a better value for the money than Capo D'Africa which we also stayed at but it doesn't have the lovely rooftop area and updated bathrooms that Capo did. I might stay here again but there was really no wow factor and the location isn't great unless you really want to be close to the train station for some reason. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Belly2007
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located near the train station - room was very large, but the carpeted floors were a bit creaky. Bathroom fairly large as well. Overall, clean hotel and would stay here again. It isn't located in the shopping areas but that was okay for us as we didn't want to be around all the noise and jumble of tourists. everything was just a short 6euro cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sinskey3643
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Europe after having booked our various hotel accommodations solely based on TA reviews/recommendations. Hotel Rafaello is terrific and exactly as everyone has described. I would only add the following to what seems to be the general consensus: 1.) Our room was actually larger than expected, though seemingly all the rooms have different decor and layouts, so this may not be the case for everyone. We were on the 4th floor along the alley; very quiet both from an indoor and outdoor perspective....never heard anything from adjacent rooms and with the windows shut, city noise was barely a whisper. Turn the A/C to quiet mode and you are in for a good night sleep. Very clean and the furnishings are all tasteful with no signs of wear. 2.) Bathroom itself was also on the large side in comparison to other places we'd been. Yes, the Jaccuzi shower was a tight fit, but it worked great and plenty of hot water. I suppose if I had to mark down for something, this would be it, but honestly, it wasn't that much of a bother for us. 3.) The staff was terrific....we especially enjoyed the ladies attending the breakfast which had all the typical Euro choices. The staff mostly understands English, but I think appreciated our (faltering) attempts at Italian. 4.) The elevator stops on a landing between each floor which may be confusing upon first use. The staff will tell you which floor number you need to select in order to walk down half a flight of stairs to your floor rather than up half a flight. 5.) While the property is near the Termini, it is not exactly right around the corner....not necessarily far enough to take a cab, but if you have a lot of luggage, you may work up a bit of a sweat getting there (about 15 mins). 6.) While the Cavour metro station is the closest, it is the other line that goes to many of the attractions that are beyond quick walking distance (Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese, Vatican). You can transfer between the lines at the Termini, but it was somewhat of a walk between platforms and frequently a madhouse so we eventually found it easier to use the Repubblica station instead. The metro day pass at 4 euros is a pretty good deal, though the system coverage is sparse when compared to the likes of London or Paris. 7.) Print up a map of the area beforehand and then take the one provided by the Hotel everywhere you go. City planning being what it was back in the day, it is really easy to get turned around in Rome even for those who otherwise have a good sense of direction (though there are worse things than being lost in Rome). 8.) Definitely take advantage of the roof top terrace at the sister property Hotel Senato. You can get a pass at the Rafaello front desk, although the desk at the Senato did not ask to see it. It's quite busy around sunset, then less so afterward depending on what you are looking for; the bartender is a hoot and was one of the few people in Europe who knew how to make a proper martini. The view is magnificent. Unless you require a view of the Colosseum out your window, I can highly recommend the Rafaello and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: skp115
Reviews.Content: This was definititely a good hotel 3 star hotel to stay in Rome. The room we were alocated was 310. It was a comfortable to stay in and a good size compared to other hotels in France or Italy. As the readers will know from reading on this site the showers are out of this world - It says jacuzzi on it but have no idea whether it massages you with water jets - but you have to be careful not bump hips, legs etc... while turning. It represents great value at around 110-125 euros but I would consider it expensive at 140 euros which is sometimes requested at high seasons. Breakfast was good with coffee or tea and had enough variety to keep people satisfied. The hotel is walking distance to Termini, walk down via cavour and it's go into street on your right once you pass the white church Santa Maria Magiore which is on your left. Use the bus for 4 Euro for 24 hours to go around Rome. The colleseum and the roman forum can be walked to if you feel like it. For the vatican we have used the metro from the Termini metro station

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: bubbyeboston
Reviews.Content: I can thoroughly recommend the Raffaello. It's conveniently located near both the Termini Station and the major sites, yet it's also on a relatively quiet side street. The rooms are fairly spacious and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was excellent. My only criticism of the hotel is the shower stall, which is a shower "tube" (at least it was in our bathroom). I'm petite and it was a squeeze for me. My husband had to scrunch down. I think a large person would have a pretty uncomfortable shower. Lastly, a tip that no one told us about until we remembered something about a roof deck and asked about it: Guests have access to the private rooftop garden of the Hotel Senato, the hotel’s sister property located in front of the Pantheon. I would have enjoyed taking advantage of this -- I'm sure the view would have been wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for 3 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Dimarchis
Reviews.Content: For a three star hotel this was great! Not too far from the station, although if you have a suitcase it might be a bit far. Good location to shops (via Nationale) and sight-seeing. We arrived too early for the 2pm checkin but we left our bags and the staff advised that they'd take our bags up to our room once it was ready so we didn't have to rush back at 2pm. Room was a decent size as too was the bathroom - it had a massage shower! Very clean. On the first night they turn down your beds and leave some lollies on the bedside tables, so that was a nice surprise. Breakfast was great, they even ask if you would a cappucino, tea etc. Lots of variety. Small lift, but that seems pretty standard in Italy. Staff friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: alanmorgan73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights mid sept after reviewing the comments made on trip advisor based on 3 star hotels. We where not dissapointed at all being a 5min walk from the collesium and walking distance to the centre of the city. We had plenty of resturants within 5 mins of us to choose from in a very safe area of Rome. The hotel rooms where spot on for the price nice size and comfortable. We would stay there again if visiting Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “loved rome”
Reviews.Author: kaylangib
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel raffaello after returning from a cruise.We found the hotel exellent , we had booked a double room for our three nights in rome and found them to be very spacious with two separate rooms .the kids had one large room with tv and we had a double bed again with tv and mini bar. the rooms we found them to be exactly like in the photographs , very highly decorated , air conditioned throughout the entire hotel , hotal staff were very friendy and very close to the main attractions.termini station is about 300 meters from the hotel.Breakfast we found it to be exellent for our needs.we will certainly recommend this hotel to family and friends , and if we ever return to rome i have no hesitation to stay there again infact i would look foward to it.Via urbana is quiet so no traffic noise and you also find very good restaurants close by.if you need to move around rome in order to visit the city , my advice is either do it by metro were a day pass will cost you 5 euros per person but be careful with pick pockets or alternatively you can also visit the city by touristic buses (hop on hop off this costs 12 euros per person

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Edelrose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Raffaello Hotel for six nights in August. It's a great little hotel and a good value. Our stay was very pleasant. Our room was clean, quiet, and spacious enough for the two of us. The hotel is conveniently located about a ten minute walk from the Termini train station. Walks to the major sites in Rome take from 15 to 30 minutes. The staff at the front desk (Francesca, Massimo, etc.), and others throughout the hotel were very friendly and helpful, which made our stay all the more pleasant. Breakfast was included in the price of the room. There was lots of variety, good coffee, and the friendly service was very attentive. We would return to this hotel and certainly recommend it to our friends. Michael (& Karla) Chicago, IL USA

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: charlieflower
Reviews.Content: Well I was taken as a surprise for my 30th birthday and what a fantastic surprise it was. This hotel is lovely, a great location to the bus station from the airport, and easy walking distance to the colluseum. The rooms were huge, with fairly rich heavy decor to be expected in Rome, with a balcony overlooking the street, but a good view of the city, and glourious in the morning with the sound of the bells ringing all over. We also had a nice surprise at about 7.30, as we had a knock on the door with champagne and nibbles deliver, my boyfriend was like oh know I didnt order this and became a bit flustered but the hotel and provided this as a happy birthday gift as they had written a card with the tray. They had looked at the passports at check in and had the consideration to provide this, which we thought was exceptionally thoughtul and lovely too. The breakfasts were buffet style so you could eat as much as you wanted, enjoy! Wonderful stay and lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: jmd_xz
Reviews.Content: Great service at the desk. Showed on the maps some great walks and bars to go to by night and where to avoid the tourist trap restaurants and go where the italians eat. There was a really nice restaurant a few minutes walk from the hotel which we enjoyed after arriving at 10.00 at night. Rooms we quiet basic but had nice shower, TV, and comfortable with your standard italian deco. Nice view of the architecture into the back roads of Rome and was all air conditioned. one thing though, if you are arriving by shuttle to Termini Station even though the hotel is very close to it, still get one of the white taxis outside because we walked for 45mins asking people which street it was on!!! nevermind, dead dead easy once you know.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: gillylynne
Reviews.Content: this is not a 3 star hotel. the quad room we were given was clean but that is the best i can say. it was depressing. small dark no natural light. overlooking elevator shaft. awoken in morning with scraping dishes. moved to better hotel for third night. will never trust trip advisor again. second bum steer!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Will stay here again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Divinorflyin
Reviews.Content: After reviewing almost 100 small hotels, we read the review on this place and it seemed to be the perfect fit. We planned a quick 2 day trip to Rome and wanted a quaint little place centrally located. Let me say it was fabulous. The cost was slightly higher than other 3 star hotels but was well worth it. The room was plenty big and slightly larger than many other rooms we've stayed in during European visits. The shower was small but the bathroom was easy to move around in. We had a top floor room with a private rooftop terrace which was a wonderful oasis. The breakfast, included in the price, was as nice as any we've ever had. The staff always greeted with a smile and were happy to brew up any coffee or tea concotion wanted. Plenty of croissants and pastries, eggs, cereal, juices, fruit, etc... The front desk staff was extremely helpful and even communicated with local tour agencies for us with the front desk phone. The hotel is located less than 10 min. walk from the terminal train station and from there its only 20 min to the Spanish steps, 15 min to the colloseum and had plenty of cafe's and gelatarias close by. We highly recommend this hotel. Great location for a great price! - Dave and Sue

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jessandmatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during part of our honeymoon and had a wonderful stay there. Our room was a large, the decor was lovely, we had a nice view, it was comfortable, it was very clean and the bathroom had the best shower! There were a lot of choices for breakfast each morning (meats, cheese, pasteries, cereal, eggs, fruit, breads, juices, coffee, tea). The location of this hotel was great for us, we traveled to most of the sites on foot, although I have to admit we had a little trouble finidng it when we first arrived. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TC76
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during our trip to Italy in June 2006. I'm a bit late writing the review but better late than never! Location: Great location - 5 to 10 mins walk from the Termini station which is the main train station in Rome. The toughest time for us was getting out of the Termini itself! We got the train from Leonardo da Vinci Fiumicino Airport to the Termini and were able to walk to the hotel. This was great as we wanted to avoid taking a cab there as Rome is notorious for cabs ripping people off. The hotel itself is on a side street off the main road so it is a bit quiter than you would expect. It is about 10 more mins walk to the Coliseum from the hotel and about 15 mins walk to the spanish steps. We walked everywhere in Rome - it is really easy to find your way around once you have a map. Room: We found our room to be very spacious and clean. We were at the end of the corridor on the first floor. Bed was comfortable athough the pillows were a litle on the hard side I found. Breakfast: Breakfast was tasty and plentiful, and set you up for the day ahead. My only gripe was that the seating was a bit limited and can get a bit backed up queue wise. We didn't have to wait for a table, but we saw others who did. We did a lot of research to find accomodation in Rome when we decided to go there and decided on the Raffaello and we were not dissapointed. Hotels in Rome can be very expensive but we thought what we paid for the standard of accomodation was worth it. We hope to return back to Rome again some day as our trip was too short, and if we do we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CIrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Raffaello on a family holiday in July. The rooms were standard city centre sized rooms but well appointed and very comfortable with air-conditioning. The en-suite was also very well finished and extremely clean. The hotel staff were all extremely friendly and a credit to the managment and the hotel in general. A continental breakfast was included in the room price. The breakfast room was quite small and was full on one morning so we had a short (5 min) wait. Every other morning we got seating immediately. The choice of food at breakfast is not large but there's lots of fruit, cereal and eggs so there's enough for a good healthy breakfast. The location of the hotel is very good ... within 10 to 15 minutes walking distance of the colliseum. Its about 2 minutes walk from the cathedral of St. Mary's on a quiet side street and very close to the termini station which made it a very good base for exploring Rome. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice -- but nothing like the pictures... nothing!”
Reviews.Author: Vitorio21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Raffaello for one night, on our way to a 10 day cruise of the Med. I booked the reservation, as I do all my reservations, from looking at the reviews on Trip Advisor. I picked this hotel because out of all the hotels in Rome, this had the least number of negative reviews for my price range. When we arrived at the hotel, it has a very nice exterior and the entrance, foyer and lobby area are as dipicted in their brochures. Our room was not ready when we arrived, so we walked around Rome for the day waiting. Not too bad of an incident, but we had to leave our bags in the lobby -- praying they weren't stolen. Needless to say, my first walk around Rome was nerve racking because I kept thinking about losing my bags. When we returned, we were set up in our rooms but we had to take the elevator one at a time because it's a single person lift. Then, you have to walk up a 1/2 flight of stairs because the elevators only go between floors. The hallways were beautiful -- stuffy -- but beautiful. Then we get to the room. It looked nothing like the pictures in the brochure. The room was dark and old; extremely hot; and rather dusty. They did have an AC; however, it never cooled down the room and I sweated most of the night. The bathroom was nice, but because of the European shower door -- water soaked the floor each time we took a shower. You're not allowed to take the main key with you with you leave, you have to turn it in to the concierge. When you leave your room -- the AC turns off, so you have to ask for a spare key to keep in the room so it stays warm... which is better than hot, especially in the Rome heat. The internet service is not part of the room fee and you have to go downstairs to the lobby to use their wi-fi or internet service, which can be expensive if you just want to download your emails. Breakfast was so-so but not the best I've had. All in all -- for the money, it was an ok hotel but I have to have AC to be happy. I was not happy with this room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly with a good location”
Reviews.Author: gillandjames
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Rafaello for the first three nights of our honeymoon and were delighted with the service provided by the friendly staff. They were keen to help, advising us of some excellent restaurants in the vicinity. The hotel is small but has everything you need (including great showers!) and a lovely breakfast. The hotel is close to Cavour underground station. We'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Find”
Reviews.Author: Gingerpumpkin
