Reviews.Content: Rome can be a real nightmare finding decently priced accommodation. Fortunately the Raffaello fits the bill. It is close to the station (but not too close) and within walking distance of the sights. We have stayed in this area before and, while our other accommodation has been OK it falls short of what the Raffaello offers. This place is bright, clean and well-fitted. The room and bathroom were both decently sized and had all the usual requirements at this type of category hotel i.e. working TV, room safe, freebies in the bathroom etc. The staff were friendly, courteous and efficient. The breakfast staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good - range of fruits, meats, cheeses, cereals, eggs and cooked items. We do have one quibble though (hence giving this above average rather than excellent). We only stayed Thursday - Saturday but on the Friday morning we could get no hot water for the shower. This may have been because we got up later than usual (c.9.30 am) due to a long journey the day before and we suspect the water is heated by solar panel. It was fine later in the day and also early on Saturday. We didn't bother making an issue of this with the hotel, as we were only there for a short period and we had better things to do with our time but it might be worth while asking about this if you intend staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Odojoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a total of 6 nights before, between, and after tours to the south and north. The hotel is small but very clean. Francesca at the desk is a friendly face and is always willing to do what it takes to help you out. It is within walking distance to the Termini Station but perhaps not if you have a whinny wife or girlfriend. I did pull my suitcase behind me when I made the trip alone. It is also a quick shot to the Colleseum. Trevi and the Pantheon are a bit longer walk. Some baths have the shower tubes which are a bit tight but doable if you are not a very wide body. They will offer to convert your bill to dollars but you do not get the best rate that way. If I return to Rome the Rafaello is a for sure a return visit. If you go be sure and ask Francesca for directions to the La Carbonara restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not more”
Reviews.Author: jipe
Reviews.Content: That was my first time in Rome. The location of Raffaello is quite OK near to Railway station Termini but keep in mind it is more at the top of the hill so when you're back from Historical center or tastevere area, you have to climb a bit.... The single rooms are really small (one per floor apparently), you do not have space to move, just sleep...The shower was good with balneo included. The service is OK but nothing exceptional. A bit disappointed to leave my luggage for my departure day behind the sofa in the lobby, they do not have any closed room for luggage... Breakfast is really correct with choice & quality. Conclusion : Hotel OK but just at the level required for a 3*, I am wondering about the pthers hotels in ROme 3 or 4* ranked far below Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break”
Reviews.Author: WoodyLeighonSea
Reviews.Content: Decided to have a short break with my almost 16 year old daughter to see the sites and sample the food in Rome. I found the Hotel Raffaello on tripadvisor. It was simple to book on-line and although giving my credit card details on-line to secure the booking actually paid by other means on leaving. The Hotel is situated about a 5 minute walk from Santa Maria Maggiore and 15 mins from the main Train Station and the Colesseum in the other direction. We actually got a taxi from the airport as it was so hot and busy when we arrvied via Ryanair. The taxi had a fixed rate of 30 Euros. You can get a Terrevision coach from the airport to the Termini Station, but we were hot and tired. We were on the top floor. Although the room was smaller than the photo on the website it was perfectly adequate. The room was fully air conditioned by a remote control. There were shutters and black out blinds so we had very comfortable sleeping conditions as it was extremely hot outside! There is also a free safe. You need to ask reception for the key (there was no charge). The lift is extremely small but adequate. The shower was also small but had a built in stand up jacuzzi option! The staff were friendly, the room and hotel spotlessly clean and Rome and it's attraction amazing! p.s. for site seeing maybe August was not such a good month as it was sooooo hot; but we survived.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay in Hotel Raffaello”
Reviews.Author: Juice76
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location, close to the Termini - a 5-10min walk away. We only stayed for one night but wished we had been there for longer. The hotel room was very clean with beautiful decor. All the staff were very helpful. Breakfast was ok, but busy around 9 o'clock, so myself and my husband had to share a table with other guests. Rome was very hot so we welcomed the air con and the fridge in our room. Bed was very comfortable. I would definately recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to TripAdvisor - This hotel was perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: MrEjection
Reviews.Content: I relied on TripAdvisor and was not misled. This hotel was great for what I needed and the money I paid. I stayed at this hotel for the location and the price. It was close to two subway stops, the Termini, 15 - 25 minute walk at the most from any major attraction (though most are 15 minutes if you walk quick), and great restaurants nearby. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and spoke good English. Breakfast was good. The room itself had what I wanted - a bed, a safe, and a private bathroom. My room was definately "no frills," but I did not travel to Rome to stay in a hotel room. It was perfect for what I needed and had no problems at all. I would definately stay here again if I went back to Rome as I got very comfortable with the area around the hotel and everything it offered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place....but”
Reviews.Author: TriggerMLR
Reviews.Content: On check-in found that the room could only accomodate 4 people, we were 5 with one of us 7 years old, so he slept between his parents (who did not sleep as a result !! ) I had booked on email for a room for 5 but the check in clerk said that 4 was the maximum, a bit late for that news !! also found this gentleman more than a little unhelpful in tone, raising arms to any suggestion of a camp bed or even a floor matress, we were also charged extra for breakfast for 5 which I thought a little mean spirited. I know from reading the previous reviews is not the norm here but this is my family's experience. Sweltering heat in Rome this July so could have done with a constant Air con supply, which switched off when exiting room. On the positive side On check out the front desk clerk (female) was a gem giving my son (the one who slept) a bag of sweets from complimentry counter top dish. Easy location to get to. Good clean Hotel, good breakfast, quiet location and near to good Irish Pub the Druid. But sorry for being a grouch but this is my experience, and wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: The_Dudes
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with 2 children (5 and 8 yrs old) in room 120, a double room with windows facing interior light well. Loved this place for its room, location, and price. We easily walked to the Coliseum, Trevi Fountain, and Piazza de la Republica. It is located one street away from busy Via Cavour, and what a difference one street makes in terms of traffic and road noise. Room was very quiet, and we could stop our car at the front door of the hotel to unload our bags as it was a non parking spot. We felt very safe in the area as the building next door was some type of government building with a police presence and area had many tourists walking. Buffet breakfast was very good (take some fruit and biscuit packs for later snacks). Room had a small fridge and safe as well. Really appreciated the air conditioning as it was extremely hot in Rome during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Elevator, but great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shawannalee
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. There are a few things to know though. The elevator stops in between floors, so you will want to up one higher and walk the suitcases down. Also, the electricity to the room turns off a few moments after you take the key out of it's resting place. This includes the air conditioner and the outlets. The shower is awesome, the staff is extremely helpful, great gelato is right around the corner, the breakfast buffet is wonderful, the location of the hotel couldn't be better, and the price is right. Not good for those in wheelchairs, but for those that can handle stairs (which I wasn't so sure about since my foot had just come out of a cast a week before my trip) it is the perfect choice

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CiaoClaudia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Raffaello for 3 night in mid-July. After checking out many sites as well as TripAdvisor, I chose it for it's central location and the good reviews and I was not disappointed. We were 3 couples in all and I was in charge of booking. Everyone was happy with my choice! Beautiful hotel, clean, spacious rooms and a firendly staff. Good breakfast. Close to Termini station and a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum and other historical sites and many beautiful churces, including Santa Maria Maggiore (the Cathedral of Rome). Nice neighborhood, good shopping on Via Nazionale which is not too far away. 20 minute walk to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. A bit far to walk to the Vatican, but close to Metro Station. Buses and metro are easy to take and a cheap alternative to taxis. I would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff”
Reviews.Author: shah_7
Reviews.Content: We always use this site before a holiday so found lots of great reviews re: Rafaello. We weren't disappointed. The hotel is in a nice location, about 10 min walk from Termini station. Its a small hotel with ok rooms& small shower but when you're in Rome, why the hell do you want to stay in your room??? It was just a temporary sanctuary for us from the blazing sun in the evenings and its location meant that everything was walking distance. Rome is beautiful. If you appreciate architecture and history, its here in abundance. This hotel does what it says on the tin. Its relatively cheap for its location, its clean and the staff are very attentive. If you want all singing and dancing, this ain't it. But if you need a place to dump your bags, sleep soundly at night and gain useful knowledge about where to go, there probably aren't many better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: RyanDL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend for 2 nights. The hotel is pretty nice and in a good location, less than a 10 min. walk to the Colliseum. There are a number of decent restaurants and bars within a close proximity. The hotel is off a side street, so it is secluded from street noise and pedestrian foot traffic. It is a bit of a walk to sites such as the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, etc., though it is walkable if you're up to the task. The room and bathroom are of decent size, though the shower is typically a small Euro shower (smaller than other Euro showers I've used). Everything is in good condition and does not seem aged. There is no Internet available in the rooms and the hotel has a PC you can purchase time on if you need Internet (3 EU per 15 min). Staff is courteous and helpful for any needs we had, which were few. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. I would stay here again, but if I were going back to Rome, I would attempt to stay a bit further north, closer to more of the sites. This hotel is a few blocks from the Termini train station, so you can walk it (hard with luggage) or take a cab for less than 10 EU.

Reviews.Title: “perfect romantic gateway”
Reviews.Author: Yaelir
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the hotel was excellent. We came to Rome to celebrate our 16th anniversary. We found the Raffaello hotel on various websites including Tripadvisor and Venere where it was highly rated. We booked on-line and informed the hotel that we were coming there for our anniversary. We arrived early and left our suitcase at reception. The hotel is less than 10 min away from the main train/bus station, with many attractions in walking distance. Upon arrival that evening we were given a beautiful room on the top floor with a balcony overlooking the quiet street the hotel is on. The room was a good size with a spotless and roomy bathroom. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Breakfast was good, lacking only in vegetables which aren't common in Europe. Lastly, the evening of our anniversary we were surprised by the staff with a chilled bottle of Champagne, condiments and a lovely and warm greeting card, hospitality of the hotel. This was the greatest romantic getaway I could have asked for. We will definitely go there again when next in Rome !!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MarcsdadDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic stay at the Raffaello. We did serious research before booking and are thankful to other Trip advisor contributors who recommended this hotel. Arrived at around 2pm and boarded the lift ( very small and intimate)just enough room for 2 and baggage. Room really nice air con a delight. Very spacious, not much of a window view but not a problem. After a few minutes a knock on the door and a very welcome ice cold bottle of complimentary wine was delivered. Tested the shower immediately and had a wonderful blast of high pressure water delivered by the jacuzzi shower to all travel weary parts. Shower not small by British standards. All staff extremely friendly and were very helpful and very patient when trying my limited Italian. The hotel is spotless clean . Location of the hotel is good for the Termini Station, and 10 minutes to the Coliseum and Palantine. The general area looks a little tatty but we felt completly safe even late at night. Hotel could be a problem to those a little infirm as it is located at the bottom of a steep incline( about 200m long) Asked for restaurant recommendation at reception on 1st night and was booked in just around the corner, can't say we were that impressed. Breakfast is a really good buffet, loads of cold meats, fruits, croissants,cakes. Did a tour bus which lets you get your bearings. Advise you buy a 4euro card for the Metro it lasts a day and can be used on buses as well. Bus stops list all stops and are dead easy to use and buses are plentiful. Beware the portable, snack cabins throughout Rome got ripped off for water best use little shops. Restaurants around Spanish steps pricey, but I suppose that is to be expected, paid 44euros for 2 salads and 2 beers, only got ourselves to blame though we did not read the small print. Would definately recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Taking a 10 year old to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Neil001
Reviews.Content: Visiting Rome with a 10 year old - who will eat very few things! The travel guides tell you Rome is big and most hotels expensive and tatty, so TripAdvisor was a huge help. I’d always check it out before travelling again - so keep your reviews coming!! Firstly, flying from the UK when I went the airport parking was half price if you booked two weeks in advance, so that’s worth checking out. In Rome the train from the airport was free for kids (about 11 Euro for both of us, compared to about £30 for catching the Heathrow Express in London!). When you arrive at Termini there is a train timetable on the wall so you easily sorty out what train you need to catch back to the airport. Hotel Raffaello was perfect. Only 10 mins walk from Termini station, so you can manage bags on wheels when you arrive and leave, unless you loads of luggage. One street off the main road, so even when there was lots of hooting horns following a football win against Milan it was still quiet enough to sleep. Clean, central and easy to get to the sites. Unless you want to pay for a 5* I wouldn’t bother going anywhere else. The lift is tiny, so if you are huge or claustrophobic that might be a problem. The hotel is on a side road, opposite and just after the junction with the huge church Santa Maria Maggiore. It turned out when we went (16/19 May) that Banca di Roma was sponsoring a culture week, so all the sites were free. Maybe TripAdvisor can highlight this sort of thing in future? The big sites for our schedule were: - arrive mid afternoon - Pantheon, Trevi, Spanish Steps ( a bit of a walk) - next day to Forum and Coliseum - next morning do Vatican, fly out mid afternoon. (Half a day is a bit tight) The Forum / Coliseum. From the hotel, walk up the 50 yard side road back to St Mario Maggiore and turn right down Via Cavour. In about 10 mins you will arrive opposite the middle of the forum. The tourist shops you pass on the way have some of the better prices for T shirts etc. As you approach this T junction on your right you will pass a restaurant with fixed awnings, Bar Masse. Pizza is excellent, pasta good (though it seems to arrive 5 mins after the pizza), prices very reasonable – strongly recommended. You are now in the middle of the rectangle that is the Forum. 20m to your left of these traffic lights is the Forum shop which has excellent picture guide books and a good cheap folding map of the ancient forum which is huglely helpful as you walk around piles of stones! When people advise you to buy a ticket at the Forum ticket office to cover both the Coliseum and the Forum, you get to this by going to the Coliseum (a 5 min walk left), then turning back on yourself into the Forum. I’d also suggest walking down from the hotel to see the Coliseum lit up at night, then going to Bar Masse to eat. Must sees are the Pantheon (the roof is so extraordinary, and the largest concrete construction in the world until this century). It’s free. The Trevi Fountain also, of course, though it is a bit confusing finding your way back to the hotel – if you go north up to the main road then turn right (ie East) you need to go much further than you think before turning right to come back to Santa Maria (The tunnel road you pass is only half way). The Spanish steps were a bit disappointing. The Egyptian needle at the top was covered in scaffolding, so no great views up them (and the guide photos of these must have been taken out of someone’s window or from a balloon at 6am!). Watch the signs to find this (we missed one and had a tiring detour up the RHS towards Villa Borghese) As regards the Vatican, you need to check out their website to see when what is open! If we hadn’t we would have gone on a day the Sistine Chapel was shut. Although I like art, it did take 45 mins to follow round the one way signs to the Sistine, and by then my 10 year old was too tired to care. Pretty impressive rooms on the way, however. We didn’t get up St Peter’s dome – there was a huge queue so allow time. From the front of the Vatican it is a10 min walk down the round Castle St Angelo, and you can cross the bridge for photos. We just stopped for lunch down a side road on the left half way to the castle in what looked a tatty cafe but had a wood burning pizza oven inside and was a fair price. It is twice as far as it looks on the map to a metro station, however! Tips: -go to the Coliseum then back into the Forum to buy an entrance ticket and avoid queues. The don’t join the big queue when you go to the Coliseum -eat at Bar Masse - lots of wonderful ice cream (make sure its from the metal containers - other reviews say they are cleaner) -They are trying to clean up the touts posing for photos with you as centurions, but agree a price first -Stay at Hotel Rafaello -There’s a lot of walking – comfy shoes not high fashion ones -Have a drink at cafes so you can use their toilets. They expect this, though ladies note that toilets don’t always seem to have seats! I’d take some of your own handwipes too, but that may be just I want to avoid sick kids Hope that helps Neil & Nick

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: LondonCathy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days with 2 children and had the quad room which I was hoping for. Good size, shower was very small but that was only problem. Staff were very pleasant and helpful, in fact every where we went, everyone was fantastic! It helps if you try to speak some Italian - they all appreciate it. Some queueing involved for Vatican, not that long and well worth it! Crowds everywhere. If you are leaving Rome by train to airport, be careful - there was an American lady who had her passport and $200.00 stolen by a girl within a couple of minutes on getting on the train, the girl had taken my dad's wallet but for some reason gave it back!

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but clean, good location and value”
Reviews.Author: minnaert
Reviews.Content: Rome is expensive, especially when using US dollars vs Euros. For overall value and comfort, this hotel is a great choice. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The longest we ever waited after a cab was called was 5 minutes. We were wanting to get tickets for a performance at the Paceo de la Musica, and the staff pointed us to a ticket outlet nearby. They also made a great dinner recommendation for a nearby place which served Roman style artichokes. All the people working at the front desk spoke fluent english. The hotel is not the closest to the most popular tourist sites, but the taxi rides were not expensive to many locations, and many sites were an easy walk. The four corners, the Cathedral were all a short walk. As others have mentioned, the rooms were recently remodeled. Out room was comfortable with a queen size bed. The shower is extremely small. The television is also extremely small, but only 3-4 channels are available, with only CNN in english, so this was no big loss. Everything worked perfectly in the room, the air conditioning was a welcome feature. The elevator was snug for 2 people with their bags, and the elevator stops do not match the flights of stairs with the rooms, so you do need to carry our bags either up or down a brief flight of stairs. we ate the free continental breakfast each of our 5 mornings at the hotel. The food is fine, nothing extraordinary, but this was a wonderful convenience. The coffee was pretty good also. The service from the people working in the breakfast area was very courteous also.

Reviews.Title: “not luxurious, but clean”
Reviews.Author: SILVERBIRD58
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days late this spring. The rooms were clean, but nothing fancy. Room size was above average. Shower was ridiculously small. I believe that someone who was significantly overweight would have a difficult time maneuvering in the cramped quarters. We joked about needing a rescue crew to pry out some unsuspecting soul who got stuck in the shower. Major problem was a musty smell to the room. It helped if the windows were open and the AC was running at the same time, but the mustiness was apparent in the hall as well. This is not a good hotel for those who are handicapped. I never saw a porter and the microelevator (I think whoever designed the showers got the contract for the elevator as well) stopped on a landing between floors. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was generally good with a large assortment of choices. The neighborhod, although somewhat dingy was not threatening and I never questioned our safety even late at night. Access to the metro was adequate although getting to the main tourist areas such as the Piazza Navonna or Pantheon was a hike. (We tok a cab on several occasions.) Restaurants in the area were not that great. The two which wre recommended by the staff were nothing special. The best and most reasonable dinner we stumbled across was at a trattoria named Antonio's near the Pantheon (across from the Pantheon Hotel) Prices were reasonable and the food was excellent....we ate there twice and if given the opportunity in hindsight would have taken another trip in a cab rather than eat at some of the reastaurants near the hotel. All in all, the Raffaello was what I expcted it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Ema73
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Raffaello in December and we were very content. As precedent reviews said, this hotel is a very good choice for its price range. It it elegant, very clean, with comfortable rooms, nice and spacious bathrooms. The breakfast was good, too, with coffee, tea, milk, juice, eggs, cheese, ham, gem and some cakes. It is also convenient situated - few minutes walk from Santa Maria Maggiore and from Termini Station. From our point of view, it was a very good value for money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: whatalife
Reviews.Content: The Raffaello was a very pleasant experience. We wanted to stay somewhere that wasn't the usual "Huge Chain" and get a more quaint experience. The hotel was lovely, very old world with some very funky modern conveniences - can you say cool shower and key/light thingy...... We had a room with a balcony overlooking the street, with plenty of room an conveniences. It is super close to everything, the staff were very helpful and it was a great experience. Definetly would recomend to anyone- very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller5_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sat/Sunday night. Staff very friendly and helpfull. We found the 'Peter Sellars' lookalike was actually very nice. Our room was spacious and the bathroom was clean and functional. The air conditioning worked and the cloth wallpaper gave the feeling of quality. Breakfast had plenty of choice and the lady serving couldn't have been more helpful. Do try the scrambled eggs, they were great. It is a short walk from the Stazione Terminus which is handy if you come in from Ciampino by Terravision bus, only 14 euros return - although the bus conductors came across as completely incompetent. It's within 20 minutes walk of the Colloseum, although many of the main attractions require you to be keen walkers or you should use the Metro which is cheap and easy to navigate. One reviewer thought the road on which the hotel is located was scarry at night. We wandered back both nights after midnight and felt perfectlly safe. There are plenty of restaurants within a 15 minute stroll. Overall loved Rome and the Rafaello.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: nurseroz
Reviews.Content: We were 3 "seasoned" nurses staying in Rome for a few days before a cruise. We booked Hotel Raffaello based on location, price, and Tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. We were traveling on a holiday weekend and British Airways had lost the luggage of one of our group. We were tired and worn out when we arrived. We staggered through the front door and into Fabio's care. We felt like we were family coming home. He and Francesca left no stone unturned to make British Airway locate the luggage and send it along to us. We were handicapped by the language difference and the airline personnel dealing with us kept saying that it was a holiday and nothing they could do - and the luggage would be shipped home and be there when we arrived. Francesca and Fabio called every hour on the hour to facilitate the return of the luggage and I am sure that without their persistence- one on us would have vacationed without luggage. The hotel was delightful- our room was immaculate and plenty roomy. The breakfast was fresh and delicious each day - there were even eggs. The ladies serving breakfast were friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the convenient location of the hotel - we were able to walk there from the Termini (all downhill!). We could also walk to the Colosseum and Forum and Tourist Bus stop. There were many delicious restaurants within walking distance. We felt the area was safe. We will always consider Hotel Raffaello our second home in Rome and highly recommend it to those seeking a friendly , comfortable, affordable, and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location, Very Clean Room, No Big Complaints.”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoWest37
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and its proximity to the main train station. Based on these primary reasons, it was pretty much as expected. While it's several blocks to the train station from the hotel, it isn't a bad walk if you have luggage on wheels...otherwise you'll need a taxi. Hotel itself is in a creepy location 1 block off of the main busy street. During the day, really no big deal. At night...while it is only 1 block off the main street and lots of people/action, it still IS. This makes it quiet...and also creepy (maybe it's just me). Our room was a suite on the top floor with a HUGE rooftop deck. So the deck is cool to sit outside, etc. But there's also nothing to look at really except rooftops. Lots of TV stations, but you'd think that only Germans stayed here based on the available channels. There were 3 English channels, but MANY more German channels. Just bizarre. Room was very clean w/ lots of closet space, A/C worked great, really a pleasure to come back to after a day of tourist stuff. However they must love flooding because there is no shower curtain on the tub...so the water goes EVERYWHERE when you shower...on the floor, windows, toilet, etc. You'll easily use every towel you have...and then request more. Don't open your window in the bathroom unless you want someone across the way to be looking at you. Breakfast was pretty good, but most days we couldn't get a place to sit unless you went very early or late. As everyone has noted, the elevator is a joke. Would consider staying here again if only for the predictability of it all and its location...but I'd certainly lean towards trying somewhere else first.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: Elixa
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay in Rome! We stayed in this hotel for the first three nights of our honeymoon in Italy. Never having visited Italy before we weren't exactly sure what to expect. We arrived at Termini station, took a short walk down to the hotel which was really easy to find. We were too early to check in so we left our bags under the watchful eye of the guy in reception (who spoke perfect English) When we got to use our rooms we were really impressed. We requested a double and ended up with a triple and the extra space was really appreciated. The bathrooms were reasonable in size an the decor was lovely. Breakfast was ample and the staff were friendly and helpful and make really good coffee! Couldn't have had a better stay! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, but Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PTAUS
Reviews.Content: Pros: Decent size hotel room for Italy; walking distance to the Roman Forum and the main train station. The daily breakfast was also very nice. Cons: Tiny bathroom (see previous reviewer comment about proximity of toilet and bidet), no shower curtain; area around the hotel was not the best. Overall, the price to value ratio was average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: escottf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic weekend in May. The hotel is a short walk from Termini, the central train station (this is also where all the airport trains and buses arrive), and it is also convenient for most of Rome provided you have any type of mobility. The room itself was clean (and kept that way properly each day) and functional - even a little glamorous. The TV was a bit mediocre but you don't go to Rome to watch the TV in your hotel room. The bathroom was very good. The hotel is in a quiet location, the service excellent with good English (I know it's easy to expect this but it isn't an English country after all). The breakfast was a perfectly respectable buffet breakfast. The hotel is especially handy to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum and it is practically on top of the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore (no, it isn't closed - the door is around the other side!). Good dining is plentiful nearby and if you like ice cream, Rome may be heaven for you. Don't bother with the public transport - if you're there on holiday walk around - Rome is better that way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rysdale
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week May 1st and found it to be excellent. Our room was clean, quiet. Via cavour nearby is really noisy but when you turned to the hotel, it was very quiet and we were on the fourth floor so up above the rooftops. the staff was very friendly but not that informative when it came to suggestions on places to go or things to do, etc. other than the usual main sites. its a shame because there are some fun churches a short walk that you shoudl see (st peter in chains for example) Clean, convenient, and quiet. cant beat that. when we arrived early after a red eye in form NY, we dropped our bags and were invited to breakfast which was a nice respite before starting the day in rome. When we left breakfast (take a piece of fruit for your snack and try the oranges -- they are yummy blood oranges and SOOO good), we were told there was a problem with our room and would we accept 2 single rooms. As I was travelling with my teenager, i was not keen on this so i politely declined and they said they'd figure something out. When we returned from our first walks around rome in the early afternoon, they offered us a room at their sister hotel by teh pantheon in rome which was quite lovely and then paid for the cab there and back. when we came back the next day, our room was ready and it was equally beautiful. on the "to look out for " list -- our shower did not flood and was fine and the bathroom was quite adequate in size. The beds were clean and comfy. the pillows however were rock hard. i hated it and have never thought of myself as a pillow snob but...whatever! Also, Would not ask for their recommendations for dinner as we were consistently steered to tourist local spots, even when we asked for places anywhere in the city. Random comments for Rome -- the Borghese Gallery was our highlight by far but is reservation only and i would suggest making reservations when you book your hotel and plan your days around that -- definitely before you leave. Ditto the vatican as we had to wait in surreal lines. that said, i noticed that many tours were waiting in line with me so i am not sure if these were "vatican" tours or random Rome tour groups but i would not want to pay for a tour guide and still stand in a 2 hour line. Palatine hill was fun but pack a lunch. buy or pack a nalgene bottle. Rome water fountains are everywhere and very good water mostly so it was nice to be able to fill up on the go. Near the hotel, we ate at Restaurant il giglio up by the opera house. it was good. We also ate at Its Amore -- again many tourists but the biggest salads we found for the best price. The best gelato was diagonally across form the opera house. The place has these gelato shaped cone garbage pails outside when it is open. the gelato place across the street (on same side of the street as the opera house) was quite missable. we also grabbed a meal (because no place was open at 3 pm) the train station, on the second floor. Cappuccino anywhere in town was fabulous! Best guidebook we took was Rick steves Rome. second best was a Michelin guide.

Reviews.Title: “On balance, quite decent”
Reviews.Author: GerryD714
Reviews.Content: This stay of 4 nights kept our TripAdvisor "formula" streak intact. We just pick whichever property in the top 20 of reviewers' favorites match our particular budget for the trip...and contact the hotel directly. Having come from the pampering of Florence's family-run Hotel Davanzati, we were prepared for a drop-off and, sure enough, this hotel failed to meet the benchmark of the Florentine champion. However, it was in every way adequate, and more than that in several aspects for my wife, myself, and our 11 yr old son. To get the negatives out of the way, two quirks that other reviewers have mentioned were indeed in evidence. 1) The shower DOES really flood the bathroom. Never quite worked out why and my wife didn't encounter it but having showered almost daily for half a century, I figure it wasn't me. (I took comfortable baths for the duration of the stay) . 2) There IS a clunker at the front desk, among the remaining very nice people. And, no, it's not the courtly Massimo, the friendly Fabio, or the wonderful Francesca! But if you see a ringer for Peter Sellers (in one of his bespectacled but non-mustachioed roles) save your inquiries or requests for the next shift. 3) There is one internet computer available in an alcove off the lobby but there is a charge and be prepared to get the cold stare from other guests who want to usurp the PC long before your purchased time has elapsed. However, positives outweigh these relative trifles. The triple room was comfortable, rather roomy, clean, with great blackout curtains and a handy armoire and nicely appointed bathroom. The lift was reliable, the free breakfast above average. Some reviewers have criticized the location, but it's quiet, safe, and if you're fit enough to walk, all but the Vatican and the catacombs, and perhaps the nightclub area, are within a healthy stroll. The Forum and Coliseum are no more than a 12 minute walk. The magnificent Santa Maria Magiori less than 5 minutes. Some have bemoaned a lack of decent restaurants within walking distance. I can't concur.There are numerous moderately-priced trattorias and ethnic restaurants reached by taking a left leaving the hotel, then a right at the corner. (the opposite direction to Santa Maria Magiore) Go up the hill then when the street starts to descend , you'll find three quite nice, informal restaurants..choose from the menus in front. Go farther down a block or two to the light..hang a left and discover a very good Indian restaurant on the next corner. Take a left at that corner and there's another Indian just as good and dirt cheap by Roman standards. On the other end of the scale, there is an incomparable restaurant for a special evening going uphill in the opposite direction, TOWARDS Santa Maria Magiore. Pass the cathedral, walking on the main avenue to the left of the church . Down half a block on your right (and still only a bit over 5 mins from the hotel) and you're in for an outstanding dining experience, albeit an expensive one. From the spot-on service to the comfortable yet elegant room, to the imaginative, delicious gourmet food, you've found one of Rome's ..and indeed one of the world's..best restaurants : Agata e Romeo. Ask Francesca or Massimo to make reservations for you. All-in-all, a nice stay. Will you rave over this hotel? I doubt it. Will you be quite satisfied? I sincerely think you will be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roy26
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly. Good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe hotel but not a great location...”
Reviews.Author: jwb_ireland
Reviews.Content: The three of us were on a weekend break to Rome. Two of us had stayed in Rome before so we had a good feel for the city and at least a couple of the hotels there (as well as numerous hotels in other cities around Europe). First the positive aspects: The (double) rooms were reasonably-sized and clean. I suspect they were recently renovated and this was done with some taste. The bed in our room was a good size - by Italian standards - and was clean and firm. The breakfast selection was reasonably good - pretty typical European buffet arrangement (meats, cheeses, cereals, etc.). The hotel is situated just off Via Cavour and about 5 minutes walk to the main train station (Stazione Termini). This is also the main interchange for the Rome Metro which is incredibly useful (and cheap!) for getting around the city. The hotel staff were pleasant - based on previous reviews, I was expecting 5-star friendliness. But I have no complaints; they were all professional and polite. Now, the negatives.... The location isn't ideal if you want quick access to the main sights (like the Spanish Steps or the Trevi...or....most important, the main shopping drag of Via del Corso, Via Condotti, etc). On a previous stay, we stayed at the Ottocente which is on Via Sistina - just 5 mins from the Spanish Steps. Much better location, higher standard of hotel and for approximately the same price (and highly recommended!). Our room was facing out onto the street (Via Urbana) and, as a result, we were woken each morning around 7am with the usual stream of noisy mopeds. But, to be honest, this is quintessential Rome, so I kind of liked it in a perverse way! Overall, this is a good 3-star (in the Irish/UK sense) hotel. For about the same price, you could probably get a 4-star nearer the main sights. Hope you found this review useful....

Reviews.Title: “The Raffaello Hotel is Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: DCRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: One always feels a little tentative booking a sight unseen hotel reservation for a major vacation. I selected the Raffaello Hotel based on the reviews that had been submitted. Let me say, the hotel not only lived up to the review scores, I actually thought it was better that what on-line scores reflected. This is an outstanding place to say. The caliber of both the facilities and the staff is excellent and the location is wonderful. The only thing 5-star facilities have on this place are large lobbies, exercise rooms, and other such amenities. The quality of the room and staff at the Raffaello is every bit as good. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Raffaello is Average”
Reviews.Author: AMWHouston
Reviews.Content: I don't usually post reviews on TripAdvisor, but I'm going to for the Hotel Davanzati (in Florence) where I also stayed during this trip so thought I'd go ahead. For context, this was my eighth trip to Europe, third to Italy, and second to Rome. I have traveled all over Europe and have stayed at hotels ranging from 2 stars to 5 stars. I generally, because of price, end up staying in the 3-4 star range when I travel to Europe. As has been noted a number of times by travelers, travel sites, etc.. the star rating system is not what some might think as most in Europe are based on objective features such as square footage, whether there are elevators, shared bathrooms, and the like instead of traditional, conventional luxury furnishings and cleanliness. That as my background, I must say that there were a number of things that jumped out at me during my stay at the Raffaello that rank it only as average among 3-4 star hotels in Europe in my opinion. The good: The breakfast was nice, had plenty of options for a continental spread, and there were nice pieces of fruit and cookies you could take with you for the day. The wait staff at breakfast was excellent. (my only complaint about breakfast was that the "orange juice" was more like Tang than actual juice). Our room was clean, nicely furnished, and about average in size (per my experiences). It was not overly-large, but there were no doors bumping into the bed or climbing over your travel companion to get to the closet or bathroom. I've read complaints along those lines and stayed once in a 4-star hotel that seemed to resemble those characterizations. The beds were comfortable. A bit on the firm side, but not overly-so. The windows seemed to be pretty well sound-proofed. The so so/not so good: The bathroom. While sparkling clean and apparently recently refurbished, the bathroom in our room had not been planned out well. I don't know if this is a common problem in the other rooms, but it definitely was in ours. First, the bidet and toilet faced each other. This would not normally be a notable problem. Here it was, however, because there were only about 2 inches between the fronts of each. This meant you had to either lift a leg over the toilet or use it side-saddle so to speak. There is no chance, regardless of how skinny or small you are, that you can fit your left through the opening between them. Not a huge problem, but it could have been eliminated by moving one of the fixtures over 6 inches (and there was wall space for such a move). Second, and this is the more annoying thing to me, the shower. While it appeared to be a brand new jacuzzi-style shower, it was incredibly small. It was shaped like a quarter circle, and a lot of the space inside was taken up by a seat and jet fixtures. It is the smallest shower I have ever been in in my life (including a small cruise ship shower). There was barely room for me to turn around, and I'm a small woman (5'5", size 4). My travel companion is 5'10", but she is built like a model. She had trouble as well. I simply cannot imagine an average-sized man, let alone above average, fitting comfortably in this shower. Perhaps other rooms have different showers. If you have an issue with tight spaces or are concerned about fitting, I'd inquire before and get a guarantee. Finally, 2 issues with service. This is actually the first hotel I've been to in Europe that recommended a restaurant that advertises on the hotel's keys and in their lobby. I asked about a couple of specific restaurants, and I was directed to this restaurant instead. When I got back to my room, I called to ask the man at reception to make reservations at one of the restaurants I'd initially asked about. I gave him the name, address, etc. When I offered to give them the phone number, he said he could find it quickly. When we were about to leave for dinner and asked about a taxi, we were told there was no need because "the restaurant" was right down the street. Reservations had been made at the restaurant they recommended. The man seemed put out when I asked him to make another reservation. Second, shipping things home. I know, I know, I was silly and bought some vinegar and other liquids without thinking about the new liquid restrictions. I travel 3-4 per month for work so I'm well aware of the rules, and I have bought all miniature toilettries to manage carry-on bags. For some reason, it went right out of my mind until the night before we were supposed to leave. When I asked the hotel about shipping the items home (because I really didn't want to check a bag), I was told they just don't do that unless someone leaves something in a room. This was a surprise from a 3-star hotel with so many recommendations. Not the end of the world, but not the greatest attention to service. I will pay a bit more to stay closer to Piazza Navona or the Spanish Steps next time I'm in Rome. Overall, the Raffaello was sae, clean, and a good hotel. Well located for the train station. A bit of a walk to most of the sights. The things that stuck out make a difference to me.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was perfect”
Reviews.Author: phil929mel
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful supprise when my girlfriend booked this hotel. I did not expect this to be so nice.The bathroom was a luxury with the kohler shower. I loved the tile.The staff was very friendly but not to the point of being nauseating. The breakfast bar was all and more for a hotel this size. We felt perfectly safe and would recommend this hotel to anyone touring the sites. Very close to the collesium. There were three of us in a room. I slept in a cot. I was concerned about my back. But, got great nights sleep on this. Would come back if given the opportunity and would stay same hotel /Melody

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaFamilyOfFour
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four that stayed at this hotel for two nights in March. This hotel was very clean, and the staff was extremely nice. The only trouble we had with this hotel was that the shower door leaked water all over the bathroom floor. Great location, a short walk to the Coluseum, close to the subway, lots of restaurants close by and very close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: gallop
Reviews.Content: The welcome we received on arrival was a foretaste of the helpful attitude of all the staff (but particularly Massimo) at the Raffaello. Our room was ready for us when we arrived around mid-day and was good-sized, well-decorated with a largish bathroom complete with bath and over the bath shower. Breakfast is fine with choice of cereals, fruit, bread, cake, cheese, ham, salami, tea. coffee, cappuccino etc. The hotel is well situated just a ten minute downhill walk from the Termini. During our 4 night stay we walked to the Colliseum and Forum (10 min) the Capitol (15 min) Pantheon (20 min) and many other sites. The ride to the Vatican on the Metro was fine but very crowded. If you don't know Rome it's a good idea to take one of the many round bus trips on your first day to help orientate yourself. We had a wonderful Mexican meal in a small restaurant further down Via Urbana.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Englebert-7
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay when exploring Rome for a few days. Quite close to the Termini station and a short walk to the Cavour metro stop. A little bit difficult to find especially when arriving at night, ensure you are armed with a good map! Nice clean room, excellent breakfast buffet. Efficient & helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Raffaello!”
Reviews.Author: travelfoolIndiana
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay in Rome and at the Raffaello and we were so happy with our choice. First, we had taken an overnight train from Venice to Rome, and arrived at the Raffaello at 8:30 AM with only hopes of leaving our baggage until we could check in later in the day. Imagine our delight when the desk clerk (we forgot his name but he was so helpful the entire stay) told us our room was ready, we could check in immediately, and also enjoy the continental breakfast as well. What a welcome. Our room was perfect for our party of four - a delightful 2 room suite with comfortable beds, spacious wardrobes, and plenty of extra bedding. The bathroom was small but clean and well kept. The breakfast each morning was delicious. A nice assortment of rolls (we woke up to the smell of them baking each morning), meats, cheeses, fruit, cereal, yogurts, and juices, as well as a fine selection of coffee, cappuchino or hot tea was grand. The service provided by the hotel was very much appreciated. They not only provided us with recommendations for restaurants, but helped us to reserve a taxi for our early morning trip to the airport, identify appropriate bus / metro lines for our destinations, and gave us directions to various sites and stores. The location of the Raffaello was perfect. Only a short 10 minute walk (downhill) from the Termini train station, so very convenient for those arriving either by train or via the Leanardo Express from the airport (follow Via Cavour to Via Ruinaglia, and go right. The hotel is at the end of the street on the left). Surprisingly, many of the sites we wanted to see were within walking distance. A 20 minute walk (again downhill) took us to the Ancient City Centre for a day spent perusing the Coliseum, Roman Forum, Palatine, etc. Another 20 minute walk a different day took us to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The only day we used the Metro (caught it at the Termini Station) was to spend the day at the Vatican. Tip on visiting the Vatican Musuems - we arrived at the Vatican Musuems at 9:15 AM (it opens at 8:45 AM) expecting a huge line. We only waited 30 minutes and when we actually finished our tour around 1-2 PM, there was absolutely no line. I'm sure this varies depending on the time of year, but arriving early before the museum opens may not be necessary. The accommodations at the Raffaello were first class. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice, reasonably priced hotel, in a GREAT location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic :-)”
Reviews.Author: CA80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffaello for 3 nights and loved the hotel. It was clean, comfortable and ideally located to explore the sights of Rome. The staff were always very friendly and helpful. The buffet syle breakfast provided was a great start to the day. It was our first trip to Rome but we found our way around very easily. The Metro system is a quick and inexpensive way to get around, especially when going over to Vatican City. We also found a great restaurant, the Chicken House, a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. The food was good and the waiters kept us entertained! Overall a great way to spend a long birthday weekend and we'll definately stay there again next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Floridabelle03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during a week long tour of Italy for our 4th anniversary. We chose the Raffaello because of the reviews of the location and the price. We had a great time at this hotel! The location was perfect and the value very good too. The airline had lost my bag with all of my clothes coming in and Fabio was extremely helpful in coordinating its return. The breakfast was very good and the hotel room clean. Fabio was extremely helpful and gave excellent customer service. What's keeping me from awarding this hotel an excellent rating is that the other front desk attendants were not as friendly or helpful. In fact, at one point someone was quite rude with my husband. However, I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone coming to Rome on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Triptrav
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome this weekend (2-4thMarch) having experienced a superb weekend and staying at the lovely little Hotel Raffaello was the icing on the cake. We were a party of four, including my 13 year old son, we were given a quad room, which was actually a suite. A beautiful room with a lovely bathroom featuring a supeb corner shower, which was a lot of fun and had my son entertained for ages and to my amazement, actually managed to leave the bathroom exactly as he had found it, spotless, not a drip on the floor. For a 13 year old, my son has amazing standards, he loves elegance, charm, quality and good furniture and was impressed with not only our lovely room, with its tasteful pictures on the walls, which were, to his amazement, padded fabric, which added a quality of high stardard, but the fact that the hallways and staircase that led to our room (320) were so lovely too. A rich coloured carpet runs up the stair and halls, the walls again have lovely artwork and even the door surrounds and door furniture are super brass quality, all of these things noted by a 13 year old. Us adults were equally impressed. Needless to say, the public areas are also elegant and rather lovely. The breakfast room accessed by a double winding marble staircase is very welcoming and the breakfast itself is lovely including the scambled eggs. A must, from this hotel is a restaurant, 1-2 minutes walk away. Come out of the hotel, walk up the little side road alongside the hotel, get to the top and look across the road to the restaurnt with the word "Restaurant" above it. In the window is a Grand Piano, played beatifully every night. Lovely friendly waiters, superb meal and not expensive, but the ambiance is perfect for an evening meal in Rome. If you are in rome for two full days, have an agenda so you don't waste precious time. We had one, which I worked out and it was perfect for our return flight timings. Day 1. Up early to get in line for Vatican Museums including the Sistene Chapel. (Take metro from Termini to Ottaviano, 1 euro each) From exit of Vatican, walk round vatican walls clockwise to St. Peters Castel St. Angelo and cross river Piazza Navone (good for lunch) (Restaurant with pink padded chairs very good) Pantheon Trevi Fountain Spanish Steps (Take metro back to Termini) Day 2 Walk down to the Colosseum (Handy Hint - Ignore guide sellers outside. By-pass the HUGE queue by joining the smaller or non existant queue for groups, when you get down to the ticket office, go to the last window which sells only entrance (11 euros) plus 3.50 euros extra, for an official guided tour by english speaking guides. A superb guide with audio connection to your guide. You have saved youself a lot of money and a lot of time. This is cheaper than taking the guides from outside the colloseum and you have saved all the queing time, all for an extra 3.50 euros.) Walk up to and through the Imperial Forum (free) Exit to the left and at the top and head down towards the river Over bridge to Isola Tiberina Over bridge to Trastevere for lunch Back over bridge Walk round the edge of roman ruins of Teatrod'Marcell (like small colosseum) and head up hill to Piazza Camidoglio Work your way across to more ruins 'Foro di Traiano' whilst aiming for Via Nazionale Walk along VN to Via A. Depretts on the right, which heads towards Santa Maria Maggiore, which is just by Hotel Rafaello. Last road on right is Via Urbana with Hotel Raffeallo in sight. We arrived in time for a quick refresh before our airport transfer arrived at 6.30 p.m. (40 euros for up to 4 people - very cost effective when you are a party of 4. Saved the hassle of metro, waiting, coach and walking uphill with bags to termini). Their telephone number is :- [--] - we had a mecedes mini van with blacked out windows, my son like that. Look no further - Hotel Raffaello will tick all your boxes.

Reviews.Title: “A Short Stay but I took Pictures!”
Reviews.Author: NevadaGal
Reviews.Content: The sad truth is that we arrived at the Hotel Raffaello in the later part of the evening and left at 7:30AM the next morning. I found the rates reasonable, the service excellent, the rooms were clean and breakfast was very good. We had need of close attention from the front desk staff with coordination of a shuttle and they were very helpful. Our rooms were nice and the bathrooms were actually fun. The biggest thing I have to contribute to this review are pictures. We stayed in 2 triples. I hope this is helpful to someone.

Reviews.Title: “Not too big or too small”
Reviews.Author: littlebriton
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for three nights in early Feburary and we loved it! Francesa on recption was so helpful as were all the staff we came into contact with. Upon arrival we were given a very small room,however we contacted reception and without hesitation were given a quad room at no extra charge,it was explained that we would be moved to another room as this one was booked for the following evening.The following morning we went to tour the sites and when we returned our luggage had been to a huge double room with balcony-all at no extra cost!!! The only minor fault(and they are minor) is that the rather odd shower cubicals are a bit cramped and there is no bar/room service. However close to many bars and diner's so no problem and very close to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: LKKAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The picture is a little misleading--the hotel is wedged on a typically narrow Roman neighborhood street lined with small cars and mopeds. We had a "superior double" room--the size was very nice--no complaints--but curiously the shower was itty bitty by American standards, even though the bathroom was a nice size, too. The bathroom and the room appeared recently renovated and were very clean. We were facing the street, which was very noisy at times, especially when the garbage truck would come in the middle of the night to empty the nearby dumpsters. I've learned that it is noisy nearly everywhere unless you find a hotel with rooms that face an interior courtyard. The breakfast was typical--eggs, fruit, cereal, pastry, coffee. By the way--we got a much better price for calling the hotel than we saw online, so call or email them directly. They speak English and also respond quickly to email. This hotel is not in the middle of it all--it is closer to old Rome--the Forum, etc. You will get a real flavor for a regular in-town Roman neighborhood with restaurants that cater to locals. There is a fantastic gelateria up the street--I can't recall the name but it is named after the big church that is near the hotel--S. Maria Maggiore--one of the largest churches in Rome, so don't miss it. We walked to the hot spots every day--right up the Via Milano. Unless the weather is bad or you are traveling with kids, it's only about 20 minutes to the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. The Vatican is, of course, much farther. For the price, we would come again. It was safe, clean, friendly and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Only average”
Reviews.Author: V0yager
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Raffaello Hotel in Rome for 5 days. 3 days on business and 2 days on vacation. I chose this hotel mainly for it's location because it was close to a line-B metro stop (Cavour) and hence it would be easy for me to get into my office whist working in Rome. From a business perspective therefore the location was quite good, from a tourist perspective it was not so good because the main tourist / restaurant / bar / shopping areas are about a 25 minute walk away. I'm not adverse to walking but this did become a bit of a drag especially because Rome is quite a hilly place and all the streets are cobbled so its quite hard on the feet. You can get a bus from near the hotel into the more interesting part of Rome from just around the corner of the hotel but these aren’t that reliable and the service ends at 9pm so you can't get a bus home if you're out for the evening. The location is much better for the historic part of Rome such as the Coliseum and Palatine, but to be honest I'd prefer to have been nearer the main nightlife in the city rather than near the historic part which basically closes down at night. The hotel accommodation is pretty basic and the pictures on the hotels website are somewhat misleading in my view. The room we stayed in could have done with a lick of paint because there were scuff marks on all walls - nothing too unsightly but something they could easily rectify if they wanted to. The bathroom was adequate although the drains did smell a bit (I think this is a generic problem in Rome) the only criticism is the size of the shower which is small. Both the bedroom and bathroom where very clean however. My biggest criticism of the room was its temperature, clearly designed for a hot climate the room didn't have adequate heating and became very cold at night. There would extra blankets but even so I did wake up a few times due to the cold. I'd recommend therefore that you avoid this hotel during the colder months. I guess that the hot months this criticism probably is reversed however! Service was only average it really depended who was on the front desk. The younger staff were pretty helpful and courteous but there was an older chap occasionally on the front desk who always seemed to be as miserable as sin. We found it quite amusing but I can imagine that other people would be quite put out by his attitude and lack of grace. The breakfast staff were also a but hit and miss - on one occasion I was ignored completely and gave up on my morning coffee completely! So all in all I would rate this hotel as average. I'm not sure why it has such a high overall rating on this site to be honest. I think its a good sound 3 star hotel but it certain isn't any more that that. I guess that because of the good reviews on this site that my expectations where probably set quite high and in the event I felt let down a little.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: MikeLaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights this month and were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is within a five minute walk of the Terravision drop off point and the railway station with plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. The room (502) was spacious, spotlessly clean and had a large balcony that would be an ideal sun trap in the summer. Minor grumbles would be that there were no coffee/tea facilities in the room and the TV did not offer any English speaking channels. We would recommend Unicum (Via di S.Maria Maggiore) for a wonderful evening meal....go after 9pm on the right night and you will be entertained by 'The Maestro' on the piano. We also discovered a rather different experience at a small newly opened restaurant recommended by the hotel receptionist. Turn left out of the hotel and follow the Via Urbana down the hill....the restaurant doesn't have a sign but you will probably hear the entertainment long before you see the place on the right. Quite honestly we have never come across a singer like her before and, despite sitting here for 10 minutes trying to describe her style/voice, words fail me. The food was very average. The entertainment was priceless. The Collosseum and The Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore are within easy walking distance as are most of the sights of Rome if you enjoy walking. For those that don't the excellent tour buses are a 5 minute walk away and their hop on hop off rides offer good value for money. Give the Rafello a go - I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Mightybadgers
Reviews.Content: We are two couples, one from the UK and one from Sweden, who spent 5 nights at the Raffaello in January 2007. It is very conveniently located close to Terminii station but also within walking distance of most of many of the major tourist sites. Rooms are not large, but very clean and comfortable and more than adequate for a City break. There are plenty of bars and restaurants close by if you can't face an evening excursion after sightseeing all day. Breakfast was a generous, continental type, after which we needed very little lunch. If anything was running low, staff immediately topped it up. All the staff were very courteous, friendly and efficient, but a special mention must go to the boss. Our flight home was cancelled and having been abandoned by Ryanair, we returned to Raffaello, some 7 hours after checking out. Unfortunately, he had only 1 room (with a small bed) for 1 night. We needed 1 room for 1 night and 1 room for 2 nights. He was more concerned that we continued to enjoy our stay together than with filling his empty room so found us rooms in a nearby hotel. Although the alternative hotel, very close by, was also 3*, it was way below the standard of Raffaello. We will definitely return to Rome and will stay at Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: Stansworth
Reviews.Content: We did hours of research to pick a hotel in Rome for our honeymoon, and Hotel Raffaello was perfect. When we first got to Rome I was afraid it might be too close to the train station as that is not a great area, but this was perfect. This was the largest room on our trip to Italy, and also the nicest bathroom. The staff was very professional, and made reservations for us for dinner when we asked, and also were eager to call cabs for us. Also, when I told the desk we were on our honeymoon, we got back to the room later and found a champagne on ice waiting for us! Generous touch. The right balance of price and location. Typical-to-nice breakfasts got us started each day as well. We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PipsDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raffello for three nights in January. It was situated in an excellent location, near both the train and metro stations. It was a short walk to the Collosseum. Breakfast was excellent, and while there was no resturaunt, there was plenty of choice nearby the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were very good, with a great view, although the walls could do with freshening up. Overall a great hotel in a great location and we will definitely rerturn. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful welcome.”
Reviews.Author: SukyD
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Raffaello for two nights. We were particularly impressed by the warmth of the welcome that we received and the high standard of care shown to us by the staff. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. We had a jacuzzi shower which we really appreciated. The breakfast buffet was lovely with a great variety of pastries, cereals, fruit and eggs. The hotel is well situated just a few minutes walk from Terminii Station. No tea & coffee making facilities in the room - perhaps that's the norm for Rome? On the whole a great hotel, well located and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “top marks again”
Reviews.Author: report88
Reviews.Content: Went back to stay at the Raffaello and this time with daughter. We had a suite with 2 good sized, beautifully furnished rooms; one double and one twin. As before the hotel & breakfast was lovely. The access to the bathroom was the only thing that could have been better as the loo was positioned awkwardly behind the door - but the bathroom itself was delightful and the jaccuzzi shower just as I remembered it - I must have a couple of those fitted at home! This time we didn't arrive via the Leonardo express (11euro each) as I had previously emailed Stefano Constantini of romecabs as he had been well recommended ((--)) and arranged an airport collection which was great, well worth 45euro for 3 people + luggage door to door. We also used Stefano for an amazing 2 hour night tour, fantastic, educational & unmissable especially with the lights and nativities still displayed. We were recommended Restaurant Tema just 2 minutes away (turn left out of hotel &then first right - reception will book it for you) and we were so impressed we ate dinner there 3 times. Impeccable service, lovely food. We also really enjoyed Trimani Wine Bar on Via Cernaia/viaGoito. For icecream don't miss 'Palazzo del freddo' on Via Principe Eugenio - it's huge (you must take a ticket and pay at the back on the right before you choose) it was commandeered by the USF during WW11. Also try Panella on Via Merulana for a pastry & cafe (you eat standing up precariously surrounded by delicacies of every sweet kind). For a great day out visit Ostia Antica - Francesca on reception told us how to get there - very quick via B line metro (the safe one) and an overground train - takes about 30 minutes and costs..............just 1 euro each! On Sunday evenings take in the free recitals in the various churches, they are amazing, such atmosphere. Go see the Capuchin Monks in their crypt and the architectural stratigraphy of crypt at the St. Clemente Basilica and the tromp d'oeil ceiling & sundial in S. Maria Degli Angeli. If you're a Dan Brown fan make sure you take your copy of A&D for reference.

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching - this is the one”
Reviews.Author: mpierce06
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I visited Rome for a long weekend. We wanted a small, moderately priced hotel close to the train station - no intentions of spending much time at the hotel. Being one block off the Via del Corso meant it was quiet - a rarity in Rome. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby, and metro and bus stops as well. However, we walked everywhere. Staff very friendly, English well spoken. Best part was a newly opened restaurant nearby on Via Urbana (#114) that was suggested: "Non c'e trippa pe' gatti". It's a very odd name (translated, "There is no tripe for cats"), but great food and live entertainment. Don't be discouraged by the outside - I don't even think there is a sign - just go! Tell Aureana (the singer) that you were sent by the woman from NYC and her son.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diarmaid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Raffaello for 3 nights in January. After an exhaustive search on the internet I opted for this hotel given the excellent reviews, its price and its location. Its location is excellent, very close to Termini yet far enough away to be in a nice area and close to all the major attractions. It is in a lovely area with lots of winding streets and hidden bars and restaurants. The hotel is well decorated with a boutique feel and the breakfasts, while simple, were a perfect start to the day. The room was clean but small. The shower wasn't great and the bathroom was strangely designed (no shower curtain or guard so the bathroom got soaked after a shower). That apart, I cannot fault the hotel and for the price and given some of the ridiculous rates that other hotels charge (with awful reviews) I would definitely recommend this hotel. Ok, the rooms are small but Rome isn't the type of city where you spend any prolonged length of time indoors. Well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel excellent showers!”
Reviews.Author: oxfordtravelller
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, the staff were friendly and great showers! However the location was a bit out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hime_lise
Reviews.Content: Perfect location with walking distance from Termini and to the Colosseum, as well as a metro stop only metres away. Hotel was beautifully decorated in the communal areas as well as the bedrooms. Restaurant was pretty and well stocked for breakfast and staff for friendly. Unbelieveable value for the money. Felt like a 4 star. A real find in Rome! I definitely recomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: FIVESTARPOOLE
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel. We are a family of 2 adults a 17 year old and a 1 year old. The breakfast was wonderful, all tasted fresh and there was plenty of choice. The hotel was very clean and only 20 minutes walk from the Trevi fountain. The staff were very helpful. We could not have chosen a better hotel, I have recommended it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rafaello”
Reviews.Author: KatharineNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. Central location, lovely elegant rooms with large clean bathrooms. Staff are so friendly. I emailed the hotel to tell them it was my boyfriend's birthday and they left a bottle of wine in our room and gave us the top room with a terrace. Staff are very helpful. 3 star but could be 4. Excellent value. Rome is lovely, can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MelaneS
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Hotel Raffaello. The front desk was very helpful, especially Fabio. He recommended two lovely restaurants for dinner. Before we got to the restaurants, the waiters already knew who we were because Fabio rang before we got there. The room was very clean. It was small but had everything you could possibly need...clean sheets, comfortable bed, safety deposit box, tv, jacuzzi tub, shower with good water pressure. The hotel went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. When we checked into the hotel, passport details were given, as they usually are. Except when Fabio was recording our details, he noticed that the second night of our stay was my birthday. He didn't mention anything until the night of my birthday. He had a lovely surprise bottle of champagne on ice sent up to our room with a Happy Birthday message sent from the hotel. It was very much a surprise and the champagne was delicious! We only paid 95 euros a night, and yet we were treated like we spent hundreds. The service and quality of this hotel was excellent. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: InckyB
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice little Hotel in a quiet location but well placed for sightseeing. The room was spotlessly clean and exactly as in the photo's on their website. Breakfast was lovely the buffett was always well stocked. Only drawback of hotel was there were no Tea/Coffee making facilities in the room and no bar, there is a mini bar in the room but it would have been nice to have somewhere to sit for a drink when returning in the evening. We found selecting a hotel in Rome really hard as there are so many but we were really pleased with this find and would recommend The Rafaello to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value,”
Reviews.Author: mookdogg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Raffaello for 3 nights in December. We arrived via train and were able to walk from the Termini to the hotel. We arrived before check in and were given a room right away. The front desk employee upon check in was not helpful at all. He did not give us any information about the complimentry breakfast. When we asked about the safe deposit box he stated that it was somewhere in the room, but he did not know where. He also stated that we would need to ask for the key and then leave it at the front desk, Not sure how Safe that was. Our experience with other front desk employees was very positive; however this paticular employee made the first impression and probably costs the hotel a higher rating. The hotel is located away from some of the tourist areas, meaning a little more residential and less of a dinning selection real close to the hotel. The neighborhood is a little questionable especially if away from main streets or closer to the train station. We did dine at the restaurant around the block from the hotel and that restaurant was excellent. The room was above average, with the bathroom a little crowded. Showering was a little difficult as there was a hand held shower with no curtain. The Blow dryer in the BR probably could double as a vacum cleaner. The breakfast was average. The coffiee was good, but most of the good breads and pastries were in very low stock or they would run out of. Overall this is a nice hotel. It is not located in a bad area, but not a place to do a lot of exploring at night. The service at this hotel probably depends on the employee you get at the front desk. I believe that hotels is lower in price then hotels in other areas which makes it a great value. If I were to return to Rome I probably would try a different hotel, but realize I would have to pay more. I would reccomend this hotel to budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: philipellis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend (fri -sun) in early december 2006. we flew into CIA airport, and had arranged with the hotel via e-mail to be met at the airport and transferred to the hotel. this was fortuitous, 'cos there was a public transport strike in rome that day and taxis were at a premium and the city was gridlocked. our driver met us at the airport exit holding our name card, and drove expertly to the hotel. brilliant. a bit pricier than taxis (and much dearer than buses etc) but well worth it. check in was fast and pleasant and our room was ready (at 11.30 a.m.). loads of pluses: immaculately clean (as was the entire hotel), spacious, nice comfy beds and well equipped ensuite with free toileteries (exceptional for a small hotel). 2 small minuses: there were no english channels on the TV (its always nice to have something to watch or listen to when in the room) and the room was freezing in the middle of the night when the heating went off; we mentioned this to the desk on day 2, but nothing could be done. that's possibly the price you pay for selecting a small hotel in a city that is possibly more concerned with staying cool in the summer than warm in the winter. breakfasts in the small dining room were good;
