pastries, breads, cereals, cold cuts etc etc. nicely served, always attentive (with hot drink refills), buffet being re-stocked up til a few minutes before time (breakfast served 7 - 10); excellent. location, location, location. just 15 mins walk from the coliseum (astounding) and then the rest of this historic city can be walked and seen. we walked via the coliseum as far as the vatican and although footsore after 2 days and umpteen miles, the sights & sites were incredible. there are a number of pizzerias and restaurants around the hotel, and although not cheap, we found them not to be as expensive as we had been warned beforehand. the 2 we ate in both offered a good value menu d'hote. we realy enjoyed the restaurant thima (?). its on the map given out by the hotel reception and only 2 mins away all in all we had a fabulous stay at the raffaello; its good value, clean and well located. we'd happily stay here again - but maybe not in mid-winter!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westheel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Raffaello Hotel Nov. 8-10 prior to connecting to a Celebrity Cruise based on reviews found on Trip Advisor and had an excellent experience. The hotel staff arranged for our transportation from FCO airport by having a driver meet us outside of baggage claim. They also made reservations for us to visit the Vatican Museum and had those reservations awating our arrival. The staff was excellent and Massimo gave great advice on directions and dining in the area. The Hotel is on a small side street off of Via Cavour, about 4 blocks from Termini Station which made transportation throughout the city very easy. It is also within very easy walking distance to the Colleseum and Forum. The rooms are quaint and clean and they provide an excellent breakfast. A great value in a mid priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Quilgy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good spot, near a subway station and a short walk from the major train station (Termini). We had a lovely modern and clean room with a balcony onto the street. After a long day of walking around Rome, the bed was very welcoming. The bathroom was new although the shower recess was small. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here forget the rest of your search!!”
Reviews.Author: MBrutus
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! We LOVED this Hotel!!! My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Raphaello for three nights in October, at the end of an eleven night oddessy across France and Italy. After a long train ride from Naples (4 hrs, we took the local by mistake) and a short walk from Termini station, we very easily found the Hotel Raphaello. Massimo was the concierge on duty when we arrived, he is great!!! We were quickly booked into a splendid room on the first floor (Rm 106, ask for this one!) a large and comfortable bed an oversized room and an ample sized bathroom, (I'm 6'0" and 240 lbs), was just the ticket to relax in after a trying train trip. The surprise of this room was the wonderful balcony overlooking the very quite street, (great for a relaxing nightly vino and cigar). The rooms were extremely clean and well appointed, nothing looked worn or out of date. Morning breakfast was great as well, a very varied menu is prepared daily by an extremely efficient wait staff who will prepare special coffee's upon request. I wish I could remember the woman’s name who ran the breakfast, as she is superb!!! Eggs to pastry every day with everything well made and tasty!! We can't say enough about the staff's professionalism. Massimo was our favorite, perhaps because we saw him the most. He is an amazing person who truly loves his job. Listen for his nightly serenade as he leaves at 11 PM every night, LOL!!! Alex is in at 11 most nights and is very professional as well. We weren't around much in the daytime, but when we were we were met with smiles and a cherry bonjourno. The noise from the street is minimal, and was never a bother we slept soundly every night. Except for the trash pickup around 4am, the street is very quite. The location of the hotel is perfect, a short walk from the Coliseum and the Roman Forum, we walked through the area around 11 pm our first night in Rome. We were out every night until after midnight and never felt unsafe. Taxi's were plentiful and inexpensive, with all of our trips under 10 euros. Our favorite restaurant is just up the street from the hotel on Via Cavor on the same block as the Hotel they have the best Fettuccini. Best place for Cappuccino is on Via Cavor on the right side of the street a Tabachi on a triangle corner on the way to the Coliseum. We are returning to Rome in May of 07 and we will most definitely stay at the Hotel Raphaello again. We really loved Rome and the staff and Hotel Raphaello made the trip Perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location!”
Reviews.Author: US_Trip
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and helpful staff, clean room, and great location! I would recommend this to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: FromDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Raffello on the basis of reviews read here and we where not disappointed. We stayed from 20-25th Oct. Small quibbles first: We asked for a room with a balcony prior to booking ( 6 weeks ahead of arrival) but this request was ignored. Lack of a bar in hotel or any tea/coffee facility in rooms left one tired after a long journey having to look around for a café. Luckily there are nice cafes nearby –but beware of overcharging. The positives far outweigh this: Fantastic location within walking distance of the main sites. Our room on the 4th floor had a lovely view of a nearby church roof. The Termini main rail Station is only a 15 min walk and the Metro at Cavour only 5 mins away. There was very little street noise – a bonus for a city centre hotel. Rooms are well decorated and most importantly are very clean with very good bathrooms. A lot of credit to housekeeping for their fresh linen, cleaning and considerate attitude towards guest’s privacy. Desk Staff are polite and somewhat helpful. Ask about bus trips of Rome the front desk have brochures on this. They can arrange pickup for lots of activities. Breakfast is very good, with lots of selections in a very attractive setting. We are generally a bit ‘picky’ about where we stay and wound have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to our best friends.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Trippingaroundthe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had read the rave reviews on tripadvisor and decided to try the hotel out. The location is walking distance to the subway and very nice stores. The entire staff were extraordinarily pleasant and helpful. The staff's English was superb. The room was delightful. The included breakfast was very nice. All in all, our stay was charming and we will definitely return. My guess is Raffaello Hotel is one of the best travel values in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic stay - great value & location”
Reviews.Author: BonnieNZgirl
Reviews.Content: I agonised over where to stay in Rome, it was our 9 year anniversary and we wanted it to be special. I couldn't afford to go for 'guaranteed perfection' in a 5 star hotel so I was trawling internet sites for weeks trying to decide on a place to stay. I ended up choosing Hotel Raffaello, thanks to the encouragement of Trip advisor reviews and I was not dissappointed. After a classic rip-off taxi ride (the guy charged us 30 euro to go 2 blocks from the train station to the hotel) I was at the end of my patience. The hotel looked cute and the staff were friendly which made it a relief to finally arrive. I had requested a corner room that was mentioned specifically in a previous review and when I opened the door to find a sweet but standard room I was getting that sinking feeling that this holiday was not going to be as I hoped. However, the staff (who turned out to be so helpful and friendly) turned that all around. They had left a chilled bottle of sparkling wine in our room with a card wishing us Happy Anniversary! We were thrilled, cracked the bottle open, forgot about the taxi ride and that set the tone for the whole rest of the holiday. The breakfast was just right, the location a perfect stroll to the colloseum, the room clean and smart with an indulgent bathroom. There is a fantasic restaurant within 100m. Up on the main road there is a traditional italian restaurant with piano player and hundreds of candles in the windows, reasonably priced. Also the stroll down to the forum or colloseum is easy and pleasant. I can't rate this hotel high enough. Stop looking, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: linnabean
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay...the room was average size for European hotel. It was extremely clean. The bathroom was updated and the beds were great. The pillows were a little hard, but got over that with the great bed! I had a little bit of noise in my room. But my traveling partners had total silence in their room. I think it was my location. the shower stall was extremely small. The staff was friendly and funny. The buffet was great! Some great restaurants close by at reasonable prices since they are away from the main tourist areas. Would stay again. Thanks for the great service!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rescue71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Raffaello for the first two nights of our honeymoon in Italy September 12 and 13. We couldn't have been happier! The location was excellent. We were able to walk everywhere, but the street itself was quiet. We had a lovely room. The bathroom was typically small but clean and functional. We had informed the hotel we were on our honeymoon and they presented us with a bottle of champagne on our first night! The desk staff was extremely kind and helpful. The breakfast was delicious--the best juice we had on our trip! There is a lift, however there are still a few stairs to each floor after the elevator--something to consider if you have mobility problems. We would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to start off our Italian travel”
Reviews.Author: RinaA
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Raffaello was the best way to rest up from our long transatlantic flight and train trip to Rome. The staff was professional, courteous, and made us feel right at home. They even surprised us with a bottle of champagne and snacks compliments of the house for our honeymoon stay. Our room was spacious, spotless and a comfortable, restful sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle that is Rome. The hotel is situated in a tucked-away quiet street, just around the corner from the Santa Maria Maggiore and away from the busier and crowded areas of Rome, but still conveniently close to the Colloseum, Termini station, and even walking distance to the Spanish Steps. Hotel Raffaello definitely made the first leg of our travels in Italy a warm, delightful and stress-free experience, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Staff, Fair Location”
Reviews.Author: Goodiam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet street in a pleasant area. It is true that the staff are extremely friendly and they answer all the questions you might have. We booked a quad room. 2 separate rooms, but there is only AC in one, so you do get hot. The bathroom was fine, but the jacuzzi shower did not work well so we had to use the hand shower. Also, at times the hot water goes off, so be prepared to wait or shower in cold water! Also the cubicle is INCREDIBLY small!!! The location is ok, but personally I prefer to stay a little more central. It is true that you can walk to a few sites, but generally speaking it is not as central as staying in the historic centre. However, taxis are not expensive (well our party was four, so it worked out cheaper than buses sometimes and we had heavy rain for 2 days) so if you get tired of walking, this is a good alternative. There are a few nice local restaurants on Via Cavour which are well priced for Rome and excellent food. The price was good, the service was good and if I needed to I would stay again if I could not get a central hotel. I was not keen on the breakfast. It diminishes quickly and isn't topped up after 9am and the bread was not great either. There is only CNN International for those English speaking guests to watch on TV. We had 2 very heavy rainy days, so this might be something worth thinking about, because I stayed in the hotel more that I would have expected. Thanks to the wonderful staff I enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “A WEE GEM”
Reviews.Author: Elainegiano
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely great value for money. The standart of cleanliness was impeccable and the shower was amazing. We had booked an apartment and it fell well below the standard we expected and we really thought that we would have difficulty getting a hotel room. However, the man on reception was extremely helpful and gave us an absolutely brilliant deal because we took a "queen" size bed, which would normally be for one, but its the size of a standard british double. He was like a breath of fresh air. This hotel made, what could have been a dreadful experience on our first trip to Rome, into a wonderful experience. The location is also very good for metro and termini railway station. The breakfast was really good We would stay here again, if we come back to Rome. Thank You to staff at Hotel Raffaello

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cupster
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in Rome with old world charm, and new world comfort -- and we found it in the Raffaello. It was clean, comfortable, and centrally located for touring on foot. Massimo at the front desk was professional, extremely helpful, and delightful. He made our stay so enjoyable. Breakfast (included in the room rate) was very good -- fresh, tasty, plentiful. I would recommend this hotel to travelers, and stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Should be 4-star, not 2-star.”
Reviews.Author: Chipotle
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Raffaello from Aug. 30-Sept. 2, 2006. Our "Excellent" rating is based upon everything being MUCH MUCH better than expectation. This is a 2-star hotel that should be a 4-star. The location is great....walking distance to Roma Termini train station, Cavour metro stop, shopping, dining, low-cost internet cafe's, etc., etc.. The hotel lobby & breakfast area is wonderful. Breakfasts are very good. Hotel staff is very good. The hotel elevator took us 1 flight of stairs short of the 5th floor so we had to haul our own luggage up; however, this was no problem for us. The room itself was cosy but comfortable and VERY clean (even in the hard-to-get-at corners as well as the bedspread) and wonderfully decorated. There was a nice little balcony for a breath of fresh air. The bathroom was very clean and boasted shiny new fixtures. The shower, although a bit small, was a VERY cool Jacuzzi brand, multi-head stall with "glass" doors. Windows and roll-shutters were new and very sound-proof. TIP: If you want to take any photos of your room, do so upon check-in because they (smartly) take away the bedspread after the first night to better maintain it's new condition (we assume).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: jenp718
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights at the end of August while we were in Europe on our honeymoon. The room was spacious and had a terrace. The bathroom was clean and had a bathtub that was retrofitted with a showerhead. My only complaint about the room is that although they added the showerhead there was not a shower curtain so every time we took showers water got all over the bathroom floor. This was not a big deal, just one of those little things they could change. Still, it was one of the larger bathrooms we had in any of the hotels we stayed in during our three-week trip to several countries in Europe. Because it was our honeymoon the hotel provided complimentary champagne service on our first night, which was a very nice touch! The lobby area was large and brighter looking than many. The breakfast buffet was very good. I was excited that they had scrambled eggs, which were tasty but a bit cold the day we went toward the end of breakfast. The buffet also had the usual cereals, croissants, fruit, boiled eggs, etc. The location near the Termini was not bad although in the future I might prefer to be a bit closer to areas with lots of restaurants such as near the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain or Pantheon. We walked most of the time in Rome and it was about 15-20 minutes to most major destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel excellent location....”
Reviews.Author: johndeff
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rafello is well above average Hotel in Rome. Our double room was very spacious with a balcony witha view which does allow you to take in and absorb the city of Rome. The advantages Easy to locate Easy access to Termini for arrival and departure. Location Size of Room Quiet area Close to Cavour underground Station Close to Colleseum Exceelent Bars( Fiddelers Elbow an good Irish Bar very close and resteraunts on Cavour (street) Air conditioning quiet but very efficent Helpfull Staff Good continental breakfast Good power showers Disadvantages Shower booth very small No bar ( but good bar at top of side stree / Cavour ) Very Small elevator

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location!”
Reviews.Author: uddybob
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I spent 4 fantastic days in Rome celebrating her 50th Birthday. We chose the Raffaello Hotel based on the brilliant reviews on Trip and we were very pleased with the results! From the moment we arrived we received wonderful service. In particular the warm welcome we received from Francesca on our arrival, ensuring the room was ready even upon our early arrival and the beautiful flowers as pre-arranged with Alex. Also a very special mention to Massimo for arranging a wonderful meal for my Mums birthday (the HiRes) and for letting the restaurant know about the special occasion as they provided a cake and Prosecco! The only thing that prevents us from giving ‘Excellent’ marks is the fact that outside of breakfast you cannot get a drink at the hotel, but there are many nice coffee bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerry19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Raffaello for a week during our vacation to Rome in March. The staff was very nice, and our room was big and very clean. The location is great, it’s on a small street that is parallel to Via Cavour. We were a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum, Palantine Hill, the Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain and Termini Station. We were a 30 minute walk to the Vatican, if you don’t want to walk, there is a Metro Station (B Line)down the street on Cavour. Every morning they served breakfast from 7-10 a.m. and had a variety of cereal, yogurt, fruit, eggs, pastries, coffee, tea, water and juice. Great way to start your morning. There are restaurants and shops to buy food very close to the hotel. My only complaint about the hotel is that our stall shower was very small. My husband and I are not big people and we both had some trouble moving around in it. All and all, an excellent hotel, I would highly recommend and will stay there again when we’re in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pilski
Reviews.Content: Close to Termini, 10 min walk, and St Maria Maggiore. Family room booked and got 2 adjoining rooms, a double and a twin, which was perfect for us. Excellent choice on the inclusive breakfast, with fresh fruit, meats, cheese, conserves, bread, scrambled eggs, pasries and cakes, juice, tea, coffee, etc, etc. Very friendly and helpful staff with good recommendations for local restaurants. Great Jaccuzzi shower, shame the cubicle was too small, even for our 15 yo, but don't let that put you off! Highly recommended especially at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: RD77
Reviews.Content: Nice location just a few blocks from the train station. Due to a taxi strike we were forced to walk most places, but were able to do so because of its fairly centralized location. Colosseum was only about fifteen minutes away. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful -- all spoke English quite well. Room was spacious, clean and well appointed. Only two negatives: 1. The air conditioner was just terrible. Complaints to the manager brought the response "Americans like it too cold." His solution was to stay in the room longer since the air conditioner shuts off when you leave. 2. No shower curtain in the tub. Water sprayed all over the bathroom. I'd stay there again. All-in-all it was a good experience. If it weren't for the air conditioner problem it would have received high marks. Hopefully it was an isolated problem.

Reviews.Title: “Raffaello was okay except for air-conditioning”
Reviews.Author: 2teens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Raffaello for just one night. I think that part of what people like about this hotel is the staff - the people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. We booked a quad room (family of four). The layout was nice (although I didn't particularly care for the dark room/decor) - there were two small connected bedrooms - one with a queen bed, and the other with two twin beds. This provided some privacy. However, we had one significant problem that is unique to the quad rooms - the air-conditioning unit was only in one of the bedrooms (the queen bed side). We left the door open between the rooms, but the twin bedroom was hot. After we brought this issue to the attention of the front desk, they gave us another key, and said that they should have told us to leave one key in the slot that controls electricity at all times so that the air conditioning never goes off when we leave the room. It was clear they were aware of this problem in the quad rooms, and this was the solution. However, even after doing that, the second bedroom never really cooled off. My kids were not able to sleep very well that night. We were glad to depart after one night. The location is good as long as you like to walk. However, if you get tired, this hotel is not located close to any of the metro stops.
